Und letztendlich kommt das Gift auch noch über den Handel zu uns zurück. Ehrlich gesagt bin ich ziemlich fassungslos darüber,dass wir erkennen,das eine Chemikalie für Mensch und Umwelt gefährlich ist,aber keine Hemmung besteht andere Menschen damit zu vergiften.
englishfeedback: I would urge them to adopt a ban on the production and export of hazardous chemicals banned in the EU. It cannot be that we are poisoning other countries, and thus others, with chemicals that are banned from us because of their dangerous nature.It cannot be what we want in Europe to protect nature and thus human beings, but it’s no matter that human beings and the environment are poisoned in other countries, human beings are irretrievably ill. What are European values there? And ultimately, the poison comes back to us through trade. To say honestly, I am quite unconscious about the fact that we recognise that a chemical is dangerous for humans and the environment, but there is no barrier to poisoning other people.

feedback: Bonjour, Je souhaite demander à l'Union Européenne de faire en sorte que cesse la production et l'exportation des produits chimiques qui sont interdits dans l'Union Européenne. Cela semble logique : pourquoi est ce que les pays hors de l'Europe pourraient être pollués ? Toutes les personnes n'ont-elles pas le droit de rester en bonne santé ? Penser aux générations futures, la planète est déjà en mauvaise état ... Comptant sur votre présence d'esprit, je vous remercie.
englishfeedback: Hello, I would like to ask the European Union to stop the production and export of chemicals banned in the European Union. This seems logical: why are countries outside Europe likely to be polluted? Do not all have the right to stay healthy? Thinking about future generations, the planet is already in bad condition... I look forward to your mind and thank you.

feedback: Los pesticidas y demás biocidas están acabando con la biodiversidad y la fertilidad del suelo de nuestro planeta. La mejor manera de producir alimentos es la agricultura regenerativa: https://polyfarming.eu/?lang=es
englishfeedback: Pesticides and other biocides are destroying biodiversity and soil fertility on our planet. Regenerative farming is the best way to produce food: https://polyfarming.eu/?lang=es

feedback: Popieram inicjatywę wprowadzenia zakazu exportu z terenu UE niebezpiecznych pestycydów, które są zkazane w państwach Unii. Nie możemy zakazywać ich u siebie i jednocześnie eksportować do innych krajów, które nie mają takich uregulowń prawnych. To jest hipokryzja, która stawia państwa Unii w bardzo złym świetle, będzie budzić wobec nas nieufność i bardzo słusznie. Poza tym państwa Unii powinny spojrzeć na ochronę środowiska globalnie. Jeśli chcemy chronić nasze środowiskow poprzez zakazywanie toksycznych chemikaliów, musimy pomóc innym krajom chronić ich własne, tak naprawdę środowisko jest jedno. To samo dotyczy ludzi. Toksyczne chemikalia szkodzą wszystkim jednakowo bez względu na kraj zamieszkania. Wysyłanie trujących substancji do innych krajów i trucie innych tylko dlatego, że nam nikt tego nie zabrania stoi w sprzeczności z wartościami, na których zbudowana jest Unia. Jeszcze raz podkreślę: to czysta hipokryzja, która zaszkodzi państwom europejskim na dłuższą metę, a także całej planecie i ludzkości.
englishfeedback: I support the initiative to ban the export from the EU of dangerous pesticides that are contaminated in EU countries. We cannot forbid them at home and at the same time export to other countries that do not have such rules. This hypocrisy, which puts EU countries in a very bad light, will cause us mistrust and very rightly. In addition, EU countries should look at environmental protection globally. If we want to protect our environment by banning toxic chemicals, we need to help other countries protect their own, indeed one environment. The same applies to people. Toxic chemicals harm everyone equally regardless of their country of residence. Shipping toxic substances to other countries and poisoning others simply because we are not forbidden from doing so is at odds with the values on which the Union is built. Let me reiterate: this is a clean hypocrisy that will damage European countries in the long run, as well as the planet and humanity as a whole.

feedback: Buongiorno, per il bene nostro e soprattutto delle future generazioni, i nostri figli ,nipoti e pronipoti, dobbiamo cessare di rovinare il nostro pianeta, l'ecosistema tutto, evitando completamente di utilizzare veleni, pesticidi e chimica invasiva nelle produzioni agricole e in ogni altro campo in cui essa impatta sull'ambiente terracqueo. Il nostro futuro di salute e prosperità, ed anche di tutti gli altri esseri viventi, dipende dalle vostre decisioni
englishfeedback: Good for our good, and above all for our future generations, our children, grandchildren and fountains, we need to stop ruining our planet, the ecosystem, and completely avoid using poison, pesticides and invasive chemistry in agricultural production and in any other field in which it affects the therracqueous environment. Our future of health and prosperity, and also of all other living beings, depends on your decisions

feedback: Si nous réussissons à diminuer la quantité de pesticides, il nous faut aider les autres à s'en débarrasser. Les entreprises sauront s'adapter, c'est leur principale capacité. À condition de leur préciser la feuille de route.
englishfeedback: If we succeed in reducing the amount of pesticides, we need to help others get rid of them. Businesses will be able to adapt, which is their main capacity. Provided the roadmap is specified.

feedback: As an occupational physician that deals with health and safety of workers, I have noticed that frequently MSDS are not sufficiently developed to address all the factors that may have influence upon the environment and the health of the users of chemical products. Persisting in using them without a full evaluation of its risks, whether in the present in the future, is not in accordance with the respect that any individual deserves be it in Europe or anywhere in the World.

The export of toxic pesticides is bad for the bees, biodiversity and the planet. The evidence is clear: neonics and other poisonous pesticides kill bees. Thats why theyre banned in Europe. Why are we still allowing them to be exported to countries with weaker regulation, killing bees and decimating biodiversity?

The export of toxic pesticides is bad for the bees, biodiversity and the planet. The evidence is clear: neonics and other poisonous pesticides kill bees. Thats why theyre banned in Europe. Why are we still allowing them to be exported to countries with weaker regulation, killing bees and decimating biodiversity?

Gentili Signore/Signori, i pesticidi pericolosi sono stati vietati in Europa dopo essere stati collegati a cancro, problemi riproduttivi e malattie neurodegenerative. Alcuni di questi pesticidi sono vietati in Europa perché collegati a danni cerebrali nei bambini e nei neonati. Se questi pesticidi sono troppo pericolosi per noi, come possiamo permettere che vengano esportati allestero? L'esportazione di pesticidi tossici, oltre a coinvolgere i diritti umani, è dannosa anche per le api, la biodiversità e il pianeta. Le prove sono chiare: i neonicotinoidi e altri pesticidi velenosi uccidono le api. Ecco perché sono vietati in Europa. Perché continuiamo a permettere che vengano esportati in Paesi terzi, uccidendo le api e decimando la biodiversità, ben sapendo che questi problemi vanno affrontati a livello globale e non solo in ambito europeo? Aver vietato questi prodotti in Europa ci deve spingere ad ampliare il nostro impegno, guardando lontano, sia in termini di spazio, che in termini di tempo. Grazie per la vostra attenzione. Buon lavoro! Concetta Capotorti
englishfeedback: Dear Mr/Ms, hazardous pesticides were banned in Europe after being linked to cancer, reproductive problems and neurodegenerative diseases. Some of these pesticides are banned in Europe because they are linked to brain damage in children and infants. If these pesticides are too dangerous for us, how can we allow them to be exported abroad? The export of toxic pesticides, as well as involving human rights, is also detrimental to bees, biodiversity and the planet. The evidence is clear: neonicotinoids and other poisonous pesticides kill bees. This is why they are banned in Europe. Why do we continue to allow them to be exported to third countries, killing bees and deciding on biodiversity, knowing that these problems need to be tackled globally and not only at European level? Having banned these products in Europe must push us to broaden our commitment, looking far away, both in terms of space and in terms of time. Thank you for your attention. Enjoy the quiz! Concetta Capotorti

feedback: Bonjour, Exporter les produits dangereux vers des pays du sud est non seulement inacceptable d'un point de vue tout simplement humain, mais c'est aussi aberrant d'un point de vue écologique global. De plus, au niveau purement égocentrique, sachant que nous allons importer un certain nombre d'aliments traités avec ces pesticides, nous allons en subir aussi les conséquences sur notre santé: retour de bâton bien mérité! Cordialement. Bernard Molliex
englishfeedback: Hello, exporting dangerous products to countries in the south is not only unacceptable from a purely human point of view, but it is also an outlier from an overall ecological point of view. Moreover, at a purely egocentric level, given that we will import a number of foods treated with these pesticides, we will also suffer the consequences for our health: back well deserved stick! With kind regards. Bernard Molliex

feedback: The export of toxic pesticides is a human rights issue as these toxic pesticides are damaging to people: Every year, thousands of farmers die from exposure to dangerous pesticides. Furthermore, the export of toxic pesticides is bad for the bees, biodiversity and the planet. The evidence is clear: neonics and other poisonous pesticides kill bees. Thats why theyre banned in Europe. Why are we still allowing them to be exported to countries with weaker regulation, killing bees and decimating biodiversity? It is really unfair to take advantage of countries with weaker regulation.

la Commissione Europea deve assolutamente vietare la produzione per esportazione delle sostanze chimiche vietate nell'UE la Commissione Europea deve vietare la produzione, l'utilizzo e l'esportazione di sostanze pericolose e persistenti come le PFAS la Commissione Europea deve vietare produzione, impiego ed esportazione del Glifosato, sostanza pericolosa, interferente endocrino, sospetto cancerogeno.
englishfeedback: the European Commission must absolutely prohibit the production for export of chemicals banned in the EU, the European Commission must prohibit the production, use and export of dangerous and persistent substances such as PFAS, the European Commission must prohibit the production, use and export of Glifosate, a dangerous substance, an endocrine disruptor or a suspected carcinogen.

feedback: Tratándose de sustancias peligrosas, ya sea para las personas, animales, plantas o el medio ambiente, la prohibición de producción y exportación debe ser total. La protección contra el empleo de este tipo de sustancias debe ser la misma en todo el mundo. Todos los seres humanos, sin excepción, debemos tener derecho a la salud, a alimentos libres de pesticidas y a un medio ambiente saludable. Además, me parece incongruente y estúpido que productos prohibidos en la UE se puedan exportar y utilizar en paises que luego venden su producción a miembros de la UE.
englishfeedback: For dangerous substances, be it for humans, animals, plants or the environment, the production and export ban should be total. Protection against the use of such substances should be the same worldwide. All human beings, without exception, must have the right to health, pesticide free food and a healthy environment. Moreover, it seems to me inconsistent and surprised that products banned in the EU can be exported and used in countries which then sell their production to EU members.

feedback: L'exportation de pesticides toxiques révèle une politique de deux poids deux mesures : les pesticides dangereux sont interdits en Europe après avoir été associés à des cancers, des problèmes de reproduction et des maladies neurodégénératives, ainsi qu'à la mort des abeilles. Certains de ces pesticides sont même interdits en Europe en raison de leur lien avec des lésions cérébrales chez les enfants et les bébés à naître. Si ces pesticides sont trop dangereux pour nous, comment pouvons-nous autoriser leur exportation ? L'exportation de pesticides toxiques est une question de droits humains, car ces pesticides sont nocifs pour notre santé : chaque année, des milliers d'agriculteurs meurent des suites dune trop forte exposition à ces pesticides dangereux. Les pesticides exportés font l'objet d'innombrables études qui confirment leurs effets néfastes sur les humains. L'exportation de pesticides toxiques est néfaste pour les abeilles, la biodiversité et la planète en général. Les preuves sont claires : les néonics et autres pesticides dangereux tuent les abeilles. C'est pourquoi ils sont interdits en Europe. Pourquoi autorisons-nous encore leur exportation vers des pays où la réglementation est moins stricte, alors quils continueront de tuer les abeilles et décimer la biodiversité ? L'exportation de pesticides toxiques profite des pays où la réglementation est moins stricte. L'UE a un rôle à jouer dans le monde - ses entreprises ne devraient pas être autorisées à profiter des pays où la réglementation est plus faible. Comment pouvons-nous être pris au sérieux si nous expédions nos produits chimiques dangereux à l'étranger, empoisonnant ainsi les populations et la nature dans des pays où les règles de sécurité sont plus faibles et moins strictement appliquées ? L'interdiction d'exporter des pesticides toxiques serait une opportunité unique pour l'innovation et aiderait l'Europe et le monde à évoluer vers des méthodes de protection des plantes plus durables. Le maintien sur le marché de pesticides anciens et dangereux nous prive d'un avenir plus vert et de pratiques agricoles plus durables. Un avis juridique du Center for International Environmental Law publié en 2022 montre que les exportations européennes de pesticides interdits vers l'Afrique et l'Amérique centrale violent les obligations juridiques internationales de l'UE et le droit relatif aux droits humains.
englishfeedback: The export of toxic pesticides reveals a double standard policy: hazardous pesticides are banned in Europe after being associated with cancer, reproductive problems and neurodegenerative diseases, as well as bee death. Some of these pesticides are even banned in Europe because of their link to brain damage in children and born babies. If these pesticides are too dangerous for us, how can we authorise their export? The export of toxic pesticides is a human rights issue, as these pesticides are harmful to our health: every year, thousands of farmers die as a result of excessive exposure to these hazardous pesticides. Exported pesticides are subject to countless studies confirming their adverse effects on humans. The export of toxic pesticides is harmful to bees, biodiversity and the planet in general. The evidence is clear: neonics and other hazardous pesticides kill bees. This is why they are banned in Europe. Why do we still allow their export to countries with less stringent regulation, while they will continue to kill bees and decay biodiversity? The export of toxic pesticides benefits countries with less stringent regulation. The EU has a role to play in the world – its businesses should not be allowed to benefit from countries with weaker regulation. How can we be taken seriously if we send our hazardous chemicals abroad, poisoning people and nature in countries where safety rules are weaker and less strictly enforced? Banning the export of toxic pesticides would be a unique opportunity for innovation and would help Europe and the world to move towards more sustainable plant protection methods. Keeping old and dangerous pesticides on the market deprives us of a greener future and more sustainable agricultural practices. A legal opinion of the Center for International Environmental Law published in 2022 shows that European exports of banned pesticides to Africa and Central America violate the EU’s international legal obligations and human rights law.

feedback: The export of toxic pesticides exposes a double standard: Dangerous pesticides are banned in Europe after they were linked to cancer, reproductive problems and neurodegenerative diseases as well as the dying of bees. Some of these pesticides are banned in Europe because of their links to brain damage in children and unborn babies. If these pesticides are too dangerous for us, how can we allow them to be exported? The export of toxic pesticides is a human rights issue as these toxic pesticides are damaging to people: Every year, thousands of farmers die from exposure to dangerous pesticides. The pesticides exported have countless studies supporting the damaging effects on people. The export of toxic pesticides is bad for the bees, biodiversity and the planet. The evidence is clear: neonics and other poisonous pesticides kill bees. Thats why theyre banned in Europe. Why are we still allowing them to be exported to countries with weaker regulation, killing bees and decimating biodiversity? The export of toxic pesticides is taking advantage of countries with weaker regulation. Europe has a role to play in the world - its companies should not be allowed to take advantage of countries with weaker regulation. How can we be taken seriously if we ship our hazardous chemicals abroad, poisoning people and nature in the process in countries where safety regulations are weaker and less strictly enforced. An export ban of toxic pesticides would be a boon for innovation and help Europe and the world move towards more sustainable plant protection methods. Keeping old and dangerous pesticides on the market is depriving us from a greener future and more sustainable farming practices. A legal opinion by the Center for International Environmental Law published in 2022 shows that EU exports of banned pesticides to Africa and Central America violate the EUs international legal obligations and human rights law.

Estimados compañeros, como representantes de nuestros estados y del bien público de nuestra sociedad europea es necesario que reflexionemos y detengamos las acciones de estas grandes multinacionales. La exportación de pesticidas tóxicos revela un doble rasero. Los pesticidas peligrosos están prohibidos en Europa por su relación con el cáncer, los problemas reproductivos y las enfermedades neurodegenerativas, así como con la muerte de las abejas. Además, se sabe que algunos provocan daño cerebral infantil y durante el embarazo. Si no usamos estos pesticidas por ser demasiado peligrosos, ¿cómo podemos permitir que se exporten? La exportación de pesticidas tóxicos es una cuestión de derechos humanos, ya que atentan contra la salud. Cada año, miles de personas que viven de la agricultura mueren por exponerse a estos peligrosos pesticidas. Numerosos estudios demuestran sus efectos nocivos. La exportación de pesticidas tóxicos perjudica a las abejas, la biodiversidad y el planeta. Los datos no mienten: los neonicotinoides y otros pesticidas tóxicos matan a las abejas. Por eso están prohibidos en Europa. ¿Cómo podemos permitir que se exporten a otros países? La industria de los pesticidas tóxicos se lucra con los países de normativas menos estrictas. Europa tiene que dar ejemplo y no permitir que sus empresas se aprovechen de una legislación más permisiva. ¿Cómo se nos puede tomar en serio si exportamos unos productos químicos que envenenan a las personas y la naturaleza? La prohibición de exportar pesticidas tóxicos fomentaría la innovación y animaría a Europa y al resto del mundo a utilizar técnicas fitosanitarias más sostenibles. Mantener en el mercado pesticidas obsoletos y peligrosos nos priva de un futuro más verde y de unas prácticas agrícolas más ecológicas. Gracias por leer mi comentario y por pensar en nuestro planeta y las personas que lo habitan. Un abrazo
englishfeedback: Dear colleagues, as representatives of our states and of the public good of our European society, we need to reflect on and stop the actions of these big multinationals. The export of toxic pesticides reveals double standards. Hazardous pesticides are banned in Europe because of their relationship with cancer, reproductive problems and neurodegenerative diseases, as well as the death of bees. In addition, some are known to cause brain damage for children and during pregnancy. If we do not use these pesticides because they are too dangerous, how can we allow them to be exported? The export of toxic pesticides is a human rights issue, as they harm health. Every year, thousands of people living in agriculture die from exposure to these dangerous pesticides. Numerous studies demonstrate its harmful effects. The export of toxic pesticides harms bees, biodiversity and the planet. The data do not feel: neonicotinoids and other toxic pesticides kill bees. This is why they are banned in Europe. How can we allow them to be exported to other countries? The toxic pesticide industry is profitable with countries with less stringent regulations. Europe needs to lead by example and not allow its businesses to take advantage of more permissive legislation. How can we be taken seriously if we export chemicals that poisonate people and nature? A ban on the export of toxic pesticides would encourage innovation and encourage Europe and the rest of the world to use more sustainable plant protection techniques. Keeping obsolete and dangerous pesticides on the market deprives us of a greener future and greener farming practices. Thank you for reading my comment and thinking about our planet and the people who live it. Best wishes,

feedback: Gefährliche Pestizide sind in Europa verboten, werden aber immer noch nach Afrika und Südamerika exportiert. Die EU könnte dem mit einem Exportverbot endlich ein Ende bereiten. Ich fordere die Eu dazu auf!
englishfeedback: Hazardous pesticides are banned in Europe but are still exported to Africa and South America. The EU could finally put an end to this with an export ban. I call on the EU to do so!

feedback: Prima wetsvoorstel om export van deze giftige stoffen te verbieden. We hebben ze in Europa niet voor niets verboden. Er zijn ontelbare onderzoeken die hun schadelijke effecten op mensen aantonen. Dat betreft natuurlijk net zo goed het gebruik in andere landen buiten de EU. Als we export zouden toestaan betekent dat in feite dat we met 2 maten meten.De gevaarlijke pesticiden werden in Europa verboden nadat een verband was aangetoond met kanker, vruchtbaarheidsproblemen, neurodegeneratieve ziektes en bijensterfte. Sommige van deze pesticiden zijn verboden in Europa omdat ze in verband zijn gebracht met hersenbeschadiging bij kinderen en ongeboren babys. Als de pesticiden te gevaarlijk voor ons zijn, dan kunnen we ze natuurlijk ook niet laten exporteren! Dus invoeren dat exportverbod!!
englishfeedback: Good legislative proposal to ban the export of these toxic substances. We have not banned them for nothing in Europe. There are countless studies showing their adverse effects on humans. This is of course equally relevant to use in other countries outside the EU. Allowing exports means, in fact, that we have 2 countries.Hazardous pesticides were banned in Europe after a link was demonstrated with cancer, fertility problems, neurodegenerative diseases and bee mortality. Some of these pesticides are banned in Europe because they have been associated with brain damage in children and unborn babys. If pesticides are too dangerous for us, we cannot, of course, have them exported! So put in place that export ban!

feedback: Zdecydowanie popieram inicjatywę zakazującą produkcji lub wywozu niektórych niebezpiecznych chemikaliów, które są zakazane w UE, aby chronić państwa spoza UE przed ich negatywnym wpływem na zdrowie ludzkie i środowisko. Inicjatywa będzie chronić również obywateli UE tak w Europie jak i przebywających poza nią. Zatrucie środowiska i jego wpływ nie jest ograniczony jedynie do terenu Europy, lecz jako całościowy ekosystem ma wpływ na wszelkie życie w każdym zakątku Ziemi. Najlepiej pokazuje to kwestia mikroplastiku, występującego obecnie w każdym zakątku świata.
englishfeedback: I strongly support the initiative banning the production or export of certain hazardous chemicals that are banned in the EU, in order to protect non-EU countries from their negative impacts on human health and the environment. The initiative will also protect EU citizens both inside and outside Europe. The poisoning of the environment and its impact is not limited to Europe alone, but as a holistic ecosystem has an impact on any life in every corner of the Earth. This is best illustrated by the issue of microplastics, which is presently present in every corner of the world.

feedback: Mijn mening is dat er genoeg gif gebruikt is in de loop der jaren en dat de natuurlijke vijanden van overlastgevende insecten door de gifstoffen bijna zijn verdwenen. Het wordt tijd dat we de balans in de natuur herstellen en dat kan rustig zonder de gifstoffen die we zelf hebben geproduceerd.
englishfeedback: I believe that enough poison has been used over the years and that the poison almost disappeared the natural enemies of interfering insects. It is time for us to restore the balance in nature, which can be calm without the toxins we have produced itself.

feedback: Bonjour, la regelementation européenne doit etre homogène vis a vis des produits chimiques et les interdire. Ce qui tue le vivant est un non sens dont on ne maitrise meme pas les conséquences (exemple l'extermination des abeilles).Il n'y a qu'une planete, soyons unis pour préserver le peu qu'il en reste. NON aux produits chimiques NON aux pesticides et autres toxiques.
englishfeedback: Bonjour, la regelementation européenne doit etre homogène vis a vis des produits chimiques et les interdire. CE qui tue le Vivant est un non sens dont on ne Maitrise meme pas les conséquences (exemple l’extermination des abeilles).Il n’y a qu’une Planete, soyons UNIS pour préserver le peu qu’il a forever. Non aux produits chimiques NON aux pesticides et autres toxiques.

feedback: Hoe kan men verbaasd zijn dat de lobby van deze industrie alles zal proberen om dit verbod te verhinderen? Dit is hoe het werkt. Men heeft geen enkel moraal dan het grote geld. Pesticiden zijn giftig, voor de natuur en bewoners van de EU en ook voor de natuur en bewoners van de rest van de wereld. Maar daar heeft deze industrie geen boodschap aan, zij zullen alles in het werk stellen om door te gaan met hun productie en verkoop. Ik mag toch hopen dat er in het Europees Parlement voldoende leden zijn die ook inzien dat dit verbod er moet komen. De natuur en bewoners in de rest van de wereld zijn niet minder maar gelijkwaardig aan de EU.
englishfeedback: How can it be surprised that the lobby of this industry will try everything to prevent this ban? This is how it works. There is no morality than the big money. Pesticides are toxic to nature and residents in the EU, as well as to nature and residents of the rest of the world. But there is no message from this industry, they will do everything in their power to continue their production and sales. However, I hope that there will be a sufficient number of Members in the European Parliament who also recognise the need for this ban. Nature and residents in the rest of the world are not less but equal to the EU.

feedback: Het is vanzelfsprekend dat er een verbod op de export van gevaarlijke chemicaliën moet komen! Zo'n besluit volgt uit de Europese waarden. Laat privé belangen niet zegevieren!
englishfeedback: It is self-evident that there is a need to ban the export of dangerous chemicals! Such a decision stems from European values. Don’t let private interests sacrifice!

feedback: The toxic pesticide industry profits from countries with less stringent regulations. Europe must set an example and not allow its companies to take advantage of more permissive legislation. How can we be taken seriously if we export chemicals that poison people and nature? If it is bad for Europe and Europeans, it is just as bad for everyone else. Let us set an example and claim for that is good for the planet as a whole
englishfeedback: The toxic pesticide industry profiles from countries with less stringent regulations. Europe must set an examination and not adopt its companies to take advantage of more harmful legislation. How can we take seriously if we export chemicals that poison people and nature? If it is bad for Europe and Europeans, it is just as bad for everyone else. Let us set an examination and claim for that is good for the plan as a whole

feedback: Bonjour, habitant une planète dont chaque élément fait partie d'un système complexe, dont nous nous apercevons chaque jour, que nous ne comprenons pas tous les éléments de fonctionnement, je suis contre la fabrication, l'utilisation et l'exportation de produits issus de la chimie détruisant ou empêchant le développement d'organismes vivants.
englishfeedback: Hello, a planet in which every element is part of a complex system, of which we see every day, that we do not understand all the elements of operation, I am against the manufacture, use and export of chemistry products that destroy or prevent the development of living organisms.

feedback: Je suis pour l'interdiction de tout produit chimique Je crains pour ma santé et celle de mes enfants et petits enfants
englishfeedback: Je suis pour l’interdiction de tout produit chimique Je crains pour ma santé et celle de mes enfants et petits enfants

feedback: On nous parle à longueur de temps d'écologie, parfois à tort et à travers malheureusement. Comment voulez-vous que les citoyens européens aient confiance dans cette commission européenne non élue si il y a hypocrisie tout le temps. Vous allez donc exporter des produits chimiques dangereux à l'autre bout de la planète, évidemment sans avoir demandé préalablement aux citoyens ce qu'ils en pensaient... Cela prouve bien que seul le marché compte pour cette commission et qu'elle se fiche éperdument de la planète. Et pourtant nous n'en avons qu'une, mais ça ne rentre pas dans la tête de technocrates qui se croient pourtant plus intelligents que la moyenne. D'autre part, aller polluer d'autres continents, c'est faire preuve d'un mépris de l'autre qui confine au racisme, que vous prétendez pourtant combattre, là aussi à longueur de temps. C'est plus qu'irresponsable, c'est criminel.
englishfeedback: We are talking about a long time of ecology, sometimes wrongly and unfortunately. How do you want European citizens to trust this unelected European Commission if there is hypocrisy all the time. You will therefore export dangerous chemicals to the other end of the world, obviously without asking citizens what they thought. This proves that only the market counts for this commission and that it falls well on the planet. And yet we have only one, but it is not at the head of technocrats who feel smarter than average. On the other hand, going to pollute other continents is a disrespect of the other that confines itself to racism, which you pretend to combat, again over a long period of time. It is more than irresponsible, it is criminal.

feedback: Wat ik me afvraag is waarom we producten die in Europa als slecht voor het milieu en daardoor ook voor mensen zijn kunnen exporteren naar andere landen c.q. continenten. Zijn deze producten daar ineens niet schadelijk? Of gaan we werken met de dubbele moraal van economisch belang. We zijn allemaal lid van de Verenigde Naties met de daarbij behorende rechten van de mens. Hebben wij meer rechten dan de landen waartoe we deze producten willen exporteren? Wat gij niet wilt wat u geschied, doe dat ook een ander niet.
englishfeedback: What I wonder is why we can export to other countries or continents products that are bad for the environment and therefore for people in Europe. Are these products not harmful at all? Or we will work with the double morality of economic importance. We are all members of the United Nations and its human rights. Do we have more rights than the countries to which we want to export these products? What you don’t want to do, do not do anything else.

feedback: The use of pesticides contaminates soils and then waters all over the world, and for decades even after their ban. It is as dangerous to spread them far from Europe as on our own plantations, because the pesticides travel in the air and in the soil and the waters. If you authorize their export, you authorize the extermination of living species everywhere on the planet, like it is already confirmed in Europe ( Birds -40% and insects -60% ) Please do not believe that you are protecting your European children in banning here these poisons, and authorizing their exportation. There is no physical frontier in the oceans and in the air. Please, stop immediately the manufacturing of pesticides and support largely and efficiently organic and natural agriculture, everywhere. We are desperate to have to convince our elected officials that multinational phytosanitary companies have been poisoning us for 50 years. Do you want a great revolt of the people because you don't have the courage to defend them? What are your health-environment programs for? To amuse the people ? Do you think we are incapable of understanding that autoimmune diseases and cancers do not come from these millions of tons of phytosanitary products? And what about biodiversity? If humans are now ill, what about fishs, plants , insects, birds, trees ...? Please, please, listen to the scientists who alert you, of course not the scientists paid by the multinationals but those who still have a certain independence. Listen to the people, and their associations of volonteers who are working hard to protest. Listen to the people, touch in their families and their health, who protest against the injustice of undergoing decisions that protect the short-term interests of a few shareholders . I am a great mother, international economist for 30 years, and now active with an Association defending our environment , instead of playing golf or organising parties with old friends...because you are not able to defend our children, our planet ! Please do the things well and stop any exportation of pesticides, NOW! I thank you for all of us. Marianne (I'm surprised that french is not proposed for this contribution ..? )
englishfeedback: The use of pesticides contaminates soils and then waters all over the world, and for decades even after their ban. It is at risk to spread them far from Europe as on our own plantations, falling within the pesticides travel in the air and in the soil and the waters. If you authorise their export, you authorise the extermination of living species all where on the planet, like it is already confirmed in Europe (Birds -40 % and insects -60 %) Please do not believe that you are protecting your European children in banning here these poisons, and authorising their export. There is no physical frontier in the oceans and in the air. Please, stop immediately the manufacturing of pesticides and support more and efficiently organic and natural agriculture, everywhere. We are desperate to have to convince our elected officials that multinational phytosanitary companies have been poisoning us for 50 years. Do you want a great Revolt of the people you have the courage to defend them? What are your health-environment programmes for? To use the people? Do you think we are incapable of understanding that auto-immune diseases and cancers do not come from these millions of tons of safety-related products? And what about biodiversity? If humans are now ill, what about fishs, plants, insects, birds, trees...? Please, please, listen to the scientists who alert you, of race not the scientists paid by the multinationals but those who still have a certain degree of independence. Listen to the people, and their associations of willing who are working hard to protest. Listen to the people, touch in their families and their health, who protest against the injustice of Undergoing decisions that protects the short-term interests of a few shareholders. I am a greast mother, international economist for 30 years, and now active with an Association defending our environment, instead of playing golf or organising parties with old friends, you are not able to defend our children, our planet! Please do the things well and stop any export of pesticides, NOW! I thank you for all of us. Marianne (I’m surprised that french is not proposed for this contribution...? )

feedback: La exportación de pesticidas tóxicos revela un doble rasero. Los pesticidas peligrosos están prohibidos en Europa por su relación con el cáncer, los problemas reproductivos y las enfermedades neurodegenerativas, así como con la muerte de las abejas. Además, se sabe que algunos provocan daño cerebral infantil y durante el embarazo. Si no usamos estos pesticidas por ser demasiado peligrosos, ¿cómo podemos permitir que se exporten? La prohibición de exportar pesticidas tóxicos fomentaría la innovación y animaría a Europa y al resto del mundo a utilizar técnicas fitosanitarias más sostenibles. Mantener en el mercado pesticidas obsoletos y peligrosos nos priva de un futuro más verde y de unas prácticas agrícolas más ecológicas.
englishfeedback: The export of toxic pesticides reveals double standards. Hazardous pesticides are banned in Europe because of their relationship with cancer, reproductive problems and neurodegenerative diseases, as well as the death of bees. In addition, some are known to cause brain damage for children and during pregnancy. If we do not use these pesticides because they are too dangerous, how can we allow them to be exported? A ban on the export of toxic pesticides would encourage innovation and encourage Europe and the rest of the world to use more sustainable plant protection techniques. Keeping obsolete and dangerous pesticides on the market deprives us of a greener future and greener farming practices.

feedback: Nous vivons sur la même planète TERRE, donc soyons solidaires sans hésitation pour la sauver ici et là-bas...! Il en est ainsi pour tous les domaines néfastes que nous connaissons bien dorénavant!
englishfeedback: We are living on the same TERRE planet, so we are united with each other without hesitation to save it here and there... This is the case for all the harmful areas that we know well now!

feedback: Tutto il mondo e le persone devono essere tutelate allo stesso modo. I pesticidi vietati in Europa non vanno commercializzati in altri paesi.
englishfeedback: All over the world and people must be protected in the same way. Pesticides banned in Europe should not be marketed in other countries.

feedback: Fermare tutti i tipi di pesticidi è un dovere: la terra sta collassando per colpa nostra che dovremmo esserne i custodi e questo è INACCETTABILE. Voi siete i rappresentanti della cultura che deve dare il buon esempio ef essere guida per tutti i popoli
englishfeedback: Stopping all types of pesticides is a duty: the land is collapsing through our own fault that we should be the guardians of it and this is INACCEPTABLE. You are the representatives of culture that needs to lead by example for all peoples.

feedback: Diese Pestizide sind in Europa verboten, aber der Export ist erlaubt: Das ist eine Doppelmoral. Die gefährlichen Pestizide wurden in Europa verboten, nachdem sie mit Krebs, Beeinträchtigung der Fruchtbarkeit und neurodegenerativen Krankheiten in Verbindung gebracht wurden - zum Bienensterben tragen sie außerdem bei. Einige dieser Pestizide sind in Europa verboten, weil sie mit Hirnschäden bei Kindern und ungeborenen Babys in Verbindung gebracht werden. Wenn diese Pestizide für uns zu gefährlich sind: Wie können wir dann zulassen, dass sie exportiert werden? Die Ausfuhr von giftigen Pestiziden ist eine Frage der Menschenrechte, denn die Pestizide schaden den Menschen: Jedes Jahr sterben Tausende von Landwirt*innen durch den Kontakt mit gefährlichen Pestiziden. Es gibt unzählige Studien, die die schädlichen Auswirkungen der exportierten Pestizide auf den Menschen belegen. Die Ausfuhr giftiger Pestizide ist desaströs für Bienen, die biologische Vielfalt und den Planeten. Die Beweislage ist eindeutig: Neonics und andere giftige Pestizide töten Bienen. Deshalb sind sie in Europa verboten. Wir sollten nicht zulassen, dass diese Pestizide in Länder exportiert werden, in denen Gesundheitsvorschriften weniger streng sind und dort Bienen und die biologische Vielfalt zerstören. Länder, in denen es kaum Vorschriften für giftige Pestizide gibt, werden als Markt benutzt. Europäische Unternehmen sollten nicht die Möglichkeit haben, diesen Umstand auszunutzen. Wie kann Europa als Weltmacht ernst genommen werden, wenn wir gefährliche Chemikalien ins Ausland verschiffen und dabei Mensch und Natur in Ländern vergiften, in denen Sicherheitsvorschriften geringer sind und weniger streng durchgesetzt werden? Ein Exportverbot für giftige Pestizide würde Europa und der Welt helfen, zu nachhaltigeren Pflanzenschutzmethoden überzugehen. Wenn gefährliche Pestizide auf dem Markt bleiben, werden wir weiter auf eine grünere Zukunft und nachhaltige Landwirtschaft warten müssen. Ein Rechtsgutachten des Center for International Environmental Law, das 2022 veröffentlicht wurde, zeigt, dass die EU mit dem Export verbotener Pestizide nach Afrika und Mittelamerika gegen internationale rechtliche Verpflichtungen und die Menschenrechte verstoßen.
englishfeedback: These pesticides are banned in Europe, but exports are allowed: This is a double standard. Hazardous pesticides have been banned in Europe after being associated with cancer, fertility impairment and neurodegenerative diseases and contribute to bee mortality. Some of these pesticides are banned in Europe because they are associated with brain damage in children and unborn babies. If these pesticides are too dangerous for us: How can we then allow them to be exported? The export of toxic pesticides is a human rights issue, as pesticides harm people: Every year thousands of farmers die from exposure to hazardous pesticides. There are countless studies demonstrating the harmful effects of exported pesticides on humans. Exports of toxic pesticides are desastrous for bees, biodiversity and the planet. The evidence is clear: Neonics and other toxic pesticides kill bees. This is why they are banned in Europe. We should not allow these pesticides to be exported to countries where health rules are less stringent and where bees and biodiversity are destroyed. Countries with little regulation on toxic pesticides are used as a market. European companies should not be able to take advantage of this fact. How can Europe be taken seriously as a global power when we ship dangerous chemicals abroad, poisoning people and nature in countries where safety rules are lower and enforcement is less stringent? A ban on exports of toxic pesticides would help Europe and the world move towards more sustainable plant protection practices. If hazardous pesticides remain on the market, we will have to wait for a greener future and sustainable agriculture. A legal opinion from the Center for International Environmental Law, published in 2022, shows that the EU is violating international legal obligations and human rights by exporting banned pesticides to Africa and Central America.

feedback: L'esportazione di pesticidi tossici sfrutta i paesi con leggi più permissive. L'Europa ha un ruolo da svolgere nel mondo: non si deve permettere alle sue aziende di approfittare dei paesi con una regolamentazione più debole. Come possiamo essere presi sul serio se spediamo le nostre sostanze chimiche pericolose all'estero, avvelenando le persone e la natura in paesi dove le norme di sicurezza sono più deboli e meno rigorose?
englishfeedback: The export of toxic pesticides exploits countries with more permissive laws. Europe has a role to play in the world: its companies should not be allowed to take advantage of countries with weaker regulation. How can we be taken seriously if we ship our hazardous chemicals abroad, poisoning people and nature in countries where safety standards are weaker and lower?

feedback: Na minha opinião a Comissão Europeia deve proíbir a produção e exportação de químicos banidos na União Europeia, pois, se foi tomada a decisão de banir esses químicos é certamente porque eles são perigosos. Então, apesar dos interesses económicos da própria Comissão Europeia e das empresas que produzem e exportam estes produtos perigosos, devemos escolher o que é melhor para o nosso planeta. A proibição da produção de produtos químicos perigosos na União Europeia certamente traria desafios económicos significativos, mas também traria oportunidades para o desenvolvimento de alternativas mais seguras e sustentáveis. Aqui estão algumas possíveis soluções para lidar com os problemas económicos que poderiam surgir: Estímulo à inovação: A proibição dos produtos químicos perigosos pode impulsionar a inovação em novas tecnologias, métodos de produção e produtos mais seguros e ambientalmente amigáveis. As empresas seriam incentivadas a investir em pesquisa e desenvolvimento para criar soluções alternativas que atendam aos padrões de segurança e regulamentação. Incentivos fiscais e subsídios: O governo poderia fornecer incentivos fiscais e subsídios para as empresas que se comprometerem a desenvolver e implementar alternativas seguras e sustentáveis. Isso ajudaria a tornar a transição mais acessível financeiramente e incentivaria a adoção de práticas mais responsáveis pelas empresas. Apoio à reconversão da indústria: A proibição dos produtos químicos perigosos pode afetar setores inteiros da indústria. Nesse sentido, seria necessário apoiar a transição e reconversão das empresas afetadas, auxiliando-as a adaptar as suas operações e recursos para atender às novas regulamentações e demandas do mercado. Investimento em formação e qualificação: A transição para alternativas mais seguras exigirá trabalhadores com conhecimentos e habilidades específicas. Portanto, investir em programas de formação e qualificação profissional seria essencial para garantir que haja mão de obra preparada para as novas demandas da indústria. Fomento à economia circular: A economia circular visa reduzir o desperdício e maximizar o uso de recursos, o que pode ser uma resposta adequada para a proibição de produtos químicos perigosos. O estímulo a modelos de negócios circulares, onde os materiais são reutilizados e reciclados, pode trazer benefícios econômicos e ambientais. Cooperação internacional: A proibição pode gerar desafios em relação à importação de produtos de países que ainda utilizem produtos químicos perigosos. É importante trabalhar em cooperação com outros países e blocos económicos para alinhar padrões e regulamentações, evitando assim a concorrência desleal. Transição gradual e acompanhamento: A proibição não precisa de ser imediata; uma transição gradual pode ser mais viável para as empresas se adaptarem. Além disso, um acompanhamento rigoroso das empresas e do mercado ajudaria a monitorar o progresso e enfrentar eventuais dificuldades. É fundamental que a proibição seja acompanhada de uma abordagem equilibrada, considerando os impactos económicos e sociais, ao mesmo tempo que procura garantir a segurança ambiental e a saúde dos cidadãos. A Comissão Europeia e os Estados membros devem trabalhar em conjunto com a indústria, organizações não governamentais e especialistas para encontrar soluções eficazes e sustentáveis para os desafios que surgirão. https://chat.openai.com/share/6e7d8beb-54ef-4bc7-846f-64c201b65cd6 https://www.hsph.harvard.edu/news/hsph-in-the-news/protecting-against-forever-chemicals/ https://www.theguardian.com/environment/2023/jul/11/eu-to-drop-ban-of-hazardous-chemicals-after-industry-pressure
englishfeedback: In my view, the European Commission should prohibit the production and export of chemicals banned in the European Union, since if the decision to ban these chemicals has been taken, it is certainly because they are dangerous. Then, despite the economic interests of the European Commission itself and the companies that produce and export these dangerous products, we must choose what is best for our planet. Banning the production of hazardous chemicals in the European Union would certainly pose significant economic challenges, but would also provide opportunities for the development of safer and more sustainable alternatives. Here are some possible solutions to deal with the economic problems that could arise: Stimulating innovation: Banning hazardous chemicals can boost innovation in new technologies, production methods and safer and environmentally friendly products. Companies would be encouraged to invest in research and development to create alternative solutions that meet safety and regulatory standards. Tax incentives and subsidies: The government could provide tax incentives and subsidies for companies that commit to developing and implementing safe and sustainable alternatives. This would help make the transition more affordable and encourage more responsible business practices. Industry reconversion support: The ban on hazardous chemicals may affect entire sectors of industry. To this end, it would be necessary to support the transition and conversion of the undertakings concerned by helping them to adapt their operations and resources to take account of the new regulations and demands on the market. Investment in training and qualification: The transition to safer alternatives will require workers with specific knowledge and skills. Investing in vocational training and qualification programmes would therefore be essential to ensure that there is a workforce ready for the new demands of industry. Fostering the circular economy: The circular economy aims to reduce waste and maximise the use of resources, which can be an appropriate response to the ban on hazardous chemicals. Stimulating circular business models, where materials are reused and recycled, can bring economic and environmental benefits. International cooperation: The ban can create challenges in relation to the import of products from countries that still use hazardous chemicals. It is important to work in cooperation with other countries and economic blocs to align standards and regulations, thus avoiding unfair competition. Gradual transition and monitoring: The prohibition does not need to be immediate; a gradual transition can be more feasible for businesses to adapt. In addition, close monitoring of businesses and the market would help to monitor progress and deal with possible difficulties. It is essential that the ban is accompanied by a balanced approach, taking into account the economic and social impacts, while seeking to ensure the environmental safety and health of citizens. The European Commission and Member States should work together with industry, non-governmental organisations and experts to find effective and sustainable solutions to the challenges that will arise. https://chat.openai.com/share/6e7d8beb-54ef-4bc7-846f-64c201b65cd6 https://www.hsph.harvard.edu/news/hsph-in-the-news/protecting-against-forever-chemicals/ https://www.theguardian.com/environment/2023/jul/11/eu-to-drop-ban-of-hazardous-chemicals-after-industry-pressure

feedback: J'approuve l'interdiction. Je souhaite que cette interdiction aboutisse rapidement
englishfeedback: I agree with the ban. I want this ban to be speedily successful

feedback: Encore un détournement de la loi pour les lobbys...L'occident est le mieux placé pour le savoir ...Alors, on ne va pas, nous, la population, vous expliquer ce qu'implique l'exportation de pesticides. En votre âme et conscience ...Et pour exemple, c'est la 1ère année que je n'ai plus observé que 5 abeilles !
englishfeedback: Another abuse of the law for lobbyists... The western world is best placed to know it... We are not going to explain to you what the export of pesticides means. In your soul and consciousness... And for example, it is the 1st year that I observed only 5 bees!

feedback: Estimados legisladores europeos. La exportación de pesticidas tóxicos revela un doble rasero. Los pesticidas peligrosos están prohibidos en Europa por su relación con el cáncer, los problemas reproductivos y las enfermedades neurodegenerativas, así como con la muerte de las abejas. Además, se sabe que algunos provocan daño cerebral infantil y durante el embarazo. Si no usamos estos pesticidas por ser demasiado peligrosos, ¿cómo podemos permitir que se exporten? La exportación de pesticidas tóxicos es una cuestión de derechos humanos, ya que atentan contra la salud. Cada año, miles de personas que viven de la agricultura mueren por exponerse a estos peligrosos pesticidas. Numerosos estudios demuestran sus efectos nocivos. La exportación de pesticidas tóxicos perjudica a las abejas, la biodiversidad y el planeta. Los datos no mienten: los neonicotinoides y otros pesticidas tóxicos matan a las abejas. Por eso están prohibidos en Europa. ¿Cómo podemos permitir que se exporten a otros países? La industria de los pesticidas tóxicos se lucra con los países de normativas menos estrictas. Europa tiene que dar ejemplo y no permitir que sus empresas se aprovechen de una legislación más permisiva. ¿Cómo se nos puede tomar en serio si exportamos unos productos químicos que envenenan a las personas y la naturaleza? La prohibición de exportar pesticidas tóxicos fomentaría la innovación y animaría a Europa y al resto del mundo a utilizar técnicas fitosanitarias más sostenibles. Mantener en el mercado pesticidas obsoletos y peligrosos nos priva de un futuro más verde y de unas prácticas agrícolas más ecológicas.
englishfeedback: Dear European legislators. The export of toxic pesticides reveals double standards. Hazardous pesticides are banned in Europe because of their relationship with cancer, reproductive problems and neurodegenerative diseases, as well as the death of bees. In addition, some are known to cause brain damage for children and during pregnancy. If we do not use these pesticides because they are too dangerous, how can we allow them to be exported? The export of toxic pesticides is a human rights issue, as they harm health. Every year, thousands of people living in agriculture die from exposure to these dangerous pesticides. Numerous studies demonstrate its harmful effects. The export of toxic pesticides harms bees, biodiversity and the planet. The data do not feel: neonicotinoids and other toxic pesticides kill bees. This is why they are banned in Europe. How can we allow them to be exported to other countries? The toxic pesticide industry is profitable with countries with less stringent regulations. Europe needs to lead by example and not allow its businesses to take advantage of more permissive legislation. How can we be taken seriously if we export chemicals that poisonate people and nature? A ban on the export of toxic pesticides would encourage innovation and encourage Europe and the rest of the world to use more sustainable plant protection techniques. Keeping obsolete and dangerous pesticides on the market deprives us of a greener future and greener farming practices.

feedback: Il n'est pas logique d'interdire des produits pour leur dangerosité en Europe et pas ailleurs. Les risques sont les mêmes pour les populations humaines et celles des insectes ici comme partout sur la planète. De plus, l'europe n'est pas crédible si elle expédie à l'étranger des produits qu'elle interdit sur ses terres. Il nous faut évoluer, avancer vers un respect de la biodiversité partout sur la planète et respecter la juridiction internationnale. Montrons le bon exemple pour notre survie à tous !
englishfeedback: It is not logical to ban products for their dangerous nature in Europe and not elsewhere. The risks are the same for human and insect populations here and all over the world. Moreover, Europe is not credible if it sends products that it bans on its land abroad. We need to evolve, move towards respect for biodiversity all over the world and respect international jurisdiction. Let’s set a good example for all of us to survive!

feedback: EU Coherence about hazardous chemicals means that EU production and exportation needs to stop. Hard talk with third country producers/exporters is essential to get their cooperation to deliver concrete results in order for action by EU to be meaningful. EU example manifests our offer of partnership in dealing with toxants, and we should expect reciprocal behaviour, and demand it if need be. You can be confident of widespread public backing - in the EU and beyond - of the work required to eliminate these hazards. Courage

This is an excellent initiative. The EU must be consistent in its policy internally and externally. If dangerous substances are banned in the EU, their production in and export from the EU should also be banned. It is vile to make profit from producing substances acknowledged to be dangerous to the environment, the soil, other forms of life and humans. One measure for us and another for other countries cannot be justified.

Les produits interdits dans l'UE à cause de leur dangérosité pour la santé des citoyens européens et pour l'environnement sont également dangereux pour la santé des citoyens et pour l'environnement des autres pays. La santé humaine et la protection de l'environnement revêtent la même importance dans tous les pays du globe. Les dommages causés dans un pays impactent inévitablement, dans notre monde globalisé, presque tous les autres.
englishfeedback: Products banned in the EU because of their danger to the health of European citizens and to the environment are also dangerous to the health of citizens and to the environment of other countries. Human health and environmental protection are equally important in all countries around the world. The damage caused in one country inevitably affects almost all the others in our globalised world.

feedback: Il est inadmissible que des produits interdits d'utilisation en europe soient autorisés de fabrication. C'est un total non sens! De plus ces produits sont souvent envoyés dans des pays où ils sont mal utilisés et où la gestion des déchets est inexistante. Les aliments traités sur des aliments qui sont ensuite renvoyés dans nos assiettes. Il s'agit d'une aberration écologique de par l'utilisation de ces produits prouvés dangereux puisque interdits par l'Europe Il s'agit d'une aberration environnementale de par le surplus de déchets produits Il s'agit d'une aberation économique puisque, de par l'utilisation de produits interdits chez nous, les exploitants non européens sont favorisés par rapport à nos propres exploitants
englishfeedback: It is unacceptable that products banned from use in Europe are authorised for manufacture. It’s a total not making sense! Moreover, these products are often sent to countries where they are poorly used and waste management does not exist. Foods treated on foods which are then returned to our plates. This is an ecological aberration through the use of these proven dangerous products, since it is banned by Europe. This is an environmental aberration due to the surplus of waste produced. This is an economic aberation since, by using products banned at our premises, non-European operators are favoured over our own operators.

feedback: Je souhaite que la commission européenne s'oppose à la fabrication et l'exportation de produits dangereux interdits dans l'UE. Un produit dangereux dans un pays l'est tout aussi bien dans un autre pays. La fabrication en vue de l'exportation de ces produits me semble totalement immorale.
englishfeedback: I want the European Commission to oppose the manufacture and export of dangerous products banned in the EU. A dangerous product in one country is just as good as it is in another country. The manufacture for export of those products seems to me to be totally immoral.

feedback: Il est important d'interdire l'exportation de pesticides interdits à l'usage en Europe. L'exportation de pesticides toxiques révèle une politique de deux poids deux mesures : Les pesticides dangereux sont interdits en Europe après avoir été associés à des cancers, des problèmes de reproduction et des maladies neurodégénératives, ainsi qu'à la mort des abeilles. Certains de ces pesticides sont même interdits en Europe en raison de leur lien avec des lésions cérébrales chez les enfants et les bébés à naître. Si ces pesticides sont trop dangereux pour nous, comment pouvons-nous autoriser leur exportation ?
englishfeedback: It is important to ban the export of pesticides banned for use in Europe. The export of toxic pesticides reveals a double standard policy: Hazardous pesticides are banned in Europe after being associated with cancer, reproductive problems and neurodegenerative diseases, as well as bee death. Some of these pesticides are even banned in Europe because of their link to brain damage in children and born babies. If these pesticides are too dangerous for us, how can we authorise their export?

feedback: The export of toxic pesticides exposes a double standard: Dangerous pesticides are banned in Europe after they were linked to cancer, reproductive problems and neurodegenerative diseases as well as the dying of bees. Some of these pesticides are banned in Europe because of their links to brain damage in children and unborn babies. If these pesticides are too dangerous for us, how can we allow them to be exported? The export of toxic pesticides is a human rights issue as these toxic pesticides are damaging to people: Every year, thousands of farmers die from exposure to dangerous pesticides. The pesticides exported have countless studies supporting the damaging effects on people. The export of toxic pesticides is bad for the bees, biodiversity and the planet. The evidence is clear: neonics and other poisonous pesticides kill bees. Thats why theyre banned in Europe. Why are we still allowing them to be exported to countries with weaker regulation, killing bees and decimating biodiversity?
I strongly disagree with the manufacturing and sending of dangerous pesticides banned in the EU abroad .

L'esportazione dell'UE di pesticidi vietati verso l'Africa e l'America centrale viola gli obblighi legali internazionali dell'UE e i diritti umani. Il pericolo per la salute umana non fa differenza se sei europeo o non lo sei. L'export danneggia la sostenibilità ambientale del pianeta, rallenta la ricerca di metodi ecocompatibili di protezione delle coltivazioni, favorisce il permanere di legislazioni permissive fuori dalla UE. Siamo tutti sulla stessa barca...
englishfeedback: The EU’s export of banned pesticides to Africa and Central America violates the EU’s international legal obligations and human rights. Danger to human health makes no difference if you are European or not. Export damages the environmental sustainability of the planet, slows down the search for environmentally friendly methods of protecting crops, and encourages the continuation of permissive legislation outside the EU. We are all on the same boat...

feedback: I am writing to express my empathic support for a ban on the export of toxic pesticides. It makes no sense to sell to farmers in other countries products we have determined to be undesirable and unsafe here in Europe. One very important issue is the damage they do to bee populations. Without pollinators agriculture is impossible. Another crucial issue is the mounting evidence of irreversible health problems these products have caused. Thank you for hearing me out on this issue Jennifer Lukac (non-EU citizen but permanent EU resident) Zaragoza, Spain

Certains produits dangereux pour la santé ont été interdits au sein de l'union européenne ; d'autres le seront sans doute à l'avenir. Nous savons que depuis 1990, le nombre de cancers "courants" (sein, prostate...) a doublé... Il n'y a pas d'autre raison à la vente de produits dangereux que les bénéfices sans doute considérables qu'elle engendre. Comment accepter que des produits interdits en Europe puissent décemment être vendus ailleurs ? La vie des personnes a-t-elle moins de valeur dès lors que nous franchissons les frontières de notre continent ? Si nous cautionnons cela, ne parlons plus de nos valeurs humanistes. Soyons honnêtes et reconnaissons que seul l'argent compte et que la vie ne vaut rien.
englishfeedback: Some products that are dangerous to health have been banned within the European Union; others are likely to be so in the future. We know that since 1990 the number of ‘common’ cancers (breast, prostate, etc.) has doubled... There is no reason for the sale of dangerous products other than the likely considerable benefits it generates. How can we accept that products banned in Europe can decisively be sold elsewhere? Is people’s lives less valuable when we cross the borders of our continent? If we endorse this, we are no longer talking about our humanist values. Let’s be honest and recognise that only money matters and that life is not worth anything.

feedback: Je suis POUR l'interdiction de la production et/ou de lexportation de certains produits chimiques dangereux interdits dans lUE, afin de protéger les pays tiers des effets négatifs de ceux-ci sur la santé humaine et sur lenvironnement.
englishfeedback: I am FOR a ban on the production and/or export of certain hazardous chemicals banned in the EU, in order to protect third countries from their negative effects on human health and the environment.

feedback: Je souhaite que la commission européenne s'oppose fermement à l'exportation des produits dangereux, interdits en Europe, vers les autres continents.C'est une pratique stupide et immorale. Yves Petiteau
englishfeedback: I want the European Commission to firmly oppose the export of dangerous products, banned in Europe, to the rest of the continent. This is a cruel and immoral practice. Yves Petiteau

feedback: Bonjour, les produits chimiques dangereux sont et restent dangereux quelle que soit la zone géographiques où ils sont utilisés. La protection de notre planète na pas de frontière. Depuis trop longtemps le modèle économique sacrifie la planète. Aujourdhui nous savons que ce modèle est dépassé et délétère pour nous tous. Je moppose fermement à la fabrication et à lexportation des produits chimiques dangereux interdits dans lUE. Merci pour votre attention,
englishfeedback: Hello, hazardous chemicals are and remain dangerous regardless of the geographical area in which they are used. The protection of our planet has no borders. The economic model has been sacrificing the planet for too long. Today we know that this model is outdated and damaging for all of us. I strongly oppose the manufacture and export of hazardous chemicals banned in the EU. Thank you for your attention.

feedback: Il faut modifier le règlement PIC pour interdire à la fois la production dans lUE et l'exportation (sans dérogation possible) de tous les pesticides et autres produits chimiques dangereux qui ont été interdits dans l'UE afin de protéger la santé humaine et l'environnement.
englishfeedback: The PIC Regulation needs to be amended to ban both the production in the EU and the export (without possible derogation) of all pesticides and other hazardous chemicals that have been banned in the EU in order to protect human health and the environment.

feedback: Sicuramente da vietare perchè ci ritornerebbero con i prodotti
englishfeedback: Certainly to be banned because they would return with the products

feedback: Buenas tardes, solicito como ciudadana de esta Comunidad Europea que no se permita la exportación de pesticidas peligrosos a otros continentes como es el caso actual de África y América del Sur, y se siga el mismo criterio de prohibición que en Europa. No podemos permitir que grandes compañías cuyo último objetivo es el enriquecimiento consigan a través de la degradación de nuestro planeta estos fines. Por favor, lo que no queremos para nosotros y nuestros hijos no podemos admitirlo en otros continentes. Muchas gracias. Paremos estos desastres, está en nuestras manos. Saludos. Guadalupe Delgado Uztárroz.
englishfeedback: Good afternoon, as a citizen of this European Community, I call for the export of hazardous pesticides to other continents, as is currently the case in Africa and South America, not to be allowed, and to follow the same prohibition criterion as in Europe. We cannot allow large companies whose ultimate goal is enrichment to achieve these goals through the degradation of our planet. Please, what we do not want for us and our children cannot admit it on other continents. Thank you very much. We will stop these disasters, it is in our hands. Best regards. Guadeloupe Delgado Uztárroz.

feedback: Szanowni Państwo, Jako obywatelki Unii Europejskiej zależy mi bardzo na zrównoważonym rozwoju, tj. troszczę się nie tylko o rozwój uprawy roślin, ale również o środowisko i zdrowie moje i swojej rodziny. Zdaje sobie sprawę jak ważne jest zabezpieczenie roślin i ich wzrostu przed owadami i innymi szkodnikami. Ww. działanie nie może jednak odbywać się kosztem naszego zdrowia, jak również istnienia pszczół i innych ważnych zapylaczy. Wiadomym jest, że koncerny działają głównie dla zysku, ale pracownicy tych koncernów, jak i ich członkowie zarządów mają również rodziny, które chciałyby żyć w czystym i zrównoważonym środowisku. Czasami więc trzeba podjąć decyzję wbrew ich oczekiwaniom odnośnie zysku. Dlatego apeluję o zakazanie eksportu niebezpiecznych pestycydów. Z poważaniem, Alicja Jurczyk
englishfeedback: As a citizen of the European Union, I am very committed to sustainable development, i.e. I am looking not only at the development of plant-breeding, but also about the environment and health of my family. Recognises the importance of protecting plants and their growth from insects and other pests. However, this action must not come at the expense of our health, as well as the existence of bees and other important pollinators. It is well known that companies operate mainly for profit, but the employees of these groups and their board members also have families that want to live in a clean and sustainable environment. It is therefore sometimes necessary to take a decision against their profit expectations. This is why I call for a ban on the export of hazardous pesticides. Sincerely, Alicja Jurczyk

feedback: Il est ignoble d,empoisonner des peuples,plutôt démunis ,pour satisfaire la voracité des groupes agroalimentaires et chimiques. Vous dégoûtez les Europeens ce faisant A Riela
englishfeedback: It is shameful of, poisoning rather poor people to satisfy the voracity of agri-food and chemical groups. You are disingenuous Europe in doing so A Riela

feedback: L'exportation de pesticides toxiques révèle une politique de deux poids deux mesures : Les pesticides dangereux sont interdits en Europe après avoir été associés à des cancers, des problèmes de reproduction et des maladies neurodégénératives, ainsi qu'à la mort des abeilles. Certains de ces pesticides sont même interdits en Europe en raison de leur lien avec des lésions cérébrales chez les enfants et les bébés à naître. Si ces pesticides sont trop dangereux pour nous, comment pouvons-nous autoriser leur exportation ?
englishfeedback: The export of toxic pesticides reveals a double standard policy: Hazardous pesticides are banned in Europe after being associated with cancer, reproductive problems and neurodegenerative diseases, as well as bee death. Some of these pesticides are even banned in Europe because of their link to brain damage in children and born babies. If these pesticides are too dangerous for us, how can we authorise their export?

feedback: Favorable à l'interdiction.
englishfeedback: In favour of the ban.

feedback: Concernant la vente de produits chimiques aux pays étrangers, il me parait ignoble de permettre cette vente alors qu'elle est interdite en UE pour la nocivité de ces produits. La pression des grandes entreprises européennes ne doit pas peser sur les décisions prises. Seuls le bon sens et la protection des populations étrangères doit guider ces décisions.
englishfeedback: With regard to the sale of chemicals to foreign countries, it seems to me that it is not possible to allow this sale even though it is banned in the EU for the harmfulness of these products. The pressure of large European companies must not put pressure on the decisions taken. Only common sense and protection of foreign populations should guide these decisions.

feedback: Han de prohibir la exportación de pesticidas tóxicos porque están dañando el planeta. No podemos quedarnos solo en soluciones para nuestro pequeño continente hay que ser valientes e ir a por más, hay que luchas por nuestra supervivencia porque de seguir así nos queda muy poco para acabar con la vida de este planeta
englishfeedback: They must ban the export of toxic pesticides because they are damaging the planet. We cannot only stay in solutions for our small continent we need to be courageous and go for more, we need to fight for our survival because if we do so there is very little to stop the life of this planet.

feedback: Si des produits sont interdits dans l'UE en raison de leur dangerosité, pourquoi devrait on continuer à les produire et les vendre à d'autres pays sous prétexte qu'ils n'y sont pas interdits. Dangereux en UE donc dangereux partout. En plus leur production est probablement génératrice de déchets et pollutions diverses dont nous n'avons pas besoin.
englishfeedback: If products are banned in the EU because of their dangerous nature, why should they continue to be produced and sold to other countries on the pretext that they are not banned there. Dangerous in the EU, so dangerous everywhere. Moreover, their production is likely to generate various types of waste and pollution that we do not need.

feedback: L'exportation de pesticides toxiques révèle une politique de deux poids deux mesures : Les pesticides dangereux sont interdits en Europe après avoir été associés à des cancers, des problèmes de reproduction et des maladies neurodégénératives, ainsi qu'à la mort des abeilles. Certains de ces pesticides sont même interdits en Europe en raison de leur lien avec des lésions cérébrales chez les enfants et les bébés à naître. Si ces pesticides sont trop dangereux pour nous, comment pouvons-nous autoriser leur exportation ? L'exportation de pesticides toxiques est une question de droits humains , car ces pesticides sont nocifs pour notre santé : Chaque année, des milliers d'agriculteurs meurent des suites dune trop forte exposition à ces pesticides dangereux. Les pesticides exportés font l'objet d'innombrables études qui confirment leurs effets néfastes sur les humains. L'exportation de pesticides toxiques est néfaste pour les abeilles, la biodiversité et la planète en général. Les preuves sont claires : les néonics et autres pesticides dangereux tuent les abeilles. C'est pourquoi ils sont interdits en Europe. Pourquoi autorisons-nous encore leur exportation vers des pays où la réglementation est moins stricte, alors quils continueront de tuer les abeilles et décimer la biodiversité ? L'exportation de pesticides toxiques profite des pays où la réglementation est moins stricte. L'UE a un rôle à jouer dans le monde - ses entreprises ne devraient pas être autorisées à profiter des pays où la réglementation est plus faible. Comment pouvons-nous être pris au sérieux si nous expédions nos produits chimiques dangereux à l'étranger, empoisonnant ainsi les populations et la nature dans des pays où les règles de sécurité sont plus faibles et moins strictement appliquées ? L'interdiction d'exporter des pesticides toxiques serait une opportunité unique pour l'innovation et aiderait l'Europe et le monde à évoluer vers des méthodes de protection des plantes plus durables. Le maintien sur le marché de pesticides anciens et dangereux nous prive d'un avenir plus vert et de pratiques agricoles plus durables. Un avis juridique du Center for International Environmental Law publié en 2022 montre que les exportations européennes de pesticides interdits vers l'Afrique et l'Amérique centrale violent les obligations juridiques internationales de l'UE et le droit relatif aux droits humains. Merci de prendre en considération ce qui précède et d'interdire la production à des fins d'exportation des produits chimiques interdits dans l'Union Européenne.
englishfeedback: The export of toxic pesticides reveals a double standard policy: Hazardous pesticides are banned in Europe after being associated with cancer, reproductive problems and neurodegenerative diseases, as well as bee death. Some of these pesticides are even banned in Europe because of their link to brain damage in children and born babies. If these pesticides are too dangerous for us, how can we authorise their export? The export of toxic pesticides is a human rights issue, as these pesticides are harmful to our health: Every year, thousands of farmers die as a result of excessive exposure to these hazardous pesticides. Exported pesticides are subject to countless studies confirming their adverse effects on humans. The export of toxic pesticides is harmful to bees, biodiversity and the planet in general. The evidence is clear: neonics and other hazardous pesticides kill bees. This is why they are banned in Europe. Why do we still allow their export to countries with less stringent regulation, while they will continue to kill bees and decay biodiversity? The export of toxic pesticides benefits countries with less stringent regulation. The EU has a role to play in the world – its businesses should not be allowed to benefit from countries with weaker regulation. How can we be taken seriously if we send our hazardous chemicals abroad, poisoning people and nature in countries where safety rules are weaker and less strictly enforced? Banning the export of toxic pesticides would be a unique opportunity for innovation and would help Europe and the world to move towards more sustainable plant protection methods. Keeping old and dangerous pesticides on the market deprives us of a greener future and more sustainable agricultural practices. A legal opinion of the Center for International Environmental Law published in 2022 shows that European exports of banned pesticides to Africa and Central America violate the EU’s international legal obligations and human rights law. Please take the above into consideration and ban the production for export of chemicals banned in the European Union.

feedback: Oczekuje od Was jako moich reprezentantow ze zajmiecie zie kluczowymi problemami naszego regionu i jego wpływu na świat. Dziekune
englishfeedback: It expects you, as my representative, to address the key problems of our region and its impact on the world. Children

feedback: Stop with using/sending/approval to chemicals that are poison. That are a threat for nature/mankind/animals/water. Are you aware that mankind -we- are the BIGGEST destroyer of nature? So please can you help us to STOP that? By e.g. not allowing to use/make/transport/export/import poisons?
