feedback: Here are some reasons why I think we need an export ban on dangerous pesticides forbidden in Europe: - The export of toxic pesticides exposes a double standard: Dangerous pesticides are banned in Europe after they were linked to cancer, reproductive problems and neurodegenerative diseases as well as the dying of bees. Some of these pesticides are banned in Europe because of their links to brain damage in children and unborn babies. If these pesticides are too dangerous for us, how can we allow them to be exported? - The export of toxic pesticides is a human rights issue as these toxic pesticides are damaging to people: Every year, thousands of farmers die from exposure to dangerous pesticides. The pesticides exported have countless studies supporting the damaging effects on people. - The export of toxic pesticides is bad for the bees, biodiversity and the planet. The evidence is clear: neonics and other poisonous pesticides kill bees. Thats why theyre banned in Europe. Why are we still allowing them to be exported to countries with weaker regulation, killing bees and decimating biodiversity? - The export of toxic pesticides is taking advantage of countries with weaker regulation. Europe has a role to play in the world - its companies should not be allowed to take advantage of countries with weaker regulation. How can we be taken seriously if we ship our hazardous chemicals abroad, poisoning people and nature in the process in countries where safety regulations are weaker and less strictly enforced. An export ban of toxic pesticides would be a boon for innovation and help Europe and the world move towards more sustainable plant protection methods. Keeping old and dangerous pesticides on the market is depriving us from a greener future and more sustainable farming practices. A legal opinion by the Center for International Environmental Law published in 2022 shows that EU exports of banned pesticides to Africa and Central America violate the EUs international legal obligations and human rights law.

En tant que citoyen de l'Union Européenne, je suis très sensible aux questions environnementales. De nombreux pesticides ou produits chimiques sont interdits en Europe mais continuent à être produits pour être exportés vers les pays d'Afrique ou d'Amérique latine. Il est indispensable d'interdire maintenant la production des ces produits sur le sol européen et je soutiens pleinement l'initiative de la commission européenne qui en a fait la ;proposition. Il est grand temps de prendre soin de notre planète!
englishfeedback: As a citizen of the European Union, I am very sensitive to environmental issues. Many pesticides or chemicals are banned in Europe but continue to be produced for export to African and Latin American countries. It is essential to ban the production of these products on European soil now and I fully support the initiative of the European Commission which has done so; It is high time to take care of our planet!

feedback: Good morning I write you too Say if you forbid in Europa all thé pesticides, you must forbid in all thé World. Thanks you
englishfeedback: Good morning I write you too Say if you forbid in Europa all pesticide tea, you must forbid in all tea World. Thanks you

feedback: Le maintient de la surproduction à l'aide des pesticides chimiques conduit au gaspillage, à la disparition des jardins bio et à l'agonie de la diversité du vivant!!!!!!!.
englishfeedback: Maintaining overproduction using chemical pesticides leads to waste, the disappearance of organic gardens and the agony of the diversity of life!

feedback: In Europe alone, 84% of the 264 crop species and 4,000 plant varieties exist thanks to pollination by bees. Bees pollinate crops such as apples, cranberries, melons, almonds, and broccoli. Fruits like blueberries and cherries are 90% dependent on honey bee pollination, and during bloom time, almonds depend entirely on honey bees for pollination. Cultivated plants are typically pollinated by animals. Animal-based pollination contributes to 30% of global food production, and bee-pollinated crops contribute to approximately one-third of the total human dietary supply. Bees are significant pollinators due to their effectiveness and wide availability. Their pollination services are essential for plants, including the ones we like to eat. Although honeybees get most of the credit, at least 1,500 insect species pollinate plants and these toxic chemicals kill virtually all of them. The export of toxic pesticides is bad for the bees, biodiversity and the planet. The evidence is clear: neonics and other poisonous pesticides kill bees, et al. Thats why theyre banned in Europe. Why are we still allowing them to be exported to countries with weaker regulation, killing bees and destroying biodiversity? "If the bee disappeared off the face of the Earth, man would only have four years left to live. Albert Einstein. As we struggle to feed the human population of the world, these toxic chemicals drastically reduce the ability of third world countries farmers to grow and reap successful harvests. These chemicals merely exacerbate the problem. The export of toxic pesticides is taking advantage of countries with weaker regulation. Europe has a role to play in the world - its companies should not be allowed to take advantage of countries with weaker regulation. How can we be taken seriously if we ship our hazardous chemicals abroad, poisoning people and nature in the process in countries where safety regulations are weaker and less strictly enforced just for profit and with a total disregard for the future of the planet?

Buongiorno, bisognerebbe essere ciechi per non vedere quello che sta capitando ai nostri territori : il nostro Pianeta non è più in grado di sopportare l'avvelenamento del terreno, dell'acqua e dell'aria il profitto di pochi. Vi prego di volervi attivare per evitare nella maniera più assoluta la produzione e l'esportazione di sostanze chimiche velenose e pericolose. Anche così, potremo sperare di darci un futuro e darlo ai nostri figli. Grazie Elena
englishfeedback: Good morning, we should be blind in order not to see what is happening in our territories: our Planet is no longer able to withstand the poisoning of land, water and air to the profit of a few. Please do not hesitate to do so in order to prevent the production and export of poisonous and dangerous chemicals in the most absolute way. Even so, we can hope to give us a future and give it to our children. Thank you Elena

feedback: Les produits dangereux pour la santé humaine, pour la biodiversité doivent être interdits. que ce soit à l'import ou à l'export. C'est une question de bon sens. Il est étrange que la question soit même posée.
englishfeedback: Products that are dangerous to human health and biodiversity must be prohibited, whether imported or exported. This is simple common sense. It is strange that the question is even asked.

feedback: It is unacceptable that the European Union allows the production and export of hazardous pesticides that are banned within its own region. The toxic effects of these pesticides on bees contribution to their extinction are well researched and documented. So are their potential risks on human health. Exposure to these pesticides were shown to be associated with serious medical conditions including neurological symptoms and liver cancer (reviewed in Zhang and Lu, Environment International, 2022). By banning these products within the EU and still allowing them to be exported to Africa and Latin America, the EU is evading its global responsibility. It is also a serious human rights issue, as the EU is knowingly exposing the population in Africa and Latin America to these toxic products while protecting its own citizens. It is a denial of a right to health of these people, and contrary to the values that the EU upholds. According to a legal opinion by the Center for International Environmental Law published in 2022, EU exports of banned pesticides to Africa and Central America violate the EUs international legal obligations and human rights law.

Il est inadmissible que des produits dangereux interdits dans l'UE soient exportés vers des pays dont la législation est moins stricte. Des populations plus fragiles ne doivent pas pâtir des comportements cyniques d'entreprises qui ne voient que le profit à court terme.
englishfeedback: It is unacceptable that dangerous products banned in the EU are exported to countries with less stringent legislation. More fragile populations should not suffer from cynic behaviour by companies that see only short-term profit.

feedback: Wir fordern ein Verbot des Exports von Pestiziden, deren Anwendung in der EU verboten ist. Allein im vergangenen Jahr wurden nach Angaben des Landwirtschaftsministeriums aus der Bundesrepublik 8.525 Tonnen Pestizidwirkstoffe exportiert, die in der EU überhaupt nicht zugelassen sind. Überdies wurden etwa 160 Wirkstoffe, die in der EU nicht genehmigt sind, als Wirkstoffe mit potentiell gesundheitsschädlichen Eigenschaften eingestuft. Diese Exporte gehen vor allem in die Länder des Globalen Südens, gefährden dort Gesundheit und Leben der Menschen und vergiften die Umwelt. Das Verbot der Anwendung dieser Pestizide bei uns besteht ja aus gutem Grund. Und Europa schützt sich ja selbst vor unerwünschten Pestiziden: durch Importkontrollen wird verhindert, dass pestizidverseuchte Lebensmittel nach Europa eingeführt werden, gleichzeitig wird durch die Pestizidexporte aus Deutschland die Vergiftung der einheimische Bevölkerung dieser Länder in Kauf genommen. Wir wissen, dass aus Deutschland solche Pestizide nach Peru exportiert werden. Cyanamid: wird hergestellt und exportiert von BASF (nach Brasilien) und exportiert auch von AlzChem, u.a. nach Peru. Obgleich der Wachstumsregulator Cyanamid in der EU bereits seit 2008 wegen seiner schädlichen Gesundheitswirkung, insbesondere auf Anwender*innen, nicht mehr erlaubt ist, wird er in großen Tonnagen von Deutschland aus auch nach Peru exportiert. (2021 lag der Export von Cyanamid in Formulierten Pestizidprodukten von Deutschland bei 2 500-9 999 Tonnen). Der Wirkstoff ist giftig beim Verschlucken, gesundheitsschädlich bei Hautkontakt und verursacht Hautreizungen. Er verursacht schwere Augenschäden und kann allergische Hautreaktionen hervorrufen. Unter Einwirkung von Cyanamid kann es zu Erbrechen, Atemnot, Blutdruckabfall und Herzrasen kommen. Die EU und die US-amerikanische Zulassungsbehörde EPA stuften den Wirkstoff zudem als möglicherweise krebserregend beim Menschen (= Verdacht auf karzinogene Wirkung) ein. Dass cyanamidhaltige Pestizidprodukte hoch problematisch für die Gesundheit der Anwender sind, ist seit vielen Jahren bekannt. Zudem wurde 2021 Imidacloprid von Bayer aus Deutschland nach Peru exportiert. Der Insektizide Wirkstoff ist hoch bienengefährlich, er hat in der EU seit 01/12/2020 seine Genehmigung für alle Freilandanwendungen verloren.
englishfeedback: We call for a ban on the export of pesticides whose use is banned in the EU. Last year alone, according to the Ministry of Agriculture, 8.525 tonnes of pesticide active substances were exported from the Federal Republic of Germany which are not authorised at all in the EU. In addition, about 160 active substances not approved in the EU have been classified as having potentially harmful properties to health. These exports mainly go to the countries of the Global South, endangering people’s health and lives and poisoning the environment. The ban on the use of these pesticides in our case is a good reason. And Europe protects itself from unwanted pesticides: import controls prevent pesticide-contaminated food from being imported into Europe and at the same time exports of pesticides from Germany accept the poisoning of the local population of these countries. We know that such pesticides are exported from Germany to Peru. Cyanamide: manufactured and exported by BASF (to Brazil) and also exported by AlzChem, including Peru. Although the growth regulator cyanamide has been banned in the EU since 2008 because of its harmful effects on health, in particular on users, it is also exported to Peru in large tonnages from Germany. (In 2021, Germany’s exports of cyanamide in formulated pesticides amounted to 2500-999 tonnes). The active substance is toxic if swallowed, harmful to health in contact with the skin and causes skin irritation. It causes serious eye damage and can cause allergic skin reactions. Under the influence of cyanamide, vomiting, difficulty in breathing, blood pressure and heart groves may occur. The EU and the US licensing authority EPA also classified the active substance as potentially carcinogenic to humans (= suspicion of carcinogenic effect). The fact that pesticide products containing cyanamide are highly problematic for the health of users has been known for many years. In 2021, imidacloprid was also exported from Bayer to Peru from Germany. The insecticide is highly hazardous to bees and has lost its approval for all field applications in the EU since 01/12/2020.

feedback: L'utilisation des produits chimiques dangereux sont interdits sur notre sol, il ne me parait pas normal que des entreprises qui produisent ces produits puissent les exporter vers des pays hors UE. Ils devraient être interdit de production étant néfaste pour la planète et ses habitants.
englishfeedback: The use of hazardous chemicals is banned on our soil, it does not seem to me normal that companies producing these chemicals can export them to countries outside the EU. They should be banned from production, which is harmful to the planet and its inhabitants.

feedback: Je trouve cela scandaleux de continuer à vendre des produits créant un tel danger pour l'humanité, au nom du seul profit. Cela doit être interdit, c'est indispensable
englishfeedback: I find it scandalous to continue selling products that create such a danger to humanity, in the name of profit alone. This must be forbidden, it is essential

feedback: Nous sommes très préoccupés par les conséquences désastreuses engendrées par les pesticides et fertilisants chimiques de synthèse sur la santé humaine, lenvironnement, la diversité biologique, les écosystèmes et lagriculture, et attirons avec gravité lattention de la Commission européenne sur les nombreux drames et une abondante littérature scientifique qui mettent en évidence les impacts négatifs des pesticides et fertilisants chimiques de synthèse sur lenvironnement, les écosystèmes, lalimentation et la santé humaine. Or, les pesticides extrêmement dangereux sont interdits d'utilisation pour leur dangerosité sur la santé humaine et sur l'environnement. Par conséquent, nous invitons l'Union Européenne a interdit la production et l'exportation de ces produits en Afrique.
englishfeedback: We are very concerned about the disastrous consequences of synthetic chemical pesticides and fertilisers on human health, the environment, biological diversity, ecosystems and agriculture, and draw the European Commission’s serious attention to the numerous tragedies and scientific literature that highlight the negative impacts of synthetic chemical pesticides and fertilisers on the environment, ecosystems, lalimentation and human health. Extremely hazardous pesticides are banned from use because they pose a danger to human health and the environment. We therefore call on the European Union to prohibit the production and export of these products in Africa.

feedback: Basta con la produzione di sostanze chimiche pericolose!!!
englishfeedback: Just with the production of hazardous chemicals!

feedback: Bonjour, L'Europe interdit les pesticides dangereux sur son territoire ; les êtres humains sont les mêmes dans le reste du monde et ces produits sont tout aussi dangereux pour eux ! Je veux être fière d'être membre de l'Europe qui fait passer la santé des humains et le souci de la biodiversité et de l'écologie avant les intérêts de firmes qui fabriquent des produits chimiques. Cordialement Dominique Bernard
englishfeedback: Hello, Europe bans dangerous pesticides on its territory; human beings are the same in the rest of the world and these products are just as dangerous for them! I want to be proud to be a member of Europe that puts human health, biodiversity and ecology before the interests of companies manufacturing chemicals. Cordially Dominique Bernard

feedback: The export of toxic pesticides is taking advantage of countries with weaker regulation. Europe has a role to play in the world - its companies should not be allowed to take advantage of countries with weaker regulation. How can we be taken seriously if we ship our hazardous chemicals abroad, poisoning people and nature in the process in countries where safety regulations are weaker and less strictly enforced? Please help Europe be a good model!

Tous les produits chimiques dangereux pour la santé ne doivent pas être produits ni pour l'exportation ni pour l'utilisation en Europe. L'industrie chimique n'a pas le droit de tuer les êtres vivants pour gagner de l'argent. Je ne comprends déjà pas pourquoi on a donné de telles autorisations.
englishfeedback: Not all chemicals that are dangerous to health should be produced for export or use in Europe. The chemical industry does not have the right to kill living beings to earn money. I do not understand why such authorisations have been granted.

feedback: Comment est-ce possible que certaines personnes trouvent éthique de produire et exporter des substances que nous interdisons pour nous car jugées toxiques ou néfastes pour la santé et l'environnement?!!! C'est à se demander si les personnes responsables de ces décisions ont une conscience ou réfléchissent seulement en terme d'argent... Il appartient à chacun de nous d'assumer la pollution et les nuisances de nos modes de vies et de consommation excessive. Et pas aux pays les moins riches/puissants!
englishfeedback: How can some people find it ethical to produce and export substances that we ban for us because they are considered toxic or harmful to health and the environment? The question is whether those responsible for these decisions are aware or think only in terms of money... It is up to all of us to take responsibility for the pollution and nuisances of our lifestyles and excessive consumption. And not for the least wealthy/powerful countries!

feedback: Les produits chimiques interdits dans l'UE le sont car ils ont été reconnus nocifs pour la santé humaine et l'environnement. Leurs impacts sont les mêmes en dehors de l'UE. Ils doivent donc y être également interdits.
englishfeedback: Chemicals banned in the EU are banned because they have been identified as harmful to human health and the environment. Their impacts are the same outside the EU. They should therefore also be prohibited.

feedback: Il est plus qu'urgent d'interdire à l'exportation les produits chimiques interdits dans l'union européenne ! Merci de penser à la survie de notre planète et à celle de l'humanité, notamment !

Wir haben unsere gemeinsame schöne Erde doch schon enügend vergiftet ,geschunden und misshandelt,und vergewaltigt!! Es kann und darf so nicht weitergehen, Wir und hauptsächlich unsere Nachkommen brauchen unsere Erde noch-in einem guten Zustand!!
englishfeedback: We have already been enough poisoning, dishonest and ill-treating our common beautiful earth and raped it! We and our descendants need our planet in a good state.

feedback: Please stop all the export of banned pesticides to vulnerable countries that have weaker legislation and and weaker regulations! There are enough research results to show the negative use of the banned pestcides! Stop sending banned pesticides to vulnerable farmers and children that suffer severe medical conditions from using them! The pesticides reduce biological diversity among insects and reducing the number of beneficial insects that combat insects pests. The banned pesticides also effect important soil microorganisms reducing the soil activity that help the plants to take up nutrients and keep the humidity in the soil. The use of pesticides also increase the climate impact producing them and exporting them. Ecological farmingmethods can meet many of the issues that a farmer meet day to day instead of using chemicals. The banned pesticides also affects the smallholders- the farmers. Very few of the smallholders have enough knowledge of pesticides to use these dangereous chemicals- we use the famers in these countries to increse our wealth in Europe!! //I am hopeful that you will take the right decision.

These hazardous pesticides are responsible for worrying declines in bee and many other insect populations. They have also been implicated in human health problems. The EU is a recognised leader in fighting climate change and biodiversity loss. The nature restoration law obliges us to work to restore nature. Insects are a vital part of the food web with many other species relying on them. We cannot have healthy ecosystems without healthy and abundant insect populations. These chemicals should be phased out worldwide. Allowing them to be exported while banning them at home is using double standards. Ecosystems are all connected and they all need protection. The EU has a chance here to show an example to the rest of the world. Phasing out these chemicals is good for nature, for farmers and will encourage development of more sustainable methods of food production.

Des géants de lagriculture tels que BASF et Bayer-Monsanto réalisent des profits indécents en exportant des pesticides toxiques en Afrique et en Amérique du Sud. Ils mettent ainsi en danger la vie dagriculteurs·ice·s et de leurs familles et empoisonnent la planète. Ces mêmes pesticides sont interdits en Europe en raison de leur dangerosité. Comment pouvons nous continuer à laisser faire ces industriels qui ne visent que le profit financier au détriment de la vie sur terre. Je demande à la commission européenne de se prononcer pour l'interdiction totale d'exporter des produits chimiques dangereux dans le monde et d'en faire cesser la production à usage agricole.
englishfeedback: Agricultural giants such as BASF and Bayer-Monsanto make indecent profits by exporting toxic pesticides to Africa and South America. This puts the lives of farmers and their families at risk and poisoning the planet. The same pesticides are banned in Europe because of their dangerous nature. How can we continue to let these industries, which only aim at financial profit at the expense of life on earth, do so. I call on the European Commission to push for a total ban on the export of dangerous chemicals to the world and to stop agricultural production.

feedback: L'interdiction est indispensable (moralement et par rapport à la préservation de la vie sur terre).
englishfeedback: The ban is essential (morally and in relation to the preservation of life on earth).

feedback: Je suis absolument contre l'exportation de pesticides toxiques vers des pays où la règlementation est moins stricte qu'en Europe. Ces pesticides sont dangereux pour les humains et les animaux, notamment les abeilles et si leur dangerosité a été démontrée en Europe, il est évident qu'elle sera la même ailleurs. Pouvons nous laisser d'autres êtres humains subir les risques de ces produits dont nous ne voulons pas? Peut-on raisonnablement laisser détruire la biodiversité chez nos voisins lointains alors que la vie sur la planète entière est mise à mal par nos productions et pollutions? L'hypocrisie doit cesser et nous devons nous donner les moyens de protéger toutes les populations humaines et animales au lieu de déplacer le problème. L'Union Européenne a un rôle crucial à jouer pour défendre l'avenir des humains et des êtres vivants de notre Terre contre les lobbies et entreprises qui ne visent que les profits. Interdisez la production et l'exportation des pesticides dangereux, il en va de notre avenir.
englishfeedback: I am absolutely against the export of toxic pesticides to countries where regulation is less stringent than in Europe. These pesticides are dangerous for humans and animals, in particular bees, and if their danger has been demonstrated in Europe, it is clear that they will be the same elsewhere. Can we allow other human beings to be exposed to the risks of these products that we do not want? Can it be reasonable to allow biodiversity to be destroyed in our distant neighbours when life on the planet is being undermined by our production and pollution? Hypocrisy must stop and we need to empower ourselves to protect all human and animal populations instead of moving the problem. The European Union has a crucial role to play in defending the future of the people and living beings of our Earth against lobbies and businesses which are aimed only at profits. Ban the production and export of dangerous pesticides, which is a matter for our future.

feedback: Pourquoi continuer à empoisonner le reste du monde quand on sait pertinemment que ces produits son toxiques? Les êtres humains vivant en dehors de lEU sont-ils moins sensibles au poisons? Arrêtons cette hypocrisie capitaliste!
englishfeedback: Why continue poisoning the rest of the world when it is well known that these products are toxic? Are humans living outside the EU less sensitive to poison? Let’s stop this capitalist hypocrisy!

feedback: The bees are what the most important issue is.

La exportación de pesticidas tóxicos perjudica a las abejas, la biodiversidad y el planeta. Los datos no mienten: los neonicotinoides y otros pesticidas tóxicos matan a las abejas. Por eso están prohibidos en Europa. ¿Cómo podemos permitir que se exporten a otros países? Además, la prohibición de exportar pesticidas tóxicos fomentaría la innovación y animaría a Europa y al resto del mundo a utilizar técnicas fitosanitarias más sostenibles. Mantener en el mercado pesticidas obsoletos y peligrosos nos priva de un futuro más verde y de unas prácticas agrícolas más ecológicas.
englishfeedback: The export of toxic pesticides harms bees, biodiversity and the planet. The data do not feel: neonicotinoids and other toxic pesticides kill bees. This is why they are banned in Europe. How can we allow them to be exported to other countries? In addition, a ban on the export of toxic pesticides would encourage innovation and encourage Europe and the rest of the world to use more sustainable plant protection techniques. Keeping obsolete and dangerous pesticides on the market deprives us of a greener future and greener farming practices.

feedback: Buongiorno, chiediamo a gran voce di vietare i pesticidi e le sostanze chimiche pericolose in Unione Europea sia per quanto riguarda la produzione che per l'esportazione. E' ora di pensare alle persone e all'ambiente, anzichè al solito profitto dannoso per tutti. Grazie. Mauro D'Angelo
englishfeedback: We very much call for a ban on pesticides and hazardous chemicals in the European Union in terms of both production and export. It is time to think about people and the environment, rather than making a profit that is harmful to everyone. Thanks. Mauro D’Angelo

feedback: A Magyar Növényvédelmi Szövetségnél úgy gondoljuk, hogy az Európai Uniónak - mint a világ egyik legnagyobb felelőséggel eljáró növényvédőszer gyártójának - a kockázatértékelése és az átláthatóság terén jól bevált legjobb gyakorlatainak megosztásán kellene dolgoznia, ahelyett, hogy az anyagok gyártásának és kereskedelmének betiltását fontolgatná. Elismerjük az Európában eladásra nem engedélyezett hatóanyagok exportjával kapcsolatos aggodalmakat. Úgy véljük, hogy az összes bizonyíték alapos mérlegelése után egy ilyen intézkedés káros lenne a harmadik országokra, a környezetre és az európai gazdaságra nézve. A bizonyítékok azt mutatják, hogy egy ilyen intézkedés egyszerűen más, nem európai beszállítók felé terelné a kereskedelmi forgalmat, és akaratlanul nagyobb hatással lenne a harmadik országok környezetére és munkavállalóira. Ismét csak oda jutnánk, hogy a problémát nem megoldjuk, csak az EU határain kívülre exportáljuk. A termékeket ugyan úgy legyártanák más országokban, semmivel nem csökkenne ezek felhasználása, így globális nézőpontból nézve semmi mást nem érnénk el csak hogy számos ember elveszítené a munkáját az Unió területén. Ezen kívül más nem változna. Az EU világszinten vezető szerepet tölt be a vegyianyag-politika terén. A harmadik országokba exportált és ott alkalmazott anyagok biztonságának és átláthatóságának javítása érdekében szorosan együttműködve az iparral és a hatóságokkal nemzetközi szinten nagyobb sikereket érhetünk el. A Bizottság által kitűzött célt figyelembe véve úgy véljük, hogy a PIC-rendelet megerősítése a leghatékonyabb módja a cél elérésének. A termékek nyomon követhetősége és biztonsága a biztonságos termékfelhasználásra vonatkozó európai politika sarokköve. Európa 20 éve számos más országgal együtt végrehajtja a meglévő nemzetközi keretrendszereket (például a Codex Alimentariust). A példamutatás és a szigorú biztonsági előírások európai átültetése érdekében az EU-nak az iparral együttműködve támogatnia kell a harmadik országokat és az olyan szervezeteket, mint az OECD és a FAO, az információ átláthatósága és a nyomon követhetőség legjobb gyakorlatainak kialakításában. A PIC alkalmazásának megerősítésével az EU egyértelmű, átlátható rendszert biztosíthat a globális vegyianyag-ellátási lánc számára, és valamennyi érdekelt fél számára javíthatja a veszélyes vegyi anyagok biztonságos használatát. Nem szabad figyelmen kívül hagyni, hogy egyes anyagokat harmadik országokban a növényvédelmen kívül más okokból bejegyeztek és használnak. Ezen túlmenően a szóban forgó termékeket az EU-n kívüli mezőgazdasági termelők különleges igényeinek kielégítésére exportálják. A különböző régióknak eltérő igényeik vannak - az agronómiai és éghajlati feltételek régiónként eltérőek. Például a trópusi és szubtrópusi éghajlaton a meleg és a nedvesség kombinációja miatt a kártevők és a betegségek nagy nyomást gyakorolnak. Biztosak vagyunk benne, hogy az ottani termelők nem jókedvükben használják a kockázatosabb készítményeket, hanem mert az éghajlati viszonyok és a károsítók nyomása ezt megköveteli. Az Unióban is lehetőséget biztosítunk a termelőknek az éghajlati viszonyoknak megfelelően megválasztani a készítményeket, ezért veszik figyelembe a zóna rendszert a 1107/2009/EK rendelet alkalmazásakor a kockázatértékelés során. A fentiek alapján nyomatékosan szeretnénk kérni a bizottságot, hogy gondolja át a harmadik országokba történő kivitellel kapcsolatos tiltási terveit. Ne alkossunk már megint egy olyan jogszabályt, ami globálisan semmilyen hatást nem gyakorol azon kívül, hogy Uniós vállalkozásokat hoz versenyhátrányba és Uniós polgárok munkáját, így megélhetését veszélyezteti.
englishfeedback: At the Hungarian Plant Protection Association, we believe that the European Union, as one of the world’s largest producers of pesticides, should work on sharing best practices in terms of risk assessment and transparency rather than considering banning the production and trade of substances. We recognise concerns about the export of active substances that are not authorised for sale in Europe. We believe that, after careful consideration of all the evidence, such a measure would be detrimental to third countries, the environment and the European economy. Evidence shows that such a measure would simply shift trade flows towards other, non-European suppliers, and would inadvertently have a greater impact on the environment and workers in third countries. Once again, we will not solve the problem, but only export outside the EU. Although products would be manufactured in other countries, their use would not be reduced in any way, so that, from a global perspective, there would be nothing more than just that many people would lose their jobs in the EU. In addition, there would be no change. The EU is a global leader in chemicals policy. In order to improve the safety and transparency of materials exported and used in third countries, we can achieve greater success at international level in close cooperation with industry and authorities. Taking into account the objective pursued by the Commission, we consider that strengthening the PIC Regulation is the most effective way to achieve it. Product traceability and safety is the cornerstone of European policy on safe use of products. For 20 years, Europe has been implementing existing international frameworks (such as the Codex Alimentariust) together with a number of other countries. In order to lead by example and implement high safety standards in Europe, the EU, in cooperation with industry, should support third countries and organisations such as the OECD and FAO in developing best practices for information transparency and traceability. By strengthening the application of the PIC, the EU can ensure a clear, transparent system for the global chemicals supply chain and improve the safe use of hazardous chemicals for all stakeholders. It should not be overlooked that some substances are registered and used in third countries for reasons other than plant protection. In addition, the products in question are exported to meet the specific needs of farmers outside the EU. Different regions have different needs – agronomic and climate conditions vary from one region to another. For example, in the tropical and subtropical climates, due to the combination of warm and moisture, pests and diseases are under high pressure. We are confident that farmers do not use riskier products in their favour, but because climatic conditions and pest pressures require it. In the EU, we also give farmers the possibility to choose preparations according to climatic conditions and therefore the zone system is taken into account in the risk assessment when applying Regulation (EC) No 1107/2009. In the light of the above, we would like to urge the Committee to reconsider its plans to ban exports to third countries. No new legislation has any global impact other than putting EU businesses at a competitive disadvantage and the work of EU citizens, thus threatening their livelihoods.

feedback: As European Anti Poverty Network Netherlands (EAPN NL) we work to abolish poverty and exclusion. This is more than just providing the poor with more financial means. It also means that we fight to give the poor and their children better changes to buy healthy food. During the decades since WW II more poison has been spread on our earth than ever before in history. We need to end this immediately and start supporting farmers who work on a environtmental safe bases, work sustainable and poisonfree. We urge you to make an end on glyfosathe and all the other neonicotinoïden that not only distroy our soils, but also distroy bees, bumbelbees and other insects. As it now is proven these poisons also makes farmers and their environment sick, since Parkinson and other diseases can be directly connected to these poisons. Make the EU a poison free area, not only to save the bees and other animals, which is very much needed, but also to stop poisonning the own population. Make the agro industral area a poison free, sustainable and biological healthy area. Start now, not in a few years, and forbid all neonicotinoïden, including Round Up, glyfosathe from today on. This is also a step to bring down diseases and cost of very costly health issues.

Was erlaubt uns als Europäer, Verbote für gefährliche Chemikalien innerhalb Europas auszusprechen und anzuwenden, aber gleichzeitig diese sinnvollen Verbote außerhalb der EU als für nicht notwendig zu erachten und zu erlauben gefährliche Chemikalien aus der EU heraus zu exportieren. Diese Hybris der EU sollten wir tunlichst unterlassen, denn wir leben auf EINEM gemeinsamen Planeten, und diese gefährlichen Chemikalien finden GANZ SICHER den Weg ZURÜCK in die EU - z.B. über Nahrungsmittel, Kleidung, Windverfrachtungen, Meeresdrift, u.v.m. Das kann nicht unser Ziel als Bürger der EU sein!
englishfeedback: What allows us, as Europeans, to impose and apply bans on hazardous chemicals within Europe, but at the same time to consider these meaningful bans outside the EU as unnecessary and to allow hazardous chemicals to be exported outside the EU. We should avoid these hybrids of the EU, as we live on a common planet, and these hazardous chemicals will find the way to the EU – e.g. through food, clothing, wind loads, marine drift, etc. This cannot be our goal as an EU citizen!

feedback: When it after much research now is clear that neonics and some other pesticides are causing the death of bees that is decimating fruit crops and biodiversity, it is immoral to allow export of these harmful substances to countries with weaker regulation. The EU must use its power to do good to both nature and humanity, not to let greed win. I fully support the initiative of banning the export of whatever is forbidden to sell or use in EU. We should realize that this is a win-win action: when we make good to others, we will get benefits from it ourselves, be it better relations, healthier imported food or more sustainable ecosystems on earth.

Pido a la Unión Europea que no exporte pesticidas contaminantes a otros países, basándose en la evidencia científica de los efectos dañinos que pueden tener en el medio ambiente y en la salud de las personas. Gracias.
englishfeedback: I call on the European Union not to export polluting pesticides to other countries, based on scientific evidence of the harmful effects they may have on the environment and human health. Thanks.

feedback: Observateur de la nature depuis plusieurs décennies, j'ai été témoin des empoisonnements par les pesticides et la disparition des insectes vivant dans le sol (pédofaune) mais également de toutes les autres espèces d'insectes volants et terrestres. Par voie de conséquence, c'est la raréfaction et la disparition progressive des oiseaux qui est inéluctable. En tant qu'apiculteur amateur, membre d'une association, nous intervenons dans les écoles et même lycée agricoles pour sensibiliser les jeunes et futurs agriculteurs à ces sujets et réfléchir sur des pratiques visant à collaborer avec la nature et non la combattre systématiquement. Mais ceci est peu de chose en regard de votre pouvoir de décision et de votre responsabilité pour la génération de vos enfants et petits enfants. MERCI d'agir MAINTENANT. Jim
englishfeedback: As an observer of nature for decades, I have witnessed poisoning by pesticides and the disappearance of insects living in the soil (pedofauna) but also of all other flying and terrestrial insect species. As a result, it is the scarcity and gradual disappearance of birds that is inevitable. As an amateur beekeeper, a member of an association, we intervene in schools and even agricultural secondary schools to raise awareness among young people and future farmers of these topics and to reflect on practices aimed at working with nature rather than systematically combating it. But this is little in view of your decision-making power and your responsibility for the generation of your children and small children. Thank you for acting MAINTENANT. Jim

feedback: L'exportation de pesticides (et de tout autre produit chimique) toxique interdit à la vente au sein de l'Union Européenne relève d'une logique mercantile et d'un système de deux poids, deux mesures qui ne correspond pas aux valeurs défendues par l'Union. L'interdiction totale de production et d'exportation de tels produits par l'UE, en commençant par les pesticides concernés par cet avis, donnerait un signal fort au reste du monde pour une politique volontariste de réduction de la pollution et d'action globale pour une meilleure santé de la planète et de ses habitants. Nous ne pouvons pas convaincre, au niveau international et dans les conventions, sommets ou congrès mondiaux auxquels l'UE participe, si nous n'appliquons pas nous-mêmes une politique exemplaire et respectueuse des populations des autres continents. En tant que citoyen de l'UE, je demande que ces pesticides toxiques soient bannis de production et d'exportation.
englishfeedback: The export of pesticides (and any other chemical) which is prohibited for sale within the European Union is based on a mercantile logic and a two-tier system, two measures which do not correspond to the values advocated by the Union. The total ban on the production and export of such products by the EU, starting with the pesticides covered by this opinion, would send a strong signal to the rest of the world for a proactive policy of pollution reduction and global action to improve the health of the planet and its inhabitants. We cannot convince, at international level and in the conventions, summits or world congresses in which the EU participates, if we do not apply an exemplary and respectful policy for the peoples of other continents ourselves. As an EU citizen, I call for these toxic pesticides to be banned from production and export.

feedback: Jako przedstawiciele obywateli w Unii Europejskiej zwracam się z wnioskiem o całkowity zakaz eksportu toksycznych pestycydów. a) Eksport toksycznych pestycydów to dowód hipokryzji. Groźne pestycydy są zakazane w Europie, ponieważ wykazano ich związek z nowotworami, problemami z płodnością i schorzeniami neurodegeneracyjnymi (uszkodzeniami układu nerwowego), takimi jak choroba Parkinsona i choroba Alzheimera. Te same pestycydy powodują wymieranie pszczół. Niektóre z nich zostały zakazane w Europie dlatego, że powiązano je z uszkodzeniami mózgu u ludzkich płodów i noworodków. Skoro wiemy, że są tak bardzo niebezpieczne, jak możemy pozwalać na ich eksport? b) Eksport toksycznych pestycydów jest kwestią praw człowieka, ponieważ te pestycydy poważnie zagrażają zdrowiu ludzi. Kontakt z tymi substancjami powoduje co roku śmierć tysięcy rolników. Istnieją niezliczone badania, które wykazują ich niezmiernie szkodliwe działanie na ludzi. c) Eksport toksycznych pestycydów zagraża pszczołom, różnorodności biologicznej i planecie. Dowody mówią jasno: neonikotynoidy i inne toksyczne substancje zabijają pszczoły. Dlatego zakazaliśmy ich w Europie. Dlaczego więc nadal pozwalamy na eksportowanie ich do krajów, gdzie regulacje nie są tak silne? Czy chcemy, aby tam powodowały wymieranie pszczół i niszczyły bioróżnorodność? d) Eksport toksycznych pestycydów to wykorzystanie krajów, gdzie regulacje są słabsze niż w Europie. Europa ma w świecie rolę do odegrania. Nie możemy pozwalać, by firmy z naszego kontynentu wykorzystywały dla zysku słabość regulacji w innych krajach. Jak możemy oczekiwać, że nasze deklaracje będą brane na poważnie, jeśli wciąż czerpiemy zyski z toksycznych chemikaliów, które powodują poważne schorzenia u ludzi i szkody w środowisku? Nie możemy eksportować toksycznych pestycydów do krajów, gdzie normy bezpieczeństwa są słabsze i mniej rygorystycznie egzekwowane niż u nas. e) Zakaz eksportu toksycznych pestycydów byłby silnym bodźcem dla innowacji. Pomógłby Europie i całemu światu przejść na bardziej zrównoważone metody ochrony roślin uprawnych. Dopuszczając na rynek stare i groźne dla zdrowia pestycydy, tracimy szansę na bardziej zieloną przyszłość i bardziej zrównoważone modele rolnictwa. f) Opinia prawna opublikowana w 2022 roku przez Center for International Environmental Law wskazuje, że eksport zakazanych w UE pestycydów do krajów Afryki i Ameryki Środkowej łamie międzynarodowe zobowiązania prawne Unii Europejskiej i narusza międzynarodowe traktaty o ochronie praw człowieka. Należy wprowadzić zakaz, życie ludzi, zwierząt i całej naszej planety nie może leżeć na szali z biznesem! Biznes nigdy nie powinien i może zwyciężać nad życiem i prawami ludzi! Zatrzymać eksport toksycznych pestycydów.
englishfeedback: As representatives of citizens in the European Union, I am asking for a total ban on the export of toxic pesticides. (a) Exports of toxic pesticides are proof of hypocriticity. Hazardous pesticides are banned in Europe because they have been shown to be associated with cancer, fertility problems and neurodegenerative disorders (neural damage), such as Parkinson’s disease and Alzheimer’s disease. The same pesticides lead to the death of bees. Some of them were banned in Europe because they were linked to brain damage in human foetuses and newborn babies. If we know that they are as dangerous as we can export, b) Exports of toxic pesticides are a human rights issue, as these pesticides pose a serious threat to human health. Contact with these substances causes thousands of farmers to die each year. There are countless studies that show extremely harmful effects on humans. c) Exports of toxic pesticides threaten bees, biodiversity and the planet. The evidence clearly says: neonicotinoids and other toxic substances kill bees. This is why we have banned them in Europe. So why do we still allow them to be exported to countries where regulation is not so strong? Do we want bees to die and damage biodiversity there?(d) Exports of toxic pesticides are a use of countries where regulation is weaker than in Europe. Europe has a role to play in the world. We cannot allow our continent’s companies to profit from the weakness of regulation in other countries. How can we expect our declarations to be taken seriously if we continue to profit from toxic chemicals that cause severe human conditions and environmental damage? We cannot export toxic pesticides to countries where safety standards are weaker and less rigorously enforced than in us. e) A ban on exporting toxic pesticides would be a powerful driver for innovation. It would help Europe and the world as a whole move towards more sustainable methods of crop protection. By allowing old and dangerous pesticides to enter the market, we lose the chance for a greener future and more sustainable farming models. (f) A legal opinion published in 2022 by the Center for International Environmental Law indicates that exports of banned pesticides in the EU to African and Central American countries are in breach of the European Union’s international legal obligations and in breach of international treaties for the protection of human rights. We need to ban people, animals and the planet as a whole. Business should never and can win over people’s lives and rights! Stop exporting toxic pesticides.

feedback: Non è ammissibile che dei pesticidi, il cui uso è vietato in Europa, continuino ad essere esportati in Africa e America del Sud. LUE deve porre fine a questa contraddizione con un divieto sulle esportazioni. Non dobbiamo consentire alle multinazionali di continuare ad arricchirsi quando il pianeta sta collassando. Bisogna intervenire ora.
englishfeedback: It is not acceptable that pesticides, whose use is banned in Europe, continue to be exported to Africa and South America. The EU must put an end to this contradiction with an export ban. We must not allow multinationals to continue to enrich themselves when the planet is colliding. Action now needs to be taken.

feedback: Je suis pour linterdiction de la production à des fins dexportation de produits chimiques interdits dans lUE pour plusieurs raisons. L'exportation de pesticides toxiques révèle une politique de deux poids deux mesures : Les pesticides dangereux sont interdits en Europe après avoir été associés à des cancers, des problèmes de reproduction et des maladies neurodégénératives, ainsi qu'à la mort des abeilles. Certains de ces pesticides sont même interdits en Europe en raison de leur lien avec des lésions cérébrales chez les enfants et les bébés à naître. Si ces pesticides sont trop dangereux pour nous, comment pouvons-nous autoriser leur exportation? L'exportation de pesticides toxiques est une question de droits humains, car ces pesticides sont nocifs pour notre santé. Chaque année, des milliers d'agriculteurs meurent des suites dune trop forte exposition à ces pesticides dangereux. Les pesticides exportés font l'objet d'innombrables études qui confirment leurs effets néfastes sur les humains. L'exportation de pesticides toxiques est néfaste pour les abeilles, la biodiversité et la planète en général. Les preuves sont claires : les néonics et autres pesticides dangereux tuent les abeilles. C'est pourquoi ils sont interdits en Europe. Pourquoi autorisons-nous encore leur exportation vers des pays où la réglementation est moins stricte, alors quils continueront de tuer les abeilles et décimer la biodiversité? L'exportation de pesticides toxiques profite des pays où la réglementation est moins stricte. L'UE a un rôle à jouer dans le monde - ses entreprises ne devraient pas être autorisées à profiter des pays où la réglementation est plus faible. Comment pouvons-nous être pris au sérieux si nous expédions nos produits chimiques dangereux à l'étranger, empoisonnant ainsi les populations et la nature dans des pays où les règles de sécurité sont plus faibles et moins strictement appliquées? L'interdiction d'exporter des pesticides toxiques serait une opportunité unique pour l'innovation et aiderait l'Europe et le monde à évoluer vers des méthodes de protection des plantes plus durables. Le maintien sur le marché de pesticides anciens et dangereux nous prive d'un avenir plus vert et de pratiques agricoles plus durables. Un avis juridique du Center for International Environmental Law publié en 2022 montre que les exportations européennes de pesticides interdits vers l'Afrique et l'Amérique centrale violent les obligations juridiques internationales de l'UE et le droit relatif aux droits humains.
englishfeedback: I am in favour of banning the production for export of chemicals banned in the EU for several reasons. The export of toxic pesticides reveals a double standard policy: Hazardous pesticides are banned in Europe after being associated with cancer, reproductive problems and neurodegenerative diseases, as well as bee death. Some of these pesticides are even banned in Europe because of their link to brain damage in children and born babies. If these pesticides are too dangerous for us, how can we authorise their export? The export of toxic pesticides is a human rights issue, as these pesticides are harmful to our health. Every year, thousands of farmers die as a result of excessive exposure to these hazardous pesticides. Exported pesticides are subject to countless studies confirming their adverse effects on humans. The export of toxic pesticides is harmful to bees, biodiversity and the planet in general. The evidence is clear: neonics and other hazardous pesticides kill bees. This is why they are banned in Europe. Why do we still allow their export to countries with less stringent regulation, while they will continue to kill bees and decay biodiversity? The export of toxic pesticides benefits countries with less stringent regulation. The EU has a role to play in the world – its businesses should not be allowed to benefit from countries with weaker regulation. How can we be taken seriously if we send our hazardous chemicals abroad, poisoning people and nature in countries where safety rules are weaker and less strictly enforced? Banning the export of toxic pesticides would be a unique opportunity for innovation and would help Europe and the world to move towards more sustainable plant protection methods. Keeping old and dangerous pesticides on the market deprives us of a greener future and more sustainable agricultural practices. A legal opinion of the Center for International Environmental Law published in 2022 shows that European exports of banned pesticides to Africa and Central America violate the EU’s international legal obligations and human rights law.

feedback: Si una sustancia está prohibida en Europa, es totalmente inadmisible y vergonzoso que se permita exportar a otros países. ¡¿Hasta cuándo vamos a permitir semejante hipocresía ?! Shame on us !!! Para hacer este tipo de políticas... mejor dedíquense a otros menesteres y no nos den más dolores de cabeza.
englishfeedback: If a substance is banned in Europe, it is totally unacceptable and shameful for exports to other countries. Until when will we allow such a hypocrisy? Shame on us! To make this kind of policy... better tell other menesteres and do not give us more headaches.

feedback: Estoy totalmente a favor de la prohibición de exportar sustancias químicas prohibidas en la Unión Europea a terceros países. También habría que prohibir la importación de alimentos y productos tratados con sustancias químicas prohibidas en la Unión, desde esos terceros países hacía el territorio de la Unión Europea. Esto último para proteger los intereses de nuestros agricultores y productores y la salud de los ciudadanos europeos. Tómense estos asuntos en serio porque nos va en ello la salud y la supervivencia económica de nuestros productores. Gracias.
englishfeedback: I am fully in favour of a ban on exporting chemicals banned in the European Union to third countries. The import of food and products treated with chemicals banned into the EU from those third countries into the territory of the European Union should also be prohibited. The latter to protect the interests of our farmers and producers and the health of European citizens. Take these issues seriously because it is the health and economic survival of our producers. Thanks.

feedback: L'exportation de pesticides toxiques révèle une politique de deux poids deux mesures : les pesticides dangereux sont interdits en Europe après avoir été associés à des cancers, des problèmes de reproduction et des maladies neurodégénératives, ainsi qu'à la mort des abeilles. Certains de ces pesticides sont même interdits en Europe en raison de leur lien avec des lésions cérébrales chez les enfants et les bébés à naître. Si ces pesticides sont trop dangereux pour nous, comment pouvons-nous autoriser leur exportation ? L'exportation de pesticides toxiques est une question de droits humains, car ces pesticides sont nocifs pour notre santé : chaque année, des milliers d'agriculteurs meurent des suites dune trop forte exposition à ces pesticides dangereux. Les pesticides exportés font l'objet d'innombrables études qui confirment leurs effets néfastes sur les humains. L'exportation de pesticides toxiques est néfaste pour les abeilles, la biodiversité et la planète en général. Les preuves sont claires : les néonics et autres pesticides dangereux tuent les abeilles. C'est pourquoi ils sont interdits en Europe. Pourquoi autorisons-nous encore leur exportation vers des pays où la réglementation est moins stricte, alors quils continueront de tuer les abeilles et décimer la biodiversité ? L'exportation de pesticides toxiques profite des pays où la réglementation est moins stricte. L'UE a un rôle à jouer dans le monde, ses entreprises ne devraient pas être autorisées à profiter des pays où la réglementation est plus faible. Comment pouvons-nous être pris au sérieux si nous expédions nos produits chimiques dangereux à l'étranger, empoisonnant ainsi les populations et la nature dans des pays où les règles de sécurité sont plus faibles et moins strictement appliquées ? L'interdiction d'exporter des pesticides toxiques serait une opportunité unique pour l'innovation et aiderait l'Europe et le monde à évoluer vers des méthodes de protection des plantes plus durables. Le maintien sur le marché de pesticides anciens et dangereux nous prive d'un avenir plus vert et de pratiques agricoles plus durables. Un avis juridique du Center for International Environmental Law publié en 2022 montre que les exportations européennes de pesticides interdits vers l'Afrique et l'Amérique centrale violent les obligations juridiques internationales de l'UE et le droit relatif aux droits humains.
englishfeedback: The export of toxic pesticides reveals a double standard policy: hazardous pesticides are banned in Europe after being associated with cancer, reproductive problems and neurodegenerative diseases, as well as bee death. Some of these pesticides are even banned in Europe because of their link to brain damage in children and born babies. If these pesticides are too dangerous for us, how can we authorise their export? The export of toxic pesticides is a human rights issue, as these pesticides are harmful to our health: every year, thousands of farmers die as a result of excessive exposure to these hazardous pesticides. Exported pesticides are subject to countless studies confirming their adverse effects on humans. The export of toxic pesticides is harmful to bees, biodiversity and the planet in general. The evidence is clear: neonics and other hazardous pesticides kill bees. This is why they are banned in Europe. Why do we still allow their export to countries with less stringent regulation, while they will continue to kill bees and decay biodiversity? The export of toxic pesticides benefits countries with less stringent regulation. The EU has a role to play in the world, its businesses should not be allowed to benefit from countries with weaker regulation. How can we be taken seriously if we send our hazardous chemicals abroad, poisoning people and nature in countries where safety rules are weaker and less strictly enforced? Banning the export of toxic pesticides would be a unique opportunity for innovation and would help Europe and the world to move towards more sustainable plant protection methods. Keeping old and dangerous pesticides on the market deprives us of a greener future and more sustainable agricultural practices. A legal opinion of the Center for International Environmental Law published in 2022 shows that European exports of banned pesticides to Africa and Central America violate the EU’s international legal obligations and human rights law.

feedback: Diese Initiative - nämlich das Verbot der Ausfuhr gefährlicher Chemikalien, die in der EU selbst verboten sind - ist längst überfällig. Ich unterstütze das Ziel vollständig und optiere insbesondere für ein totales Verbot der Ausfuhr und das aus einem einfachen Grund: Die Landbevölkerung in Ländern des globalen Südens (zum Beispiel Lateinamerikas, wo ich einschlägige Erfahrungen gemacht habe) hat keine Möglichkeit, sich über die Gefährlichkeit der Substanzen zu informieren oder über deren Anwendung zu entscheiden -- denn das tun andere. Ein Beispiel aus El Salvador: Die Bevölkerung am Unterlauf der Río Lempa leidet unter hoher Belastung mit Umweltchemikalien, die aus dem Oberlauf eingeschwemmt werden. Die Folge sind Fehlgeburten, Missbildungen, Tumore, etc. Vielleicht ist es wahr, dass nach einem Verbot, die Stoffe aus anderen Teilen der Welt importiert werden, doch das kann kein ernsthafter Grund zu sein, diese Initiative scheitern zu lassen. Wer anders handelt, gibt zu verstehen, dass es für ihn Menschen zweiter Klasse gibt.
englishfeedback: This initiative – banning the export of dangerous chemicals that are banned in the EU itself – is long overdue. I fully support the objective, in particular for a total ban on exports, for a simple reason: The rural population in countries of the global south (e.g. in Latin America, where I have had relevant experience) has no opportunity to learn about the hazardous nature of the substances or to decide on their use – as others do. An example from El Salvador: The population at the bottom of the river Lempa suffers from high exposure to environmental chemicals from the upper course. The result is miscarriage, malformation, tumours, etc. It is perhaps true that, after a ban on importing substances from other parts of the world, this cannot be a serious reason to let this initiative fail. If you act differently, it can be understood that there are people in second class for him.

feedback: Les produits chimiques dangereux ne doivent plus être produits dans l'Union Européenne ni pour l'exportation,ni pour toute autre utilisation: ils sont trop néfastes que ce soit pour la santé humaine,pour tout le règne animal ou pour notre environnement.
englishfeedback: Hazardous chemicals must no longer be produced in the European Union either for export or for any other use: they are too harmful to human health, to the whole animal life or to our environment.

feedback: Si una sustancia está prohibida como peligrosa en la UE, por eso mismo habrá de prohibirse su exportación fuera de la UE.
englishfeedback: If a substance is banned as dangerous in the EU, its export outside the EU should be prohibited.

feedback: Mi argumento es muy sencillo: "Lo que no quieres para ti, no lo envíes para otro"
englishfeedback: My argument is very simple: “What you don’t want for you, don’t send it for another”

feedback: Pour une interdiction d'exportation des pesticides interdits en Europe L'exportation de pesticides toxiques est néfaste pour les abeilles, la biodiversité et la planète en général. Les preuves sont claires : les néonics et autres pesticides dangereux tuent les abeilles. C'est pourquoi ils sont interdits en Europe. Pourquoi autorisons-nous encore leur exportation vers des pays où la réglementation est moins stricte, alors quils continueront de tuer les abeilles et décimer la biodiversité ? Serait-ce le retour d'une nouvelle forme de colonialisme ?
englishfeedback: For a ban on the export of pesticides banned in Europe The export of toxic pesticides is harmful to bees, biodiversity and the planet in general. The evidence is clear: neonics and other hazardous pesticides kill bees. This is why they are banned in Europe. Why do we still allow their export to countries with less stringent regulation, while they will continue to kill bees and decay biodiversity? Would this be the return of a new form of colonialism?

feedback: Fijn dat ik U op deze wijze feedback kan geven over mijn bezorgdheid voor export van giftige pesticiede, die niet alleen slecht zijn voor bijen en de bio diversiteit maar in Europa ook verboden nadat een verband was aangetoond met kanker, vruchtbaarheidsproblemen, neurodegeneratieve ziektes en bijensterfte. Zelf heb ik schade opgelopen door oplosmiddelen en daardoor neurodegeneratieve ziekte opgelopen en een auto-immuunziekte ontwikkeld (zie bijlagen) waardoor ik niet meer zelfstandig in mijn levensbehoefte kan voorzien, door overgevoeligheid voor pesticiden ben ik ook moeten verhuizen naar een Provincie met schonere luchtkwaliteit, dit was dus alleen op een natura 2000 beschermd gebied (het Bargerveen) ben dus een Chemisch vluchteling zonder status. mijn drie kinderen en vier kleinkinderen bleven achter in Brabant, ik mis ze veel ook omdat ik niet naar verjaardagen kan. Dit wens ik niemand toe, en hoop middels deze feedback U op de gevaren van export van deze gevaarlijke chemicaliën te wijzen, zodat deze stoffen niet via het buitenland weer op ons bordtje kan komen. Dank voor Uw aandacht en vriendelijke groet, Anton
englishfeedback: Thank you for providing feedback in this way on my concerns about the export of toxic pesticides, which are not only bad for bees and bio diversity but also banned in Europe after a link with cancer, fertility problems, neurodegenerative diseases and bee mortality. For my part, I have been damaged by solvents and, as a result, neurodegenerative disease and developed a autoimmune disease (see annexes) which prevents me from self-sustaining my need for life, because of the hypersensitivity to pesticides, I have also had to move to a province with cleaner air quality, so this was only in an in-kind 2000 protected area (Bargerven) is a chemical refugee without status. My three children and four grandchildren were left in Brabant, I miss it too much because I cannot go back to birthday. I do not wish to do so, and I hope this feedback will inform you of the dangers of exporting these dangerous chemicals, so that these substances cannot be returned to our platform via the rest of the world. Thank you for your attention and kind regards, Anton

feedback: The export of toxic pesticides exposes an EU double standard: dangerous pesticides are banned in Europe after they were linked to the dying of one of Earth's most important pollinators, the bee; and cancer, reproductive problems and neurodegenerative diseases in humans. Some of these pesticides are banned in Europe because of their links to brain damage in children and unborn babies. If these pesticides are too dangerous for us, how can we allow them to be exported? - Moreover, exporting toxic pesticides is a human rights issue, as these toxic substances are damaging to people. Every year, thousands of farmers die from exposure to dangerous pesticides. There are countless studies confirming the damaging effects of pesticides on people. - But, most importanty, if we actually care for our Planet - and keeping in mind there is no Planet B - we must understand how bad the export of toxic pesticides is for the bees, biodiversity and the Planet itself. The evidence is clear: neonics and other poisonous pesticides kill bees. Thats why theyre banned in Europe. Why are we still allowing them to be exported to countries with weaker regulations, killing bees and decimating biodiversity? This is utterly unethical. - Exporting toxic pesticides shows we are taking advantage of countries with weaker regulations. Europe has a role to play in the world - its companies should not be allowed to make a profit by exploiting countries with weaker regulations. How can we be taken seriously if we ship our hazardous chemicals abroad, poisoning people and Nature in the process? - Keeping old and dangerous pesticides on the market is depriving us of a greener future and more sustainable farming practices. An export ban on toxic pesticides would be a boon for innovation, and help Europe and the world move towards the more sustainable plant protection methods which our Planet desperately needs.

- The export of toxic pesticides exposes an EU double standard: dangerous pesticides are banned in Europe after they were linked to the dying of one of Earth's most important pollinators, the bee; and cancer, reproductive problems and neurodegenerative diseases in humans. Some of these pesticides are banned in Europe because of their links to brain damage in children and unborn babies. If these pesticides are too dangerous for us, how can we allow them to be exported? - Moreover, exporting toxic pesticides is a human rights issue, as these toxic substances are damaging to people. Every year, thousands of farmers die from exposure to dangerous pesticides. There are countless studies confirming the damaging effects of pesticides on people. - But, most importanty, if we actually care for our Planet - and keeping in mind there is no Planet B - we must understand how bad the export of toxic pesticides is for the bees, biodiversity and the Planet itself. The evidence is clear: neonics and other poisonous pesticides kill bees. Thats why theyre banned in Europe. Why are we still allowing them to be exported to countries with weaker regulations, killing bees and decimating biodiversity? This is utterly unethical. - Exporting toxic pesticides shows we are taking advantage of countries with weaker regulations. Europe has a role to play in the world - its companies should not be allowed to make a profit by exploiting countries with weaker regulations. How can we be taken seriously if we ship our hazardous chemicals abroad, poisoning people and Nature in the process? - Keeping old and dangerous pesticides on the market is depriving us of a greener future and more sustainable farming practices. An export ban on toxic pesticides would be a boon for innovation, and help Europe and the world move towards the more sustainable plant protection methods which our Planet desperately needs.

Estimados, todos vivimos en la misma casa, nuestro planeta Tierra. Todos somos parte de la humanidad. La exportación de pesticidas tóxicos perjudica a las personas, las abejas, la biodiversidad y al planeta en general. Los datos no mienten: por ejemplo, los neonicotinoides y otros pesticidas tóxicos matan a las abejas. Por eso están prohibidos en Europa. ¿Cómo podemos permitir que se sigan produciendo y además se exporten a otros países? La industria de los pesticidas tóxicos lucra con los países de normativas menos estrictas. Europa tiene que dar ejemplo y no permitir que sus empresas se aprovechen de una legislación más permisiva. ¿Cómo se nos puede tomar en serio si exportamos unos productos químicos que envenenan a las personas y la naturaleza? No hagamos a otros lo que no queremos hacer para nosotros mismos. Seamos coherentes por favor y sólo así podremos exigir lo mismo de los demás. Cordiales saludos.
englishfeedback: Dear, we all live in the same house, our planet Earth. We are all part of humanity. The export of toxic pesticides harms people, bees, biodiversity and the planet in general. The data do not feel: for example, neonicotinoids and other toxic pesticides kill bees. This is why they are banned in Europe. How can we allow them to continue to be produced and also exported to other countries? The toxic pesticide industry is profitable with countries with less stringent regulations. Europe needs to lead by example and not allow its businesses to take advantage of more permissive legislation. How can we be taken seriously if we export chemicals that poisonate people and nature? We don’t do what we do not want to do for ourselves. Let us be coherent and only in this way we can demand the same from others. Complimentary close.

feedback: Je préconise de refuser lexportation hors CEE de produits interdits dans la CEE.
englishfeedback: I recommend that products banned in the EEC should not be exported from the EEC.

feedback: Tous les pesticides et autres produits chimiques dangereux qui ont été interdits dans l'UE doivent également être interdits de production et d'exportation (sans dérogation) !!!! . Le règlement PIC doit donc être modifié dans ce sens afin de protéger la santé humaine et l'environnement.
englishfeedback: All pesticides and other hazardous chemicals that have been banned in the EU must also be banned from production and export (without derogation)! . The PIC Regulation should therefore be amended accordingly in order to protect human health and the environment.

feedback: Die gefährlichen Pestizide wurden in Europa verboten, weil sie mit verschiedenen negativen Auswirkungen durch wissenschaftliche Nachweise in Verbindung gebracht wurden. Wenn diese Pestizide für uns zu gefährlich sind: Wie können wir dann zulassen, dass sie exportiert werden? Es gibt viele Studien, die belegen, dass die Auswirkungen dieser Pestizide für Menschen, Tiere und Pflanzen enorme Schädigungen bis zum Tod sein können. In den letzten Jahren war dies auch immer wieder ein Thema besonders bei den Bienen und anderen bestäubenden Insekten. Warum sollten wir es zulassen das so etwas in anderen Ländern geschieht, wenn wir es nicht bei uns haben wollen. Ein weltweites Umdenken in Bezug auf die Landwirtschaft ist dringend von Nöten. Durch weitere Exporte von giftigen Pestiziden machen wir es anderen Ländern schwer Alternativen zu entwickeln. Ein Rechtsgutachten* des Center for International Environmental Law, das 2022 veröffentlicht wurde, zeigt, dass die EU mit dem Export verbotener Pestizide nach Afrika und Mittelamerika gegen internationale rechtliche Verpflichtungen und die Menschenrechte verstößt. * https://www.eko.org/media/campaigners-warn-european-commission-not-to-abandon-hazardous-chemical-exports-commitments-made-in-eu-green-deal/
englishfeedback: Hazardous pesticides have been banned in Europe because they have been associated with various negative impacts through scientific evidence. If these pesticides are too dangerous for us: How can we then allow them to be exported? There are many studies that show that the impact of these pesticides on humans, animals and plants can be huge damage to death. In recent years, this has always been an issue especially for bees and other pollinating insects. Why should we allow this to happen in other countries if we do not want to have it with us. There is an urgent need for a global rethink of agriculture. Through further exports of toxic pesticides, we are making it difficult for other countries to develop alternatives. A legal opinion* from the Center for International Environmental Law, published in 2022, shows that the EU is in breach of international legal obligations and human rights by exporting banned pesticides to Africa and Central America. * https://www.eko.org/media/campaigners-warn-european-commission-not-to-abandon-hazardous-chemical-exports-commitments-made-in-eu-green-deal/

feedback: Tout d'abord, il faudrait rappeler aux empoisonneurs que nous sommes tous sur la même planète, et qu'en "déplaçant le problème" vers l'hémisphère sud, on n'en sortira jamais ; et tout ça pour continuer à engranger des profits pharaoniques ! Il n'y a que LA RICHESSE DE LA BIO-DIVERSITE qui peut nous sauver, avec toutes ses défenses naturelles, et les ABEILLES et autres pollinisateurs ainsi que les oiseaux, fortement touchés par nos comportements . N'oublions pas que la planète se défend, d'une certaine manière, et le retour de bâton pourrait bien dépasser tout ce que nous pouvons imaginer ; la COVID était un avertissement, un échantillon de ce que peut engendrer notre folie ... De plus, il s'agit d'assassinat de masse, censés "profiter" (?) à une poignées d'individus; ces gens-là - les empoisonneurs - sont de grands malades ! Il n'y a aucun bénéfice à vouloir vivre dans un monde mortifère.
englishfeedback: First of all, poisoners should be reminded that we are all on the same planet and that “moving the problem” to the southern hemisphere will never leave it; and all this will continue to make pharaonic profits! There is only THE BIO-DIVERSITE RICHESSE that can save us, with all its natural defences, and ABEILLES and other pollinators as well as birds, which are heavily affected by our behaviour. Let us not forget that the planet defends itself, in a certain way, and the return of stick could go far beyond what we can imagine; COVID was a warning, a sample of what we can create... Moreover, it is a mass murder, which is supposed to ‘enjoy’ (?) a handful of individuals; these people – the poisoners – are great patients! There is no benefit to want to live in a mortiferous world.

feedback: Geachte Commissie, de bestuurbaarheid van veel landen binnen de EU neemt gestaag af. De kiezer laat zich steeds meer verleiden door makkelijke standpunten en extreme meningen, die door de naar ophef zoekende journalistiek maar al te graag worden gereproduceerd en opgeklopt. Gelukkig is daar de Europese Commissie, die zich steeds meer de hoeder toont van het algemeen Europees belang en zich blijft focussen op echt belangrijke dossiers. Elke Commissie lijkt zich weer wat meer bewust van haar essentiële rol bij complexe thema's van onze tijd en elke Commissie lijkt weer wat meer vastberaden om de juiste beslissingen te nemen. Dat is moedig en dat siert u. Dat schept tegelijkertijd ook verplichtingen. Een Commissie die de hoeder is van het algemeen belang kan - en mag zich niet permitteren besluiten te nemen die niet alleen contrair zijn aan het algemeen (in dit geval: mondiaal) belang, maar die nadrukkelijk specifieke deelbelangen behartigen (in dit geval die van een aantal grote bedrijven). Dat past een zo belangwekkend orgaan als de Europese Commissie niet. Beste Commissie, als ú het algemeen belang niet meer dient, doet niemand het meer. Noblesse oblige, ik reken dus op u. Met vriendelijke groeten, Laus de Jonge
englishfeedback: Dear Commission, the governability of many countries within the EU is steadily decreasing. The voter is increasingly distracted by easy views and extreme opinions, which are very much replicated and captured by investigative journalism. Fortunately, the European Commission, which is increasingly acting as guarantor of the general European interest, continues to focus on truly important issues. Each Commission seems to be somewhat more aware of its essential role in complex issues of our time and every Commission seems somewhat more determined to take the right decisions. This is courageous and like you, and at the same time creates obligations. A Commission which is the guardian of the public interest can – and should not allow itself to take decisions that are not only contrasting with the general one (in this case: global), but strongly advocating specific shared interests (in this case, those of a number of large companies). This is not a body as important as the European Commission. Dear Commission, if you no longer serve the public interest, nobody does more. Noblesse oblee, so I count on you. With your best wishes, Laus de Jonge

feedback: L'exportation de pesticides toxiques révèle une politique de deux poids deux mesures : Les pesticides dangereux sont interdits en Europe après avoir été associés à des cancers, des problèmes de reproduction et des maladies neurodégénératives. Certains de ces pesticides sont même interdits en Europe en raison de leur lien avec des lésions cérébrales chez les enfants et les bébés à naître. Si ces pesticides sont trop dangereux pour nous, comment pouvons-nous autoriser leur exportation ? Un avis juridique du Center for International Environmental Law publié en 2022 montre que les exportations européennes de pesticides interdits vers l'Afrique et l'Amérique centrale violent les obligations juridiques internationales de l'UE et le droit relatif aux droits humains.L'interdiction d'exporter des pesticides toxiques serait une opportunité unique pour l'innovation et aiderait l'Europe et le monde à évoluer vers des méthodes de protection des plantes plus durables.
englishfeedback: The export of toxic pesticides reveals a double standard policy: Hazardous pesticides are banned in Europe after being associated with cancers, reproductive problems and neurodegenerative diseases. Some of these pesticides are even banned in Europe because of their link to brain damage in children and born babies. If these pesticides are too dangerous for us, how can we authorise their export? A legal opinion of the Center for International Environmental Law published in 2022 shows that European exports of banned pesticides to Africa and Central America violate the EU’s international legal obligations and human rights law.The export ban on toxic pesticides would be a unique opportunity for innovation and would help Europe and the world to move towards more sustainable plant protection methods.

feedback: Il faut modifier le règlement PIC pour interdire à la fois la production dans lUE et l'exportation (sans dérogation possible) de tous les pesticides et autres produits chimiques dangereux qui ont été interdits dans l'UE afin de protéger la santé humaine et l'environnement.
englishfeedback: The PIC Regulation needs to be amended to ban both the production in the EU and the export (without possible derogation) of all pesticides and other hazardous chemicals that have been banned in the EU in order to protect human health and the environment.

feedback: « Il faut modifier le règlement PIC pour interdire à la fois la production dans lUE et l'exportation (sans dérogation possible) de tous les pesticides et autres produits chimiques dangereux qui ont été interdits dans l'UE afin de protéger la santé humaine et l'environnement. »
englishfeedback: “The PIC Regulation needs to be amended to ban both the production in the EU and the export (without possible derogation) of all pesticides and other hazardous chemicals that have been banned in the EU in order to protect human health and the environment.”

feedback: Wenn man etwas giftiges im Haus hat und es selbst nicht haben möchte, sollte man es dann seinem Nachbarn verkaufen? Stoffe, die Menschen, Umwelt und unseren Planeten im Ganzen schädigen, darf man nicht als Geldquelle benutzen!
