A legal opinion of the Center for International Environmental Law published in 2022 shows that European exports of banned pesticides to Africa and Central America violate the EU’s international legal obligations and human rights law.

feedback: LOS PESTICIDAS Y OTROS PRODUCTOS QUÍMICOS NOCIVOS PARA LA NATURALEZA QUE ESTÉN PROHIBIDOS EN LA UNIÓN EUROPEA TAMPOCO DEBEN SER EXPORTADOS DESDE LA MISMA A OTROS PAISES. TAMBIÉN SE DEBE PROHIBIR LA IMORTACIÓN DENTRO DE LA UNIÓN EUROPEA DE AQUELLOS PRODUCTOS QUE HAN SIDO TRATADOS CON LOS PRODUCTOS PROHIBIDOS.
englishfeedback: PESTICIDES AND OTHER NATURALLY HARMFUL CHEMICALS THAT ARE BANNED IN THE EUROPEAN UNION SHOULD ALSO NOT BE EXPORTED FROM THE EUROPEAN UNION TO OTHER COUNTRIES. THE IMORTATION WITHIN THE EUROPEAN UNION OF PRODUCTS THAT HAVE BEEN TREATED WITH THE PROHIBITED PRODUCTS SHOULD ALSO BE PROHIBITED.

feedback: Je trouve inadmissible et indécent d'exporter des produits dont la toxicité a été reconnue en Europe vers des pays d'Amérique latine et d'Afrique. Il faut stopper la production de ces produits chimiques et arrêter leur commercialisation. La sauvegarde de l'Humanité ne doit pas être remise en cause par des ambitions mercantiles de quelques grandes sociétés industrielles, pas plus que la préservation de la biodiversité bien mise à mal par ces groupes.
englishfeedback: I find it unacceptable and indecent to export products whose toxicity has been recognised in Europe to countries in Latin America and Africa. The production of these chemicals must be stopped and their marketing stopped. The preservation of humanities must not be called into question by the mercantile ambitions of a few major industrial societies, nor should the preservation of biodiversity that these groups are well affected.

feedback: Saludos cordiales; Solamente pedirles que recuerden el dicho "trata a los demás como te gustaría que te tratasen a ti" y, que todo está conectado en la naturaleza. Eduquemos para cuidarnos la salud. Coraje y tenacidad en estos tiempos de metamorfosis. Ánimos y Gracias Tània Donate Urbano
englishfeedback: Warmly greetings; Just ask them to remember this “treats others as you would like you to treat you” and that everything is connected in nature. Let’s take care of our health. Courage and tenacity at these times of metamorphosis. We and Thanks Tània Donate Urban

feedback: L'exportation de pesticides dangereux doit être interdite. Elle est néfaste pour pour les abeilles, la biodiversité et la planète en général. C'est aussi une question de droits humains. Chaque année, des milliers d'agriculteurs meurent d'une trop forte exposition à ses produits toxiques. D'innombrables études confirment leurs effets néfaste sur les humains : cancers, problèmes reproductifs, maladies neurodégénératives, et lésions cérébrales chez les enfants et les bébés à naître. L'exportation des pesticides interdits dans l'UE révèle une politique de deux poids deux mesures. Comment peut-on l'autoriser alors qu'ils considérer comme dangereux pour nous ? Un avis juridique du Center for International Environmental Law publié en 2022 montre que les exportations européennes de pesticides interdits vers l'Afrique et l'Amérique centrale violent les obligations juridiques internationales de l'UE et le droit relatif aux droits humains. L'UE qui se veut un modèle dans le genre peut-elle être prise au sérieux en permettant l'empoisonnement de la nature et des populations de pays avec une législation moins stricte en la matière ? A l'heure où notre environnement est mis à mal par le réchauffement climatique dû aux activités humaines (principalement des pays développés), l'interdiction d'exporter des pesticides dangereux serait une opportunité unique pour l'innovation et permettrait à l'Europe et au reste du monde d'évoluer vers des méthodes de protection des plantes plus durables et respectueuses des écosystèmes.
englishfeedback: The export of hazardous pesticides should be prohibited. It is harmful for bees, biodiversity and the planet in general. It is also a human rights issue. Every year thousands of farmers die from too high exposure to their toxic products. Countless studies confirm their adverse effects on humans: cancers, reproductive problems, neurodegenerative diseases, and brain lesions in children and unborn babies. The export of pesticides banned in the EU reveals a double standards policy. How can they be allowed when they consider them dangerous for us? A legal opinion of the Center for International Environmental Law published in 2022 shows that European exports of banned pesticides to Africa and Central America violate the EU’s international legal obligations and human rights law. Can the EU that wants a gender model be taken seriously by allowing the poisoning of nature and people in countries with less stringent legislation? At a time when our environment is being undermined by global warming due to human activities (mainly developed countries), banning the export of dangerous pesticides would be a unique opportunity for innovation and would allow Europe and the rest of the world to move towards more sustainable and ecosystem-friendly methods of plant protection.

feedback: Hi! I am deeply concerned about companies, selling/exporting banned chemicals to other countries outside of EU. Forbid this inhuman way of earning money for all company's involved in this and demand them to start developing nontoxic formulas for a long-lasting planet! Best Regards Cecilia Petersson

If certain products are considered to be harmful, cancer-inducing and possibly lethal, and therefore banned in the EU, why are they exported outside the EU? Is this not quasi-murder? This is what the UK allowed with 'flour' made from animals that had died from / been destroyed because of mad cow disease. German companies such as Bayer and BASF should remember their 'contribution' to elimination of other ethnic groups through 'exporting' their products to Auschwitz etc

Les pesticides sont nocifs pour notre santé et pour la biodiversité. Leur exportation vers des pays où la réglementation est moins stricte ne serait quun déplacement du problème et UNE MARQUE DE MÉPRIS POUR LES POPULATIONS DE LÉTRANGER.
englishfeedback: Pesticides are harmful to our health and biodiversity. Their export to countries with less stringent regulation would only be a shift of the problem and a disrespect for foreign countries.

feedback: L'esportazione di pesticidi tossici sfrutta i paesi con leggi più permissive. L'Europa ha un ruolo da svolgere nel mondo: non si deve permettere alle sue aziende di approfittare dei paesi con una regolamentazione più debole. Come possiamo essere presi sul serio se spediamo le nostre sostanze chimiche pericolose all'estero, avvelenando le persone e la natura in paesi dove le norme di sicurezza sono più deboli e meno rigorose?
englishfeedback: The export of toxic pesticides exploits countries with more permissive laws. Europe has a role to play in the world: its companies should not be allowed to take advantage of countries with weaker regulation. How can we be taken seriously if we ship our hazardous chemicals abroad, poisoning people and nature in countries where safety standards are weaker and lower?

feedback: L'esportazione di pesticidi tossici sfrutta i paesi con leggi più permissive. L'Europa ha un ruolo da svolgere nel mondo: non si deve permettere alle sue aziende di approfittare dei paesi con una regolamentazione più debole. Come possiamo essere presi sul serio se spediamo le nostre sostanze chimiche pericolose all'estero, avvelenando le persone e la natura in paesi dove le norme di sicurezza sono più deboli e meno rigorose?
englishfeedback: The export of toxic pesticides exploits countries with more permissive laws. Europe has a role to play in the world: its companies should not be allowed to take advantage of countries with weaker regulation. How can we be taken seriously if we ship our hazardous chemicals abroad, poisoning people and nature in countries where safety standards are weaker and lower?

feedback: Con un mercado cada día mas globalizado es fácil que los pesticidas vuelvan en parte a la unión europea en forma de importación de productos agrícolas. Acabamos de tener una alerta con las sandias provenientes de Marruecos por contener un pesticida prohibido en la UE. Si hemos conseguido que no se utilicen en la UE para evitar su consumo,por que debemos aceptar que se consuman de forma indirecta?
englishfeedback: With a more globalised market every day, it is easy for pesticides to return partly to the European Union in the form of imports of agricultural products. We have just been alerted to watermelons from Morocco for containing a pesticide banned in the EU. If we have managed not to use them in the EU to prevent their consumption, so we must accept that they are consumed indirectly?

feedback: Je ne comprends pas que la question fasse objet de contradiction par les firmes concernées.La règle éthique de bon sens est de ne pas proposer voire imposer à un autre pays ce qui est considéré comme nuisible par et pour son propre pays.L'argument de protection de l'emploi n'en est pas un. Les firmes doivent employer leurs salariés à mettre au point des solutions efficaces et non nocives pour qui que ce soit sur notre unique planète. Il est temps que la politique et l'économie suivent les règles de base de la morale et de la civilisation dans une Europe démocratique
englishfeedback: I do not understand that the issue is contradictory by the firms concerned. The ethical rule of common sense is not to propose or even impose on another country what is considered harmful by and for his own country. The argument of employment protection is not one. Firms must employ their employees to develop effective and non-harmful solutions for people on our single planet. It is time for politics and the economy to follow the basic rules of morality and civilisation in a democratic Europe

feedback: Ich bin für ein Verbot der Herstellung und Ausfuhr von Chemikalien von verbotenen Stoffen, da deren Anwendung nicht ohne Grund verboten wurden. Wenn sie in der EU Schäden anrichten können, werden sie es genauso anderswo bei deren Anwendung tun. Weiterhin können diese Chemikalien oder deren Überreste über die Endprodukte zurück in die EU gelangen. Damit kann das Wohl der EU-Bürger ebenfalls beeiträchtigt werden.
englishfeedback: I am in favour of a ban on the production and export of chemicals from banned substances, as their use has not been banned unreasonably. If they can cause damage in the EU, they will do the same elsewhere in their application. These chemicals, or their residues, can also be returned to the EU via the final products. This can also undermine the well-being of EU citizens.

feedback: Je trouve nécessaire d'interdire l'exportation de pesticides toxiques qui ont d'ores et déjà prouvé leur nocivité vis-à-vis de la biodiversité et des personnes ici en Europe. L'UE se doit d'être un exemple aux yeux du monde ...
englishfeedback: I find it necessary to ban the export of toxic pesticides that have already proven to be harmful to biodiversity and people here in Europe. The EU must be an example in the eyes of the world...

feedback: Comment peut-on autoriser l'exportation de pesticides dont la dangerosité et la toxicité ont été prouvées, et qui de fait ont été interdits en Europe ? Jean-Pierre Méro
englishfeedback: How can the export of pesticides which have been proven to be dangerous and toxic and which have in fact been banned in Europe be authorised? Jean-Pierre Mero

feedback: Guten Tag, im Sinne des Vorsorgeprinzips dürfen Pestizide weder in Europa noch in anderen Ländern eingesetzt werden. Bis heute gibt es keine eindeutigen Beweise, dass Pestizide für Mensch und Natur unschädlich sind. Von der Logik her können sie dies nicht sein, denn sonst könnten sie nicht ihrer Zielsetzung gerecht werden. Ein großes Problem besteht auch darin, dass der Cocktail von verschiedenen Pestiziden und deren Auswirkung überhaupt nicht erforscht wurde. Pestizide geraten auf Nicht-Zielflächen, reichern sich im Boden an, bilden Metaboliten, geraten in das Grundwasser und belasten somit über Jahrzente die Grundlagen der menschlichen Ernährung. Sind Gifte einmal ausgebracht, können diese nur mehr schwer, bzw. gar nicht mehr beseitigt und neutralisiert werden. Jeder Mensch, sowohl in Europa als auch in jedem anderen Land der Erde hat das Recht auf eine gesunde Nahrung und auf Gesundheit. Auch ist es verantwortungslos zukünftigen Generationen Lasten zu übertragen, deren Folgen nicht abschätzbar sind und die sie nicht bewältigen können. Im Sinne von Respekt, Gleichberechtigung, Rücksichtnahme, Vorsorge und Schutz von Mensch und Natur dürfen zukünftig keine Pestizide mehr eingesetzt werden. Die großen Gewinne, die bisher erzielt wurden, sollen zur Erforschung von Alternativen und zur Förderung einer enkeltauglichen Wirtschaftsweise verwendet werden. Mit freundlichen Grüßen
englishfeedback: Dear, in line with the precautionary principle, pesticides must not be used in Europe or in other countries. To date, there is no clear evidence that pesticides are harmless to humans and nature. From a logical point of view, they cannot be that, otherwise they would not be able to fulfil their objectives. A major problem is that the cocktail of various pesticides and their impact have not been explored at all. Pesticides are found in non-target areas, accumulate in the soil, form metabolites, fall into groundwater and thus affect the foundations of human nutrition more than centuries. Once poisons are applied, they are difficult to remove or even neutralise. Everyone, both in Europe and in any other country in the world, has the right to healthy food and health. It is also irresponsible for future generations to carry burdens, the consequences of which cannot be estimated and which they cannot cope with. In the interests of respect, equality, consideration, precaution and protection of human beings and nature, pesticides can no longer be used in the future. The major gains made so far will be used to explore alternatives and promote a healthy economy. [Complimentary close]

feedback: En tant que citoyen de l'Union Européenne, je trouve inacceptable que la nuisance de certains pesticides dont l'Union Européenne nous protège soit exportée et nuise à des populations pauvres et fragiles. J'apprécie la présente consultation et en remercie l'Union Européenne car je privilégie le modeste pouvoir des citoyens face au pouvoir de l'argent et des lobbies qui agissent de façon non transparente et non démocratique. veuillez accepter mes salutations citoyennes. Jean Paul Cubaynes.
englishfeedback: As a citizen of the European Union, I find it unacceptable that the nuisance of certain pesticides from which the European Union protects us is exported and harms poor and fragile populations. I appreciate this consultation and thank the European Union for it because I favour the modest power of citizens over the power of money and lobbyists who act in a non-transparent and non-democratic manner. Please accept my citizen’s greetings. Jean Paul Cubaynes.

feedback: Sappiamo che certe sostanze chimiche sono tossiche e pericolose. Lo sono per le persone europee e per i territori europei tanto da averle vietate. Sono altrettanto tossiche e pericolose al di fuori dell'Europa. Mi preoccupa l'idea di continuare a produrle ed usarle. Vorrei che tutte le vite, umane e non umane, fossero rispettate. Desidero che sia vietata la produzione e l'esportazione di sostanze chimiche vietate nell'Unione europea.
englishfeedback: We know that certain chemicals are toxic and dangerous. This is the case for European people and European territories to the extent that they have banned them. They are equally toxic and dangerous outside Europe. I am concerned about the idea of continuing to produce and use them. I would like all lives, both human and non-human, to be respected. I want the production and export of chemicals banned in the European Union to be banned.

feedback: Eksport toksycznych pestycydów to dowód hipokryzji. Groźne pestycydy są zakazane w Europie, ponieważ wykazano ich związek z nowotworami, problemami z płodnością i schorzeniami neurodegeneracyjnymi (uszkodzeniami układu nerwowego), takimi jak choroba Parkinsona i choroba Alzheimera. Te same pestycydy powodują wymieranie pszczół. Niektóre z nich zostały zakazane w Europie dlatego, że powiązano je z uszkodzeniami mózgu u ludzkich płodów i noworodków. Skoro wiemy, że są tak bardzo niebezpieczne, jak możemy pozwalać na ich eksport? W skład wielu pestycydów oprócz owianych złą sławą neonikotynoidów wchodzą m.in. produkty ropopochodne, które znacznie podwyższają skuteczność oraz są tajemnicą producentów. Głównie to one właśnie wykazują najwyższą toksyczność.
englishfeedback: Exports of toxic pesticides are evidence of hypocriticity. Hazardous pesticides are banned in Europe because they have been shown to be associated with cancer, fertility problems and neurodegenerative disorders (neural damage), such as Parkinson’s disease and Alzheimer’s disease. The same pesticides lead to the death of bees. Some of them were banned in Europe because they were linked to brain damage in human foetuses and newborn babies. If we know that they are as dangerous, how can we allow them to be exported? In addition to the bad reputation of neonicotinoids, many pesticides include petroleum products, which significantly increase the efficiency and confidentiality of producers. They are mainly the ones that show the highest toxicity.

feedback: Comment peut-on interdire des pesticides dangereux et désirer les exporter ??? Parce que la vie des "autres" nous importe peu ? (Et pour ensuite réimporter les productions agricoles qui auront 'béneficié' de cette chimie ???) Ca m'échappe et je demande donc l'interdiction totale de production de ces produits chimiques dangereux. Merci.
englishfeedback: How can hazardous pesticides be banned and exported? Because the life of “others” does not matter to us? (And then in order to re-import the agricultural products that will have “loved” this chemistry?) This escapes me and I therefore call for a total ban on the production of these dangerous chemicals. Thank you.

feedback: L'exportation de pesticides toxiques révèle une politique de deux poids deux mesures : Les pesticides dangereux sont interdits en Europe après avoir été associés à des cancers, des problèmes de reproduction et des maladies neurodégénératives, ainsi qu'à la mort des abeilles. Certains de ces pesticides sont même interdits en Europe en raison de leur lien avec des lésions cérébrales chez les enfants et les bébés à naître. Si ces pesticides sont trop dangereux pour nous, comment pouvons-nous autoriser leur exportation ?
englishfeedback: The export of toxic pesticides reveals a double standard policy: Hazardous pesticides are banned in Europe after being associated with cancer, reproductive problems and neurodegenerative diseases, as well as bee death. Some of these pesticides are even banned in Europe because of their link to brain damage in children and born babies. If these pesticides are too dangerous for us, how can we authorise their export?

feedback: La situation environnementale est toujours plus critique sur notre planète. Pour notre propre survie il est temps d'arrêter d'utiliser tout ce que l'industrie agro-chimique a de pire dans ses rayons. C'est aux états, aux politiques, à tous les responsables élus (sensés être au service des citoyens et non des lobbys) à agir fermement et clairement dans cette direction. Comment est-il possible que l'Europe continue à produire et exporter des produits qui ne sont plus autorisés sur son sol?
englishfeedback: The environmental situation is becoming ever more critical on our planet. For our own survival, it is time to stop using everything that the agro-chemical industry has worse on its shelves. It is up to states, politicians and all elected officials (who are thought to be at the service of citizens and not lobbyists) to act firmly and clearly in this direction. How can Europe continue to produce and export products that are no longer authorised on its soil?

feedback: Ich ersuche DRINGEND, ein Exportverbot für alles Pestizide, die in der EU verboten sind, auch auf alle anderen Länder dieser Welt (inklusive Afrika...) auszudehnen. Es ist unsere EINE Welt und überall leben Menschen wie WIR. Dr. Elisabeth Frank, Kinderärztin
englishfeedback: I urge that an export ban on all pesticides banned in the EU be extended to all other countries in the world (including Africa...). It is our ONE world and people like WIR live everywhere. Dr Elisabeth Frank, paediatric doctor

feedback: La exportación de pesticidas tóxicos revela un doble rasero. Los pesticidas peligrosos están prohibidos en Europa por su relación con el cáncer, los problemas reproductivos y las enfermedades neurodegenerativas, así como con la muerte de las abejas. Además, se sabe que algunos provocan daño cerebral infantil y durante el embarazo. Si no usamos estos pesticidas por ser demasiado peligrosos, ¿cómo podemos permitir que se exporten? La exportación de pesticidas tóxicos es una cuestión de derechos humanos, ya que atentan contra la salud. Cada año, miles de personas que viven de la agricultura mueren por exponerse a estos peligrosos pesticidas. Numerosos estudios demuestran sus efectos nocivos. La exportación de pesticidas tóxicos perjudica a las abejas, la biodiversidad y el planeta. Los datos no mienten: los neonicotinoides y otros pesticidas tóxicos matan a las abejas. Por eso están prohibidos en Europa. ¿Cómo podemos permitir que se exporten a otros países? La industria de los pesticidas tóxicos se lucra con los países de normativas menos estrictas. Europa tiene que dar ejemplo y no permitir que sus empresas se aprovechen de una legislación más permisiva. ¿Cómo se nos puede tomar en serio si exportamos unos productos químicos que envenenan a las personas y la naturaleza? La prohibición de exportar pesticidas tóxicos fomentaría la innovación y animaría a Europa y al resto del mundo a utilizar técnicas fitosanitarias más sostenibles. Mantener en el mercado pesticidas obsoletos y peligrosos nos priva de un futuro más verde y de unas prácticas agrícolas más ecológicas. Permitir su exportación es sencillamente inmoral.
englishfeedback: The export of toxic pesticides reveals double standards. Hazardous pesticides are banned in Europe because of their relationship with cancer, reproductive problems and neurodegenerative diseases, as well as the death of bees. In addition, some are known to cause brain damage for children and during pregnancy. If we do not use these pesticides because they are too dangerous, how can we allow them to be exported? The export of toxic pesticides is a human rights issue, as they harm health. Every year, thousands of people living in agriculture die from exposure to these dangerous pesticides. Numerous studies demonstrate its harmful effects. The export of toxic pesticides harms bees, biodiversity and the planet. The data do not feel: neonicotinoids and other toxic pesticides kill bees. This is why they are banned in Europe. How can we allow them to be exported to other countries? The toxic pesticide industry is profitable with countries with less stringent regulations. Europe needs to lead by example and not allow its businesses to take advantage of more permissive legislation. How can we be taken seriously if we export chemicals that poisonate people and nature? A ban on the export of toxic pesticides would encourage innovation and encourage Europe and the rest of the world to use more sustainable plant protection techniques. Keeping obsolete and dangerous pesticides on the market deprives us of a greener future and greener farming practices. Allowing their export is simply immoral.

feedback: Me parece inaceptable que se permita exportar a otros países pesticidas y productos peligrosos que están prohibidos en la EU. ¿Acaso son menos peligrosos y contaminantes fuera de Europa? ¿No nos preocupan las personas de esos países? No queremos que nadie se contamine y contamine la tierra con esos productos......por favor, prohíban su producción, uso y exportación. Europa también tiene el deber de proteger a esos países
englishfeedback: It seems to me inaceptable that it is possible to export the otros pesticide countries y productos Peligrosos que Estn prohibidos en la EU. But not least Peligrosos and contaminants have fled Europe? Are you worried by country personas? We want you to get in touch y contamine la tierra con esos productos...... in favour, prohíban su producción, uso y exportación. Europa también tiene el deber to protect the country

feedback: Tous les produits exportés, dangereux pour la santé et la nature, nous reviendrons tel un boomerang sous une forme ou autre... Arrêtons d'autoriser ces sociétés industrielles travaillant soit-disant pour notre bien, de détruire le vivant !
englishfeedback: All exported products, dangerous to health and nature, will come back like a boomerang in some form... Let’s stop allowing these industrial companies that allegedly work for our good, destroy life!

feedback: L'exportation de pesticides toxiques révèle une politique de deux poids deux mesures : Les pesticides dangereux sont interdits en Europe après avoir été associés à des cancers, des problèmes de reproduction et des maladies neurodégénératives, ainsi qu'à la mort des abeilles. Certains de ces pesticides sont même interdits en Europe en raison de leur lien avec des lésions cérébrales chez les enfants et les bébés à naître. Si ces pesticides sont trop dangereux pour nous, comment pouvons-nous autoriser leur exportation ? Chaque année, des milliers d'agriculteurs meurent des suites dune trop forte exposition à ces pesticides dangereux. Les pesticides exportés font l'objet d'innombrables études qui confirment leurs effets néfastes sur les humains. L'interdiction d'exporter des pesticides toxiques serait une opportunité unique pour l'innovation et aiderait l'Europe et le monde à évoluer vers des méthodes de protection des plantes plus durables. Le maintien sur le marché de pesticides anciens et dangereux nous prive d'un avenir plus vert et de pratiques agricoles plus durables.
englishfeedback: The export of toxic pesticides reveals a double standard policy: Hazardous pesticides are banned in Europe after being associated with cancer, reproductive problems and neurodegenerative diseases, as well as bee death. Some of these pesticides are even banned in Europe because of their link to brain damage in children and born babies. If these pesticides are too dangerous for us, how can we authorise their export? Every year, thousands of farmers die as a result of excessive exposure to these hazardous pesticides. Exported pesticides are subject to countless studies confirming their adverse effects on humans. Banning the export of toxic pesticides would be a unique opportunity for innovation and would help Europe and the world to move towards more sustainable plant protection methods. Keeping old and dangerous pesticides on the market deprives us of a greener future and more sustainable agricultural practices.

feedback: Il serait tout à fait inadmissible que l'Europe autorise des exportations de produits dangereux, qu"elle a elle-même interdit dans ses frontières
englishfeedback: It would be totally unacceptable for Europe to authorise exports of dangerous products, which it has itself banned at its borders

feedback: Bonjour, Il est choquant, immoral et écologiquement irresponsable de permettre la vente du substances produites en Europe mais interdites sur son sol. L'Union européenne permet ainsi de polluer d'autres parties de notre planète et d'empoisonner d'autres populations que celles de son territoire. Bel exemple, qui en dit long sur notre système législatif, économique et politique. Nous courons ainsi à la catastrophe mondiale, dont nous serons en grande partie directement responsables. Il est grand temps d'être plus cohérents et responsables. Cordialement, Xavier Duboscq
englishfeedback: Hello, it is shocking, immoral and environmentally irresponsible to allow the sale of substances produced in Europe but banned on his soil. The European Union is thus making it possible to pollute other parts of our planet and poisoning people other than those on its territory. A good example, who tells a lot about our legislative, economic and political system. In this way, we are facing the global disaster, for which we will largely be directly responsible. It is high time to be more coherent and accountable. Cordially, Xavier Duboscq

feedback: Si nous interdisons certains produits en raison de leur dangerosité, il est criminel de les laisser exporter vers d'autres pays où la surveillance quant à la qualité des produits est moindre. Merci d'en interdire définitivement la production pour des raisons purement économiques, au détriment de la santé et de lenvironnement.
englishfeedback: If we ban certain products because of their dangerous nature, it is a criminal offence to let them export to other countries where product quality monitoring is lower. Thank you for definitively banning its production for purely economic reasons, to the detriment of health and the environment.

feedback: Hola, considero inaceptable enviar a otras personas, otros países, lo que es nocivo para nosotr@s. Gracias
englishfeedback: Hello, I find it unacceptable to send other people, other countries, which is harmful to nosotr@s. Thanks

feedback: Il faut être bien hypocrite, avoir peu d'honneur et ne penser qu'au fric pour interdire chez nous des produits dangereux et continuer à les produire et les exporter. Pensez à nos enfants que vous empoisonnez. Honte à la France et à l'UE.
englishfeedback: We need to be hypocritical, have little honour and think only with fric to ban dangerous products on our premises and continue to produce and export them. Think of our children that you are poisoning. Shame to France and the EU.

feedback: La exportación de pesticidas tóxicos revela un doble rasero. Los pesticidas peligrosos están prohibidos en Europa por su relación con el cáncer, los problemas reproductivos y las enfermedades neurodegenerativas, así como con la muerte de las abejas. Además, se sabe que algunos provocan daño cerebral infantil y durante el embarazo. Si no usamos estos pesticidas por ser demasiado peligrosos, ¿cómo podemos permitir que se exporten? La exportación de pesticidas tóxicos perjudica a las abejas, la biodiversidad y el planeta. Los datos no mienten: los neonicotinoides y otros pesticidas tóxicos matan a las abejas. Por eso están prohibidos en Europa. ¿Cómo podemos permitir que se exporten a otros países? La industria de los pesticidas tóxicos se lucra con los países de normativas menos estrictas. Europa tiene que dar ejemplo y no permitir que sus empresas se aprovechen de una legislación más permisiva. ¿Cómo se nos puede tomar en serio si exportamos unos productos químicos que envenenan a las personas y la naturaleza? Un saludo cordial
englishfeedback: The export of toxic pesticides reveals double standards. Hazardous pesticides are banned in Europe because of their relationship with cancer, reproductive problems and neurodegenerative diseases, as well as the death of bees. In addition, some are known to cause brain damage for children and during pregnancy. If we do not use these pesticides because they are too dangerous, how can we allow them to be exported? The export of toxic pesticides harms bees, biodiversity and the planet. The data do not feel: neonicotinoids and other toxic pesticides kill bees. This is why they are banned in Europe. How can we allow them to be exported to other countries? The toxic pesticide industry is profitable with countries with less stringent regulations. Europe needs to lead by example and not allow its businesses to take advantage of more permissive legislation. How can we be taken seriously if we export chemicals that poisonate people and nature? Best regards

feedback: La exportación de pesticidas tóxicos revela un doble rasero. Los pesticidas peligrosos están prohibidos en Europa por su relación con el cáncer, los problemas reproductivos y las enfermedades neurodegenerativas, así como con la muerte de las abejas. Además, se sabe que algunos provocan daño cerebral infantil y durante el embarazo. Si no usamos estos pesticidas por ser demasiado peligrosos, ¿cómo podemos permitir que se exporten? La exportación de pesticidas tóxicos perjudica a las abejas, la biodiversidad y el planeta. Los datos no mienten: los neonicotinoides y otros pesticidas tóxicos matan a las abejas. Por eso están prohibidos en Europa. ¿Cómo podemos permitir que se exporten a otros países? La industria de los pesticidas tóxicos se lucra con los países de normativas menos estrictas. Europa tiene que dar ejemplo y no permitir que sus empresas se aprovechen de una legislación más permisiva. ¿Cómo se nos puede tomar en serio si exportamos unos productos químicos que envenenan a las personas y la naturaleza? Un saludo cordial
englishfeedback: The export of toxic pesticides reveals double standards. Hazardous pesticides are banned in Europe because of their relationship with cancer, reproductive problems and neurodegenerative diseases, as well as the death of bees. In addition, some are known to cause brain damage for children and during pregnancy. If we do not use these pesticides because they are too dangerous, how can we allow them to be exported? The export of toxic pesticides harms bees, biodiversity and the planet. The data do not feel: neonicotinoids and other toxic pesticides kill bees. This is why they are banned in Europe. How can we allow them to be exported to other countries? The toxic pesticide industry is profitable with countries with less stringent regulations. Europe needs to lead by example and not allow its businesses to take advantage of more permissive legislation. How can we be taken seriously if we export chemicals that poisonate people and nature? Best regards

feedback: It should not be legal to export chemicals which are banned in Europe. This is not only immoral and inconsistent treatment of non-European citizens but also in the case of pesticides exposes Europeans to the chemicals through food imports.

Il ne peut y avoir deux poids deux mesures : apporter de l'aide publique aux pays du sud, fondée sur des valeurs de développement durable, de défense des droits humains, quels qu'ils soient, et de protection de lenvironnement et, d'un autre côté bafouer ces mêmes valeurs en acceptant l'exportation de pesticides qui vont à leur encontre. La vie des femmes, des enfants et des hommes vivant hors de l'Union européenne aurait-elle moins de valeur que celles de nos propres concitoyens ? Il s'agit d'une question de cohérence, de crédibilité et d'humanité. Les grandes compagnies de pesticides gagneraient largement à leur tour en image de marque en développant pour le marché des produits nettement moins toxiques, tout en préservant au maximum l'efficacité recherchée. La science a toujours avancé et ce qui semblait impossible hier peut l'être aujourd'hui. Plutôt que d'être radicalement opposés, les intérêts des uns des autres ne seraient-ils pas finalement liés ? C'est vers un réel effort commun qu'il faut tendre. En attendant, les exportations de ce type doivent impérativement cesser.
englishfeedback: There can be no double standards: to provide public aid to the countries of the south, based on the values of sustainable development, the defence of any human rights and the protection of the environment, and, on the other hand, to disregard the same values by accepting the export of pesticides which run counter to them. Would the lives of women, children and men living outside the European Union be less valuable than those of our own citizens? This is a question of coherence, credibility and humanity. The large pesticide companies would in turn gain a strong brand image by developing much less toxic products for the market, while preserving the desired efficiency to the maximum extent possible. Science has always advanced and what seemed impossible yesterday can be. Rather than being radically opposed, would the interests of each other not ultimately be linked? We must strive for a real joint effort. In the meantime, exports of this kind must cease.

feedback: Geachte heer, mevrouw, Graag wil in kenbaar maken dat ik zeer tegen de export ben van chemische (agri business) middelen naar Afrika en Zuid Amerika. Middelen die in Europa omwille van gezondheid voor mens en dier verboden zijn en die we dan wel zouden exporteren naar landen waar de wetgeving het minder nauw neemt mbt dit soort stoffen. Hoeveel boter moet je op je hoofd hebben? Slecht voor de planeet, voor dieren groot en klein, voor mensen, voor de gewassen en dus slecht voor alles. De economische retoriek die met betrekking tot dit onderwerp gebezigd wordt (voldoende voedsel voor iedereen) is niet waarachtig. 'Eerlijk zullen we alles delen' zou passender zijn.
englishfeedback: Dear Mr, Ms, Graag, would like to express my strong opposition to the export of chemical (agri business) funds to Africa and South America. Products that are banned in Europe for reasons of human and animal health and which we would export to countries where legislation is less restrictive in relation to this type of substance. How many butter should you have on your head? Bad for the planet, for animals large and small, for humans, for crops and therefore bad for everything. The economic rhetoric used on this subject (sufficient food for all) is not true. “Fairly we will share everything” would be more appropriate.

feedback: Madame, Monsieur, l'accumulation de produits chimiques indésirables et dangereux pour la population humaine et les animaux ne cesse d'augmenter. Il est suicidaire pour l'humanité de continuer dans cette voie. Pour notre avenir, je vous prie de cesser la production de ces substances nocives sans contrepartie et dès maintenant et d'interdire le plus possible leur prolifération. Merci.
englishfeedback: Dear Sir/Madam, the accumulation of undesirable and dangerous chemicals for the human population and animals is constantly increasing. It is suicidal for humanity to continue along this path. For our future, I would ask you to stop the production of these harmful substances without compensation and as soon as possible and to ban their proliferation as much as possible. Thank you.

feedback: No tiene justificación prohibir el uso de pesticidas en la UE y autorizar su exportación. El daño es el mismo en todas partes.
englishfeedback: There is no justification for prohibiting the use of pesticides in the EU and authorising their export. The damage is the same everywhere.

feedback: Europe and North America mass use of pesticides had already degraded environment significantly. That's why Pesticides or intermediates for production of pesticides should not be exported to African/ South American countries. Let's draw conclusions from the experience we have gained so far.
People living outside the European Union deserve the same risk avoidance as European citizens! They should not be put in danger by toxic pesticides. Dieter Gold Voiron, France

Gentili rappresentanti delle istituzioni europee, vorrei invitarvi a prendere seriamente in considerazione la necessità di un divieto di esportazione dei pesticidi ritenuti tossici in Europa verso paesi di continenti terzi. E' necessrio pensare all'umanità come un'unica comunità di questo pianeta per poterlo preservare e soprattuto per non alimentare la creazione di zone ghetto nel mondo. La maggior parte delle persone vuole giustizia sociale, vuole preservare il pianeta e la salute di tutte le persone che lo abitano. Spero facciate la scelta giusta, senza temere le minacce delle lobby che vogliono che questo orrendo mercato non chiuda. Grazie per l'attenzione, Dario De Nicola
englishfeedback: Dear representatives of the European institutions, I would like to invite you to seriously consider the need for a ban on the export of pesticides considered toxic in Europe to countries on third continents. It is necessary to think of humanity as a single community of this planet in order to preserve it and above all not to fuel the creation of ghetto areas in the world. Most people want social justice, want to preserve the planet and the health of all people living there. I hope you make the right choice, without fearing the threats of lobbies who want this horrific market not to close. Thank you for your attention, Dario De Nicola

feedback: Bonjour Les impacts environnementaux sont essentiellement globaux et mondiaux. Il est donc indispensable d interdire la fabrication et l exportation de produits dangereux déjà interdits en Europe. De plus, ces produits peuvent nous contaminer via les importations de produits agricoles et avoir des impacts sur notre santé. Je souhaite donc que toute activité de fabrication, de vente en Europe ou ailleurs de ces produits soit interdite. Cordialement
englishfeedback: Hello The environmental impacts are essentially global and global. It is therefore essential to ban the manufacture and export of dangerous products already banned in Europe. Moreover, these products can contaminate us through imports of agricultural products and have an impact on our health. I would therefore like to see any activity of manufacturing and selling these products in Europe or elsewhere prohibited. Best regards

feedback: Die Ausfuhr von giftigen Pestiziden ist eine Frage der Menschenrechte, denn die Pestizide schaden den Menschen: Jedes Jahr sterben Tausende von Landwirt*innen durch den Kontakt mit gefährlichen Pestiziden. Es gibt unzählige Studien, die die schädlichen Auswirkungen der exportierten Pestizide auf den Menschen belegen. Außerdem kommen Pestizide in Form von vergifteten Blumen wieder in die EU.
englishfeedback: The export of toxic pesticides is a human rights issue, as pesticides harm people: Every year thousands of farmers die from exposure to hazardous pesticides. There are countless studies demonstrating the harmful effects of exported pesticides on humans. In addition, pesticides in the form of poisoned flowers return to the EU.

feedback: Sehr geehrte Damen und Herren, wenn es mit der Welt global weiter in diesem Tempo bergab geht brauchen wir bald auch keine Arbeitsplätze mehr. Also, bei uns verbieten aber exportieren ist hirnrissig. Laßen Sie sich bitte nicht von den Lobbyisten einschüchtern. Mit besten Grüßen aus Bremen, Deutschland Andreas Bastian
englishfeedback: Ladies and gentlemen, if the world continues to do so at this pace, we will soon no longer need jobs. So, we are banning exports from us. Please do not intimidate yourself from the lobbyists. Best regards from Bremen, Germany Andreas Bastian

feedback: Il faudrait interdire tous les produits qui nuisent à notre planète, aux animaux et donc également à la santé des humains, où qu'ils soient. Il est plus que temps de se tourner exclusivement vers des solutions respectueuses. Comment peut-on encore actuellement ne fût-ce que se poser la question ? Donc, évidemment qu'il faut interdire l'exportation de produits qui sont trop nocifs pour l'UE !
englishfeedback: All products that harm our planet, animals and therefore also human health, wherever they may be, should be banned. It is more than time to turn exclusively to respectful solutions. How can we still even ask the question at present? So, of course, it is necessary to ban the export of products that are too harmful to the EU!

feedback: Buongiorno,la vita sul pianeta Terra è appesa purtroppo ad un filo ed ogni nostra azione ha una sua conseguenza.....cosi vi preghiamo di vietare l'esportazione di pesticidi che avvelenano qualsiasi forma di vita,compresa quella degli agricoltori! Le malattie di tante persone sono frutto di tutte le decisioni errate che portano solo ad arricchire alcuni " colossi" industriali senza tenere conto che l'unica cosa importante è la vita,la Natura e questo mondo cosi martoriato dall'inquinamento!! Non abbiate paura a lottare per ciò che è giusto! Vietate l'esportazione di questi potenti veleni! Grazie! In.fede Cuoghi Elisabetta.
englishfeedback: Very good, life on the planet Earth is unfortunately hanging on a thread and all our actions have a consequence..... we would ask you to ban the export of pesticides that poisoned any form of life, including that of farmers! The diseases of many people are the result of all the wrong decisions that lead only to enriching some industrial ‘giants’ without taking into account that life, nature and this world are marked by pollution as the only important thing is life, nature and this world! Don’t be afraid to fight for what is right! Ban the export of these powerful poison! Thank you! Authentic Elisabetta Hearts.

feedback: The export of toxic pesticides is bad for the bees, biodiversity and the planet. The evidence is clear: neonics and other poisonous pesticides kill bees. Thats why theyre banned in Europe. Why are we still allowing them to be exported to countries with weaker regulation, killing bees and decimating biodiversity? The export of toxic pesticides is taking advantage of countries with weaker regulation. Europe has a role to play in the world - its companies should not be allowed to take advantage of countries with weaker regulation. How can we be taken seriously if we ship our hazardous chemicals abroad, poisoning people and nature in the process in countries where safety regulations are weaker and less strictly enforced. I urge you to ban this export as soon as possible. Best Regards Morgan Johansson

L'exportation de pesticides toxiques est une question de droits humains , car ces pesticides sont nocifs pour notre santé : Chaque année, des milliers d'agriculteurs meurent des suites dune trop forte exposition à ces pesticides dangereux. Les pesticides exportés font l'objet d'innombrables études qui confirment leurs effets néfastes sur les humains. L'exportation de pesticides toxiques est néfaste pour les abeilles, la biodiversité et la planète en général. Les preuves sont claires : les néonics et autres pesticides dangereux tuent les abeilles. C'est pourquoi ils sont interdits en Europe. Pourquoi autorisons-nous encore leur exportation vers des pays où la réglementation est moins stricte, alors quils continueront de tuer les abeilles et décimer la biodiversité ? L'exportation de pesticides toxiques profite des pays où la réglementation est moins stricte. L'UE a un rôle à jouer dans le monde - ses entreprises ne devraient pas être autorisées à profiter des pays où la réglementation est plus faible. Comment pouvons-nous être pris au sérieux si nous expédions nos produits chimiques dangereux à l'étranger, empoisonnant ainsi les populations et la nature dans des pays où les règles de sécurité sont plus faibles et moins strictement appliquées ? Le maintien sur le marché de pesticides anciens et dangereux nous prive d'un avenir plus vert et de pratiques agricoles plus durables. Un avis juridique du Center for International Environmental Law publié en 2022 montre que les exportations européennes de pesticides interdits vers l'Afrique et l'Amérique centrale violent les obligations juridiques internationales de l'UE et le droit relatif aux droits humains.
englishfeedback: The export of toxic pesticides is a human rights issue, as these pesticides are harmful to our health: Every year, thousands of farmers die as a result of excessive exposure to these hazardous pesticides. Exported pesticides are subject to countless studies confirming their adverse effects on humans. The export of toxic pesticides is harmful to bees, biodiversity and the planet in general. The evidence is clear: neonics and other hazardous pesticides kill bees. This is why they are banned in Europe. Why do we still allow their export to countries with less stringent regulation, while they will continue to kill bees and decay biodiversity? The export of toxic pesticides benefits countries with less stringent regulation. The EU has a role to play in the world – its businesses should not be allowed to benefit from countries with weaker regulation. How can we be taken seriously if we send our hazardous chemicals abroad, poisoning people and nature in countries where safety rules are weaker and less strictly enforced? Keeping old and dangerous pesticides on the market deprives us of a greener future and more sustainable agricultural practices. A legal opinion of the Center for International Environmental Law published in 2022 shows that European exports of banned pesticides to Africa and Central America violate the EU’s international legal obligations and human rights law.

feedback: I pesticidi pericolosi sono vietati in Europa, ma continuano ad essere esportati in Africa e America del Sud. E' arrivato il momento di smettere di considerare il sud del mondo come la discarica del nord e dei paesi ricchi. Siamo in una realtà globale, danneggiare una parte della Terra equivale a danneggiare tutti. Occorre bloccare i pesticidi pericolosi in ogni dove. Grazie
englishfeedback: Hazardous pesticides are banned in Europe, but continue to be exported to Africa and South America. The time has come to stop considering the South of the world as the landfill in the north and rich countries. We are in a global reality, damaging a part of the Earth is tantamount to harming everyone. Hazardous pesticides should be stopped wherever they are. Thanks

feedback: Merci d'interdire l'exportation de pesticides vers les pays du Sud. Si ceux-ci sont dangereux pour l'UE, ils le sont aussi ailleurs ! Les pays du Sud servent depuis trop longtemps de poubelle aux pays du Nord (médicaments périmés, vêtements en surnombre ou d'occasion, déchets toxiques,...). C'est l'occasion pour la Commission de manifester que l'ère coloniale n'est plus ou ne doit plus être. De plus ces pesticides reviennent dans nos assiettes avec les importations plus ou moins bien contrôlées.
englishfeedback: Thank you for banning the export of pesticides to southern countries. If they are dangerous for the EU, they are also dangerous elsewhere! The countries of the South have been used for too long as a waste bin for the northern countries (out-of-date medicines, overcrowded or second-hand clothing, toxic waste, etc.). This is an opportunity for the Commission to demonstrate that the colonial era is no longer or should no longer be. Moreover, these pesticides return to our plates with imports that are more or less well controlled.

feedback: Here are some reasons why we need an export ban: - The export of toxic pesticides exposes a double standard: Dangerous pesticides are banned in Europe after they were linked to cancer, reproductive problems and neurodegenerative diseases as well as the dying of bees. Some of these pesticides are banned in Europe because of their links to brain damage in children and unborn babies. If these pesticides are too dangerous for us, how can we allow them to be exported? - The export of toxic pesticides is a human rights issue as these toxic pesticides are damaging to people: Every year, thousands of farmers die from exposure to dangerous pesticides. The pesticides exported have countless studies supporting the damaging effects on people. - The export of toxic pesticides is bad for the bees, biodiversity and the planet. The evidence is clear: neonics and other poisonous pesticides kill bees. Thats why theyre banned in Europe. Why are we still allowing them to be exported to countries with weaker regulation, killing bees and decimating biodiversity? - The export of toxic pesticides is taking advantage of countries with weaker regulation. Europe has a role to play in the world - its companies should not be allowed to take advantage of countries with weaker regulation. How can we be taken seriously if we ship our hazardous chemicals abroad, poisoning people and nature in the process in countries where safety regulations are weaker and less strictly enforced. - An export ban of toxic pesticides would be a boon for innovation and help Europe and the world move towards more sustainable plant protection methods. Keeping old and dangerous pesticides on the market is depriving us from a greener future and more sustainable farming practices. - A legal opinion by the Center for International Environmental Law published in 2022 shows that EU exports of banned pesticides to Africa and Central America violate the EUs international legal obligations and human rights law. Kind regards, René

Ein giftiger/schädlicher Stoff ist es in jedem Land! Das hängt nicht von der Nationalität ab! Und etwas zu verkaufen, was man selber verbietet, ist mehr als dreist! Sind denn andere Menschen, Pflanzen, Tiere weniger wert als hier bei uns?!? Zudem teilen wir uns einen Planeten, und alles ist miteinander verzahnt. Schäden, Hitze, Niederschläge, sie treffen uns alle! Bitte tun Sie alles für den Erhalt unserer schönen !!!
englishfeedback: It is a toxic/harmful substance in every country! This does not depend on nationality! And selling something that you ban yourself is more than three! Are other people, plants, animals worth less than here?! We also share a planet and everything is intertwined. Damage, heat, precipitation, they hit us all! Please do everything to preserve our beautiful!

feedback: Tout d'abord je dois affirmer l'absurdité de la question qui est équivalente à demander si nous pouvons empoisonner des citoyens non européens, simplement parce qu'ils sont non européens! Cette absurdité dénote très bien la barbarie ordinaire qui domine la culture européenne depuis très longtemps. Notre défense des droits est toujours à géométrie variable et va toujours dans le sens de nos intérêt et de notre profond mépris pour les autres. Il est donc évident que des produits interdits en Europe soit interdit à l'exportation, ça devrait être automatique. Bien à vous.
englishfeedback: First of all, I must say the absurdity of the question, which is equivalent to asking whether we can poison non-European citizens, simply because they are not European! This absurdity very well denotes the ordinary barbarism which has dominated European culture for a very long time. Our defence of rights is always variable geometry and always supports our interest and deep disregard for others. It is therefore clear that products banned in Europe are banned from export, it should be automatic. Best regards,

feedback: Bonjour, Étant donné l'état actuel de la biodiversité, notamment l'effondrement des populations d'insectes (dont nous avons besoin pour notre propre survie. Cf. les phénomènes de pollinisation), je vous demande expressément de procéder à la cessation d'exportation de produits pesticides. En vous remerciant.
englishfeedback: Hello, Given the current state of biodiversity, including the collapse of insect populations (which we need for our own survival. See pollination), I expressly ask you to stop exporting pesticide products. Thank you very much.

feedback: If we're not okay using chemicals in Europe, why should we be okay with other people using them. Hazardous chemicals should be prohibited from being exported.

La perte d'emplois avancée par les lobbies qui essayent d'éviter l'interdiction d'exportation en dehors de l'Europe de produits interdits en Europe pour des raisons sanitaires en argumentant par rapport à la perte d'emplois est un argument tout à fait fallacieux. Les cigarettiers l'ont déjà également employé "in illo tempore". La santé d'un non européen ne vaut pas moins que celle d'un européen.
englishfeedback: The loss of jobs put forward by lobbyists who try to avoid a ban on exports outside Europe of products banned in Europe for health reasons by arguing in relation to job losses is a completely misleading argument. The shippers have also already used it ‘in illo tempore’. The health of a non-European is no less than that of a European.

feedback: Invito le persone che mi rappresentano presso la Commissione Europea a fare la cosa Giusta, chiedendosi se vogliono essere coloro che hanno fatto un altro piccolo passo verso la creazione di un mondo migliore, o verso la fine di quello che conosciamo. Fare il Giusto non è semplice, è complesso, e in un mondo ormai stracolmo di sostanze inquinanti di ogni genere, non si sa quale possa essere la goccia che farà traboccare il vaso. Vi prego di non aggiungere un altra goccia. Grazie.
englishfeedback: I invite the people who represent me at the European Commission to do this, wondering whether they want to be those who have taken another small step towards creating a better world, or towards the end of what we know. To do the Justification is not easy, it is complex, and in a world that is now straining of pollutants of all kinds, it is not known what the drop that will overwhelm the pot. Please do not add another drop. Thanks.

feedback: Interdire à tout usage les produits jugés dangereux à la santé.
englishfeedback: Prohibit any use of products deemed to be dangerous to health.

feedback: Lexportation de ces pesticides est une atteinte aux droits humains, car ces pesticides sont nocifs pour notre santé. Chaque année des milliers dagriculteurs meurent des suites dune trop forte exposition à ces pesticides dangereux. Les pesticides exportés font lobjet dinnombrables études qui confirment leurs effets néfastes.
englishfeedback: The export of these pesticides is an infringement of human rights, as these pesticides are harmful to our health. Every year thousands of farmers die as a result of excessive exposure to these hazardous pesticides. Exported pesticides are subject to numerous studies that confirm their adverse effects.

feedback: Comment comprendre et tolérer que des produits jugés toxiques pour les Européens puissent ne pas l'être pour le reste du monde ? Nous devons interdire l'exportation de ces produits vers les pays non européens. C'est une question de cohérence, d'éthique, et une démarche responsable vis à vis du reste du monde. S'il fallait un autre argument, un avis juridique du Center for International Environmental Law publié en 2022 montre que les exportations européennes de pesticides interdits vers l'Afrique et l'Amérique centrale violent les obligations juridiques internationales de l'UE et le droit relatif aux droits humains.
englishfeedback: How can we understand and tolerate that products considered toxic to Europeans may not be toxic to the rest of the world? We must ban the export of these products to non-European countries. This is a question of consistency, ethics and a responsible approach towards the rest of the world. If another argument were needed, a legal opinion of the Center for International Environmental Law published in 2022 shows that European exports of banned pesticides to Africa and Central America violate the EU’s international legal obligations and human rights law.

feedback: Voici quelques raisons pour lesquelles nous avons besoin dinterdire les pesticides dangereux : L'exportation de pesticides toxiques révèle une politique de deux poids deux mesures : Les pesticides dangereux sont interdits en Europe après avoir été associés à des cancers, des problèmes de reproduction et des maladies neurodégénératives, ainsi qu'à la mort des abeilles. Certains de ces pesticides sont même interdits en Europe en raison de leur lien avec des lésions cérébrales chez les enfants et les bébés à naître. Si ces pesticides sont trop dangereux pour nous, comment pouvons-nous autoriser leur exportation ? L'exportation de pesticides toxiques est une question de droits humains , car ces pesticides sont nocifs pour notre santé : Chaque année, des milliers d'agriculteurs meurent des suites dune trop forte exposition à ces pesticides dangereux. Les pesticides exportés font l'objet d'innombrables études qui confirment leurs effets néfastes sur les humains. L'exportation de pesticides toxiques est néfaste pour les abeilles, la biodiversité et la planète en général. Les preuves sont claires : les néonics et autres pesticides dangereux tuent les abeilles. C'est pourquoi ils sont interdits en Europe. Pourquoi autorisons-nous encore leur exportation vers des pays où la réglementation est moins stricte, alors quils continueront de tuer les abeilles et décimer la biodiversité ? L'exportation de pesticides toxiques profite des pays où la réglementation est moins stricte. L'UE a un rôle à jouer dans le monde - ses entreprises ne devraient pas être autorisées à profiter des pays où la réglementation est plus faible. Comment pouvons-nous être pris au sérieux si nous expédions nos produits chimiques dangereux à l'étranger, empoisonnant ainsi les populations et la nature dans des pays où les règles de sécurité sont plus faibles et moins strictement appliquées ? L'interdiction d'exporter des pesticides toxiques serait une opportunité unique pour l'innovation et aiderait l'Europe et le monde à évoluer vers des méthodes de protection des plantes plus durables. Le maintien sur le marché de pesticides anciens et dangereux nous prive d'un avenir plus vert et de pratiques agricoles plus durables. Un avis juridique du Center for International Environmental Law publié en 2022 montre que les exportations européennes de pesticides interdits vers l'Afrique et l'Amérique centrale violent les obligations juridiques internationales de l'UE et le droit relatif aux droits humains.
englishfeedback: Here are some reasons why we need to ban hazardous pesticides: The export of toxic pesticides reveals a double standard policy: Hazardous pesticides are banned in Europe after being associated with cancer, reproductive problems and neurodegenerative diseases, as well as bee death. Some of these pesticides are even banned in Europe because of their link to brain damage in children and born babies. If these pesticides are too dangerous for us, how can we authorise their export? The export of toxic pesticides is a human rights issue, as these pesticides are harmful to our health: Every year, thousands of farmers die as a result of excessive exposure to these hazardous pesticides. Exported pesticides are subject to countless studies confirming their adverse effects on humans. The export of toxic pesticides is harmful to bees, biodiversity and the planet in general. The evidence is clear: neonics and other hazardous pesticides kill bees. This is why they are banned in Europe. Why do we still allow their export to countries with less stringent regulation, while they will continue to kill bees and decay biodiversity? The export of toxic pesticides benefits countries with less stringent regulation. The EU has a role to play in the world – its businesses should not be allowed to benefit from countries with weaker regulation. How can we be taken seriously if we send our hazardous chemicals abroad, poisoning people and nature in countries where safety rules are weaker and less strictly enforced? Banning the export of toxic pesticides would be a unique opportunity for innovation and would help Europe and the world to move towards more sustainable plant protection methods. Keeping old and dangerous pesticides on the market deprives us of a greener future and more sustainable agricultural practices. A legal opinion of the Center for International Environmental Law published in 2022 shows that European exports of banned pesticides to Africa and Central America violate the EU’s international legal obligations and human rights law.

feedback: You are allowing creation and shipment of chemicals that have been proven to be dangerous, they must be banned NOW!!!

Bonjour Je ne comprends pas quaprès tous les avis des scientifiques et du monde médical prouvant la nocificité des produits utilisés que la question soit encore posée! Quand nos dirigeants arriveront ils enfin à saffranchir des pressions de sociétés qui nont rien à faire dune éthique basique qui consisterait à prendre en compte le bien être des populations? Il serait temps davoir le courage de ne pas accepter la puissance de largent comme mode unique de fonctionnement. Merci de prendre en compte lindignation des gens, qui comme moi, mettent lêtre humain, quelque soit son lieu de vie, en priorité
englishfeedback: Hello I do not understand that, after all the scientific and medical opinions proving the harmful nature of the products used, the question is still asked! When will our leaders finally overcome pressure from societies that have nothing to do with a basic ethos of taking people’s well-being into account? It would be time to have the courage not to accept widening power as a single mode of operation. Thank you for taking into account the indignation of people, who like me put human beings, wherever they live, first and foremost

feedback: Toute une série de pesticides dangereux sont interdits en Europe, après avoir été associés à des cancers, des problèmes de reproduction et des maladies neurodégénératives. Certains sont même susceptibles de provoquer des lésions cérébrales chez les enfants et les bébés à naître. S'ils sont trop dangereux pour nous, Européens, comment pouvons-nous tolérer que d'autres populations en subissent les effets toxiques ?? De plus, ces substances sont néfastes pour les abeilles, la biodiversité et la planète en général, d'où leur interdiction en Europe. Pourquoi alors profiter de pays où la réglementation est moins stricte pour les y exporter, alors quils continueront de tuer les abeilles et décimer la biodiversité ? Comment pouvons-nous être pris au sérieux si nous expédions nos produits chimiques dangereux à l'étranger, empoisonnant ainsi les populations et la nature dans des pays où les règles de sécurité sont plus faibles et moins strictement appliquées ? Cette attitude est d'un cynisme éhonté. Continuer à exporter ces produits montre bien que le profit à court terme de quelques uns prime sur l'intérêt général et sur la survie de notre Terre.
englishfeedback: A whole range of hazardous pesticides are banned in Europe, after being associated with cancers, reproductive problems and neurodegenerative diseases. Some are even likely to cause brain damage to children and unborn babies. If they are too dangerous for us Europeans, how can we tolerate other populations suffering toxic effects? Moreover, these substances are harmful to bees, biodiversity and the planet in general, hence their ban in Europe. Why then take advantage of countries where regulation is less stringent to export them, while they will continue to kill bees and decay biodiversity? How can we be taken seriously if we send our hazardous chemicals abroad, poisoning people and nature in countries where safety rules are weaker and less strictly enforced? This attitude is a shameful cynism. Continuing to export these products clearly shows that the short-term benefit of a few of them outweighs the public interest and the survival of our Earth.

feedback: Des géants de lagriculture tels que BASF et Bayer-Monsanto réalisent des profits indécents en exportant des pesticides toxiques en Afrique et en Amérique du Sud. Ils mettent ainsi en danger la vie dagriculteurs·ice·s et de leurs familles et empoisonnent la planète. Ces mêmes pesticides sont interdits en Europe en raison de leur dangerosité. Pour toutes ces raisons ,il est essentiel de faire barrage à ce projet fou et inhumain. Michel.
englishfeedback: Agricultural giants such as BASF and Bayer-Monsanto make indecent profits by exporting toxic pesticides to Africa and South America. This puts the lives of farmers and their families at risk and poisoning the planet. The same pesticides are banned in Europe because of their dangerous nature. For all these reasons, it is essential to block this fun and inhuman project. Michel.

feedback: Please Bann all Exports of in the EU forbidden Pestizides to other countries We have to Start thinking global only if we do so our beautiful Planet Earth has a future.
Les pesticides ne sont pas bons pour les européens donc ils sont à proscrire pour tous les continents l'humanité est la même
englishfeedback: Les pesticides ne sont pas bons pour les européens donc ils sont à proscrire pour tous les continents l’humanité est la même

feedback: Es necesario no exportar los pesticidas tóxicos fuera de Europa dada la prohibición y todos los peligros que conlleva. Cuidemos el planeta y todos sus habitantes.
englishfeedback: It is necessary not to export toxic pesticides outside Europe, given the ban and all the dangers it entails. We take care of the planet and all its inhabitants.

feedback: Dear Sirs, Madames, The export of toxic pesticides exposes a double standard: Dangerous pesticides are banned in Europe after they were linked to cancer, reproductive problems and neurodegenerative diseases as well as the dying of bees. Some of these pesticides are banned in Europe because of their links to brain damage in children and unborn babies. If these pesticides are too dangerous for us, how can we allow them to be exported? That is why I ask you to support an EXPORT BAN on toxic pesticides. Best regards Artur Kowalczyk

De export van giftige pesticiden is slecht voor bijen, biodiversiteit en de planeet. Het bewijs laat er geen twijfel over bestaan: neonicotinoïden en andere giftige pesticiden zijn dodelijk voor bijen. Daarom zijn ze verboden in Europa. Waarom staan we dan alsnog toe dat ze naar landen met zwakkere regelgeving worden geëxporteerd, om aldaar de bijen te doden en de biodiversiteit te decimeren?
englishfeedback: The export of toxic pesticides is bad for bees, biodiversity and the planet. The evidence leaves no doubt: neonicotinoids and other toxic pesticides are fatal to bees. This is why they are banned in Europe. Why do we still allow them to be exported to countries with weaker regulations in order to kill bees and decompose biodiversity?

feedback: ¿Cómo es posible que sustancias que han sido prohibidas por su peligrosidad se sigan fabricando para exportarlas a otros lugares? ¿Cómo pueden ser legales tales prácticas? ¿Qué nombre podemos dar a estos negocios? ¿Y a la comunidad que los consiente? ¿Y a los/las, ciudadanos/as de esa comunidad?
englishfeedback: How is it possible that substances that have been banned because of their hazardous nature continue to be manufactured for export elsewhere? How can such practices be legal? What name can we give these businesses? And to the community that consents to them? And to the citizens of that community?

feedback: The EU should be a leader in all things environmental and climate related and show proper respect towards the health and wellbeing of others. We must not prosper on the backs of the suffering of others.

No tiene lógica ni sentido, que, lo que hemos prohibido utilizar en nuestros países europeos, se pueda exportar a terceros países para su utilización. La mismas causas que se aplicaron para su prohibición en la UE, deben regir su prohibición de exportación. Yo no querría para mi país, algo que esté prohibido en otro por los riesgos que acarrea y sus consecuencias
englishfeedback: It makes no sense, nor does it make sense, that what we have forbidden to use in our European countries can be exported to third countries for use. The same reasons as those applied for their ban in the EU should apply to their export ban. I would not want for my country, something that is forbidden in another country because of the risks involved and its consequences.

feedback: Sehr geehrte Damen und Herren, unterstützen Sie das Ausfuhrverbot für gefährliche Chemikalien! Es kann doch nicht sein, dass diese lebensvernichtenden Chemikalien weiterhin um des Profit Willens in die ärmeren Länder ausgeführt werden darf! Damit muss Schluss sein!!!!!!! Freundliche Grüße Gesa Gatzki
englishfeedback: Ladies and Gentlemen, support the ban on exports of hazardous chemicals, It cannot be the case that these life-degrading chemicals can continue to be exported to poorer countries for profit! This must come to an end! Best regards, Gesa Gatzki

feedback: Dangerous pesticides are banned in Europe after they were linked to cancer, reproductive problems and neurodegenerative diseases as well as the dying of bees. Some of these pesticides are banned in Europe because of their links to brain damage in children and unborn babies. If these pesticides are too dangerous for us, how can we allow them to be exported? The export of toxic pesticides is bad for the bees, biodiversity and the planet as well as taking advantage of countries with weaker regulation. The agricultural giants are only interested in their profits and not the well being of the people or the planet.

Dinnanzi a sostanze di provata pericolosità, trovo doveroso che l'UE si impegni in politiche coerenti e che proteggano innanzitutto la vita e la salute umana. A nulla ci serve una UE che primeggi in campo industriale e commerciale senza primeggiare sul campo delle tutele e dei diritti.
englishfeedback: In the face of proven dangerous substances, I find it necessary for the EU to engage in coherent policies that primarily protect human life and health. There is no need for an EU that prioritises industrial and commercial matters without prioritising protections and rights on the ground.

feedback: Si les produits chimiques ont été interdits en Europe c'est qu'ils étaient toxiques pour l'environnement et pour la santé humaine. Alors pourquoi polluer à l'extérieur de l'UE en revendant ces poisons aux pays en voie de développement ? Merci d'interdire ces produits à l'exportation.
englishfeedback: Chemicals were banned in Europe because they were toxic to the environment and human health. So why pollute outside the EU by selling these poison to developing countries? Thank you for banning these products for export.

feedback: Me parece muy peligroso que la industria siga ENVENENANDO LA TIERRA Y LAS PERSONAS
englishfeedback: It seems to me very dangerous that industry continues to poisonise TIERRA AND PERSONS

feedback: We would like to welcome the Commissions proposal to stop exports of banned chemicals. This is one of the most important commitments of the Chemicals Strategy for Sustainability. In March 2021, the Council of the European Union expressly welcomed this initiative. Also, 70 Members of the European Parliament have written to the President of the Commission, welcoming its promise to end this immoral practice. We would like to congratulate members states such as France and Belgium who have already banned these exports and Germany who is discussing a ban. By stopping the export of banned chemicals, including chemical pesticides, the EU will comply with its international obligations under the Basel Convention, as well as its international human rights obligations. The practice of wealthy States exporting their banned toxic chemicals to poorer nations lacking the capacity to control the risks is deplorable and must end, according to a statement endorsed by United Nations Human Rights Council experts . The experts warned that the health and environmental impacts are externalized on the most vulnerable, especially communities of African descent and other people of colour. Stopping these exports will undoubtedly reduce the toxic and unethical profits of companies who continue producing these toxic chemicals and production may also be shifted outside the EU. However, it will not be the first shameful profitable activity that Europe decides to end without major impacts. In fact, the ban will boost green innovation and enhance EU industry competitiveness globally. The EU must play a global leadership role on this issue, the ban will also inspire non-EU countries to follow and promote a global transition towards a toxic free environment. For example, the ban will also support the efforts of authorities and stakeholders in importing countries to protect their people and environment, such as the proposal by the African region for a Global Alliance on Highly Hazardous Pesticides (HHP) to be convened under the new SAICM/Beyond 2020 instrument. This proposal aims to mobilise and coordinate the efforts to achieve a global phase-out of HHPs and the adoption of more sustainable alternatives, including a draft resolution for adoption at the next International Conference on Chemical Management (ICCM5). Therefore, we encourage the European Commision to ensure an effective export ban by amending the EU PIC and REACH Regulations, including all banned chemicals and all countries. Find attached a joint statement signed by over 300 organisations: NGOs AND TRADE UNIONS DEMAND THE END OF EUS EXPORT OF BANNED PESTICIDES AND OTHER HAZARDOUS CHEMICALS https://www.pan-europe.info/sites/pan-europe.info/files/public/resources/Letters/Joint-Statement-december-2022.pdf

La exportación de pesticidas tóxicos perjudica a las abejas, la biodiversidad y el planeta. Los datos no mienten: los neonicotinoides y otros pesticidas tóxicos matan a las abejas. Por eso están prohibidos en Europa. ¿Cómo podemos permitir que se exporten a otros países?
englishfeedback: The export of toxic pesticides harms bees, biodiversity and the planet. The data do not feel: neonicotinoids and other toxic pesticides kill bees. This is why they are banned in Europe. How can we allow them to be exported to other countries?

feedback: La exportación de pesticidas tóxicos perjudica a las abejas, la biodiversidad y el planeta. Los datos no mienten: los neonicotinoides y otros pesticidas tóxicos matan a las abejas. Por eso están prohibidos en Europa. ¿Cómo podemos permitir que se exporten a otros países?
englishfeedback: The export of toxic pesticides harms bees, biodiversity and the planet. The data do not feel: neonicotinoids and other toxic pesticides kill bees. This is why they are banned in Europe. How can we allow them to be exported to other countries?

feedback: Diese Pestizide sind in Europa verboten, aber der Export ist erlaubt: Das ist eine Doppelmoral. Die gefährlichen Pestizide wurden in Europa verboten, nachdem sie mit Krebs, Beeinträchtigung der Fruchtbarkeit und neurodegenerativen Krankheiten in Verbindung gebracht wurden - zum Bienensterben tragen sie außerdem bei. Einige dieser Pestizide sind in Europa verboten, weil sie mit Hirnschäden bei Kindern und ungeborenen Babys in Verbindung gebracht werden. Wenn diese Pestizide für uns zu gefährlich sind: Wie können wir dann zulassen, dass sie exportiert werden? Jedes Jahr sterben Tausende von Landwirt*innen durch den Kontakt mit gefährlichen Pestiziden. Es gibt unzählige Studien, die die schädlichen Auswirkungen der exportierten Pestizide auf den Menschen belegen. Die Ausfuhr giftiger Pestizide ist desaströs für Bienen, die biologische Vielfalt und den Planeten. Die Beweislage ist eindeutig: Neonics und andere giftige Pestizide töten Bienen. Deshalb sind sie in Europa verboten. Wir sollten nicht zulassen, dass diese Pestizide in Länder exportiert werden, in denen Gesundheitsvorschriften weniger streng sind und dort Bienen und die biologische Vielfalt zerstören. Länder, in denen es kaum Vorschriften für giftige Pestizide gibt, werden als Markt benutz: Ein Exportverbot für giftige Pestizide würde Europa und der Welt helfen, zu nachhaltigeren Pflanzenschutzmethoden überzugehen. Wenn gefährliche Pestizide auf dem Markt bleiben, werden wir weiter auf eine grünere Zukunft und nachhaltige Landwirtschaft warten müssen. Ein Rechtsgutachten des Center for International Environmental Law, das 2022 veröffentlicht wurde, zeigt, dass die EU mit dem Export verbotener Pestizide nach Afrika und Mittelamerika gegen internationale rechtliche Verpflichtungen und die Menschenrechte verstößt.
