englishfeedback: These pesticides are banned in Europe, but exports are allowed: This is a double standard. Hazardous pesticides have been banned in Europe after being associated with cancer, fertility impairment and neurodegenerative diseases and contribute to bee mortality. Some of these pesticides are banned in Europe because they are associated with brain damage in children and unborn babies. If these pesticides are too dangerous for us: How can we then allow them to be exported? Every year thousands of farmers die from exposure to hazardous pesticides. There are countless studies demonstrating the harmful effects of exported pesticides on humans. Exports of toxic pesticides are desastrous for bees, biodiversity and the planet. The evidence is clear: Neonics and other toxic pesticides kill bees. This is why they are banned in Europe. We should not allow these pesticides to be exported to countries where health rules are less stringent and where bees and biodiversity are destroyed. Countries with little regulation on toxic pesticides are used as a market: A ban on exports of toxic pesticides would help Europe and the world move towards more sustainable plant protection practices. If hazardous pesticides remain on the market, we will have to wait for a greener future and sustainable agriculture. A legal opinion from the Center for International Environmental Law, published in 2022, shows that the EU is in breach of international legal obligations and human rights by exporting banned pesticides to Africa and Central America.

feedback: Het is een misdaad om stoffen die hier verboden zijn te exporteren naar andere landen waar de controle op dit soort stoffen minimaal of geheel afwezig is.
englishfeedback: It is a crime to export substances banned here to other countries where control of such substances is minimal or absent.

feedback: Het is een uitstekend initiatief. Giftige stoffen moeten niet geexporteerd worden naar derde landen.
englishfeedback: It is an excellent initiative. Toxic substances should not be exported to third countries.

feedback: L'exportation de pesticides toxiques est une question de droits humains , car ces pesticides sont nocifs pour notre santé : Chaque année, des milliers d'agriculteurs meurent des suites dune trop forte exposition à ces pesticides dangereux. Les pesticides exportés font l'objet d'innombrables études qui confirment leurs effets néfastes sur les humains. Les preuves sont claires : les néonics et autres pesticides dangereux tuent les abeilles. C'est pourquoi ils sont interdits en Europe. Pourquoi autorisons-nous encore leur exportation vers des pays où la réglementation est moins stricte, alors quils continueront de tuer les abeilles et décimer la biodiversité ? L'UE a un rôle à jouer dans le monde - ses entreprises ne devraient pas être autorisées à profiter des pays où la réglementation est plus faible. Comment pouvons-nous être pris au sérieux si nous expédions nos produits chimiques dangereux à l'étranger, empoisonnant ainsi les populations et la nature dans des pays où les règles de sécurité sont plus faibles et moins strictement appliquées ? L'interdiction d'exporter des pesticides toxiques serait une opportunité unique pour l'innovation et aiderait l'Europe et le monde à évoluer vers des méthodes de protection des plantes plus durables. Le maintien sur le marché de pesticides anciens et dangereux nous prive d'un avenir plus vert et de pratiques agricoles plus durables. Un avis juridique du Center for International Environmental Law publié en 2022 montre que les exportations européennes de pesticides interdits vers l'Afrique et l'Amérique centrale violent les obligations juridiques internationales de l'UE et le droit relatif aux droits humains.
englishfeedback: The export of toxic pesticides is a human rights issue, as these pesticides are harmful to our health: Every year, thousands of farmers die as a result of excessive exposure to these hazardous pesticides. Exported pesticides are subject to countless studies confirming their adverse effects on humans. The evidence is clear: neonics and other hazardous pesticides kill bees. This is why they are banned in Europe. Why do we still allow their export to countries with less stringent regulation, while they will continue to kill bees and decay biodiversity? The EU has a role to play in the world – its businesses should not be allowed to benefit from countries with weaker regulation. How can we be taken seriously if we send our hazardous chemicals abroad, poisoning people and nature in countries where safety rules are weaker and less strictly enforced? Banning the export of toxic pesticides would be a unique opportunity for innovation and would help Europe and the world to move towards more sustainable plant protection methods. Keeping old and dangerous pesticides on the market deprives us of a greener future and more sustainable agricultural practices. A legal opinion of the Center for International Environmental Law published in 2022 shows that European exports of banned pesticides to Africa and Central America violate the EU’s international legal obligations and human rights law.

feedback: NON à l exportation des produits dangereux déjà interdits en Europe! Il est scandaleux de penser que les MONSANTO, BAYER & co ne pouvant plus empoisonner les citoyens de l'UE (et encore ...) cherchent à empoisonner des populations dans des pays où la règlementation est moins protectrice. STOP, STOP, STOP aux engrais chimiques destructeurs de la biodiversité. D'autres modèles d'agriculture existent ! L'avenir n'est pas à l'argent que veulent gagner ces firmes, il est à la défense d'une planète qui en gagnera moins mais mieux et répartie plus justement. Merci BC
englishfeedback: No to export dangerous products already banned in Europe! It is scandalous to think that MONSANTO, BAYER, who can no longer poison EU citizens (and even more...) are seeking to poison populations in countries where regulation is less protective. Stop, STOP, STOP to chemical fertilisers destroying biodiversity. Other farming models exist! The future is not about the money that these firms want to earn, it is in the defence of a planet that will earn less but better and more accurately. Thank you BC

feedback: Comment est-ce possible d'interdire des pesticides en Europe et les laisser envoyer dans les autres parties du monde ? Vous savez très bien pourquoi vous le faites. C'est inhumain ce que vous faites ! Mais vous rendrez des gens malades et cela ne vous touches même pas, aucune conscience pour certain(e)s Député(e)s. Comme toujours vous privilégiez les lobbies et multinationales qui polluent le monde entier avec leurs "cochonneries" et pas qu'avec les pesticides. Où est le bon sens s'il y en a ? Et dire que vous représentez le peuple européen. Du vent oui pour être élu on caresse l'électeur dans le sens du poil mais après...Déjà que n'importe quel pesticide que vous avez autorisé est nocif à long terme pour les consommateurs et vous bloquez les lois pour les interdire pour protéger les agriculteurs polluants. Et après qui paie la facture des nappes phréatiques polluées, des terres, des cours d'eau, de la faune et de la flore qui disparaît ? Faites le ratio si vous savez le faire. Les citoyens comme d'habitude paieront les dégâts. Quelle confiance donner à nos Député(e)s européens sauf ceux écologiques qui sont conscients de la destruction de notre planète pour les intérêts de certains et ce malgré vos discours ? On s'en souviendra lors des prochaines élections européennes en juin 2024. Déjà que vous n'avez pas respecté le vote du peuple en 2005 concernant le référendum et après faut pas s'étonner qu'il y ait de moins en moins d'électeurs ! Il y a une réelle fracture entre vous et nous. Et pour finir : "Les pesticides, les fongicides, les herbicides, les insecticides, les ..........., sont des génocides de l'homme et de la nature ! A quand des "Tyrannicides" ?
englishfeedback: How can pesticides be banned in Europe and sent to other parts of the world? You know very well why you do so. This is inhumane what you do! But you will make people sick and this doesn’t even touch you, no consciousness for some Members. As you always prefer lobbyists and multinationals who pollute the world with their ‘cochonneries’ and not only with pesticides. Where is common sense if there is one? And say that you represent the European people. Yes to be elected to be elected, but after... Any pesticide you have authorised is harmful to consumers in the long term and you block laws to ban them to protect polluting farmers. And who pays the bill for polluted groundwater, land, rivers, fauna and flora that disappear? Do the ratio if you know to do so. Citizens as usual will pay for the damage. How do we trust our Members of the European Parliament, except those green ones who are aware of the destruction of our planet for the interests of some, despite your speeches? This will be remembered at the next European elections in June 2024. Already that you did not respect the vote of the people in 2005 on the referendum and after being surprised that there are fewer and fewer voters! There is a real divide between you and us. Finally, “Pesticides, fungicides, herbicides, insecticides,........... are genocides of humans and nature! When are Tyrannicides?

feedback: Se i pesticidi fanno male in Europa lo faranno sicuramente anche in altri paesi del mondo. Abbiamo imparato che qualsiasi tipo di inquinamento e sfruttamento intensivo della natura reca danni a tutto il pianeta indipendentemente da dove viene attuato, quindi, anche a voler essere egoisti, e non è il mio caso, si deve vietare la produzione e l'esportazione di pesticidi anche in pesi extra EU perché prima o poi ci si ritorcerà contro. Una volta tanto fate gli interessi del pianeta e delle persone invece di quelli delle multinazionali. Tobia Grassi Un elettore
englishfeedback: If pesticides do bad in Europe, they will certainly do so in other countries around the world. We have learned that any kind of pollution and intensive exploitation of nature causes damage to the entire planet regardless of where it is implemented, so even if we want to be selfish, and that is not my case, we must ban the production and export of pesticides even in extra EU weights, because before or later we will come back against. Once the interests of the planet and people are so high, rather than those of multinationals. Tobia Grassi One voter

feedback: Je suis d' avis d'interdire l'exportation des pesticides. Les lobbies liés à BASF et Bayer - Monsanto vont bien sûr agiter la menace de perte d'emploi, mais c'est surtout la perte de profit qui les préoccupe. Enfin, nous sommes déjà tous plus ou moins contaminés par tous ces pesticides, y compris ceux qui en tirent un profit immédiat .
englishfeedback: I am of the opinion that the export of pesticides should be banned. The lobbies linked to BASF and Bayer – Monsanto will of course stifle the threat of loss of jobs, but their main concern is the loss of profit. Finally, we are all already more or less contaminated with all these pesticides, including those that benefit immediately from them.

feedback: Il faut arrêter l'exportation de pesticides. L'exportation de pesticides toxiques est une question de droits humains, car ces pesticides sont nocifs pour notre santé. L'exportation de pesticides toxiques révèle une politique de deux poids deux mesures : Si ces pesticides sont trop dangereux pour nous et interdits en Europe, comment pouvons-nous autoriser leur exportation ? Les pesticides sont toxiques et néfaste pour la biodiversité et la planète en général. Or les actions de protections doivent être prises de manière globales pour être plus efficaces. Pourquoi autorisons-nous encore leur exportation vers des pays où la réglementation est moins stricte, alors que ces produits continueront de décimer la biodiversité ? L'interdiction d'exporter des pesticides toxiques est une opportunité unique pour l'innovation et aiderait l'Europe et le monde à évoluer vers des méthodes de protection des plantes plus durables. L'interdiction d'exporter des pesticides toxiques est une question de crédibilité pour l'UE : L'UE a un rôle à jouer dans le monde - ses entreprises ne devraient pas être autorisées à profiter des pays où la réglementation est plus faible. Comment pouvons-nous être pris au sérieux si nous expédions nos produits chimiques dangereux à l'étranger, empoisonnant ainsi les populations et la nature dans des pays où les règles de sécurité sont plus faibles et moins strictement appliquées ?
englishfeedback: Export of pesticides must be stopped. The export of toxic pesticides is a human rights issue, as these pesticides are harmful to our health. The export of toxic pesticides reveals a double standard policy: If these pesticides are too dangerous for us and banned in Europe, how can we authorise their export? Pesticides are toxic and harmful to biodiversity and the planet in general. Protective measures must be taken in a comprehensive manner in order to be more effective. Why do we still allow their export to countries with less stringent regulation, while these products will continue to decay biodiversity? Banning the export of toxic pesticides is a unique opportunity for innovation and would help Europe and the world to move towards more sustainable plant protection methods. The ban on the export of toxic pesticides is a matter of credibility for the EU: The EU has a role to play in the world – its businesses should not be allowed to benefit from countries with weaker regulation. How can we be taken seriously if we send our hazardous chemicals abroad, poisoning people and nature in countries where safety rules are weaker and less strictly enforced?

feedback: je suis contre tous les pesticides, pour de multiple raison , en particulier en éliminant les insectes c'est toute la chaine du vivant que l'on condamne et nous par conséquence, les quantités astronomique déversé chaque année dans les sols , est juste un crime contre la nature ,il y a j'en convaincu des solutions bien plis naturelle de lutte efficacement contre les insectes et même d'en faire des alliés dans certaine production, si l'on dépensai beaucoup moins pour la recherche de solutions chimique et plus our la recherche de solution biologique je suis persuadé que l'on réglerai de façon perenne bien des problèmes.
englishfeedback: I am against all pesticides, for a variety of reasons, in particular by eliminating insects, it is the whole chain of life that we condemn and consequently we are condemning the astronomical quantities discharged into the soil each year, is just a crime against nature, I am convinced of well-folded solutions to combat insects effectively and even to make them allies in certain production, if we spend much less on chemical solutions and more on biological solutions, I am convinced that many problems will be dealt with in a loose way.

feedback: no exporten sustancias toxicas a otros paises, no es bueno en general para esos paises que son en general pobres, quiero prohibir la exportacion de sustancias quimicas prohibidas en la Union Europea
englishfeedback: do not export toxicant substances to other countries; it is generally not good for these countries, which are generally poor. I want to ban the export of chemical substances banned in the European Union.

feedback: Ik vind het onaanvaardbaar dat gevaarlijke stoffen in de derde wereld worden verzonden om de bevolking daar mee op te zadelen, groot gevaar voor de bevolking, hun gezondheid en het milieu.
englishfeedback: I find it unacceptable that dangerous substances are sent in the third world to inform the population, a major danger to the population, their health and the environment.

feedback: Il est temps d'agir et d'interdire les substances qui empoisonnent notre environnement et menacent notre santé. Le principe de précaution doit s'appliquer en cas de doute et non le contraire.
englishfeedback: It is time to act and ban substances that poise our environment and threaten our health. The precautionary principle should apply in case of doubt and not the contrary.

feedback: Mon point de vue est simple. L'exportation pour leur utilisation ailleurs dans le monde de produits chimiques interdits en Europe parce qu'ils sont dangereux et mettent en péril l'avenir de notre biosphère n'est pas une activité économique, c'est une activité criminelle.
englishfeedback: My point of view is simple. Exporting chemicals banned in Europe for their use elsewhere in the world because they are dangerous and jeopardise the future of our biosphere is not an economic activity, it is a criminal activity.

feedback: Señores y señoras comisarios, Entiendo que a estas alturas estamos de acuerdo que los pesticidas químicos con sustancias prohibidas no solo afectan directamente a la salud de las personas y los costes derivados de las afecciones que provocan en los presupuestos sanitarios de los distintos países que tenemos que sostener con nuestros impuestos, sino que afectan también a la biodiversidad de la que dependemos radicalmente y que cada vez, con mayor motivo, debemos luchar por preservar dado su gravísimo deterioro en las últimas décadas. Vivimos en un único planeta, lo que no es bueno para nosotros, no es bueno para ningún otro ser humano viva donde viva, ninguna especie viva donde viva. Por favor, tengan esto en cuenta, no solo deben prohibir y evitar la exportación de sustancias químicas prohibidas y la importación de productos de países que trabajan con este tipo de sustancias, sino ayudar de forma decidida y urgente a la consecución de prácticas que promueven la recuperación de la fertilidad, la biodiversidad y el suelo y que, por lo tanto, ayuden a revertir y evitar la desertificación, la pérdida de fertilidad y la contaminación de las aguas. Pongan en valor a aquellos científicos y agricultores que trabajan e investigan en prácticas beneficiosas para el ecosistema global y la alimentación, ayúdenlos a llevar a cabo tan crítica tarea, difundan, apoyen. Espero de ustedes un compromiso decidido con la vida, con la sostenibilidad del planeta y con las personas que dedican esfuerzos a la recuperación de prácticas compatibles con la vida del ser humano y la soberanía alimentaria de los pueblos. No entiendo que los ciudadanos tengamos que exponer lo obvio y defender nuestra salud porque no se defienda de forma decidida desde las instituciones, pero llegados a este punto, aquí dejo mi ruego. Espero que para muchos de ustedes solo sea un apoyo más a las políticas que están decididos a acometer. Muchas gracias.
englishfeedback: Ladies and Commissioners, I believe that, at this stage, we agree that chemical pesticides with banned substances not only directly affect human health and the costs of the conditions they cause to the health budgets of the various countries that we have to sustain with our taxes, but also affect the biodiversity on which we are radically dependent and which, all the more and more so, we must fight to preserve their dramatic deterioration in recent decades. We live on a single planet, which is not good for us, it is not good for any other human being living where you live, no species living where you live. Please take this into account, not only should they ban and prevent the export of banned chemicals and the import of products from countries working with such substances, but they should also strongly and urgently help to achieve practices that promote the restoration of fertility, biodiversity and soil and thus help to reverse and prevent desertification, loss of fertility and water pollution. Value scientists and farmers working and researching practices beneficial for the global ecosystem and food, help them carry out such critical tasks, disseminate, support. I look forward to a determined commitment to life, to the sustainability of the planet and to the people who devote efforts to the recovery of practices compatible with human life and the food sovereignty of peoples. I do not understand that citizens need to show the obvious and defend our health because they do not defend themselves decisively from the institutions, but at this point, I am grateful here. I hope that many of you will only be more supportive of the policies they are determined to pursue. Thank you very much.

feedback: Those chemical products are banned in Europe because they're harmful. There is no reason they would be less harmful in other parts of the world so they should be banned everywhere. Keeping exporting them is not an option. Industrials must stop producing products that harm people and the planet they're living in.

Bonjour. Pourquoi des produits considérés comme toxiques et/ou dangereux pour notre santé et interdits dans l'Union Européenne devraient-ils pouvoir continuer à être exportés dans d'autre pays ? La vie et la santé des êtres humains hors UE vaut-elle moins que la nôtre ? Si nous avons eu les moyens de prouver que ces produits sont délétères pour la santé et la nature, autant que l'humanité entière profite de ces études. Et inutile de nous culpabiliser avec la menace de pertes d'emplois, je suis convaincue que les personnes concernées pourront trouver un emploi UTILE à la mesure de leurs compétences respectives. Cordialement, Martine MEESCHAERT
englishfeedback: Good morning. Why should products considered toxic and/or dangerous to our health and banned in the European Union be allowed to continue to be exported to other countries? Is the life and health of human beings outside the EU less important than ours? We have had the means to prove that these products are harmful to health and nature, as much as humanity benefits from these studies. And there is no need to blame us with the threat of job losses, I am convinced that the people concerned will be able to find a UTILE job commensurate with their respective competences. Warmly, Martine MEESCHAERT

feedback: Des pesticides dangereux sont interdits en Europe, mais ils continuent dêtre exportés en Afrique et en Amérique du Sud. LUE pourrait enfin mettre un terme à cette situation en interdisant leurs exportations. Il est grand temps de cesser dexporter des produits chimiques dangereux !
englishfeedback: Dangerous pesticides are banned in Europe, but they continue to be exported to Africa and South America. It could finally put an end to this situation by banning their exports. It is high time to stop exporting dangerous chemicals!

feedback: Non possiamo permettere l'esportazione in altri paesi di sostanze che in Europa sono proibite perchè pericolose. La vita e la salute di altri popoli è meno importanti delle nostre? In quei paesi i peticidi non inquinano? Di fatto permettere l'esportazione di queste sostanze pericolose è negare i diritti umani delle persone che vi sono esposte. Non è accettabile
englishfeedback: We cannot allow the export to other countries of substances that are banned in Europe because they are dangerous. Is the life and health of other peoples less important than ours? In those countries, do the peticides not pollute? Actually allowing the export of these dangerous substances is to deny the human rights of those exposed to them. Not acceptable

feedback: Los pesticidas peligrosos están prohibidos en Europa por su relación con el cáncer, los problemas reproductivos y las enfermedades neurodegenerativas, así como con la muerte de las abejas. Además, se sabe que algunos provocan daño cerebral infantil y durante el embarazo. Si no usamos estos pesticidas por ser demasiado peligrosos, ¿cómo podemos permitir que se exporten?
englishfeedback: Hazardous pesticides are banned in Europe because of their relationship with cancer, reproductive problems and neurodegenerative diseases, as well as the death of bees. In addition, some are known to cause brain damage for children and during pregnancy. If we do not use these pesticides because they are too dangerous, how can we allow them to be exported?

feedback: Impact sur la santé publique : En interdisant les exportations de pesticides potentiellement dangereux, l'Union européenne pourrait contribuer à réduire les risques pour la santé humaine dans les pays importateurs, notamment les travailleurs agricoles et les consommateurs de ces produits. Soutien aux agriculteurs : La Commission européenne pourrait mettre en place des programmes de reconversion ou de soutien financier pour aider les agriculteurs qui dépendent actuellement des pesticides interdits à se tourner vers des méthodes alternatives. Cela permettrait de minimiser l'impact sur l'emploi tout en favorisant des pratiques agricoles plus durables.
englishfeedback: Impact on public health By banning exports of potentially dangerous pesticides, the EU could help reduce the risks to human health in importing countries, including agricultural workers and consumers of these products. Support for farmers: The European Commission could set up retraining or financial support programmes to help farmers who currently rely on banned pesticides to switch to alternative methods. This would minimise the impact on employment while promoting more sustainable farming practices.

feedback: Aquellos productos que están prohibidos en Europa se debe a su peligrosidad para el medio ambiente y para el ser humano, por lo tanto, no se debe enviar a ningún otro país. Todos somos iguales
englishfeedback: Products that are banned in Europe are due to their danger to the environment and humans, therefore they should not be sent to any other country. We are all equal

feedback: Ne pas exporter des pesticides interdits en Europe Ces pesticides sont dangereux pour les agriculteurs et pour les personnes qui habitent près des zones dépandage et dangereux pour la biodiversité ils ne faut pas écouter les arguments des lobbies qui ne sont intéressés que par le profit et qui nont rien à faire des dangers pour la planete
englishfeedback: Not to export pesticides banned in Europe. These pesticides are dangerous for farmers and for people living near areas of descent and dangerous for biodiversity. They must not listen to the arguments of lobbyists who are interested only in profit and who have nothing to do with the dangers of planting.

feedback: Hej Det handlar om två saker, dels vill vi inte att gifter sprids i världen, dels om vår egen moral, vi kan inte förbjuda gifter i EU samtidigt som vi sprider dem i andra länder.
englishfeedback: Dear Madam, we are about two things: on the one hand, we do not want poison to spread around the world and, on the other hand, our own morals, we cannot ban poisoning in the EU at the same time as we spread them in other countries.

feedback: L'UE dovrebbe assolutamente dotarsi di strumenti normativi più coerenti rispetto al divieto sulle esportazione. I motivi sono ben noti e ormai ampiamente riconosciuti. Alcuni pesticidi sono vietati in Europa perché collegati a danni cerebrali nei bambini e nei neonati: se questi pesticidi sono troppo pericolosi per i cittadini europei, non possiamo consentire che vengano esportati allestero L'esportazione di pesticidi tossici è anche una questione di diritti umani, poiché questi pesticidi tossici danneggiano le persone. Ogni anno, migliaia di agricoltori muoiono per l'esposizione di pesticidi pericolosi. Esistono innumerevoli studi che dimostrano gli effetti dannosi sulle persone dei pesticidi esportati. L'esportazione di pesticidi tossici è dannosa per le api, la biodiversità e il pianeta. Le prove sono chiare: i neonicotinoidi e altri pesticidi velenosi uccidono le api. Per questo sono vietati in Europa. Perché dovremmo continuare a permettere che vengano esportati in Paesi uccidendo le api e decimando la biodiversità? L'esportazione di pesticidi tossici sfrutta e danneggia i paesi con leggi più permissive e i relativi cittadini. L'Europa da sempre intende svolgere un ruolo guida ben preciso nel mondo e non deve permettere, quindi, alle sue aziende di approfittare dei paesi con una regolamentazione più debole. Quale credibilità può avere l'UE se continuiamo a portare le nostre sostanze chimiche pericolose all'estero, avvelenando le persone e la natura, in paesi dove le norme di sicurezza sono più deboli e meno rigorose? Un divieto di esportazione dei pesticidi tossici sarebbe un vantaggio per l'innovazione e aiuterebbe l'Europa e il mondo intero verso pratiche agricole più sostenibili. Mantenere sul mercato pesticidi vecchi e pericolosi ci priva di un futuro più verde e di pratiche agricole più sostenibili. Un parere legale del Centro di diritto ambientale internazional (Center for International Environmental Law), pubblicato nel 2022, dimostra che le esportazioni dell'UE di pesticidi vietati verso l'Africa e l'America centrale violano gli obblighi legali internazionali dell'UE e i diritti umani.
englishfeedback: The EU should adopt regulatory instruments that are more consistent with the export ban. The reasons are well known and now widely recognised. Some pesticides are banned in Europe because they are linked to brain damage in children and infants: if these pesticides are too dangerous for European citizens, we cannot allow export of toxic pesticides. Export of toxic pesticides is also a human rights issue, as these toxic pesticides harm people. Every year, thousands of farmers die from exposure of hazardous pesticides. There are countless studies demonstrating the harmful effects of exported pesticides on people. The export of toxic pesticides is detrimental to bees, biodiversity and the planet. The evidence is clear: neonicotinoids and other poisonous pesticides kill bees. This is why they are banned in Europe. Why should we continue to allow them to be exported to countries by killing bees and deciding on biodiversity? The export of toxic pesticides exploits and damages countries with more permissive laws and their citizens. Europe has always wanted to play a clear leading role in the world and must therefore not allow its companies to take advantage of countries with weaker regulation. What credibility can the EU have if we continue to bring our hazardous chemicals abroad, poisoning people and nature, to countries where safety standards are weaker and lower? A ban on the export of toxic pesticides would benefit innovation and help Europe and the world towards more sustainable farming practices. Keeping old and hazardous pesticides on the market deprives us of a greener future and more sustainable farming practices. A legal opinion of the Center for International Environmental Law, published in 2022, shows that EU exports of banned pesticides to Africa and Central America violate the EU’s international legal obligations and human rights.

feedback: Ces produits devraient être interdits dans le monde entier
englishfeedback: These products should be banned worldwide

feedback: Voici quelques raisons pour lesquelles nous avons besoin dinterdire les pesticides dangereux : - L'exportation de pesticides toxiques révèle une politique de deux poids deux mesures : Les pesticides dangereux sont interdits en Europe après avoir été associés à des cancers, des problèmes de reproduction et des maladies neurodégénératives, ainsi qu'à la mort des abeilles. Certains de ces pesticides sont même interdits en Europe en raison de leur lien avec des lésions cérébrales chez les enfants et les bébés à naître. Si ces pesticides sont trop dangereux pour nous, comment pouvons-nous autoriser leur exportation ? - L'exportation de pesticides toxiques est une question de droits humains , car ces pesticides sont nocifs pour notre santé : Chaque année, des milliers d'agriculteurs meurent des suites dune trop forte exposition à ces pesticides dangereux. Les pesticides exportés font l'objet d'innombrables études qui confirment leurs effets néfastes sur les humains. - L'exportation de pesticides toxiques est néfaste pour les abeilles, la biodiversité et la planète en général. Les preuves sont claires : les néonics et autres pesticides dangereux tuent les abeilles. C'est pourquoi ils sont interdits en Europe. Pourquoi autorisons-nous encore leur exportation vers des pays où la réglementation est moins stricte, alors quils continueront de tuer les abeilles et décimer la biodiversité ? - L'exportation de pesticides toxiques profite des pays où la réglementation est moins stricte. L'UE a un rôle à jouer dans le monde - ses entreprises ne devraient pas être autorisées à profiter des pays où la réglementation est plus faible. Comment pouvons-nous être pris au sérieux si nous expédions nos produits chimiques dangereux à l'étranger, empoisonnant ainsi les populations et la nature dans des pays où les règles de sécurité sont plus faibles et moins strictement appliquées ? - L'interdiction d'exporter des pesticides toxiques serait une opportunité unique pour l'innovation et aiderait l'Europe et le monde à évoluer vers des méthodes de protection des plantes plus durables. Le maintien sur le marché de pesticides anciens et dangereux nous prive d'un avenir plus vert et de pratiques agricoles plus durables. - Un avis juridique du Center for International Environmental Law publié en 2022 montre que les exportations européennes de pesticides interdits vers l'Afrique et l'Amérique centrale violent les obligations juridiques internationales de l'UE et le droit relatif aux droits humains.
englishfeedback: Here are some reasons why we need to ban hazardous pesticides: — The export of toxic pesticides reveals a double standard policy: Hazardous pesticides are banned in Europe after being associated with cancer, reproductive problems and neurodegenerative diseases, as well as bee death. Some of these pesticides are even banned in Europe because of their link to brain damage in children and born babies. If these pesticides are too dangerous for us, how can we authorise their export? — The export of toxic pesticides is a human rights issue, as these pesticides are harmful to our health: Every year, thousands of farmers die as a result of excessive exposure to these hazardous pesticides. Exported pesticides are subject to countless studies confirming their adverse effects on humans. — The export of toxic pesticides is harmful to bees, biodiversity and the planet in general. The evidence is clear: neonics and other hazardous pesticides kill bees. This is why they are banned in Europe. Why do we still allow their export to countries with less stringent regulation, while they will continue to kill bees and decay biodiversity? — The export of toxic pesticides benefits countries with less stringent regulations. The EU has a role to play in the world – its businesses should not be allowed to benefit from countries with weaker regulation. How can we be taken seriously if we send our hazardous chemicals abroad, poisoning people and nature in countries where safety rules are weaker and less strictly enforced? — Banning the export of toxic pesticides would be a unique opportunity for innovation and would help Europe and the world to move towards more sustainable plant protection methods. Keeping old and dangerous pesticides on the market deprives us of a greener future and more sustainable agricultural practices. — A legal opinion of the Center for International Environmental Law published in 2022 shows that European exports of banned pesticides to Africa and Central America violate the EU’s international legal obligations and human rights law.

feedback: Pesticides or intermediates for production of pesticides should not be exported to African/ South American countries because they do not need them. In Europe and North America mass use of pesticides already degrades environment significantly without added benefit. Exporting chemicals of known harmful effect to the environment and people for short term boost in food production is the same as exporting plastic rubbish to the countries that do not have recycling installations to process them. It is plain and simple protection of agrochemical industry giants profits from declining instead of forcing them to find better use of their glyphosate or neonicotinoids producing factories. We understand that finding better way to deal with pests requires large investment with no guarantee of return while toxifying environment of African and South American continents brings instant profit.

I completely agree upon banning all forbidden chemicals in all parts of the world. Only a shared vision of how much we care for our planet, not only human health, and a global effort can save humanity and all living creatures from extinction. Nature restoration law and all the actions aiming at preserving biodiversity, climate appeasement, natural progress, clean water access, protection of species, etc. are to be activated at any time against the enemies of sustainable living.

Il me semble évident que si on interdit les pesticides dangereux en Europe ce n'est pas pour continuer à les vendre ailleurs en intoxicant d'autres humains et au final retrouver les molécules interdites dans notre assiette via des aliments importés. Et évidemment aussi les marchands de pesticides ne sont pas d'accord mais pourquoi suivre l'avis de ceux pour qui seuls les profits comptent ? Donc oui je soutiens totalement cette proposition d'interdiction.
englishfeedback: It seems clear to me that if dangerous pesticides are banned in Europe, it is not to continue selling them elsewhere by intoxicating other humans and ultimately tracing banned molecules in our plate via imported food. And obviously also the pesticide dealers do not agree, but why follow the opinion of those for whom only profits matter? So yes, I fully support this proposed ban.

feedback: Es moralmente evidente que lo que Europa no quiere tampoco puede exportarlo. El planeta es de todos. No a la exportación de pesticidas!!!
englishfeedback: It is morally clear that what Europe does not want to export can also not be exported. The planet is everybody’s planet. No for the export of pesticides!

feedback: La exportación de pesticidas tóxicos revela un doble rasero. Los pesticidas peligrosos están prohibidos en Europa por su relación con el cáncer, los problemas reproductivos y las enfermedades neurodegenerativas, así como con la muerte de las abejas. Además, se sabe que algunos provocan daño cerebral infantil y durante el embarazo. Si no usamos estos pesticidas por ser demasiado peligrosos, ¿cómo podemos permitir que se exporten? La exportación de pesticidas tóxicos es una cuestión de derechos humanos, ya que atentan contra la salud. Cada año, miles de personas que viven de la agricultura mueren por exponerse a estos peligrosos pesticidas. Numerosos estudios demuestran sus efectos nocivos. La exportación de pesticidas tóxicos perjudica a las abejas, la biodiversidad y el planeta. Los datos no mienten: los neonicotinoides y otros pesticidas tóxicos matan a las abejas. Por eso están prohibidos en Europa. ¿Cómo podemos permitir que se exporten a otros países? La industria de los pesticidas tóxicos se lucra con los países de normativas menos estrictas. Europa tiene que dar ejemplo y no permitir que sus empresas se aprovechen de una legislación más permisiva. ¿Cómo se nos puede tomar en serio si exportamos unos productos químicos que envenenan a las personas y la naturaleza? La prohibición de exportar pesticidas tóxicos fomentaría la innovación y animaría a Europa y al resto del mundo a utilizar técnicas fitosanitarias más sostenibles. Mantener en el mercado pesticidas obsoletos y peligrosos nos priva de un futuro más verde y de unas prácticas agrícolas más ecológicas. Según un dictamen jurídico del Centro de Derecho Ambiental Internacional publicado en 2022, la exportación de pesticidas prohibidos a África y América Central infringe los derechos humanos y las obligaciones legales internacionales de la UE.
englishfeedback: The export of toxic pesticides reveals double standards. Hazardous pesticides are banned in Europe because of their relationship with cancer, reproductive problems and neurodegenerative diseases, as well as the death of bees. In addition, some are known to cause brain damage for children and during pregnancy. If we do not use these pesticides because they are too dangerous, how can we allow them to be exported? The export of toxic pesticides is a human rights issue, as they harm health. Every year, thousands of people living in agriculture die from exposure to these dangerous pesticides. Numerous studies demonstrate its harmful effects. The export of toxic pesticides harms bees, biodiversity and the planet. The data do not feel: neonicotinoids and other toxic pesticides kill bees. This is why they are banned in Europe. How can we allow them to be exported to other countries? The toxic pesticide industry is profitable with countries with less stringent regulations. Europe needs to lead by example and not allow its businesses to take advantage of more permissive legislation. How can we be taken seriously if we export chemicals that poisonate people and nature? A ban on the export of toxic pesticides would encourage innovation and encourage Europe and the rest of the world to use more sustainable plant protection techniques. Keeping obsolete and dangerous pesticides on the market deprives us of a greener future and greener farming practices. According to a legal opinion of the International Environmental Law Centre published in 2022, the export of banned pesticides to Africa and Central America violates human rights and international legal obligations of the EU.

feedback: Madame, Monsieur, L'interdiction de l'exportation des pesticides toxiques interdits en Europe est tout d'abord une question de bon sens et de droits humains: si ils ont été interdits au sein de l'UE, c'est parce que leur nocivité tant pour la santé que pour l'environnement a été prouvée, et il est de la responsabilité de l'UE de ne pas infliger leurs conséquences aux populations autres pays. Notamment, l'exportation de ces produits profite aux industries des pays où la réglementation est plus faible, et le faire relève d'une hypocrisie de la part de l'Europe envers les habitants de ces pays, mais également d'un manque de cohérence (Cf avis juridique du Center for International Environmental Law publié en 2022 montre que les exportations européennes de pesticides interdits vers l'Afrique et l'Amérique centrale violent les obligations juridiques internationales de l'UE et le droit relatif aux droits humains) Par ailleurs, les conséquences de ces produits ne connaissent pas de frontières et impactent la biodiversité et la santé de façon globale, et à long terme l'UE sera également touchée. Enfin, c'est également une opportunité pour l'Europe d'innover en matière de politiques et pratiques agricoles, afin de nous affranchir de méthodes néfaste. L'Europe a ici l'occasion de faire preuve d'exemplarité, et de montrer qu'elle n'est pas soumise aux lobbys agro-industriels, qui trouveront toujours un arguments pour se soumettre à leur volonté. L'Europe peut se montrer plus forte que d'obéir à des intérêts courts-termistes qui ne satisferont que quelques uns. Les arguments de l'emploi, de la compétitivité, de la productivité ne sont que des épouvantails brandis par ces firmes. Nous pouvons employer, être compétitif en nous passant de l'exportation de ces pesticides toxiques et en trouvant des solutions plus durables.
englishfeedback: Dear Sir/Madam, The ban on the export of toxic pesticides banned in Europe is first and foremost a matter of common sense and human rights: if they have been banned within the EU, it is because they have been proven to be harmful to health and the environment, and it is the EU’s responsibility not to inflict their consequences on other countries. In particular, the export of these products benefits industries in countries with weaker regulation, as a result of Europe’s hypocrisy towards the inhabitants of these countries, but also of a lack of coherence (see legal opinion of the Center for International Environmental Law published in 2022 shows that European exports of banned pesticides to Africa and Central America violate the EU’s international legal obligations and human rights law). Furthermore, the consequences of these products know no borders and affect biodiversity and health in a comprehensive manner, and in the long term the EU will also be affected. Finally, it is also an opportunity for Europe to innovate in agricultural policies and practices, in order to avoid harmful methods. Here Europe has the opportunity to be exemplary and to show that it is not subject to agro-industrial lobbies, who will always find a case for their will. Europe can be stronger than obeying short-termistic interests which will satisfy only a few. The arguments of employment, competitiveness and productivity are only shaken by these firms. We can use, be competitive by exporting these toxic pesticides and finding more sustainable solutions.

feedback: Jahr für Jahr werden giftige Pestizide, die in der EU verboten sind, in EU-Staaten produziert. Um Produkte in Drittländer zu exportieren, welche in der EU verbotene Chemikalien enthalten, werden Ausfuhrnotifikationen europäischen Regulierungsämtern zur Prüfung vorgelegt. Diese Meldungen müssen Unternehmen gemäß EU-Gesetzgebung ausfüllen, um anschliessend legal in Länder mit deutlich niedrigeren Standards liefern zu dürfen. Dort gefährden diese Firmen so das Leben der Menschen, die dort in der Landwirtschaft arbeiten, und vergiften die Umwelt. Die EU muss, statt den Export von hier verbotenen Substanzen in Drittländer zu ermöglichen, diese Praxis sofort beenden, denn in den Zielländern kommt es dadurch zu zahllosen Verletzungen des Rechts auf Leben und der menschlichen Würde. Doch in den letzten Jahren sind die genehmigten Ausfuhrmengen sogar regelmäßig gestiegen. Zu den grössten Absatzmärkten gehören ausgerechnet jene Länder, die Europa hauptsächlich mit Agrarprodukten versorgen zuvorderst die USA, Brasilien und die Ukraine. So gelangen die unerwünschten Stoffe als Rückstände in Lebensmitteln wieder zurück nach Europa. Nachdem die Europäische Union mit der Strategie «From Farm to Fork», also vom Bauernhof bis auf den Teller, weltweit zur Pionierin auf dem Weg hin zu einem «fairen, gesunden und umweltfreundlichen Ernährungssystem» werden möchte, ist der Schritt zu einem umfassenden Verbot des Exportes von hochgefährlichen, in der EU verbotenen Pestiziden nur logisch.
englishfeedback: Every year toxic pesticides that are banned in the EU are produced in EU countries. In order to export products to third countries containing chemicals banned in the EU, export notifications are submitted to European regulators for scrutiny. EU legislation requires companies to fill in these notifications in order to be able to deliver legally to countries with significantly lower standards. There, these companies are endangering the lives of people working in agriculture and poisoning the environment. Instead of allowing the export of substances banned here to third countries, the EU must immediately put an end to this practice, as this leads to countless violations of the right to life and human dignity in destination countries. However, authorised export volumes have even increased regularly in recent years. Among the largest markets are those countries that mainly supply Europe with agricultural products, first and foremost the US, Brazil and Ukraine. The undesirable substances are returned to Europe as residues in food. Since the European Union wants to become the world’s pioneer towards a ‘fair, healthy and environmentally friendly food system’ with the ‘From Farm to Fork’ strategy, the move towards a comprehensive ban on the export of highly dangerous pesticides banned in the EU is logical.

feedback: Je suis contre l'exportation des pesticides de Bayer-Monsanto. S'ils sont interdits ici, pourquoi les envoyer empoisonner un autre continent? Cela est dangereux pour la biodiversité, et le climat.
englishfeedback: I am against the export of Bayer-Monsanto pesticides. If they are banned here, why send them poisoning another continent? This is dangerous for biodiversity and climate.

feedback: Esportare sostanze chimiche proibite in UE crea un enorme danno alla salute di tutti i cittadini. Non solo va fermata l'esportazione, ma andrebbe attuata una politica di educazione nei confronti dei Paesi che ancora utilizzano certe sostanze.
englishfeedback: Exporting banned chemicals to the EU is causing enormous damage to the health of all citizens. Not only should exports stop, but an education policy should be put in place towards countries that still use certain substances.

feedback: Con este tema no se puede actuar con hipocresía para mantener el volumen de negocio de las multinacionales. Por culpa de estas sustancias está disminuyendo la fauna en amplias zonas del planeta al alterar la cadena alimentaria. Incluso en zonas apartadas y poco pobladas ha habido una drástica reducción de la fauna local. El hecho banal de mantener el volumen de negocio de las multinacionales no puede poner en juego la salud de los ecosistemas. Es mucho lo que está en juego; el futuro del planeta y nuestro propio futuro.
englishfeedback: This cannot be done with hypocrisy to maintain the turnover of multinationals. Due to these substances, wildlife is shrinking in large parts of the planet by disrupting the food chain. Even in remote and sparsely populated areas there has been a drastic reduction in local fauna. The banal fact of maintaining the turnover of multinationals cannot jeopardise the health of ecosystems. A lot is at stake; the future of the planet and our own future.

feedback: La UE debe caracterizarse por los valores sociales y no económicos. Si estas sustancias son consideradas peligrosas para los habitantes de la UE, no es aceptable la exportación a otros países, sería un acto criminal conociendo sus riesgos. Hagan que nos sintamos orgullosos como europeos de no practicar un nuevo colonialismo económico. Muchas gracias
englishfeedback: The EU must be characterised by social and non-economic values. If these substances are considered dangerous for EU residents, export to other countries is not acceptable, it would be a criminal act knowing their risks. Make us proud as Europeans not to practise a new economic colonialism. Many thanks

feedback: Je suis en faveur de cette procédure qui nous permettra d'être crédible aux yeux des nations du monde entier. Et permet de réaffirmer nos valeurs, se des droits de l'homme. Le droit d'avoir un environnement saint dans lequel sépanouir, d'être en bonne santé et de préserver son intégrité. En plus, elle permettra d'aider les pays pas toujours respectueux de la santé de ces citoyens et de leurs bien êtres, peu soucieux de l'environnement, à faire respecter leurs droits et à améliorer leurs conditions de vie, de lutter sur ce qui leurs pourris la vie, leurs santés et leurs environnements. Cette démarche est tout simplement la suite logique à prendre qui permettrait d'améliorer les conditions de vie de beaucoup d'individus qui ont eu le malheurs de vivre dans un état mafieux ou le profit est prioritaire à leurs droits. On a interdit ses produits, car on a estimé qu'ils étaient nuisibles pour nous. Pourquoi les encourager à nuire aux autres nations ? Il faut arrêter de les empoissonnés et mettre un terme à ses exportations.
englishfeedback: I am in favour of this procedure which will allow us to be credible in the eyes of nations around the world. It is an opportunity to reaffirm our values, human rights. The right to have a healthy environment in which to flourish, to be healthy and to preserve its integrity. In addition, it will help countries that do not always respect the health of these citizens and their environmentally-minded well-being to uphold their rights and improve their living conditions, to fight for their lives, health and environments. This is simply the logical next step to take, which would improve the living conditions of many individuals who have had the mistrust of living in a mafia state or profit is given priority over their rights. Their products were banned because they were considered harmful to us. Why encourage them to harm other nations? It is necessary to stop poisoning and stop its exports.

feedback: We must ban export of toxic pesticides. They are banned in EU exactly because they are harmful to people, animals,bees and whole environment. Bees are dying because of those toxins, and we need bees for ours crops to be productive. No bees means no fruits/vegetables which means no jobs for farmers and no products in shops or are farmers going to pollinate every crop by their own hands like something people in China do. Impossible job to do. Pesticides are the source of cancers, reproductive problems, Alzheimer and Parkinson and of course they are killing our bees we desperately need. Exposure to toxins is killing many farmers every year and that is a big problem too as it is simply a murder. Those people from less developed countries deserve and need protection from pesticides. They shouldn't be dying from exposure to such toxins ,so they can grow crops that give them money to live. We can stop production and export of pesticides that no one in the whole world needs. We can grow plants in an ecological way that is not harmful to the environment and every living being on this planet, that taste much better than regular vegetables and fruits and are healthy. A legal opinion by the Center for International Environmental Law published in 2022 shows that EU exports of banned pesticides to Africa and Central America violate the EUs international legal obligations and human rights law.
These dangerous chemicals must not be used anywhere in the world. Stop the exportation of pesticides and other dangerous chemicals immediately.
englishfeedback: These dangerous chemicals must not be used anywhere in the world. Stop the exportation of pesticides and other dangerous chemicals immediately.

feedback: E' immorale e razzista permettere l'esportazione in altri paesi di sostanze che in Europa sono proibite perchè pericolose. La vita e la salute di africani e sud-americani sono meno importanti delle nostre? In quei paesi i pesticidi non inquinano? Sarebbe come pensare che la natura agisca a settori stagni!!! Di fatto permettere l'esportazione di queste sostanze pericolose è negare i diritti umani delle persone che vi sono esposte. Mi unisco alla voce di molti e vi chiedo di vietare le esportazioni di tali sostanze, senza ascoltarne i produttori, che, volendo, potrebbero concentrarsi su prodotti più sostenibili e garantire un futuro meno intossicato.
englishfeedback: It is immoral and racist to allow the export to other countries of substances that are banned in Europe because they are dangerous. Are the lives and health of Africans and South Americans less important than ours? In those countries, do pesticides not pollute? It would be like to think that nature works in watertight areas! Actually allowing the export of these dangerous substances is to deny the human rights of those exposed to them. I join the voice of many and ask you to ban exports of these substances, without listening to their producers, who might want to focus on more sustainable products and ensure a less intoxicated future.

feedback: Produire en Europe et exporter des marchandises hautement toxiques interdites ici est d'un cynisme intolérable. Il faut résister au chantage à l'emploi. L'industrie européenne est parfaitement capable de s'adapter et de produire à des coûts sociaux et environnementaux honnêtes. A nous tous ensemble d'exercer une pression maximale pour une interdiction totale des pesticides les plus délétères.
englishfeedback: Producing in Europe and exporting highly toxic goods banned here is intolerable cynism. You must be resistant to blackmail. European industry is perfectly capable of adapting and producing at honest social and environmental costs. We all together exert maximum pressure on a total ban on the most harmful pesticides.

feedback: Szanowni Państwo, Uważam, że eksport toksycznych pestycydów zagraża pszczołom, różnorodności biologicznej i planecie. Dowody mówią jasno: neonikotynoidy i inne toksyczne substancje zabijają pszczoły. Dlatego zakazaliśmy ich w Europie. Dlaczego więc nadal pozwalamy na eksportowanie ich do krajów, gdzie regulacje nie są tak silne? Czy chcemy, aby tam powodowały wymieranie pszczół i niszczyły bioróżnorodność? To zniszczy również człowieka! Z poważaniem, Renata Twaróg POLAND
englishfeedback: Ladies, I believe that the export of toxic pesticides threatens bees, biodiversity and the planet. The evidence clearly says: neonicotinoids and other toxic substances kill bees. This is why we have banned them in Europe. So why do we still allow them to be exported to countries where regulation is not so strong? Do we want bees to die and destroy biodiversity? This will also destroy people! Sincerely, Renata Twaróg POLAND

feedback: L'exportation de pesticides toxiques est une question de droits humains , car ces pesticides sont nocifs pour notre santé : Chaque année, des milliers d'agriculteurs meurent des suites dune trop forte exposition à ces pesticides dangereux. Les pesticides exportés font l'objet d'innombrables études qui confirment leurs effets néfastes sur les humains. L'exportation de pesticides toxiques profite des pays où la réglementation est moins stricte. L'UE a un rôle à jouer dans le monde - ses entreprises ne devraient pas être autorisées à profiter des pays où la réglementation est plus faible. Comment pouvons-nous être pris au sérieux si nous expédions nos produits chimiques dangereux à l'étranger, empoisonnant ainsi les populations et la nature dans des pays où les règles de sécurité sont plus faibles et moins strictement appliquées ? Un avis juridique du Center for International Environmental Law publié en 2022 montre que les exportations européennes de pesticides interdits vers l'Afrique et l'Amérique centrale violent les obligations juridiques internationales de l'UE et le droit relatif aux droits humains. L'exportation de pesticides toxiques est néfaste pour les abeilles, la biodiversité et la planète en général. Les preuves sont claires : les néonics et autres pesticides dangereux tuent les abeilles. C'est pourquoi ils sont interdits en Europe. Pourquoi autorisons-nous encore leur exportation vers des pays où la réglementation est moins stricte, alors quils continueront de tuer les abeilles et décimer la biodiversité ? L'interdiction d'exporter des pesticides toxiques serait une opportunité unique pour l'innovation et aiderait l'Europe et le monde à évoluer vers des méthodes de protection des plantes plus durables. Le maintien sur le marché de pesticides anciens et dangereux nous prive d'un avenir plus vert et de pratiques agricoles plus durables.
englishfeedback: The export of toxic pesticides is a human rights issue, as these pesticides are harmful to our health: Every year, thousands of farmers die as a result of excessive exposure to these hazardous pesticides. Exported pesticides are subject to countless studies confirming their adverse effects on humans. The export of toxic pesticides benefits countries with less stringent regulation. The EU has a role to play in the world – its businesses should not be allowed to benefit from countries with weaker regulation. How can we be taken seriously if we send our hazardous chemicals abroad, poisoning people and nature in countries where safety rules are weaker and less strictly enforced? A legal opinion of the Center for International Environmental Law published in 2022 shows that European exports of banned pesticides to Africa and Central America violate the EU’s international legal obligations and human rights law. The export of toxic pesticides is harmful to bees, biodiversity and the planet in general. The evidence is clear: neonics and other hazardous pesticides kill bees. This is why they are banned in Europe. Why do we still allow their export to countries with less stringent regulation, while they will continue to kill bees and decay biodiversity? Banning the export of toxic pesticides would be a unique opportunity for innovation and would help Europe and the world to move towards more sustainable plant protection methods. Keeping old and dangerous pesticides on the market deprives us of a greener future and more sustainable agricultural practices.

feedback: No enviar pesticidas a África y Asia
englishfeedback: Do not send pesticides to Africa and Asia

feedback: Bonjour, comment peut-on envisager d'exporter des produits jugés dangereux et interdits en Europe vers d'autres pays ? C'est absolument honteux. Ces produits sont néfastes pour la santé, pour l'environnement et la biodiversité. L'extinction des abeilles en est un des signes importants. Comment peut-on être irresponsable en autorisant chez les autres ce qu'on a interdit chez nous ? Faire de l'argent sur le dos de populations moins bien protégées est tout simplement scandaleux. Les laboratoires feraient bien mieux de se tourner vers la recherche et l'innovation pour trouver des méthodes respectueuses de notre santé, et de notre planète. Merci de ne pas autoriser de telles exportations. je compte sur vous pour empêcher de si sinistres projets.
englishfeedback: Hello, how can we envisage exporting products that are considered dangerous and banned in Europe to other countries? This is absolutely shameful. These products are harmful to health, the environment and biodiversity. One important sign of this is the extinction of bees. How can we be irresponsible by allowing others what has been forbidden at home? Making money on the back of less well protected populations is simply scandalous. Laboratories would do much better to turn to research and innovation to find methods that respect our health, and our planet. Thank you for not authorising such exports. I count on you to prevent any project claims.

feedback: Det är ofattbart att kemiska substanser vi vet är giftiga för levande organismer, växter, insekter vattenlevande och jordlevande mickroliv och små livsbärande organismer fortfarande används och sprids någonstans på jorden. Dessa små existenser utgör basen för allt liv på jorden, även vårt. En fungerande biosfär måste skyddas och där viktiga balanse rubbats återskapas. Att tillåta spridning av kända gifter är oförsvarligt av den upplysta församling som EU representerar. Lyssna på verifierad forskning som kan ge oss en annan väg att gå än mer de förslag lobbyister från BASF and Bayer-Monsanto förespråkar. Förbjud spridning av kända gifter. Vänligen Eva-Lill Nilsson https://www.ohchr.org/en/press-releases/2020/07/states-must-stop-exporting-unwanted-toxic-chemicals-poorer-countries-says-un?LangID=E&NewsID=26063
englishfeedback: It is inconceivable that chemical substances we know are toxic to living organisms, plants, aquatic and soil microlife and small life-bearing organisms are still used and spread somewhere on the soil. These small habits form the basis of all life on Earth, including ours. It is necessary to protect a functioning biosphere and to restore important balances. Allowing the dissemination of known toxins is unjustifiable by the informed assembly represented by the EU. Listen to verified research that could give us a different way to go even further the proposals advocated by BASF and Bayer-Monsanto lobbyists. Prohibit the dissemination of known toxins. Please Ms Eva-Lill Nilsson https://www.ohchr.org/en/press-releases/2020/07/states-must-stop-exporting-unwanted-toxic-chemicals-poorer-countries-says-un?LangID=E&NewsID=26063

feedback: Diese Pestizide sind in Europa verboten, aber der Export ist erlaubt: Das ist eine Doppelmoral. Die gefährlichen Pestizide wurden in Europa verboten, nachdem sie mit Krebs, Beeinträchtigung der Fruchtbarkeit und neurodegenerativen Krankheiten in Verbindung gebracht wurden - zum Bienensterben tragen sie außerdem bei. Einige dieser Pestizide sind in Europa verboten, weil sie mit Hirnschäden bei Kindern und ungeborenen Babys in Verbindung gebracht werden. Wenn diese Pestizide für uns zu gefährlich sind: Wie können wir dann zulassen, dass sie exportiert werden? Die Ausfuhr von giftigen Pestiziden ist eine Frage der Menschenrechte, denn die Pestizide schaden den Menschen: Jedes Jahr sterben Tausende von Landwirt*innen durch den Kontakt mit gefährlichen Pestiziden. Es gibt unzählige Studien, die die schädlichen Auswirkungen der exportierten Pestizide auf den Menschen belegen. Die Ausfuhr giftiger Pestizide ist desaströs für Bienen, die biologische Vielfalt und den Planeten. Die Beweislage ist eindeutig: Neonics und andere giftige Pestizide töten Bienen. Deshalb sind sie in Europa verboten. Wir sollten nicht zulassen, dass diese Pestizide in Länder exportiert werden, in denen Gesundheitsvorschriften weniger streng sind und dort Bienen und die biologische Vielfalt zerstören. Länder, in denen es kaum Vorschriften für giftige Pestizide gibt, werden als Markt benutzt. Europäische Unternehmen sollten nicht die Möglichkeit haben, diesen Umstand auszunutzen. Wie kann Europa als Weltmacht ernst genommen werden, wenn wir gefährliche Chemikalien ins Ausland verschiffen und dabei Mensch und Natur in Ländern vergiften, in denen Sicherheitsvorschriften geringer sind und weniger streng durchgesetzt werden? Ein Exportverbot für giftige Pestizide würde Europa und der Welt helfen, zu nachhaltigeren Pflanzenschutzmethoden überzugehen. Wenn gefährliche Pestizide auf dem Markt bleiben, werden wir weiter auf eine grünere Zukunft und nachhaltige Landwirtschaft warten müssen.
englishfeedback: These pesticides are banned in Europe, but exports are allowed: This is a double standard. Hazardous pesticides have been banned in Europe after being associated with cancer, fertility impairment and neurodegenerative diseases and contribute to bee mortality. Some of these pesticides are banned in Europe because they are associated with brain damage in children and unborn babies. If these pesticides are too dangerous for us: How can we then allow them to be exported? The export of toxic pesticides is a human rights issue, as pesticides harm people: Every year thousands of farmers die from exposure to hazardous pesticides. There are countless studies demonstrating the harmful effects of exported pesticides on humans. Exports of toxic pesticides are desastrous for bees, biodiversity and the planet. The evidence is clear: Neonics and other toxic pesticides kill bees. This is why they are banned in Europe. We should not allow these pesticides to be exported to countries where health rules are less stringent and where bees and biodiversity are destroyed. Countries with little regulation on toxic pesticides are used as a market. European companies should not be able to take advantage of this fact. How can Europe be taken seriously as a global power when we ship dangerous chemicals abroad, poisoning people and nature in countries where safety rules are lower and enforcement is less stringent? A ban on exports of toxic pesticides would help Europe and the world move towards more sustainable plant protection practices. If hazardous pesticides remain on the market, we will have to wait for a greener future and sustainable agriculture.

feedback: The export of toxic pesticides exposes a double standard: Dangerous pesticides are banned in Europe after they were linked to cancer, reproductive problems and neurodegenerative diseases as well as the dying of bees. Some of these pesticides are banned in Europe because of their links to brain damage in children and unborn babies. If these pesticides are too dangerous for us, how can we allow them to be exported? The export of toxic pesticides is a human rights issue as these toxic pesticides are damaging to people: Every year, thousands of farmers die from exposure to dangerous pesticides. The pesticides exported have countless studies supporting the damaging effects on people. The export of toxic pesticides is bad for the bees, biodiversity and the planet. The evidence is clear: neonics and other poisonous pesticides kill bees. Thats why theyre banned in Europe. Why are we still allowing them to be exported to countries with weaker regulation, killing bees and decimating biodiversity? The export of toxic pesticides is taking advantage of countries with weaker regulation. Europe has a role to play in the world - its companies should not be allowed to take advantage of countries with weaker regulation. How can we be taken seriously if we ship our hazardous chemicals abroad, poisoning people and nature in the process in countries where safety regulations are weaker and less strictly enforced. An export ban of toxic pesticides would be a boon for innovation and help Europe and the world move towards more sustainable plant protection methods. Keeping old and dangerous pesticides on the market is depriving us from a greener future and more sustainable farming practices. A legal opinion by the Center for International Environmental Law published in 2022 shows that EU exports of banned pesticides to Africa and Central America violate the EUs international legal obligations and human rights law.

L'exportation de pesticides toxiques révèle une politique de deux poids deux mesures : Les pesticides dangereux sont interdits en Europe après avoir été associés à des cancers, des problèmes de reproduction et des maladies neurodégénératives, ainsi qu'à la mort des abeilles. Certains de ces pesticides sont même interdits en Europe en raison de leur lien avec des lésions cérébrales chez les enfants et les bébés à naître. Si ces pesticides sont trop dangereux pour nous, comment pouvons-nous autoriser leur exportation ?
englishfeedback: The export of toxic pesticides reveals a double standard policy: Hazardous pesticides are banned in Europe after being associated with cancer, reproductive problems and neurodegenerative diseases, as well as bee death. Some of these pesticides are even banned in Europe because of their link to brain damage in children and born babies. If these pesticides are too dangerous for us, how can we authorise their export?

feedback: Il est absolument immoral et scandaleux quun produit interdit dutilisation au sein de lUnion européenne puisse y être produit à des fins dexportation dans un but purement mercantile. Et ainsi pouvoir continuer à polluer allègrement et mettre en danger la vie dautrui.
englishfeedback: It is absolutely immoral and scandalous that a product banned from using within the European Union can be produced there for export purposes for purely mercantile purposes. In this way, it can continue to pollute less and put life at risk.

feedback: Des études scientifiques ont démontré la dangerosité se certains pesticides. La seule position acceptable est de cesser de les produire et de détruire les stocks existants et dans aucun cas d'exporter leur nocivité, fut-ce même comme je l'ai vu à Madagascar sous couvert d'aide à la production agricole.
englishfeedback: Scientific studies have shown that some pesticides are dangerous. The only acceptable position is to stop producing them and destroy existing stocks and in no case to export their harmfulness, even as I have seen in Madagascar under the guise of agricultural production aid.

feedback: La exportación de pesticidas tóxicos revela un doble rasero. Los pesticidas peligrosos están prohibidos en Europa por su relación con el cáncer, los problemas reproductivos y las enfermedades neurodegenerativas, así como con la muerte de las abejas. Además, se sabe que algunos provocan daño cerebral infantil y durante el embarazo. Si no usamos estos pesticidas por ser demasiado peligrosos, ¿cómo podemos permitir que se exporten? La exportación de pesticidas tóxicos es una cuestión de derechos humanos, ya que atentan contra la salud. Cada año, miles de personas que viven de la agricultura mueren por exponerse a estos peligrosos pesticidas. Numerosos estudios demuestran sus efectos nocivos. La exportación de pesticidas tóxicos perjudica a las abejas, la biodiversidad y el planeta. Los datos no mienten: los neonicotinoides y otros pesticidas tóxicos matan a las abejas. Por eso están prohibidos en Europa. ¿Cómo podemos permitir que se exporten a otros países? La industria de los pesticidas tóxicos se lucra con los países de normativas menos estrictas. Europa tiene que dar ejemplo y no permitir que sus empresas se aprovechen de una legislación más permisiva. ¿Cómo se nos puede tomar en serio si exportamos unos productos químicos que envenenan a las personas y la naturaleza? La prohibición de exportar pesticidas tóxicos fomentaría la innovación y animaría a Europa y al resto del mundo a utilizar técnicas fitosanitarias más sostenibles. Mantener en el mercado pesticidas obsoletos y peligrosos nos priva de un futuro más verde y de unas prácticas agrícolas más ecológicas.
englishfeedback: The export of toxic pesticides reveals double standards. Hazardous pesticides are banned in Europe because of their relationship with cancer, reproductive problems and neurodegenerative diseases, as well as the death of bees. In addition, some are known to cause brain damage for children and during pregnancy. If we do not use these pesticides because they are too dangerous, how can we allow them to be exported? The export of toxic pesticides is a human rights issue, as they harm health. Every year, thousands of people living in agriculture die from exposure to these dangerous pesticides. Numerous studies demonstrate its harmful effects. The export of toxic pesticides harms bees, biodiversity and the planet. The data do not feel: neonicotinoids and other toxic pesticides kill bees. This is why they are banned in Europe. How can we allow them to be exported to other countries? The toxic pesticide industry is profitable with countries with less stringent regulations. Europe needs to lead by example and not allow its businesses to take advantage of more permissive legislation. How can we be taken seriously if we export chemicals that poisonate people and nature? A ban on the export of toxic pesticides would encourage innovation and encourage Europe and the rest of the world to use more sustainable plant protection techniques. Keeping obsolete and dangerous pesticides on the market deprives us of a greener future and greener farming practices.

feedback: Por favor, prohiban la exportación de pesticidas tóxicos. La exportación de pesticidas tóxicos revela un doble rasero. Los pesticidas peligrosos están prohibidos en Europa por su relación con el cáncer, los problemas reproductivos y las enfermedades neurodegenerativas, así como con la muerte de las abejas. Además, se sabe que algunos provocan daño cerebral infantil y durante el embarazo. Si no usamos estos pesticidas por ser demasiado peligrosos, ¿cómo podemos permitir que se exporten? La exportación de pesticidas tóxicos es una cuestión de derechos humanos, ya que atentan contra la salud. Cada año, miles de personas que viven de la agricultura mueren por exponerse a estos peligrosos pesticidas. Numerosos estudios demuestran sus efectos nocivos. La exportación de pesticidas tóxicos perjudica a las abejas, la biodiversidad y el planeta. Los datos no mienten: los neonicotinoides y otros pesticidas tóxicos matan a las abejas. Por eso están prohibidos en Europa. ¿Cómo podemos permitir que se exporten a otros países? La industria de los pesticidas tóxicos se lucra con los países de normativas menos estrictas. Europa tiene que dar ejemplo y no permitir que sus empresas se aprovechen de una legislación más permisiva. ¿Cómo se nos puede tomar en serio si exportamos unos productos químicos que envenenan a las personas y la naturaleza? La prohibición de exportar pesticidas tóxicos fomentaría la innovación y animaría a Europa y al resto del mundo a utilizar técnicas fitosanitarias más sostenibles. Mantener en el mercado pesticidas obsoletos y peligrosos nos priva de un futuro más verde y de unas prácticas agrícolas más ecológicas.
englishfeedback: Please ban the export of toxic pesticides. The export of toxic pesticides reveals double standards. Hazardous pesticides are banned in Europe because of their relationship with cancer, reproductive problems and neurodegenerative diseases, as well as the death of bees. In addition, some are known to cause brain damage for children and during pregnancy. If we do not use these pesticides because they are too dangerous, how can we allow them to be exported? The export of toxic pesticides is a human rights issue, as they harm health. Every year, thousands of people living in agriculture die from exposure to these dangerous pesticides. Numerous studies demonstrate its harmful effects. The export of toxic pesticides harms bees, biodiversity and the planet. The data do not feel: neonicotinoids and other toxic pesticides kill bees. This is why they are banned in Europe. How can we allow them to be exported to other countries? The toxic pesticide industry is profitable with countries with less stringent regulations. Europe needs to lead by example and not allow its businesses to take advantage of more permissive legislation. How can we be taken seriously if we export chemicals that poisonate people and nature? A ban on the export of toxic pesticides would encourage innovation and encourage Europe and the rest of the world to use more sustainable plant protection techniques. Keeping obsolete and dangerous pesticides on the market deprives us of a greener future and greener farming practices.

feedback: L'esportazione di pesticidi tossici mette in luce un doppio standard: I pesticidi pericolosi sono stati vietati in Europa dopo essere stati collegati a cancro, problemi riproduttivi e malattie neurodegenerative, nonché alla morte delle api. Alcuni di questi pesticidi sono vietati in Europa perché collegati a danni cerebrali nei bambini e nei neonati. Se questi pesticidi sono troppo pericolosi per noi, come possiamo che vengano esportati allestero? L'esportazione di pesticidi tossici è una questione di diritti umani, poiché questi pesticidi tossici danneggiano le persone: Ogni anno, migliaia di agricoltori muoiono per l'esposizione di pesticidi pericolosi. Esistono innumerevoli studi che dimostrano gli effetti dannosi sulle persone dei pesticidi esportati. L'esportazione di pesticidi tossici è dannosa per le api, la biodiversità e il pianeta. Le prove sono chiare: i neonicotinoidi e altri pesticidi velenosi uccidono le api. Ecco perché sono vietati in Europa. Perché continuiamo a permettere che vengano esportati in Paesi uccidendo le api e decimando la biodiversità? L'esportazione di pesticidi tossici sfrutta i paesi con leggi più permissive. L'Europa ha un ruolo da svolgere nel mondo: non si deve permettere alle sue aziende di approfittare dei paesi con una regolamentazione più debole. Come possiamo essere presi sul serio se spediamo le nostre sostanze chimiche pericolose all'estero, avvelenando le persone e la natura in paesi dove le norme di sicurezza sono più deboli e meno rigorose? Un divieto di esportazione dei pesticidi tossici sarebbe un vantaggio per l'innovazione e aiuterebbe l'Europa e il mondo intero verso pratiche agricole più sostenibili. Mantenere sul mercato pesticidi vecchi e pericolosi ci priva di un futuro più verde e di pratiche agricole più sostenibili. Un parere legale del Centro di diritto ambientale internazional (Center for International Environmental Law), pubblicato nel 2022, dimostra che le esportazioni dell'UE di pesticidi vietati verso l'Africa e l'America centrale violano gli obblighi legali internazionali dell'UE e i diritti umani. Per questo mi unisco alla causa. Dobbiamo difendere le api!
