englishfeedback: The export of toxic pesticides highlights a double standard: Hazardous pesticides have been banned in Europe after being linked to cancer, reproductive problems and neurodegenerative diseases, as well as to the death of bees. Some of these pesticides are banned in Europe because they are linked to brain damage in children and infants. If these pesticides are too dangerous for us, how can they be exported abroad? The export of toxic pesticides is a human rights issue, as these toxic pesticides harm people: Every year, thousands of farmers die from exposure of hazardous pesticides. There are countless studies demonstrating the harmful effects of exported pesticides on people. The export of toxic pesticides is detrimental to bees, biodiversity and the planet. The evidence is clear: neonicotinoids and other poisonous pesticides kill bees. This is why they are banned in Europe. Why do we continue to allow them to be exported to countries by killing bees and deciding on biodiversity? The export of toxic pesticides exploits countries with more permissive laws. Europe has a role to play in the world: its companies should not be allowed to take advantage of countries with weaker regulation. How can we be taken seriously if we ship our hazardous chemicals abroad, poisoning people and nature in countries where safety standards are weaker and lower? A ban on the export of toxic pesticides would benefit innovation and help Europe and the world towards more sustainable farming practices. Keeping old and hazardous pesticides on the market deprives us of a greener future and more sustainable farming practices. A legal opinion of the Center for International Environmental Law, published in 2022, shows that EU exports of banned pesticides to Africa and Central America violate the EU’s international legal obligations and human rights. I therefore join the case. We need to defend bees!

feedback: Gefährliche Substanzen dürfen erst gar nicht produziert werden, sie gefährden das Leben auf unserem ganzen Planeten !
englishfeedback: Dangerous substances must not be produced at all; they threaten life on our planet!

feedback: Me parece increíble que los legisladores europeos aún duden si lo que es malo para los europeos puede ser bueno para el resto del mundo. Me pregunto si estas dudas se deben a razones económicas, es decir, que es un negocio suculento para las compañías productoras de venenos. Mi opinión al respecto es que se debe prohibir exportar fuera de nuestras fronteras lo que se prohíbe dentro.
englishfeedback: I think it incredible that European legislators still have doubts as to whether what is bad for Europeans can be good for the rest of the world. I wonder whether these doubts are due to economic reasons, i.e. that it is a pull business for poison producing companies. My view in this regard is that exports outside our borders must be prohibited.

feedback: Madame,Monsieur, Interdire la production à des fins d'exportations de produits chimiques interdits dans l'U.E est une question de cohérence par rapport à la volonté affichée de transition écologique et de préservation de la santé des personnes en Europe. Ces objectifs ne peuvent être réalisés en autarcie, puisqu'une grande partie des aliments consommés sur notre continent proviennent d'ailleurs. Il est donc essentiel de décider aujourd'hui... Cessons d'empoisonner les populations
englishfeedback: Madam, Sir/Madam, Ban production for export of chemicals banned in the EU is a question of consistency with the stated desire for the ecological transition and the preservation of human health in Europe. These objectives cannot be achieved by self-determination, as much of the food consumed on our continent comes from elsewhere. It is therefore essential to decide today... Let’s stop poisoning populations

feedback: Prohibir la exportación de pesticidas tóxicos, además de proteger la salud de la población y el medioambiente, fomentaría la innovación y animaría a Europa y al resto del mundo a utilizar técnicas fitosanitarias más sostenibles. Mantener en el mercado pesticidas obsoletos y peligrosos es irresponsable, provoca daños masivos a nuestra generación y a las siguientes, y nos priva de prácticas agrícolas viables y ecológicas.
englishfeedback: Banning the export of toxic pesticides, as well as protecting the health of the population and the environment, would encourage innovation and encourage Europe and the rest of the world to use more sustainable plant protection techniques. Keeping obsolete and dangerous pesticides on the market is irresponsible, causes massive damage to our generation and the following ones, and deprives us of viable and ecological farming practices.

feedback: De export van giftige pesticiden druist in tegen onze waarden. Hoe kan de Europese burger nog in de Unie geloven wanneer het belang van mensen voor de zoveelste keer wordt achtergesteld aan de winsten van grote conglomeraten? Zet in op duurzame landbouw en een groenere toekomst!
englishfeedback: The export of toxic pesticides runs counter to our values. How can European citizens still believe in the Union when the interests of people are once again subordinated to the profits of large conglomerates? Focus on sustainable agriculture and a greener future!

feedback: Madame,Monsieur, Interdire la production à des fins d'exportations de produits chimiques interdits dans l'U.E est une question de cohérence par rapport à la volonté affichée de transition écologique et de préservation de la santé des personnes en Europe. Ces objectifs ne peuvent être réalisés en autarcie, puisqu'une grande partie des aliments consommés sur notre continent proviennent d'ailleurs. Il est donc essentiel de décider aujourd'hui d'une exclusion des exportations de néonics et autres pesticides dangeureux pour les humains, les abeilles et la bio-diversité. La vague de chaleur actuelle résonne comme une alarme que nous ne pouvons collectivement plus ignorer. Assumez vos responsabilités et décidez maintenant de la fin de ces exportations. Merci. Paul Castella
englishfeedback: Madam, Sir/Madam, Ban production for export of chemicals banned in the EU is a question of consistency with the stated desire for the ecological transition and the preservation of human health in Europe. These objectives cannot be achieved by self-determination, as much of the food consumed on our continent comes from elsewhere. It is therefore essential to decide today to exclude exports of neonics and other dangerous pesticides for humans, bees and biodiversity. The current heat wave resonates as an alarm that we can no longer ignore collectively. Assume your responsibilities and now decide on the end of these exports. Thank you. Paul Castella

feedback: Il est temps que des décisions importantes soient prises concernant les produits chimiques dangereux. Notre futur en dépend.
englishfeedback: It is time for important decisions on hazardous chemicals. Our future depends on it.

feedback: Todas las sustancias prohibidas en la UE no deberían de producirse ni exportarse. El mercado hace que esas substancias vuelvan a la UE en los alimentos que importamos de los países a los que actualmente les vendemos los productos químicos. Por la seguridad de nuestros hijos y futuras generaciones impidamos incorporar a la cadena alimenticia productos tóxicos para la salud a medio/largo plazo.
englishfeedback: All substances banned in the EU should not be produced or exported. The market brings these substances back to the EU in the food we import from the countries to which chemicals are currently sold. For the safety of our children and future generations, we are preventing the incorporation into the food chain of products that are toxic to health in the medium to long term.

feedback: Je suis les recommandations de "WeMove Europe" et je suis en accord avec leur valeur et le format de leur avis ci-après : - L'exportation de pesticides toxiques révèle une politique de deux poids deux mesures : Les pesticides dangereux sont interdits en Europe après avoir été associés à des cancers, des problèmes de reproduction et des maladies neurodégénératives, ainsi qu'à la mort des abeilles. Certains de ces pesticides sont même interdits en Europe en raison de leur lien avec des lésions cérébrales chez les enfants et les bébés à naître. Si ces pesticides sont trop dangereux pour nous, comment pouvons-nous autoriser leur exportation ? - L'exportation de pesticides toxiques est une question de droits humains , car ces pesticides sont nocifs pour notre santé : Chaque année, des milliers d'agriculteurs meurent des suites dune trop forte exposition à ces pesticides dangereux. Les pesticides exportés font l'objet d'innombrables études qui confirment leurs effets néfastes sur les humains. - L'exportation de pesticides toxiques est néfaste pour les abeilles, la biodiversité et la planète en général. Les preuves sont claires : les néonics et autres pesticides dangereux tuent les abeilles. C'est pourquoi ils sont interdits en Europe. Pourquoi autorisons-nous encore leur exportation vers des pays où la réglementation est moins stricte, alors quils continueront de tuer les abeilles et décimer la biodiversité ? - L'exportation de pesticides toxiques profite des pays où la réglementation est moins stricte. L'UE a un rôle à jouer dans le monde - ses entreprises ne devraient pas être autorisées à profiter des pays où la réglementation est plus faible. Comment pouvons-nous être pris au sérieux si nous expédions nos produits chimiques dangereux à l'étranger, empoisonnant ainsi les populations et la nature dans des pays où les règles de sécurité sont plus faibles et moins strictement appliquées ? - L'interdiction d'exporter des pesticides toxiques serait une opportunité unique pour l'innovation et aiderait l'Europe et le monde à évoluer vers des méthodes de protection des plantes plus durables. Le maintien sur le marché de pesticides anciens et dangereux nous prive d'un avenir plus vert et de pratiques agricoles plus durables. - Un avis juridique du Center for International Environmental Law publié en 2022 montre que les exportations européennes de pesticides interdits vers l'Afrique et l'Amérique centrale violent les obligations juridiques internationales de l'UE et le droit relatif aux droits humains.
englishfeedback: I am the recommendations of WeMove Europe and agree with their value and the following format of their opinion: — The export of toxic pesticides reveals a double standard policy: Hazardous pesticides are banned in Europe after being associated with cancer, reproductive problems and neurodegenerative diseases, as well as bee death. Some of these pesticides are even banned in Europe because of their link to brain damage in children and born babies. If these pesticides are too dangerous for us, how can we authorise their export? — The export of toxic pesticides is a human rights issue, as these pesticides are harmful to our health: Every year, thousands of farmers die as a result of excessive exposure to these hazardous pesticides. Exported pesticides are subject to countless studies confirming their adverse effects on humans. — The export of toxic pesticides is harmful to bees, biodiversity and the planet in general. The evidence is clear: neonics and other hazardous pesticides kill bees. This is why they are banned in Europe. Why do we still allow their export to countries with less stringent regulation, while they will continue to kill bees and decay biodiversity? — The export of toxic pesticides benefits countries with less stringent regulations. The EU has a role to play in the world – its businesses should not be allowed to benefit from countries with weaker regulation. How can we be taken seriously if we send our hazardous chemicals abroad, poisoning people and nature in countries where safety rules are weaker and less strictly enforced? — Banning the export of toxic pesticides would be a unique opportunity for innovation and would help Europe and the world to move towards more sustainable plant protection methods. Keeping old and dangerous pesticides on the market deprives us of a greener future and more sustainable agricultural practices. — A legal opinion of the Center for International Environmental Law published in 2022 shows that European exports of banned pesticides to Africa and Central America violate the EU’s international legal obligations and human rights law.

feedback: Il est inimaginable quaujourdhui lEurope pratique encore une politique qui permette aux industriels implantés sur son territoire de produire et exporter des molécules interdites ici pour empoisonner le reste de lhumanité. Il est grand temps quil soit mis un terme à des pratiques qui devraient sapparenter à des crimes contre lhumanité.
englishfeedback: It is unimaginable that Europe still practises a policy that allows industrialists in its territory to produce and export molecules banned here to poison the rest of humanity. It is high time that practices that should be related to crimes against humanity are put to an end.

feedback: Here are some of the many reasons why we need to ban exporting poisonous chemicals: - The export of toxic pesticides exposes a double standard: Dangerous pesticides are banned in Europe after they were linked to cancer, reproductive problems and neurodegenerative diseases as well as the dying of bees. Some of these pesticides are banned in Europe because of their links to brain damage in children and unborn babies. If these pesticides are too dangerous for us, how can we allow them to be exported? - The export of toxic pesticides is a human rights issue as these toxic pesticides are damaging to people: Every year, thousands of farmers die from exposure to dangerous pesticides. The pesticides exported have countless studies supporting the damaging effects on people. - The export of toxic pesticides is bad for the bees, biodiversity and the planet. The evidence is clear: neonics and other poisonous pesticides kill bees. Thats why theyre banned in Europe. Why are we still allowing them to be exported to countries with weaker regulation, killing bees and decimating biodiversity? - The export of toxic pesticides is taking advantage of countries with weaker regulation. Europe has a role to play in the world - its companies should not be allowed to take advantage of countries with weaker regulation. How can we be taken seriously if we ship our hazardous chemicals abroad, poisoning people and nature in the process in countries where safety regulations are weaker and less strictly enforced. - An export ban of toxic pesticides would be a boon for innovation and help Europe and the world move towards more sustainable plant protection methods. Keeping old and dangerous pesticides on the market is depriving us from a greener future and more sustainable farming practices. - A legal opinion by the Center for International Environmental Law published in 2022 shows that EU exports of banned pesticides to Africa and Central America violate the EUs international legal obligations and human rights law.

Prohibir la producción y, o, la exportación de determinadas sustancias químicas peligrosas prohibidas en la UE, protegerá a los países no pertenecientes a la UE de sus efectos negativos sobre la salud humana y el medio ambiente. La armonización de la política interior y exterior reforzará la posición internacional de la UE dando mayor credibilidad de nuestras acciones. Y cumplirá también el compromiso contraído en la estrategia de la UE para la sostenibilidad de las sustancias químicas.
englishfeedback: Banning the production and, or, the export of certain hazardous chemicals banned in the EU, will protect non-EU countries from their negative effects on human health and the environment. The harmonisation of internal and external policy will strengthen the EU’s international position by increasing the credibility of our actions. It will also deliver on the commitment made in the EU Chemicals Strategy for Sustainability.

feedback: Las grandes corporaciones agroalimentarias se enriquecen con la exportación a África y Sudamérica de pesticidas tóxicos que envenenan el planeta y ponen en peligro las pequeñas granjas y a las familias que viven de ellas. Son pesticidas vetados en la UE por peligrosos y, por ello, no es aceptable que se utilicen en ningún lugar del planeta. Deben prohibir su exportación, a pesar de las presiones de la industria de los pesticidas.
englishfeedback: Large agri-food corporations enrich themselves with the export to Africa and South America of toxic pesticides poisoning the planet and endangering small farms and their families. Pesticides are banned in the EU as hazardous and therefore it is not acceptable for them to be used anywhere on the planet. They must ban their export, despite pressure from the pesticide industry.

feedback: Vous êtes responsables de la santé de millions de personnes ! Interdisez ce poison qui pollue notre corps, nos aliments, notre environnent.
englishfeedback: You are responsible for the health of millions of people! Ban this poison, which pollutes our body, food and surroundings.

feedback: Mesdames et Messieurs les Commissaires Européens, Concernant lexportation de produits toxiques en cours de débat je pense que le moment est venu dadopter une position claire et éthique en interdisant lenvoi dans tout pays tiers de ces produits déjà bannis chez nous et porteurs de graves atteintes à lenvironnement. Nos propres agriculteurs, tout spécialement en France ne montrent pas lexemple en les utilisant massivement alors que leur effet dévastateur sur la biodiversité est prouvé. Eux-mêmes en sont les premières victimes. Au lieu de laisser aux géants de lagrobusiness lopportunité de faire des profits dans des pays moins regardants sur le plan des droits humains, mieux vaut pour notre avenir à tous envoyer un signal déterminé pour quils mettent les bouchées doubles vers une saine innovation vers un futur sans pesticides. Avec mon plus grand respect G ROYON
englishfeedback: Ladies and gentlemen, European Commissioners, with regard to the import of toxic products in the course of the debate, I think that the time has come to adopt a clear and ethical position by prohibiting the sending to any third country of such products already banned from us and causing serious environmental damage. Our own farmers, especially in France, do not show a massive use of them, even though their devastating effect on biodiversity is proven. They themselves are the first victims. Instead of giving the giants of agrobusiness the opportunity to make profits in countries that are less interested in human rights, it is better for all of us to send a clear signal that they are putting the twin sides towards a healthy innovation towards a future without pesticides. With my utmost respect G ROYON

feedback: Hallo, selbstverständlich sollte dies verboten werden, denn es geht ja nicht um Europa, sondern um den ganzen Planeten! Vielen Dank. Mit freundlichen Grüßen Elisabeth Dauzenroth
englishfeedback: Hello, of course, this should be banned because it is not about Europe, but about the whole planet! Many thanks. Yours sincerely, Elisabeth Dauzenroth

feedback: Si les produits sont dangereux pour lEurope, ils le sont aussi pour le reste du monde. Il n'y a pas de raison que ces produits dangereux restent commercialisés pour être utilisé hors Europe et empoisonné la population locale , voir par le commerce internationale toute la planète.
englishfeedback: While products are dangerous for Europe, they are dangerous for the rest of the world. There is no reason why these dangerous products should continue to be marketed for use outside Europe and poisoned the local population, or through international trade all over the world.

feedback: Je demande que les produits chimiques interdits dans l'Union Européenne ne soient plus produits pour être exportés.
englishfeedback: I am calling for chemicals banned in the European Union to no longer be produced for export.

feedback: Il faut interdir les produits chimiques dangereux. Ils mettent en péril notre vie et celle de nos enfants.
englishfeedback: Hazardous chemicals need to be intertwined. They put our lives and that of our children at risk.

feedback: Sehr geehrte Damen und Herren, Für mich ist es eine Selbstverständlichkeit, dass Chemikalien, die in der EU wegen Gefährlichkeit verboten sind, gar nicht erst hergestellt werden dürfen. Wenn sie exportiert werden, schädigen sie nicht nur Mensch und Natur in den Importländern, sondern sie kommen auch. auf Umwegen (Nahrung, Waren, Luft, Wasser) wieder in die EU zurück. Beste Grüße Beate Becker
englishfeedback: Ladies and gentlemen, for me it is self-evident that chemicals banned in the EU for dangerous reasons cannot be manufactured in the first place. When they are exported, they not only damage people and nature in importing countries, but they also return to the EU by re-routing (food, goods, air, water). Best wishes Beate Becker

feedback: Ich empfinde es als kurzsichtig, nachweislich natur- und menschen-schädigende Pestizide in Europa zu verbieten, aber in z.B. Afrika einsetzen zu lassen. Nachdem alles auf dieser Erde in Verbindung zueinander steht, werden die Auswirkungen eines Pestizidexportes früher oder später - auf heute noch nicht abzusehende Weise - auch Europa betreffen. Zudem ist die Entwicklung und Umsetzung naturfreundlicher Landwirtschaft möglich, wird aber durch den weiteren Einsatz von Bayer-Monsanto-Pestiziden gebremst. Ich bitte die europäische Führung um mehr Weitsicht und Rückgrat.
englishfeedback: I find it short-sighted to ban pesticides that have been shown to be harmful to nature and human beings in Europe, but to have them used in Africa, for example. As everything on this planet is interlinked, the effects of pesticide export sooner or later – in a way that cannot be predicted today – will affect Europe as well. In addition, the development and implementation of nature-friendly agriculture is possible, but is hampered by the continued use of Bayer-Monsanto pesticides. I ask the European leadership for a greater vision and backbone.

feedback: Madame,Monsieur, Interdire la production à des fins d'exportations de produits chimiques interdits dans l'U.E est une question de cohérence par rapport à la volonté affichée de transition écologique des Européens. Il est temps aussi d'instaurer d'autres rapports avec les pays tiers fondés sur le respect ,ces pays ont droit comme nous à la protection de leur environnement et de leurs populations. Cessons l'hypocrisie qui nous décrédibilise et engendre la méfiance! En espérant un vote favorable de votre part, Catherine Guibert
englishfeedback: Madam, Sir/Madam, Ban production for export of chemicals banned in the EU is a question of consistency with the declared desire for the green transition of Europeans. It is also time to establish other relations with third countries based on respect, these countries have the right, like us, to protect their environment and their populations. Let’s stop the hypocrisy that dissects us and causes mistrust! Hoping for a positive vote on your part, Catherine Guibert

feedback: Hola: Me parece poco ético producir sustancias que hemos prohibido en Europa, porque sabemos que son peligrosas y perjudiciales para la salud y el medio ambiente, y exportarlas a otros países con una legislación menos desarrollada. Este tipo de empresas no deberían tener existencia en nuestro continente, como el caso de Bayern-Monsanto. Lo primero es la salud y el medio ambiente. Espero que prohíban este tipo de negocios. Un saludo.
englishfeedback: Hello, It seems to me unethical to produce substances that we have banned in Europe, because we know that they are dangerous and harmful to health and the environment, and export them to other countries with less developed legislation. Such companies should not exist on our continent, such as Bayern-Monsanto. The first thing is health and the environment. I hope that they will ban this type of business. Regards.

feedback: La exportación de pesticidas tóxicos revela un doble rasero. Los pesticidas peligrosos están prohibidos en Europa por su relación con el cáncer, los problemas reproductivos y las enfermedades neurodegenerativas, así como con la muerte de las abejas. Además, se sabe que algunos provocan daño cerebral infantil y durante el embarazo. Si no usamos estos pesticidas por ser demasiado peligrosos, ¿cómo podemos permitir que se exporten? La exportación de pesticidas tóxicos es una cuestión de derechos humanos, ya que atentan contra la salud. Cada año, miles de personas que viven de la agricultura mueren por exponerse a estos peligrosos pesticidas. Numerosos estudios demuestran sus efectos nocivos. La exportación de pesticidas tóxicos perjudica a las abejas, la biodiversidad y el planeta. Los datos no mienten: los neonicotinoides y otros pesticidas tóxicos matan a las abejas. Por eso están prohibidos en Europa. ¿Cómo podemos permitir que se exporten a otros países? La industria de los pesticidas tóxicos se lucra con los países de normativas menos estrictas. Europa tiene que dar ejemplo y no permitir que sus empresas se aprovechen de una legislación más permisiva. ¿Cómo se nos puede tomar en serio si exportamos unos productos químicos que envenenan a las personas y la naturaleza? La prohibición de exportar pesticidas tóxicos fomentaría la innovación y animaría a Europa y al resto del mundo a utilizar técnicas fitosanitarias más sostenibles. Mantener en el mercado pesticidas obsoletos y peligrosos nos priva de un futuro más verde y de unas prácticas agrícolas más ecológicas. Según un dictamen jurídico del Centro de Derecho Ambiental Internacional publicado en 2022, la exportación de pesticidas prohibidos a África y América Central infringe los derechos humanos y las obligaciones legales internacionales de la UE.
englishfeedback: The export of toxic pesticides reveals double standards. Hazardous pesticides are banned in Europe because of their relationship with cancer, reproductive problems and neurodegenerative diseases, as well as the death of bees. In addition, some are known to cause brain damage for children and during pregnancy. If we do not use these pesticides because they are too dangerous, how can we allow them to be exported? The export of toxic pesticides is a human rights issue, as they harm health. Every year, thousands of people living in agriculture die from exposure to these dangerous pesticides. Numerous studies demonstrate its harmful effects. The export of toxic pesticides harms bees, biodiversity and the planet. The data do not feel: neonicotinoids and other toxic pesticides kill bees. This is why they are banned in Europe. How can we allow them to be exported to other countries? The toxic pesticide industry is profitable with countries with less stringent regulations. Europe needs to lead by example and not allow its businesses to take advantage of more permissive legislation. How can we be taken seriously if we export chemicals that poisonate people and nature? A ban on the export of toxic pesticides would encourage innovation and encourage Europe and the rest of the world to use more sustainable plant protection techniques. Keeping obsolete and dangerous pesticides on the market deprives us of a greener future and greener farming practices. According to a legal opinion of the International Environmental Law Centre published in 2022, the export of banned pesticides to Africa and Central America violates human rights and international legal obligations of the EU.

feedback: Buenos dias Estoy totalmente de acuerdo en prohibir la exportacion de pesticidas por las siguientes razones: La exportación de pesticidas tóxicos revela un doble rasero. Los pesticidas peligrosos están prohibidos en Europa por su relación con el cáncer, los problemas reproductivos y las enfermedades neurodegenerativas, así como con la muerte de las abejas. Además, se sabe que algunos provocan daño cerebral infantil y durante el embarazo. Si no usamos estos pesticidas por ser demasiado peligrosos, ¿cómo podemos permitir que se exporten? La exportación de pesticidas tóxicos es una cuestión de derechos humanos, ya que atentan contra la salud. Cada año, miles de personas que viven de la agricultura mueren por exponerse a estos peligrosos pesticidas. Numerosos estudios demuestran sus efectos nocivos. La exportación de pesticidas tóxicos perjudica a las abejas, la biodiversidad y el planeta. Los datos no mienten: los neonicotinoides y otros pesticidas tóxicos matan a las abejas. Por eso están prohibidos en Europa. ¿Cómo podemos permitir que se exporten a otros países? La industria de los pesticidas tóxicos se lucra con los países de normativas menos estrictas. Europa tiene que dar ejemplo y no permitir que sus empresas se aprovechen de una legislación más permisiva. ¿Cómo se nos puede tomar en serio si exportamos unos productos químicos que envenenan a las personas y la naturaleza? La prohibición de exportar pesticidas tóxicos fomentaría la innovación y animaría a Europa y al resto del mundo a utilizar técnicas fitosanitarias más sostenibles. Mantener en el mercado pesticidas obsoletos y peligrosos nos priva de un futuro más verde y de unas prácticas agrícolas más ecológicas. Según un dictamen jurídico del Centro de Derecho Ambiental Internacional publicado en 2022, la exportación de pesticidas prohibidos a África y América Central infringe los derechos humanos y las obligaciones legales internacionales de la UE. Espero que actuen en consecuencia
englishfeedback: Good days I fully agree to prohibit the export of pesticides for the following reasons: The export of toxic pesticides reveals double standards. Hazardous pesticides are banned in Europe because of their relationship with cancer, reproductive problems and neurodegenerative diseases, as well as the death of bees. In addition, some are known to cause brain damage for children and during pregnancy. If we do not use these pesticides because they are too dangerous, how can we allow them to be exported? The export of toxic pesticides is a human rights issue, as they harm health. Every year, thousands of people living in agriculture die from exposure to these dangerous pesticides. Numerous studies demonstrate its harmful effects. The export of toxic pesticides harms bees, biodiversity and the planet. The data do not feel: neonicotinoids and other toxic pesticides kill bees. This is why they are banned in Europe. How can we allow them to be exported to other countries? The toxic pesticide industry is profitable with countries with less stringent regulations. Europe needs to lead by example and not allow its businesses to take advantage of more permissive legislation. How can we be taken seriously if we export chemicals that poisonate people and nature? A ban on the export of toxic pesticides would encourage innovation and encourage Europe and the rest of the world to use more sustainable plant protection techniques. Keeping obsolete and dangerous pesticides on the market deprives us of a greener future and greener farming practices. According to a legal opinion of the International Environmental Law Centre published in 2022, the export of banned pesticides to Africa and Central America violates human rights and international legal obligations of the EU. I hope you will act accordingly

englishfeedback: The export of toxic pesticides reveals double standards. Hazardous pesticides are banned in Europe because of their relationship with cancer, reproductive problems and neurodegenerative diseases, as well as the death of bees. In addition, some are known to cause brain damage for children and during pregnancy. If we do not use these pesticides because they are too dangerous, how can we allow them to be exported? The export of toxic pesticides is a human rights issue, as they harm health. Every year, thousands of people living in agriculture die from exposure to these dangerous pesticides. Numerous studies demonstrate its harmful effects. The export of toxic pesticides harms bees, biodiversity and the planet. The data do not feel: neonicotinoids and other toxic pesticides kill bees. This is why they are banned in Europe. How can we allow them to be exported to other countries? The toxic pesticide industry is profitable with countries with less stringent regulations. Europe needs to lead by example and not allow its businesses to take advantage of more permissive legislation. How can we be taken seriously if we export chemicals that poisonate people and nature? A ban on the export of toxic pesticides would encourage innovation and encourage Europe and the rest of the world to use more sustainable plant protection techniques. Keeping obsolete and dangerous pesticides on the market deprives us of a greener future and greener farming practices. According to a legal opinion of the International Environmental Law Centre published in 2022, the export of banned pesticides to Africa and Central America violates human rights and international legal obligations of the EU.

feedback: Je suis complètement opposée à l'exportation de produits chimiques dangereux, qui sont interdits en Europe. Il est immonde et immoral d'empoisonner d'autres pays, pour l'unique profit de quelques uns. Je vous demande de vous opposer fermement à cet empoisonnement. Comptant sur votre engagement Bien à vous Mme Ernould
englishfeedback: I am completely opposed to the export of dangerous chemicals, which are banned in Europe. It is imworld and immoral to poison other countries, for the sole benefit of a few. I ask you to strongly oppose this poisoning. Counting on your commitment Good to you, Ms Ernould

feedback: Thank you for trying to stop a greedy industry from making profit by poisoning our whole world, casually causing harm to and possible extinction of a variety of lifeforms.

On ne peut pas interdire des produits chimiques parce qu'ils sont dangereux pour la santé, la biodiversité ou autre et en même temps les vendre dans des pays tiers. D'une part parce qu'il y a une possibilité que leurs cultures traitées avec ces produits reviennent sur le marché européen, d'autre part, parce que c'est mépriser ces populations en leur disant que c'est bien assez pour eux, donc les considérer comme des sous-européens, et enfin parce que la biodiversité n'a pas de frontières. Il est donc urgent que les multinationales de l'agroalimentaire arrêtent de nous dicter leur loi pour faire toujours plus de bénéfices puisqu'on sait bien que l'argent ne se mange pas et qu'il n'est pas utile de l'accumuler à l'infini dans la poche des actionnaires au détriment de l'immense majorité de la population et au détriment de la biodiversité. Tout ce qui est interdit pour l'Europe doit être interdit tout court et ne plus être fabriqué ni exporté. Bien cordialement, L. Pagani
englishfeedback: Chemicals cannot be banned because they are dangerous to health, biodiversity or other, and at the same time sold in third countries. On the one hand, because there is a possibility that their crops treated with these products will return to the European market; on the other hand, because it is to disregard these people by saying that it is quite enough for them, therefore to regard them as sub-Europeans, and finally because biodiversity has no borders. There is therefore an urgent need for multinational agri-food companies to stop forcing us to make ever more profits, since it is well known that money is not eaten and that it is not useful to accumulate it infinely in the pocket of shareholders to the detriment of the vast majority of the population and to the detriment of biodiversity. Everything that is forbidden for Europe must be banned at all times and no longer be manufactured or exported. Warmly, L. Pagani

feedback: Sehr geehrte Damen und Herren, natürlich spreche ich mich dafür aus, dass in der EU verbotene Pestizide NICHT in andere Länder exportiert werden dürfen. Das Verbot der Pestizide IN der EU hat ja seinen Grund, z.B. weil sie als gesundheits- oder umweltschädlich oder beides gelten. Daher erscheint es völlig unverantwortlich, zu tolerieren, dass AUSSERHALB der EU damit Schaden angerichtet wird. Analog des Lieferkettengesetzes ist die Verantwortung global zu sehen. Daher bitte ich Sie, auf ein Exportverbot hinzuwirken. Vielen Dank.
englishfeedback: Ladies and Gentlemen, of course, I am in favour that pesticides banned in the EU may NOT be exported to other countries. The reason for the ban on pesticides in the EU is, for example, because they are considered to be harmful to health or to the environment, or both. It therefore seems totally irresponsible to tolerate the damage caused to the EU by AUSSERHALB. By analogy with the Supply Chain Act, responsibility must be seen globally. I would therefore ask you to work towards an export ban. Many thanks.

feedback: No permitir su exportación a África y Sudamérica de pesticidas tóxicos que envenenan el planeta y ponen en peligro las pequeñas granjas y a las familias que viven de ellas. La UE debe poner fin a estas exportaciones. que deje de exportar sustancias químicas peligrosas!
englishfeedback: Not to allow their export to Africa and South America of toxic pesticides poisoning the planet and endangering small farms and their families. The EU must stop these exports, stop exporting hazardous chemicals!

feedback: On ne doit pas exporter les produits chimiques interdits en Europe. Chez nous, ils sont nocifs pour les populations et l'environnement, ailleurs aussi... Save the planet !
englishfeedback: Chemicals banned in Europe should not be exported. At home, they are harmful to people and the environment, also elsewhere... Save the planet!

feedback: Bonjour, L'Europe doit montrer l'exemple et renforcer sa cohérence. Elle doit mettre fin à l'exportation des pesticides dangereux alors même qu'ils sont interdits en Europe. Merci
englishfeedback: Hello, Europe must lead by example and strengthen its coherence. It must stop the export of hazardous pesticides even though they are banned in Europe. Thanks

feedback: Bonjour, L'exportation de pesticides toxiques profite des pays où la réglementation est moins stricte. L'UE a un rôle à jouer dans le monde - ses entreprises ne devraient pas être autorisées à profiter des pays où la réglementation est plus faible. Comment pouvons-nous être pris au sérieux si nous expédions nos produits chimiques dangereux à l'étranger, empoisonnant ainsi les populations et la nature dans des pays où les règles de sécurité sont plus faibles et moins strictement appliquées ? L'interdiction d'exporter des pesticides toxiques serait une opportunité unique pour l'innovation et aiderait l'Europe et le monde à évoluer vers des méthodes de protection des plantes plus durables. Le maintien sur le marché de pesticides anciens et dangereux nous prive d'un avenir plus vert et de pratiques agricoles plus durables. Un avis juridique du Center for International Environmental Law publié en 2022 montre que les exportations européennes de pesticides interdits vers l'Afrique et l'Amérique centrale violent les obligations juridiques internationales de l'UE et le droit relatif aux droits humains. C'est aussi honteux que de leur envoyer nos anciens véhicules polluants et de nous inciter à acheter des véhicules "propres". Cordialement, Alexis Boutin.
englishfeedback: Hello, The export of toxic pesticides benefits countries with less stringent regulation. The EU has a role to play in the world – its businesses should not be allowed to benefit from countries with weaker regulation. How can we be taken seriously if we send our hazardous chemicals abroad, poisoning people and nature in countries where safety rules are weaker and less strictly enforced? Banning the export of toxic pesticides would be a unique opportunity for innovation and would help Europe and the world to move towards more sustainable plant protection methods. Keeping old and dangerous pesticides on the market deprives us of a greener future and more sustainable agricultural practices. A legal opinion of the Center for International Environmental Law published in 2022 shows that European exports of banned pesticides to Africa and Central America violate the EU’s international legal obligations and human rights law. It’s just as shameful as sending them our old polluting vehicles and encouraging us to buy “clean” vehicles. Warmly, Alexis Boutin.

feedback: Srs. de la Comissió Europea Una vegada més els grans lobbies econòmics, encara marquen la ideologia que ha de seguir les grans institucions mundials o , com en aquest cas, la UE. Tots ells, se suposa, creats en defensa dels més elementals principis i drets humans. El tema no fa res més que evidenciar, malgrat l'elevada despesa pública destinada, la poca capacitat i credibilitat que té la UE. No és hora de què la UE, més que demanar suport als seus ciutadans, ( sensació d'impotència institucional) faci una anàlisi crítica sobre els interessos ocults dels seus membres, que sembla que molts d'ells s'han oblidat dels principis ètics com a ciutadans i del codi deontològic com a representats legals de la ciutadania? Les votacions de la UE contra les exportacions serà un bon indicador que evidenciarà qui mana Salutacions
englishfeedback: European Commissioner, A vegade més els Grans lobbies, embodies the ideologies to be followed by the Grans Institus Globals or, in aquest, the EU. Tots ellS, daughter, creats in defence of més elementals principis i Drets humans. The issue does not seem to me, Malgrat l’alta Despesa destinada, the limited Capacitat i credibilitat that the EU had. It’s not time for the EU to demand suport als seus Ciutadans, faci n an Anàlisi critic about the interesting hidden ones dels seus membres, which sat that molts d’ellS s’han oblidat dels principis ètics com a Ciutadans i del Codi deontolàgic com a representats legals de la ciutadania? EU voters against exporters serà a bon indicator showing that they are qui mana Salutacions

feedback: Geachte leden van de Europese Commissie, met deze verzoek ik u om Het wetgevingsinitiatief met tot doel een mechanisme in te voeren dat de productie en/of uitvoer van bepaalde gevaarlijke chemische stoffen die in de EU verboden zijn, goed te keuren om niet-EU-landen te beschermen tegen de negatieve gevolgen ervan voor de menselijke gezondheid en het milieu. Het initiatief zal het interne en het externe beleid verder op elkaar afstemmen en de internationale reputatie van de EU verbeteren. Op die manier komen we een verbintenis na die we zijn aangegaan in het kader van de EU-strategie voor duurzame chemische stoffen. Geen bijen : geen leven ! Hoogachtend, Gino SMEKENS Rue de Bohée 56 5575 Gedinne België
englishfeedback: Dear Members of the European Commission, with this request, I invite you to adopt the legislative initiative to introduce a mechanism for the production and/or export of certain hazardous chemicals banned in the EU to protect non-EU countries from their negative effects on human health and the environment. The initiative will further align internal and external policies and improve the EU’s international reputation. In this way, we are delivering on a commitment we have made under the EU Chemicals Strategy for Sustainability. No bees: no life! Yours faithfully, Gino Smekens Rue de Bohée 56 5575 Gedinne Belgium

feedback: Agrarkonzerne wie BASF und Bayer-Monsanto machen riesige Gewinne mit dem Export giftiger Pestizide nach Afrika und Südamerika. Damit gefährden sie das Leben der Menschen, die dort in der Landwirtschaft arbeiten und vergiften den Planeten. [1] In Europa sind diese Pestizide verboten, weil sie zu schädlich sind. Aber der Export ist erlaubt: Das ist eine Doppelmoral! Die gefährlichen Pestizide wurden in Europa verboten, nachdem sie mit Krebs, Beeinträchtigung der Fruchtbarkeit und neurodegenerativen Krankheiten in Verbindung gebracht wurden - zum Bienensterben tragen sie auch bei und sollen Hirnschäden bei Kindern und ungeborenen Babys verursachen. Wenn diese Pestizide für uns so schädlich sind, dass sie verboten werden: Wie können wir dann zulassen, dass sie exportiert werden? Seit die EU-Kommission erwägt endlich auch ein Exportverbot zu erlassen, versucht die Pestizidindustrie unseren Entscheidungsträger*innen Angst zu machen und argumentiert mit dem Verlust von Arbeitsplätzen. Stattdessen müssen aber diese Argumente zählen: Die Ausfuhr von giftigen Pestiziden ist eine Frage der Menschenrechte, denn die Pestizide schaden den Menschen: Jedes Jahr sterben Tausende von Landwirt*innen durch den Kontakt mit gefährlichen Pestiziden. Es gibt unzählige Studien, die die schädlichen Auswirkungen der exportierten Pestizide auf den Menschen belegen. Die Ausfuhr giftiger Pestizide ist desaströs für Bienen, die biologische Vielfalt und den Planeten. Die Beweislage ist eindeutig: Neonics und andere giftige Pestizide töten Bienen. Deshalb sind sie in Europa verboten. Wir dürfen nicht zulassen, dass diese Pestizide in Länder exportiert werden, in denen Gesundheitsvorschriften weniger streng sind und dort Bienen und die biologische Vielfalt zerstören. Länder, in denen es kaum Vorschriften für giftige Pestizide gibt, werden als Markt benutzt. Europäische Unternehmen sollten nicht die Möglichkeit haben, diesen Umstand auszunutzen. Wie kann Europa als Weltmacht ernst genommen werden, wenn wir gefährliche Chemikalien ins Ausland verschiffen und dabei Mensch und Natur in Ländern vergiften, in denen Sicherheitsvorschriften geringer sind und weniger streng durchgesetzt werden? Ein Exportverbot für giftige Pestizide würde Europa und der Welt helfen, zu nachhaltigeren Pflanzenschutzmethoden überzugehen. Wenn gefährliche Pestizide auf dem Markt bleiben, werden wir weiter auf eine grünere Zukunft und nachhaltige Landwirtschaft warten müssen. Ein Rechtsgutachten des Center for International Environmental Law, das 2022 veröffentlicht wurde, zeigt, dass die EU mit dem Export verbotener Pestizide nach Afrika Menschenrechte gefährdet Ich fordere ein Exportverbot jetzt! Referenzen: [1] https://www.publiceye.ch/en/topics/pesticides/banned-in-europe
englishfeedback: Agricultural groups such as BASF and Bayer-Monsanto make huge profits from exporting toxic pesticides to Africa and South America. As a result, they threaten the lives of people working in agriculture and poisoning the planet. These pesticides are banned in Europe because they are too harmful. But export is allowed: This is a double standard! Hazardous pesticides have been banned in Europe after being associated with cancer, fertility impairment and neurodegenerative diseases, contributing to bee mortality and causing brain damage in children and unborn babies. If these pesticides are so harmful to us that they are banned: How can we then allow them to be exported? Since the European Commission has finally considered an export ban, the pesticide industry is trying to make our decision-makers afraid and argues that jobs have been lost. Instead, these arguments must count: The export of toxic pesticides is a human rights issue, as pesticides harm people: Every year thousands of farmers die from exposure to hazardous pesticides. There are countless studies demonstrating the harmful effects of exported pesticides on humans. Exports of toxic pesticides are desastrous for bees, biodiversity and the planet. The evidence is clear: Neonics and other toxic pesticides kill bees. This is why they are banned in Europe. We cannot allow these pesticides to be exported to countries where health rules are less stringent and where bees and biodiversity are destroyed. Countries with little regulation on toxic pesticides are used as a market. European companies should not be able to take advantage of this fact. How can Europe be taken seriously as a global power when we ship dangerous chemicals abroad, poisoning people and nature in countries where safety rules are lower and enforcement is less stringent? A ban on exports of toxic pesticides would help Europe and the world move towards more sustainable plant protection practices. If hazardous pesticides remain on the market, we will have to wait for a greener future and sustainable agriculture. A legal opinion from the Center for International Environmental Law, published in 2022, shows that the EU is putting human rights at risk by exporting banned pesticides to Africa I call for an export ban now! Client references [1] https://www.publiceye.ch/en/topics/pesticides/banned-in-europe

feedback: Bonjour, L'Europe ne peut pas être une ile bleue au milieu d'un monde noir, mais doit rester bleue. Fournir des produits dangereux pour les recevoir en retour après traitement ou camouflage est inacceptable. Importer des produits non conformes à ce qui est la règle communautaire doit être surveillé (contrôle systématique et pas seulement en %) et contraint.
englishfeedback: Hello, Europe cannot be blue in the middle of a black world, but must remain blue. Providing dangerous products for return after treatment or camouflage is unacceptable. Import of products which do not comply with what is the Community rule must be monitored (systematic control and not only in%) and forced.

feedback: Je souhaite que les produits dangereux identifiés par l'Union européenne ne soient pas autorisés dans le monde et surtout produits afin d'être exportés. Il en va de la santé de l'humanité
englishfeedback: I would like dangerous products identified by the European Union not to be authorised worldwide and, above all, produced for export. The health of humanity is at stake

feedback: Credo che per un basilare principio di credibilità e coerenza, l'EU non deve esportare in altri paesi sostanze chimiche vietate nel territorio dell'Unione, indipendentemente dal paese in cui vengono prodotte.
englishfeedback: I believe that for a basic principle of credibility and consistency, the EU must not export chemicals banned in the territory of the Union to other countries, regardless of the country in which they are produced.

feedback: Ich unterstütze das Verbot der Herstellung und Ausfuhrung vollumfänglich!
englishfeedback: I fully support the ban on production and export!

feedback: Estoy a favor de prohibir la exportación de sustancias químicas que la UE considera peligrosas. Si existen leyes que prohíben esas sustancias en la UE no se puede justificar moralmente producirla y exportarlas. Estas sustancias son peligrosas independientemente de su situación en el mundo, me parece indigno y amoral aprovecharse de leyes menos avanzadas en otros países del mundo para poner en peligro la salud y bienestar de otros pueblos
englishfeedback: I am in favour of banning the export of chemicals that the EU considers dangerous. If there are laws prohibiting such substances in the EU, it cannot be morally justified to produce and export them. These substances are dangerous regardless of their situation in the world, I find it undignified and love to take advantage of less advanced laws in other countries of the world to endanger the health and well-being of other peoples.

feedback: merci de ne pas autoriser d exporter les pesticides, merci de proteger la biodiversite
englishfeedback: thank you for not authorising the export of pesticides, please protect biodiversity

feedback: Debemos legislar la prohibición de la producción de sustancias químicas peligrosas en todo el mundo para que no sé exporten a países que permitan su entrada. Las empresas siempre buscan los huecos son legislación para sus beneficios empresariales, y a posterior los ciudadanos del mundo costeamos sus consecuencias a corto y largo plazo.
englishfeedback: We must legislate to ban the production of dangerous chemicals around the world so that I do not know to export to countries that allow them to enter. Businesses always look for the gaps are legislation for their business profits, and later the world’s citizens pay for its consequences in the short and long term.

feedback: L'esportazione di pesticidi tossici è dannosa per le api, la biodiversità e il pianeta. Le prove sono chiare: i neonicotinoidi e altri pesticidi velenosi uccidono le api. Ecco perché sono vietati in Europa. Perché continuiamo a permettere che vengano esportati in Paesi uccidendo le api e decimando la biodiversità? Inoltre, l'esportazione di pesticidi tossici è una questione di diritti umani, poiché questi pesticidi tossici danneggiano le persone: ogni anno, migliaia di agricoltori muoiono per l'esposizione di pesticidi pericolosi. Esistono innumerevoli studi che dimostrano gli effetti dannosi sulle persone dei pesticidi esportati. Un divieto di esportazione dei pesticidi tossici sarebbe un vantaggio per l'innovazione e aiuterebbe l'Europa e il mondo intero verso pratiche agricole più sostenibili. Mantenere sul mercato pesticidi vecchi e pericolosi ci priva di un futuro più verde e di pratiche agricole più sostenibili.
englishfeedback: The export of toxic pesticides is detrimental to bees, biodiversity and the planet. The evidence is clear: neonicotinoids and other poisonous pesticides kill bees. This is why they are banned in Europe. Why do we continue to allow them to be exported to countries by killing bees and deciding on biodiversity? In addition, the export of toxic pesticides is a human rights issue, as these toxic pesticides harm people: every year, thousands of farmers die from exposure of hazardous pesticides. There are countless studies demonstrating the harmful effects of exported pesticides on people. A ban on the export of toxic pesticides would benefit innovation and help Europe and the world towards more sustainable farming practices. Keeping old and hazardous pesticides on the market deprives us of a greener future and more sustainable farming practices.

feedback: Je suis pour l'interdiction de la production à des fins d'exportation de produits chimiques interdits dans l'Union Européenne. Un produits dangereux pour l'homme ne devient pas vertueux en passant les frontières, il faut mettre de la cohérence à l'échelle planétaire dans nos décisions pour préserver à la fois l'humain et sont espace vitale qui s'appelle la terre.
englishfeedback: I am in favour of banning the production for export of chemicals banned in the European Union. A product that is dangerous for humans does not become virtuous when crossing borders, we need to put global coherence in our decisions in order to preserve both humans and a vital space called the earth.

feedback: Planeta solo hay uno y prohibir pesticidas y fitosanitarios nocivos en una pequeña parte del mismo ni siquiera es una pobre solución. No debemos permitir que los intereses económicos de unos pocos prevalezcan sobre la vida de muchos y la sostenibilidad del mundo que nos pertenece a todos. Tenemos la obligación de preservarlo para futuras generaciones. Es mejor que se pierdan unos cuantos puestos de trabajo (que podrían trasladarse a industrias ecológicas respetuosas con el medio ambiente) a que se condene a muerte a muchas personas, niños incluidos, aunque no sean europeos. A mayor abundamiento y ampliando el foco, desearía que los gobiernos trabajarán para el interés general y para el bien común, presente y futuro, en todos los ámbitos en lugar de plegarse servilmente a los dictados de las grandes corporaciones que ya están por encima de los estados y que amenazan a las democracias que con tanto esfuerzo se han conseguido.
englishfeedback: There is only one planet and a ban on harmful pesticides and plant protection products in a small part of it is not even a poor solution. We should not allow the economic interests of a few to prevail over the lives of many and the sustainability of the world that belongs to us all. We have an obligation to preserve it for future generations. It is better that a few jobs (which could be transferred to eco-friendly industries) are lost to condemning many people, including children, even if they are not European. For the sake of completeness and broadening the focus, I would like governments to work for the general interest and for the common good, present and future, in all areas, rather than to rely on the dictates of the big corporations that are already above the states and that threaten democracies that have been so hard.

feedback: Dear representatives, Pesticides and other biocides are poisoning the environment and destroying biodiversity and soil productivity. I ask that they eliminate the use of pesticides. The best way to produce food is with regenerative agriculture. I'll give you a https://polyfarming.eu/?lang=es Sincerely, jordi
englishfeedback: DEAR representatives, Pesticides and other biocidal products are poisoning the environment and destroying biodiversity and soil productivity. I ask that you eliminate the use of pesticides. The best way to produce food is with Regenerative agriculture. I'll give you to https://polyfarming.eu/?lang=es sincerely, Jordi

feedback: Fundamentem naszego wspólnego dobra powinno być zupełne wycofanie pestycydów nie tylko w Europie ale i na całym Świecie. Dobrym przykładem i ukieronkowaniem dla tego typu działania będzie miało zwiększenie zaufania społeczeństwa do instytucji europejskich, wiekszej ochrony dla środowiska naturalnego. Przy obecnych zmianach klimatu my ludzie wspólnymi siłami, każdy jak tylko potrafi od jednostki po organizacje może mieć znaczący wpływ na ochronę ekosystemu. W dłuższej perspektywie jest to bardzo ważne dla każdego z nas od największych firm do pojedynczego człowieka. Najważniejsza inwestycja w przyszłość to życie ale to życie jest teraz zaburzane przez wielkie pieniądze nie pozwólmy zniszczyć im siebie i nas oraz całej naszej planety.
englishfeedback: The cornerstone of our common good should be the complete phase-out of pesticides not only in Europe but throughout the world. A good example and direction for this type of action will be to increase public confidence in the European institutions and to protect the environment more effectively. In the current climate change, we people together, everybody knows from individuals to organisations can have a significant impact on ecosystem protection. In the long run, this is very important for each of us from the largest companies to a single human being. The most important investment in the future is life, but this life is now disrupted by huge money, let’s not destroy ourselves and our planet as a whole.

feedback: Det är hög tid att ni som beslutsfattare tar ert ansvar och förbjuder inte bara användning utan även produktion av skadliga kemikalier. Vidare bör kraven för att få godkänt kemikalier höjas avsevärt. Oberoende test med höga krav på ex hur kemikalier reagerar med andra substanser, hur de bryts ner i naturen och våra kroppar mm bör noga vägas in och krävas innan dessa ämnen tillåts att produceras och säljas - oavsett var i världen.
englishfeedback: It is high time that you, as a decision-maker, take responsibility and ban not only the use but also the production of harmful chemicals. Furthermore, the requirements for authorised chemicals should be significantly increased. Independent tests with high standards for e.g. how chemicals react with other substances, how they decompose in nature and our bodies, etc. should be carefully weighed in and required before these substances are allowed to be produced and sold – no matter where in the world.

feedback: Were exporting dozens of pesticides who have a dramatic impact on the local fauna, flora but also the health of not only local farmers but also all people living in rural areas. There are dozens of documentaries testimoning this, look for example at the below. And then the harvest of the plants grown with our pesticides typically in South America are then coming back to feed our meat breeders in Europe. Yo avoid that such pesticides are produced somewhere else in the world, we should also work on this importations. We should stop exporting forbidden pesticides AND stop importing plants containing any residual presence of these pesticides ! Thanks and kind regards Arnaud https://justicepesticides.org/2022/07/20/reportage-de-arte-pesticides-lhypocrisie-europeenne-a-voir-jusquau-3-aout/

gefährliche pestizide gefährden mensch und tier und die artenvielfalt insgesamt. sie in andere länder zu verschicken ist zynisch und dumm. diese erde ist ein zusammenhängendes system. alles, was wir uns antun, tun wir über kurz oder lang allen anderen an. wir müssen unsere landwirtschaft ändern in hinblick auf boden, bewässerung und düngung. jetzt!! wir sind nicht schlauer als das leben selbst. wir sind ein teil und nicht sein meister. permakultur arbeitet auf diese weise und erzielt pro qm mehr ertrag als jede monokultur.
englishfeedback: dangerous pesticides threaten human and animal health and biodiversity as a whole. It is cynical and fraught. This is a coherent system. We are doing everything we do for short or long to all others. We need to change our farming sector to ground, irrigate and fertilise. We are not slower than we live. We are part and not mastering. Permaculture works on this and produces more per m² than any monoculture.

feedback: La exportación de pesticidas tóxicos es una cuestión de derechos humanos, ya que atentan contra la salud. Cada año, miles de personas que viven de la agricultura mueren por exponerse a estos peligrosos pesticidas. Numerosos estudios demuestran sus efectos nocivos.
englishfeedback: The export of toxic pesticides is a human rights issue, as they harm health. Every year, thousands of people living in agriculture die from exposure to these dangerous pesticides. Numerous studies demonstrate its harmful effects.

feedback: Please accept my comments as written below: -The export of toxic pesticides exposes a double standard: Dangerous pesticides are banned in Europe after they were linked to cancer, reproductive problems and neurodegenerative diseases as well as the dying of bees. Some of these pesticides are banned in Europe because of their links to brain damage in children and unborn babies. If these pesticides are too dangerous for us, how can we allow them to be exported? -The export of toxic pesticides is a human rights issue as these toxic pesticides are damaging to people: Every year, thousands of farmers die from exposure to dangerous pesticides. The pesticides exported have countless studies supporting the damaging effects on people. -The export of toxic pesticides is bad for the bees, biodiversity and the planet. The evidence is clear: neonics and other poisonous pesticides kill bees. Thats why theyre banned in Europe. Why are we still allowing them to be exported to countries with weaker regulation, killing bees and decimating biodiversity? -The export of toxic pesticides is taking advantage of countries with weaker regulation. Europe has a role to play in the world - its companies should not be allowed to take advantage of countries with weaker regulation. How can we be taken seriously if we ship our hazardous chemicals abroad, poisoning people and nature in the process in countries where safety regulations are weaker and less strictly enforced. -An export ban of toxic pesticides would be a boon for innovation and help Europe and the world move towards more sustainable plant protection methods. Keeping old and dangerous pesticides on the market is depriving us from a greener future and more sustainable farming practices. -A legal opinion by the Center for International Environmental Law published in 2022 shows that EU exports of banned pesticides to Africa and Central America violate the EUs international legal obligations and human rights law. This message was sent as part of a public pesticide regulation campaign by WeMove Europe. I am not affiliated or employed with this organization, simply participating as an individual advocate.

Ich bitte dringend um das Verbot der Herstellung und Ausfuhr von Chemikalien, die in der EU verboten sind. Sie sind verboten, weil sie uns Menschen und Tiere, die wichtig für das Ökosystem sind, gefährlich sind. Ich möchte, dass es aufhört, dass hier Firmen Geld verdienen, und in anderen Teilen der Erde Menschen davon krank werden und sterben. Außerdem wird das Gift weiter getragen durch Wind und Wetter. Die Erde und die Menschen brauchen eine Landwirtschaft, die frei von Gift ist und sich nicht nach Gewinnoptimierung richtig, sondern, dass wir alle gesund essen können.
englishfeedback: I urge you to ban the production and export of chemicals that are banned in the EU. They are banned because they are dangerous for us, humans and animals that are important for the ecosystem. I want it to stop companies earning money here and people in other parts of the world get ill and die. In addition, the poison continues to be worn by wind and weather. The planet and people need an agriculture that is free from poison and is not right after profit-optimisation, but that we can all eat healthyly.

feedback: Om vi har standarder för gifter i t.ex. jordbruket är det oansvarigt att utsätta de som arbetar där utanför EU med de risker som är för stora i EU genom att exportera giftiga kemikalier.
englishfeedback: If we have standards for toxins in agriculture, for example, it is irresponsible to expose those working there outside the EU with the risks that are too high in the EU by exporting toxic chemicals.

feedback: L'exportation de pesticides toxiques révèle une politique de deux poids deux mesures : Les pesticides dangereux sont interdits en Europe après avoir été associés à des cancers, des problèmes de reproduction et des maladies neurodégénératives, ainsi qu'à la mort des abeilles. Certains de ces pesticides sont même interdits en Europe en raison de leur lien avec des lésions cérébrales chez les enfants et les bébés à naître. Si ces pesticides sont trop dangereux pour nous, comment pouvons-nous autoriser leur exportation ? Est-ce que le droit à la santé et à la vie serait moindre dans les pays du tiers monde que chez nous ? Comment pouvons nous nous rendre complice d'une telle ignominie ?
englishfeedback: The export of toxic pesticides reveals a double standard policy: Hazardous pesticides are banned in Europe after being associated with cancer, reproductive problems and neurodegenerative diseases, as well as bee death. Some of these pesticides are even banned in Europe because of their link to brain damage in children and born babies. If these pesticides are too dangerous for us, how can we authorise their export? Would the right to health and life be lower in third world countries than at home? How can we become complicit in such an ignominy?

feedback: Chiedo di vietare la produzione per l'esportazione di sostenze chimiche vietate nell'Unione europea I motivi sono molteplici e credo siano del tutto logici e condivisibili : 1 L'esportazione di pesticidi tossici è dannosa per le api, la biodiversità e il pianeta. Le prove sono chiare: i neonicotinoidi e altri pesticidi velenosi uccidono le api. Ecco perché sono vietati in Europa. Perché continuiamo a permettere che vengano esportati in Paesi uccidendo le api e decimando la biodiversità? 2 Il divieto di esportazione dei pesticidi tossici sarebbe un vantaggio per l'innovazione e aiuterebbe l'Europa e il mondo intero verso pratiche agricole più sostenibili. Mantenere sul mercato pesticidi vecchi e pericolosi ci priva di un futuro più verde e di pratiche agricole più sostenibili. 3 L'Europa ha un ruolo da svolgere nel mondo: non si deve permettere alle sue aziende di approfittare dei paesi con una regolamentazione più debole. Come possiamo essere presi sul serio se spediamo le nostre sostanze chimiche pericolose all'estero, avvelenando le persone e la natura in paesi dove le norme di sicurezza sono più deboli e meno rigorose?
englishfeedback: I call for a ban on production for the export of chemical support banned in the European Union. The reasons are many and I believe they are entirely logical and acceptable: 1 the export of toxic pesticides is detrimental to bees, biodiversity and the planet. The evidence is clear: neonicotinoids and other poisonous pesticides kill bees. This is why they are banned in Europe. Why do we continue to allow them to be exported to countries by killing bees and deciding on biodiversity? 2 the export ban on toxic pesticides would benefit innovation and help Europe and the world towards more sustainable farming practices. Keeping old and hazardous pesticides on the market deprives us of a greener future and more sustainable farming practices. 3 Europe has a role to play in the world: its companies should not be allowed to take advantage of countries with weaker regulation. How can we be taken seriously if we ship our hazardous chemicals abroad, poisoning people and nature in countries where safety standards are weaker and lower?

feedback: È moralmente ed economicamente sbagliato nonchè totalmente stupido proibire luso di pesticidi tossici e dannosi in europa e poi importare dal resto del mondo i prodotti coltivati con gli stessi pesticidi . Se devastano l ambiente e fanno male qui lo faranno anche da altre parti. Inoltre i prodotti europei risulteranno sicuramente meno competitivi rispetto a quelli prodotti coi pesticidi in oggetto. Quando ero giovane, destate i campi erano pieni di lucciole adesso non ce nè più una. Tolleranza zero abbiamo distrutto abbastanza. Viva le api.
englishfeedback: It is morally and economically wrong and totally stupid to prohibit the use of toxic and harmful pesticides in Europe and then import products grown with the same pesticides from the rest of the world. If they devastate the environment and do harm here, they will also do so from other parties. Moreover, European products will certainly be less competitive than those produced with the pesticides in question. When I was young, the fields were filled with hazelnuts now there is no longer one. Zero tolerance has been destroyed enough. Live bees.

feedback: Ces pesticides dangereux sont interdits en Europe après avoir été associés à des cancers, des problèmes de reproduction et des maladies neurodégénératives, ainsi qu'à la mort des abeilles. Certains de ces pesticides sont même interdits en Europe en raison de leur lien avec des lésions cérébrales chez les enfants et les bébés à naître. Si ces pesticides sont trop dangereux pour nous, comment pouvons-nous autoriser leur exportation ? Sachez que chaque année, des milliers d'agriculteurs meurent des suites dune trop forte exposition à ces pesticides dangereux. Les pesticides exportés font l'objet d'innombrables études qui confirment leurs effets néfastes sur les humains. Les preuves sont claires : les néonics et autres pesticides dangereux tuent les abeilles. C'est pourquoi ils sont interdits en Europe. Pourquoi autorisons-nous encore leur exportation vers des pays où la réglementation est moins stricte, alors quils continueront de tuer les abeilles et décimer la biodiversité ? L'UE a un rôle à jouer dans le monde - ses entreprises ne devraient pas être autorisées à profiter des pays où la réglementation est plus faible. Comment pouvons-nous être pris au sérieux si nous expédions nos produits chimiques dangereux à l'étranger, empoisonnant ainsi les populations et la nature dans des pays où les règles de sécurité sont plus faibles et moins strictement appliquées ? Merci de faire le bon choix, c'est à dire respecter le vivant, aucun produit dangereux ne devrait être crée. La vie ou quelle soit est importante, Il n'est pas envisageable de cautionner des produits qui vont nuire à la planète, ses habitants humains et non humains, tout cela pour le profit de grandes firmes tueuses du VIVANT.
englishfeedback: These hazardous pesticides are banned in Europe after being associated with cancer, reproductive problems and neurodegenerative diseases, as well as bee death. Some of these pesticides are even banned in Europe because of their link to brain damage in children and born babies. If these pesticides are too dangerous for us, how can we authorise their export? Be aware that every year thousands of farmers die as a result of too high exposure to these hazardous pesticides. Exported pesticides are subject to countless studies confirming their adverse effects on humans. The evidence is clear: neonics and other hazardous pesticides kill bees. This is why they are banned in Europe. Why do we still allow their export to countries with less stringent regulation, while they will continue to kill bees and decay biodiversity? The EU has a role to play in the world – its businesses should not be allowed to benefit from countries with weaker regulation. How can we be taken seriously if we send our hazardous chemicals abroad, poisoning people and nature in countries where safety rules are weaker and less strictly enforced? Thank you for making the right choice, i.e. respecting living conditions, no dangerous products should be created. Life or what is important, it is not possible to endorse products that will harm the planet, its human and non-human inhabitants, all for the benefit of the great killer companies of the VIVANT.

feedback: The export of toxic pesticides is bad for the bees, biodiversity, and the future of our planet. There is clear evidence that neonics and other poisonous pesticides kill bees and many other vitally important insect pollinators. These extremly dangerous pesticides have also been linked to cancer, reproductive problems and neurological diseases in addition to their egregious role in the catastrophic decline in populations of beneficial insects. Hence, these toxic chemicals are banned in Europe. There is, therefore, a clear, compelling, moral and ethical duty and responsibility not to allow them to be exported to countries with weaker regulation, widening and accelerating the global killing of bees and other pollinators; poisoning people and the planet; and decimating biodiversity. To further permit the export of such egregiously toxic chemicals when the whole world is in the grip of an accellerating ecological extinction crisis further exacerbated by the compounding effects of runaway global heating and the increasingly malign impacts of worsening climate change driven catastrophes would be both unacceptable and unforgiveable. Indeed, in a 2022 legal opinion, the Centre for International Environment Law stated that EU exports of banned pesticides to Africa and Central America are in violation of EUs international legal obligations and human rights law. Unquestionably, we must act right now to establish and enforce a total ban on the exportation of toxic chemical pesticides.

Les dangers des pesticides ne s'arrêtent pas aux frontières et la situation actuelle ressemble à du deux poids deux mesures. Ces produits ont des effets nocifs sur les humains, les abeilles, la biodiversité, comment peut-on les envoyer dans d'autres pays. L'interdiction d'exporter des pesticides toxiques serait une opportunité unique pour l'innovation et aiderait l'Europe et le monde à évoluer vers des méthodes de protection des plantes plus durables. Le maintien sur le marché de pesticides anciens et dangereux nous prive d'un avenir plus vert et de pratiques agricoles plus durables.
englishfeedback: The dangers of pesticides do not stop at borders and the current situation resembles double standards. These products have harmful effects on humans, bees, biodiversity, and how to send them to other countries. Banning the export of toxic pesticides would be a unique opportunity for innovation and would help Europe and the world to move towards more sustainable plant protection methods. Keeping old and dangerous pesticides on the market deprives us of a greener future and more sustainable agricultural practices.

feedback: L'exportation de pesticides toxiques est une question de droits humains , car ces pesticides sont nocifs pour notre santé. Des pesticides dangereux sont interdits en Europe après avoir été associés à des cancers, des problèmes de reproduction et des maladies neurodégénératives, ainsi qu'à la mort des abeilles. Certains de ces pesticides sont même interdits en Europe en raison de leur lien avec des lésions cérébrales chez les enfants et les bébés à naître. Si ces pesticides sont trop dangereux pour nous, comment pouvons-nous autoriser leur exportation ? L'interdiction d'exporter des pesticides toxiques serait une opportunité unique pour l'innovation et aiderait l'Europe et le monde à évoluer vers des méthodes de protection des plantes plus durables. Le maintien sur le marché de pesticides anciens et dangereux nous prive d'un avenir plus vert et de pratiques agricoles plus durables.
englishfeedback: The export of toxic pesticides is a human rights issue, as these pesticides are harmful to our health. Hazardous pesticides are banned in Europe after being associated with cancer, reproductive problems and neurodegenerative diseases, as well as bee death. Some of these pesticides are even banned in Europe because of their link to brain damage in children and born babies. If these pesticides are too dangerous for us, how can we authorise their export? Banning the export of toxic pesticides would be a unique opportunity for innovation and would help Europe and the world to move towards more sustainable plant protection methods. Keeping old and dangerous pesticides on the market deprives us of a greener future and more sustainable agricultural practices.

feedback: Bonjour, Je pense qu'il serait logique d'interdire l'exportation des produits chimiques interdits dans l'EU car : - La pollution générée même en dehors de l'UE peut avoir un impact indirect sur celle-ci, par exemple via l'import de produit alimentaires traités avec ces produits hors UE. Également les dégâts faits sur les écosystèmes (réduction de la biodiversité) quelque qu'en soit le lieu ont un impact sur l'ensemble des équilibres de notre planète. - A partir du moment ou l'on a acquis la connaissance d'un risque, on a la responsabilité d'agir pour protéger toute personnes de celui-ci. Continuer de vendre des produits dont la toxicité est documenté est une mise en danger délibérée dautrui. - La production sur le sol Européen de molécules toxiques même sans vente sur le marché intérieur, n'écarte pas le risque de pollution locale en cas d'incident industriel. Merci, Alexandre
englishfeedback: Hello, I think it would make sense to ban the export of chemicals banned in the EU because: — Pollution generated even outside the EU may have an indirect impact on the EU, for example through the import of food products treated with these products outside the EU. Also damage to ecosystems (reduction of biodiversity) anywhere in the world has an impact on the balance of our planet as a whole. — From the time when knowledge of a risk has been acquired, it is responsible for taking action to protect all persons of that risk. Continuing to sell products whose toxicity is documented is a deliberate danger to others. — The production on European soil of toxic molecules even without sales on the internal market does not eliminate the risk of local pollution in the event of an industrial incident. Thank you, Alexander

feedback: Die Herstellung und Ausfuhr von in der EU verbotenen gefährlichen Chemikalien gefährdet nicht nur die Gesundheit der Bevölkerung und der Böden in den einführenden Ländern. Der Export, der damit kultivierten landwirtschaftlichen Produkte in die EU, bewirkt damit auch eine Kontamination der in der EU verfügbaren Nahrungsmittel und somit eine Gefährdung der Gesundheit der europäischen Bevölkerung. Nicht nur wegen des Bommerang-Effekts, sondern auch aus globalem Verantwortungsbewusstsein sollten diese in der EU verbotenen Chemikalien nicht exportiert werden dürfen.
