An export ban would be a boon for innovation and help Europe and the world move towards more sustainable plant protection methods. Keeping old and dangerous pesticides on the market is depriving us of a greener future and more sustainable farming practices. Thank you for your attention to this important matter. Sincerely, Michał Gawełczyk

L'exportation de pesticides toxiques révèle une politique de deux poids deux mesures : Les pesticides dangereux sont interdits en Europe après avoir été associés à des cancers, des problèmes de reproduction et des maladies neurodégénératives, ainsi qu'à la mort des abeilles. Certains de ces pesticides sont même interdits en Europe en raison de leur lien avec des lésions cérébrales chez les enfants et les bébés à naître. Si ces pesticides sont trop dangereux pour nous, comment pouvons-nous autoriser leur exportation ? L'exportation de pesticides toxiques est une question de droits humains , car ces pesticides sont nocifs pour notre santé : Chaque année, des milliers d'agriculteurs meurent des suites dune trop forte exposition à ces pesticides dangereux. Les pesticides exportés font l'objet d'innombrables études qui confirment leurs effets néfastes sur les humains. L'exportation de pesticides toxiques est néfaste pour les abeilles, la biodiversité et la planète en général. Les preuves sont claires : les néonics et autres pesticides dangereux tuent les abeilles. C'est pourquoi ils sont interdits en Europe. Pourquoi autorisons-nous encore leur exportation vers des pays où la réglementation est moins stricte, alors quils continueront de tuer les abeilles et décimer la biodiversité ? L'exportation de pesticides toxiques profite des pays où la réglementation est moins stricte. L'UE a un rôle à jouer dans le monde - ses entreprises ne devraient pas être autorisées à profiter des pays où la réglementation est plus faible. Comment pouvons-nous être pris au sérieux si nous expédions nos produits chimiques dangereux à l'étranger, empoisonnant ainsi les populations et la nature dans des pays où les règles de sécurité sont plus faibles et moins strictement appliquées ? L'interdiction d'exporter des pesticides toxiques serait une opportunité unique pour l'innovation et aiderait l'Europe et le monde à évoluer vers des méthodes de protection des plantes plus durables. Le maintien sur le marché de pesticides anciens et dangereux nous prive d'un avenir plus vert et de pratiques agricoles plus durables. Un avis juridique du Center for International Environmental Law publié en 2022 montre que les exportations européennes de pesticides interdits vers l'Afrique et l'Amérique centrale violent les obligations juridiques internationales de l'UE et le droit relatif aux droits humains.
englishfeedback: The export of toxic pesticides reveals a double standard policy: Hazardous pesticides are banned in Europe after being associated with cancer, reproductive problems and neurodegenerative diseases, as well as bee death. Some of these pesticides are even banned in Europe because of their link to brain damage in children and born babies. If these pesticides are too dangerous for us, how can we authorise their export? The export of toxic pesticides is a human rights issue, as these pesticides are harmful to our health: Every year, thousands of farmers die as a result of excessive exposure to these hazardous pesticides. Exported pesticides are subject to countless studies confirming their adverse effects on humans. The export of toxic pesticides is harmful to bees, biodiversity and the planet in general. The evidence is clear: neonics and other hazardous pesticides kill bees. This is why they are banned in Europe. Why do we still allow their export to countries with less stringent regulation, while they will continue to kill bees and decay biodiversity? The export of toxic pesticides benefits countries with less stringent regulation. The EU has a role to play in the world – its businesses should not be allowed to benefit from countries with weaker regulation. How can we be taken seriously if we send our hazardous chemicals abroad, poisoning people and nature in countries where safety rules are weaker and less strictly enforced? Banning the export of toxic pesticides would be a unique opportunity for innovation and would help Europe and the world to move towards more sustainable plant protection methods. Keeping old and dangerous pesticides on the market deprives us of a greener future and more sustainable agricultural practices. A legal opinion of the Center for International Environmental Law published in 2022 shows that European exports of banned pesticides to Africa and Central America violate the EU’s international legal obligations and human rights law.

feedback: L'exportation de pesticides toxiques révèle une politique de deux poids deux mesures : Les pesticides dangereux sont interdits en Europe après avoir été associés à des cancers, des problèmes de reproduction et des maladies neurodégénératives, ainsi qu'à la mort des abeilles. Certains de ces pesticides sont même interdits en Europe en raison de leur lien avec des lésions cérébrales chez les enfants et les bébés à naître. Si ces pesticides sont trop dangereux pour nous, comment pouvons-nous autoriser leur exportation ? L'exportation de pesticides toxiques est une question de droits humains , car ces pesticides sont nocifs pour notre santé : Chaque année, des milliers d'agriculteurs meurent des suites dune trop forte exposition à ces pesticides dangereux. Les pesticides exportés font l'objet d'innombrables études qui confirment leurs effets néfastes sur les humains. L'exportation de pesticides toxiques est néfaste pour les abeilles, la biodiversité et la planète en général. Les preuves sont claires : les néonics et autres pesticides dangereux tuent les abeilles. C'est pourquoi ils sont interdits en Europe. Pourquoi autorisons-nous encore leur exportation vers des pays où la réglementation est moins stricte, alors quils continueront de tuer les abeilles et décimer la biodiversité ? L'exportation de pesticides toxiques profite des pays où la réglementation est moins stricte. L'UE a un rôle à jouer dans le monde - ses entreprises ne devraient pas être autorisées à profiter des pays où la réglementation est plus faible. Comment pouvons-nous être pris au sérieux si nous expédions nos produits chimiques dangereux à l'étranger, empoisonnant ainsi les populations et la nature dans des pays où les règles de sécurité sont plus faibles et moins strictement appliquées ? L'interdiction d'exporter des pesticides toxiques serait une opportunité unique pour l'innovation et aiderait l'Europe et le monde à évoluer vers des méthodes de protection des plantes plus durables. Le maintien sur le marché de pesticides anciens et dangereux nous prive d'un avenir plus vert et de pratiques agricoles plus durables. Un avis juridique du Center for International Environmental Law publié en 2022 montre que les exportations européennes de pesticides interdits vers l'Afrique et l'Amérique centrale violent les obligations juridiques internationales de l'UE et le droit relatif aux droits humains.
englishfeedback: The export of toxic pesticides reveals a double standard policy: Hazardous pesticides are banned in Europe after being associated with cancer, reproductive problems and neurodegenerative diseases, as well as bee death. Some of these pesticides are even banned in Europe because of their link to brain damage in children and born babies. If these pesticides are too dangerous for us, how can we authorise their export? The export of toxic pesticides is a human rights issue, as these pesticides are harmful to our health: Every year, thousands of farmers die as a result of excessive exposure to these hazardous pesticides. Exported pesticides are subject to countless studies confirming their adverse effects on humans. The export of toxic pesticides is harmful to bees, biodiversity and the planet in general. The evidence is clear: neonics and other hazardous pesticides kill bees. This is why they are banned in Europe. Why do we still allow their export to countries with less stringent regulation, while they will continue to kill bees and decay biodiversity? The export of toxic pesticides benefits countries with less stringent regulation. The EU has a role to play in the world – its businesses should not be allowed to benefit from countries with weaker regulation. How can we be taken seriously if we send our hazardous chemicals abroad, poisoning people and nature in countries where safety rules are weaker and less strictly enforced? Banning the export of toxic pesticides would be a unique opportunity for innovation and would help Europe and the world to move towards more sustainable plant protection methods. Keeping old and dangerous pesticides on the market deprives us of a greener future and more sustainable agricultural practices. A legal opinion of the Center for International Environmental Law published in 2022 shows that European exports of banned pesticides to Africa and Central America violate the EU’s international legal obligations and human rights law.

feedback: I pesticidi pericolosi sono stati vietati in Europa dopo essere stati collegati a cancro, problemi riproduttivi e malattie neurodegenerative, nonché alla morte delle api. L'esportazione di pesticidi tossici è dannosa per le api, la biodiversità e il pianeta. Le prove sono chiare: i neonicotinoidi e altri pesticidi velenosi uccidono le api. Ecco perché sono vietati in Europa.Se questi pesticidi sono troppo pericolosi per noi, come possiamo che vengano esportati allestero? L'esportazione di pesticidi tossici è dunque anche una questione di diritti umani; esistono innumerevoli studi che dimostrano gli effetti dannosi sulle persone dei pesticidi esportati. L'esportazione di pesticidi tossici sfrutta i paesi con leggi più permissive. L'Europa ha un ruolo da svolgere nel mondo: non si deve permettere alle sue aziende di approfittare dei paesi con una regolamentazione più debole. Vietare l' esportazione dei pesticidi tossici sarebbe un vantaggio per l'innovazione e aiuterebbe l'Europa e il mondo intero verso pratiche agricole più sostenibili. Mantenere sul mercato pesticidi vecchi e pericolosi ci priva di un futuro più verde e di pratiche agricole più sostenibili. Inoltre, un parere legale da parte del Center for International Environmental Law (2022), dimostra che le esportazioni dell'UE di pesticidi vietati verso l'Africa e l'America centrale violano gli obblighi legali internazionali dell'UE e i diritti umani. Per questi motivi mi auguro che venga vietata l'esportazione di pesticidi tossici verso qualunque paese del mondo.
englishfeedback: Hazardous pesticides have been banned in Europe after being linked to cancer, reproductive problems and neurodegenerative diseases, as well as to the death of bees. The export of toxic pesticides is detrimental to bees, biodiversity and the planet. The evidence is clear: neonicotinoids and other poisonous pesticides kill bees. That is why they are banned in Europe. If these pesticides are too dangerous for us, how can we export them abroad? The export of toxic pesticides is therefore also a human rights issue; there are countless studies demonstrating the harmful effects of exported pesticides on people. The export of toxic pesticides exploits countries with more permissive laws. Europe has a role to play in the world: its companies should not be allowed to take advantage of countries with weaker regulation. Banning the export of toxic pesticides would benefit innovation and help Europe and the world towards more sustainable farming practices. Keeping old and hazardous pesticides on the market deprives us of a greener future and more sustainable farming practices. In addition, a legal opinion from the Center for International Environmental Law (2022) shows that EU exports of banned pesticides to Africa and Central America violate EU international legal obligations and human rights. For these reasons, I hope that the export of toxic pesticides to any country in the world will be banned.

feedback: This is a question of ethics. It's not a question of economics, nor of environmental concerns. We have already established that these chemicals are too hazardous to be used. To still produce them for export would be devaluing the life of human beings in other countries.
Was für eine Bigotterie- hier in der EU Agrargifte zu verbieten, den Herstellern aber den Export erlauben. Wir verdanken unseren Wohlstand den Ländern, die wir weiter ausbeuten und vergiften.
englishfeedback: To ban agricultural poisons in the EU for a Bigotterie here, but to allow producers to export. We ow our prosperity to the countries we continue to exploit and poison.

feedback: La seule production de très substances devrait être interdire.
englishfeedback: The production of very substances alone should be prohibited.

feedback: Eksport szkodliwych pestycydów poza obszar UE nie sprawia że stają się mniej szkodliwe dla Planety. Zabijają tak samo. Obojętnosc i tolerowanie takiego procederu to świadome szkodzenie środowisku i ludziom. Nie można niszczyć i zabijać w imię zysku zwłaszcza mając pełną świadomość szkodliwości własnych produktów. Takie postępowanie to zwyczajny bandytyzm i tylko na takie określenie zasługuje. Proponowałbym aby lobbyści firm sprzedających takie pestycydy obowiązkowo poddawali swoje rodziny wieloletniemu oddziaływaniu na takie substancje. Szafowanie czyimś życiem i zdrowiem jest proste do puki nie dotyczy nas samych.
englishfeedback: Exports of harmful pesticides outside the EU do not make them less harmful to Planet. They kill the same. Indifference and tolerance are conscious harm to the environment and people. It is not possible to destroy and kill in the name of profit, especially in full awareness of the harmfulness of own products. Such a procedure is ordinary banditicism and deserves to be defined only. I would propose that lobbyists of companies selling such pesticides should compulsorily treat their families with long-standing effects on such substances. It’s not for us to save your life and health.

feedback: Rien ne doit rentrer dans l'union européenne qui soit interdit dans l'union . Même un produit ou une méthode interdite en l'Europe lors de la fabrication ou de la pousse du produit ou de l'élevage ! Merci pour votre écoute
englishfeedback: Nothing should enter the European Union that is forbidden in the Union. Even a product or method banned in Europe during the manufacture or growth of the product or farming! Thank you for listening

feedback: Eksport toksycznych pestycydów to dowód hipokryzji. Groźne pestycydy są zakazane w Europie, ponieważ wykazano ich związek z nowotworami, problemami z płodnością i schorzeniami neurodegeneracyjnymi (uszkodzeniami układu nerwowego), takimi jak choroba Parkinsona i choroba Alzheimera. Te same pestycydy powodują wymieranie pszczół. Niektóre z nich zostały zakazane w Europie dlatego, że powiązano je z uszkodzeniami mózgu u ludzkich płodów i noworodków. Skoro wiemy, że są tak bardzo niebezpieczne, jak możemy pozwalać na ich eksport? Eksport toksycznych pestycydów jest kwestią praw człowieka, ponieważ te pestycydy poważnie zagrażają zdrowiu ludzi. Kontakt z tymi substancjami powoduje co roku śmierć tysięcy rolników. Istnieją niezliczone badania, które wykazują ich niezmiernie szkodliwe działanie na ludzi. Eksport toksycznych pestycydów zagraża pszczołom, różnorodności biologicznej i planecie. Dowody mówią jasno: neonikotynoidy i inne toksyczne substancje zabijają pszczoły. Dlatego zakazaliśmy ich w Europie. Dlaczego więc nadal pozwalamy na eksportowanie ich do krajów, gdzie regulacje nie są tak silne? Czy chcemy, aby tam powodowały wymieranie pszczół i niszczyły bioróżnorodność? Eksport toksycznych pestycydów to wykorzystanie krajów, gdzie regulacje są słabsze niż w Europie. Europa ma w świecie rolę do odegrania. Nie możemy pozwalać, by firmy z naszego kontynentu wykorzystywały dla zysku słabość regulacji w innych krajach. Jak możemy oczekiwać, że nasze deklaracje będą brane na poważnie, jeśli wciąż czerpiemy zyski z toksycznych chemikaliów, które powodują poważne schorzenia u ludzi i szkody w środowisku? Nie możemy eksportować toksycznych pestycydów do krajów, gdzie normy bezpieczeństwa są słabsze i mniej rygorystycznie egzekwowane niż u nas. Zakaz eksportu toksycznych pestycydów byłby silnym bodźcem dla innowacji. Pomógłby Europie i całemu światu przejść na bardziej zrównoważone metody ochrony roślin uprawnych. Dopuszczając na rynek stare i groźne dla zdrowia pestycydy, tracimy szansę na bardziej zieloną przyszłość i bardziej zrównoważone modele rolnictwa.
englishfeedback: Exports of toxic pesticides are evidence of hypocriticity. Hazardous pesticides are banned in Europe because they have been shown to be associated with cancer, fertility problems and neurodegenerative disorders (neural damage), such as Parkinson’s disease and Alzheimer’s disease. The same pesticides lead to the death of bees. Some of them were banned in Europe because they were linked to brain damage in human foetuses and newborn babies. If we know that they are as dangerous, how can we allow them to be exported? The export of toxic pesticides is a human rights issue, as these pesticides pose a serious threat to human health. Contact with these substances causes thousands of farmers to die each year. There are countless studies that show extremely harmful effects on humans. Exports of toxic pesticides threaten bees, biodiversity and the planet. The evidence clearly says: neonicotinoids and other toxic substances kill bees. This is why we have banned them in Europe. So why do we still allow them to be exported to countries where regulation is not so strong? Do we want bees to die and destroy biodiversity? Exports of toxic pesticides are the use of countries where regulation is weaker than in Europe. Europe has a role to play in the world. We cannot allow our continent’s companies to profit from the weakness of regulation in other countries. How can we expect our declarations to be taken seriously if we continue to profit from toxic chemicals that cause severe human conditions and environmental damage? We cannot export toxic pesticides to countries where safety standards are weaker and less rigorously enforced than in us. A ban on exports of toxic pesticides would be a powerful incentive for innovation. It would help Europe and the world as a whole move towards more sustainable methods of crop protection. By allowing old and health-threatening pesticides to the market, we lose the chance for a greener future and more sustainable farming models.

feedback: Chemikalien, die Europäer:innen schädigen, tun dies auch mit allen anderen Menschen der Welt. Daher sollen diese Chemikalien auch nicht exportiert werden. Woher nimmt Europa die Präpotenz zu meinen, dass anderen Menschen zumutbar ist, was wir nicht haben wollen??
englishfeedback: Chemicals that harm Europeans do so with all other people in the world. Therefore, these chemicals should not be exported either. Where does Europe take the view that other people are reasonable what we do not want to have?

feedback: Here are some reasons why we need an export ban: The export of toxic pesticides exposes a double standard: Dangerous pesticides are banned in Europe after they were linked to cancer, reproductive problems and neurodegenerative diseases as well as the dying of bees. Some of these pesticides are banned in Europe because of their links to brain damage in children and unborn babies. If these pesticides are too dangerous for us, how can we allow them to be exported? The export of toxic pesticides is a human rights issue as these toxic pesticides are damaging to people: Every year, thousands of farmers die from exposure to dangerous pesticides. The pesticides exported have countless studies supporting the damaging effects on people. The export of toxic pesticides is bad for the bees, biodiversity and the planet. The evidence is clear: neonics and other poisonous pesticides kill bees. Thats why theyre banned in Europe. Why are we still allowing them to be exported to countries with weaker regulation, killing bees and decimating biodiversity? The export of toxic pesticides is taking advantage of countries with weaker regulation. Europe has a role to play in the world - its companies should not be allowed to take advantage of countries with weaker regulation. How can we be taken seriously if we ship our hazardous chemicals abroad, poisoning people and nature in the process in countries where safety regulations are weaker and less strictly enforced. An export ban of toxic pesticides would be a boon for innovation and help Europe and the world move towards more sustainable plant protection methods. Keeping old and dangerous pesticides on the market is depriving us from a greener future and more sustainable farming practices. A legal opinion by the Center for International Environmental Law published in 2022 shows that EU exports of banned pesticides to Africa and Central America violate the EUs international legal obligations and human rights law. Thank you for considering my feedback!

Sehr geehrte Damen und Herren, ich plädiere für ein Verbot der Herstellung und Ausfuhr von Chemikalien, die in der EU verboten sind. Ich halte es für selbstverständlich und geboten, Chemikalien die wir für gefährlich halten, nicht zu produzieren und nicht in andere Länder auszuliefern, wo sie Mensch und Natur genauso gefährden wie hierzulande. Bitte setzen Sie sich mit aller Kraft dafür ein. Mit freundlichen Grüßen Edeltraud Mandausch
englishfeedback: Ladies and Gentlemen, I call for a ban on the production and export of chemicals that are banned in the EU. I think it is natural and necessary to take chemicals that we consider dangerous, not to produce and not to deliver to other countries where they pose the same risk to human beings and nature as countries. Please make every effort to do so. Yours sincerely, Edeltraud Mandausch

feedback: Chemikalien, die in Europa verboten sind, sollten selbstverständlich auch überall woanders auf der Welt nicht eingesetzt werden dürfen. Außerdem sollten die Richtlinien für Verbote auch in Europa weiter verschärft werden, um das immense Artensterben zu stoppen, den letzten Endes hängt auch die Zukunft der Menschheit von stabilen Ökosystemen ab.
englishfeedback: It goes without saying that chemicals banned in Europe should not be used anywhere else in the world. In addition, the ban directives in Europe should be further strengthened in order to stop the huge extinction of species, and ultimately the future of humanity depends on stable ecosystems.

feedback: Dangerous pesticides are banned in Europe after they were linked to cancer, reproductive problems and neurodegenerative diseases as well as the dying of bees. Some of these pesticides are banned in Europe because of their links to brain damage in children and unborn babies. If these pesticides are too dangerous for us, how can we allow them to be exported?
Je suis totalement opposé à la production à des fins d'exportation de produits chimiques interdits dans l'Union Européenne.
englishfeedback: I am totally opposed to the production for export of chemicals banned in the European Union.

feedback: You must forbid to export toxic substances to countries with low environmental protections. These substances are not allowed in Europe and must not be exported. We import fruit and vegetables from these countries. Local populations working with toxic substances suffer from the effects of these substances, which cause cancers and childhood illnesses.

Les pesticides, insecticides, fongicides, sont partout. Déversés en grande quantité, il est désormais reconnu et admis quils sont à lorigine de la disparition des insectes et, par suite, des oiseaux. Chez les humains, ils sont à lorigine de maladies graves (cancers, leucémies,) en premier lieu chez ceux qui les manipulent, des travailleurs. De plus leffet cocktail nest pas, ou peu, étudié mais des soupçons graves pèsent sur lui. La dangerosité de ces produits a été en partie reconnue pour certains dentre eux au point den interdire la commercialisation et/ou lutilisation. Il est navrant de constater que ces produits sont encore fabriqués en Europe au fin dexportation : quel cynisme ! LEurope, celle sur je voudrais, doit se placer en pointe de la lutte pour la préservation de notre environnement et donc, en premier lieu, interdire la fabrication de ces produits chimiques dont les effets ne sont même pas connus lors de leur commercialisation. Parallèlement, afin de rester maître chez elle, lEurope doit se doter de laboratoires performants et INDÉPENDANTS pour mener des études complètes sur les produits proposés par lindustrie. Protéger notre environnement cest nous protéger nous-mêmes.
englishfeedback: Pesticides, insecticides and fungicides are everywhere. Discarded in large quantities, it is now recognised and accepted that they are due to the disappearance of insects and, consequently, birds. In humans, they are characterised by serious diseases (cancers, leukaemia, etc.) in the first place among those who handle them, workers. Moreover, the cocktail is not studied, or little, but there are serious suspicions against him. The dangerous nature of these products has been recognised in part for some of them at point den to prohibit the marketing and/or use of these products. It is important to note that these products are still manufactured in Europe for the purpose of export: what cynism! Europe, the one on which I would like, must be at the forefront of the struggle to preserve our environment and therefore, in the first place, prohibit the manufacture of these chemicals, the effects of which are not even known when they are marketed. At the same time, in order to remain master, Europe needs to equip itself with effective laboratories and INDEPENDERS to conduct comprehensive studies of the products offered by the industry. Protecting our environment is protecting ourselves.

feedback: Es kann doch nicht sein, dass die Verbotsgründe für Pestizide in der EU für Afrika und Südamerika keine Rolle spielen sollen. Es ist an der Zeit, endlich ein Exportverbot für Pestizide und giftige Chemikalien aus zu sprechen. Was ist das für eine Moral der Hersteller, aus Profitgründen Menschen diesen Stoffen aus zu setzen. Dies ruft natürlich den Lobbyverband auf den Plan, der dieses Verbot verhindern will; u.a. mit dem Todschlag-Argument Arbeitsplätze. Bei der Abwägung der Entscheidung, sollte das Wohl der Menschen für ein Exportverbot den Ausschlag geben.
englishfeedback: It cannot be said that the reasons for banning pesticides in the EU should be irrelevant to Africa and South America. It is time to finally speak out of an export ban on pesticides and toxic chemicals. What is in favour of a morale on the part of producers to expose people to these substances for profit. This, of course, calls on the lobby association to put an end to this ban; including the death strike argument, workplaces. When considering the choice, people’s well-being should prevail for an export ban.

feedback: 1. Il est inadmissible de fournir à d'autres pays moins "favorisés" des substances interdites au sein de l'Union Européenne. 2. La terre formant un ensemble indissociable, l'utilisation , même à plusieurs milliers de kilomètres, de produits clairement définis comme hautement préjudiciables tant à l'homme qu'à l'ensemble de la faune et de la flore ne peut qu'accentuer la dégénérescence de la planète. 3. L'utilisation de ces produits contribue de manière dramatique à la disparition de biotopes naturels essentiels pour y implanter des cultures et élevages hautement nocifs. 4. Les seuls bénéficiaires à (très) court terme sont les industries chimiques et agro alimentaires pour qui le profit est la seule motivation. 5. Il est grand temps que les Politiques prennent leurs responsabilités en privilégiant l'Avenir et non en satisfaisant les lobbies contre d'avantageuses compensation personnelles.
englishfeedback: 1. It is unacceptable to supply other less “favoured” countries with substances banned within the European Union. 2. As land forms an inseparable whole, the use, even thousands of kilometres, of products clearly defined as highly harmful to humans and to all fauna and flora can only exacerbate the degeneration of the planet. 3. The use of these products makes a dramatic contribution to the disappearance of natural biotopes essential for the establishment of highly harmful crops and livestock. 4. The only (very) short-term beneficiaries are the chemical and agro food industries for which profit is the only motivation. 5. It is high time that policies take their responsibility by focusing on the future and not by satisfying lobbyists against advantageous personal compensation.

feedback: Popieram całkowity zakaz eksportu toksycznych pestycydów. Trwa szóste wielkie wymieranie, a toksyczne pestycydy zagrażają tysiącom organizmów: pszczołom, różnorodności biologicznej i planecie. Dlatego zakazaliśmy ich w Europie. Dlaczego więc nadal pozwalamy na eksportowanie ich do krajów, gdzie regulacje nie są tak silne? Czy chcemy, aby tam powodowały wymieranie pszczół i niszczyły bioróżnorodność? To nie tylko kwestia Europy, ale i innych krajów - nie wolno nam wykorzystywać ich i słabszych norm bezpieczeństwa, które tam obowiązują.
englishfeedback: I support a total ban on exports of toxic pesticides. There is a sixth large extinction and toxic pesticides threaten thousands of organisms: bees, biodiversity and the planet. This is why we have banned them in Europe. So why do we still allow them to be exported to countries where regulation is not so strong? Do we want bees to die and destroy biodiversity? It is not only a matter of Europe, but also of other countries – we must not use them and the weaker safety standards that apply there.

feedback: Chemikalien, die in der EU verboten sind, sollten weder hier hergestellt noch ausgeführt werden. Sie schädigen Mensch und Natur und kommen über Einfuhr von Lebens- und Futtermitteln wieder zu uns zurück. Es ist auch unsägliche Doppelmoral, dass man Menschen außerhalb der EU diesen Chemikalien aussetzt, während man es EU-Bürgern nicht zumutet.
englishfeedback: Chemicals banned in the EU should not be produced or exported here. They damage people and nature and come back to us by importing food and feed. It is also impractical for people outside the EU to be exposed to these chemicals while not exploiting it to EU citizens.

feedback: Wir brauchen ein Exportverbot! Diese Pestizide, welche in Europa verboten wurden, nachdem sie mit Krebs, Beeinträchtigung der Fruchtbarkeit und neurodegenerativen Krankheiten in Verbindung gebracht wurden, schädigen Menschen, Tiere und Umwelt außerhalb der EU genauso wie innerhalb der EU. Eigentlich sollte es selbstverständlich sein, dass diese Mittel komplett aus dem Verkehr gezogen werden. Diese Doppelmoral und das Profitstreben auf Kosten Aller, geht gar nicht, und gehört Verboten!
englishfeedback: We need an export ban! These pesticides, which have been banned in Europe after being associated with cancer, fertility degradation and neurodegenerative diseases, cause harm to people, animals and the environment outside the EU as well as within the EU. In fact, it should be self-evident that these funds should be completely withdrawn from the market. This double morale and the pursuit of profits at the expense of everyone does not happen at all, and it is a ban!

feedback: Wir brauchen ein Exportverbot! Diese Pestizide, welche in Europa verboten wurden, nachdem sie mit Krebs, Beeinträchtigung der Fruchtbarkeit und neurodegenerativen Krankheiten in Verbindung gebracht wurden, schädigen Menschen, Tiere und Umwelt außerhalb der EU genauso wie innerhalb der EU. Eigentlich sollte es selbstverständlich sein, dass diese Mittel komplett aus dem Verkehr gezogen werden. Diese Doppelmoral und das Profitstreben auf Kosten anderer widert mich an!
englishfeedback: We need an export ban! These pesticides, which have been banned in Europe after being associated with cancer, fertility degradation and neurodegenerative diseases, cause harm to people, animals and the environment outside the EU as well as within the EU. In fact, it should be self-evident that these funds should be completely withdrawn from the market. I resist this double morality and the pursuit of profits at the expense of others!

feedback: Penso sia opportuno iniziare ad ascoltare veramente la scienza e un po' meno la politica.
englishfeedback: I think it is worth starting to really listen to science and a little less politics.

feedback: We need to stop poisoning ourselves. Pesticides need to be banned from our food. We can do better agriculture free of poison.

I want you to forbid to export toxic substances to countries with low protection of the environment. All these toxics that are not allowed in Europe should not be exported. We get them all back by importing fruits, vegetables and flowers. The local population working with these toxics gets sick, e.g.. cancer illnesses and deformated children. Why should we destroy the environment for others, when we can do it better? Nowadays we could export ecological methods with natural parasites or pheromons. Bep Weijand, ecologist
Il me semble cohérent que les produits interdits au sein de lUE parce que dangereux soient aussi interdits à la fabrication et à la commercialisation hors des frontières de lUE
englishfeedback: It seems to me to be consistent that products banned within the EU because they are dangerous are also prohibited from manufacturing and marketing outside the EU’s borders.

feedback: We need an export ban because: The export of toxic pesticides exposes a double standard: Dangerous pesticides are banned in Europe after they were linked to cancer, reproductive problems and neurodegenerative diseases as well as the dying of bees. Some of these pesticides are banned in Europe because of their links to brain damage in children and unborn babies. If these pesticides are too dangerous for us, how can we allow them to be exported? The export of toxic pesticides is a human rights issue as these toxic pesticides are damaging to people: Every year, thousands of farmers die from exposure to dangerous pesticides. The pesticides exported have countless studies supporting the damaging effects on people. The export of toxic pesticides is bad for the bees, biodiversity and the planet. The evidence is clear: neonics and other poisonous pesticides kill bees. Thats why theyre banned in Europe. Why are we still allowing them to be exported to countries with weaker regulation, killing bees and decimating biodiversity? The export of toxic pesticides is taking advantage of countries with weaker regulation. Europe has a role to play in the world - its companies should not be allowed to take advantage of countries with weaker regulation. How can we be taken seriously if we ship our hazardous chemicals abroad, poisoning people and nature in the process in countries where safety regulations are weaker and less strictly enforced. An export ban of toxic pesticides would be a boon for innovation and help Europe and the world move towards more sustainable plant protection methods. Keeping old and dangerous pesticides on the market is depriving us from a greener future and more sustainable farming practices. A legal opinion by the Center for International Environmental Law published in 2022 shows that EU exports of banned pesticides to Africa and Central America violate the EUs international legal obligations and human rights law. Yours sincerely, Conor O'Neill Dublin, Ireland.

Ich schließe mich dem nachdrücklich an, dass Chemikalien, die in Europa verboten sind, auch auf keinen Fall exportiert und daher erst gar nicht produziert werden sollten. Sie sind in anderen Ländern für die Menschen ebenso gefährlich wie hier und Umweltpolitik muss in jedem Fall global gedacht werden. Es ist zutiefst unmoralisch nur deshalb hier verbotene Substanzen in manche Länder weiter zu exportieren, weil es dort weniger strenge oder überhaupt weniger politische Regulative gibt.
englishfeedback: I strongly agree that chemicals banned in Europe should never be exported and therefore should not be produced at all. They are as dangerous for people in other countries as here, and environmental policies must in any case be considered globally. It is deeply immoral to continue exporting substances banned here to some countries only because there are less stringent or even less political regulation.

feedback: The export of toxic pesticides exposes a double standard: Dangerous pesticides are banned in Europe after they were linked to cancer, reproductive problems and neurodegenerative diseases as well as the dying of bees. Some of these pesticides are banned in Europe because of their links to brain damage in children and unborn babies. If these pesticides are too dangerous for us, how can we allow them to be exported? The export of toxic pesticides is a human rights issue as these toxic pesticides are damaging to people: Every year, thousands of farmers die from exposure to dangerous pesticides. The pesticides exported have countless studies supporting the damaging effects on people. The export of toxic pesticides is bad for the bees, biodiversity and the planet. The evidence is clear: neonics and other poisonous pesticides kill bees. Thats why theyre banned in Europe. Why are we still allowing them to be exported to countries with weaker regulation, killing bees and decimating biodiversity? The export of toxic pesticides is taking advantage of countries with weaker regulation. Europe has a role to play in the world - its companies should not be allowed to take advantage of countries with weaker regulation. How can we be taken seriously if we ship our hazardous chemicals abroad, poisoning people and nature in the process in countries where safety regulations are weaker and less strictly enforced. An export ban of toxic pesticides would be a boon for innovation and help Europe and the world move towards more sustainable plant protection methods. Keeping old and dangerous pesticides on the market is depriving us from a greener future and more sustainable farming practices. A legal opinion by the Center for International Environmental Law published in 2022 shows that EU exports of banned pesticides to Africa and Central America violate the EUs international legal obligations and human rights law.

Nous serons amenés à manger aussi des produits venant des pays utilisant ces pesticides. De plus, cela tuera les insectes susceptibles de revenir chez nous pour fertiliser nos plantes. Enfin, nous devons être plus solidaires des populations du monde que des actionnaires de l'industrie chimique.
englishfeedback: We will also eat products from countries using these pesticides. In addition, it will kill insects that may return to us to fertilise our plants. Finally, we need to be more cohesive with the people of the world than with shareholders in the chemical industry.

feedback: Giftige Pestizide sind in Europa verboten, aber der Export ist erlaubt: Das ist eine Doppelmoral. Die gefährlichen Pestizide wurden in Europa verboten, nachdem sie mit Krebs, Beeinträchtigung der Fruchtbarkeit und neurodegenerativen Krankheiten in Verbindung gebracht wurden - zum Bienensterben tragen sie außerdem bei. Einige dieser Pestizide sind in Europa verboten, weil sie mit Hirnschäden bei Kindern und ungeborenen Babys in Verbindung gebracht werden. Wenn diese Pestizide für uns zu gefährlich sind: Wie können wir dann zulassen, dass sie exportiert werden?Die Ausfuhr von giftigen Pestiziden ist eine Frage der Menschenrechte, denn die Pestizide schaden den Menschen: Jedes Jahr sterben Tausende von Landwirt*innen durch den Kontakt mit gefährlichen Pestiziden. Es gibt unzählige Studien, die die schädlichen Auswirkungen der exportierten Pestizide auf den Menschen belegen.Die Ausfuhr giftiger Pestizide ist desaströs für Bienen, die biologische Vielfalt und den Planeten. Die Beweislage ist eindeutig: Neonics und andere giftige Pestizide töten Bienen. Deshalb sind sie in Europa verboten. Wir sollten nicht zulassen, dass diese Pestizide in Länder exportiert werden, in denen Gesundheitsvorschriften weniger streng sind und dort Bienen und die biologische Vielfalt zerstören. Länder, in denen es kaum Vorschriften für giftige Pestizide gibt, werden als Markt benutzt. Europäische Unternehmen sollten nicht die Möglichkeit haben, diesen Umstand auszunutzen. Wie kann Europa als Weltmacht ernst genommen werden, wenn wir gefährliche Chemikalien ins Ausland verschiffen und dabei Mensch und Natur in Ländern vergiften, in denen Sicherheitsvorschriften geringer sind und weniger streng durchgesetzt werden?Ein Exportverbot für giftige Pestizide würde Europa und der Welt helfen, zu nachhaltigeren Pflanzenschutzmethoden überzugehen. Wenn gefährliche Pestizide auf dem Markt bleiben, werden wir weiter auf eine grünere Zukunft und nachhaltige Landwirtschaft warten müssen. Ein Rechtsgutachten des Center for International Environmental Law, das 2022 veröffentlicht wurde, zeigt, dass die EU mit dem Export verbotener Pestizide nach Afrika und Mittelamerika gegen internationale rechtliche Verpflichtungen und die Menschenrechte verstößt.
englishfeedback: Toxic pesticides are banned in Europe, but exports are allowed: This is a double standard. Hazardous pesticides have been banned in Europe after being associated with cancer, fertility impairment and neurodegenerative diseases and contribute to bee mortality. Some of these pesticides are banned in Europe because they are associated with brain damage in children and unborn babies. If these pesticides are too dangerous for us: How can we allow them to be exported?The export of toxic pesticides is a matter of human rights because pesticides harm people: Every year thousands of farmers die from exposure to hazardous pesticides. There are countless studies showing the harmful effects of exported pesticides on humans, export of toxic pesticides is disastrous for bees, biodiversity and the planet. The evidence is clear: Neonics and other toxic pesticides kill bees. This is why they are banned in Europe. We should not allow these pesticides to be exported to countries where health rules are less stringent and where bees and biodiversity are destroyed. Countries with little regulation on toxic pesticides are used as a market. European companies should not be able to take advantage of this fact. How can Europe be taken seriously as a global power when we ship dangerous chemicals abroad, poisoning people and nature in countries where safety rules are lower and where enforcement is less stringent? A ban on exports of toxic pesticides would help Europe and the world to move towards more sustainable plant protection methods. If hazardous pesticides remain on the market, we will have to wait for a greener future and sustainable agriculture. A legal opinion from the Center for International Environmental Law, published in 2022, shows that the EU is in breach of international legal obligations and human rights by exporting banned pesticides to Africa and Central America.

feedback: Diese Pestizide sind in Europa verboten, aber der Export ist erlaubt: Das ist eine Doppelmoral. Die gefährlichen Pestizide wurden in Europa verboten, nachdem sie mit Krebs, Beeinträchtigung der Fruchtbarkeit und neurodegenerativen Krankheiten in Verbindung gebracht wurden - zum Bienensterben tragen sie außerdem bei. Einige dieser Pestizide sind in Europa verboten, weil sie mit Hirnschäden bei Kindern und ungeborenen Babys in Verbindung gebracht werden. Wenn diese Pestizide für uns zu gefährlich sind: Wie können wir dann zulassen, dass sie exportiert werden? Die Ausfuhr von giftigen Pestiziden ist eine Frage der Menschenrechte, denn die Pestizide schaden den Menschen: Jedes Jahr sterben Tausende von Landwirt*innen durch den Kontakt mit gefährlichen Pestiziden. Es gibt unzählige Studien, die die schädlichen Auswirkungen der exportierten Pestizide auf den Menschen belegen. Die Ausfuhr giftiger Pestizide ist desaströs für Bienen, die biologische Vielfalt und den Planeten. Die Beweislage ist eindeutig: Neonics und andere giftige Pestizide töten Bienen. Deshalb sind sie in Europa verboten. Wir sollten nicht zulassen, dass diese Pestizide in Länder exportiert werden, in denen Gesundheitsvorschriften weniger streng sind und dort Bienen und die biologische Vielfalt zerstören. Länder, in denen es kaum Vorschriften für giftige Pestizide gibt, werden als Markt benutzt. Europäische Unternehmen sollten nicht die Möglichkeit haben, diesen Umstand auszunutzen. Wie kann Europa als Weltmacht ernst genommen werden, wenn wir gefährliche Chemikalien ins Ausland verschiffen und dabei Mensch und Natur in Ländern vergiften, in denen Sicherheitsvorschriften geringer sind und weniger streng durchgesetzt werden? Ein Exportverbot für giftige Pestizide würde Europa und der Welt helfen, zu nachhaltigeren Pflanzenschutzmethoden überzugehen. Wenn gefährliche Pestizide auf dem Markt bleiben, werden wir weiter auf eine grünere Zukunft und nachhaltige Landwirtschaft warten müssen. Ein Rechtsgutachten des Center for International Environmental Law, das 2022 veröffentlicht wurde, zeigt, dass die EU mit dem Export verbotener Pestizide nach Afrika und Mittelamerika gegen internationale rechtliche Verpflichtungen und die Menschenrechte verstößt.
englishfeedback: These pesticides are banned in Europe, but exports are allowed: This is a double standard. Hazardous pesticides have been banned in Europe after being associated with cancer, fertility impairment and neurodegenerative diseases and contribute to bee mortality. Some of these pesticides are banned in Europe because they are associated with brain damage in children and unborn babies. If these pesticides are too dangerous for us: How can we then allow them to be exported? The export of toxic pesticides is a human rights issue, as pesticides harm people: Every year thousands of farmers die from exposure to hazardous pesticides. There are countless studies demonstrating the harmful effects of exported pesticides on humans. Exports of toxic pesticides are desastrous for bees, biodiversity and the planet. The evidence is clear: Neonics and other toxic pesticides kill bees. This is why they are banned in Europe. We should not allow these pesticides to be exported to countries where health rules are less stringent and where bees and biodiversity are destroyed. Countries with little regulation on toxic pesticides are used as a market. European companies should not be able to take advantage of this fact. How can Europe be taken seriously as a global power when we ship dangerous chemicals abroad, poisoning people and nature in countries where safety rules are lower and enforcement is less stringent? A ban on exports of toxic pesticides would help Europe and the world move towards more sustainable plant protection practices. If hazardous pesticides remain on the market, we will have to wait for a greener future and sustainable agriculture. A legal opinion from the Center for International Environmental Law, published in 2022, shows that the EU is in breach of international legal obligations and human rights by exporting banned pesticides to Africa and Central America.

feedback: Un parere legale del Center for International Environmental Law, pubblicato nel 2022, dimostra che le esportazioni dell'UE di pesticidi vietati verso l'Africa e l'America centrale violano gli obblighi legali internazionali dell'UE e i diritti umani. L'Europa non deve permettere alle sue aziende di approfittare dei paesi con una regolamentazione più debole. Come possiamo essere presi sul serio se inviamo le nostre sostanze chimiche pericolose all'estero, avvelenando le persone e la natura in paesi dove le norme di sicurezza sono più deboli e meno rigorose? Un divieto di esportazione dei pesticidi tossici aiuterebbe l'Europa e il mondo intero verso pratiche agricole più sostenibili! Vi ringrazio per l'attenzione e confidando nel vostro sostegno per un bando all'esportazione dei pesticidi tossici vi saluto distintamente, Chiara Faglia
englishfeedback: A legal opinion of the Center for International Environmental Law, published in 2022, shows that EU exports of banned pesticides to Africa and Central America violate the EU’s international legal obligations and human rights. Europe must not allow its companies to take advantage of countries with weaker regulation. How can we be taken seriously if we send our hazardous chemicals abroad, poisoning people and nature in countries where safety standards are weaker and lower? A ban on the export of toxic pesticides would help Europe and the world towards more sustainable farming practices! Thank you for your attention and trust in your support for a ban on the export of toxic pesticides. Yours sincerely, Chiara Faglia

feedback: I pesticidi e le sostanze chimiche pericolose sono nocive sempre e in ogni luogo!! Se sono vietate in Europa lo devono essere anche in Africa e Sud America!! Bisogna ASSOLUTAMENTE vietare l'esportazione, in qualsiasi parte del mondo, di pesticidi e sostanze chimiche pericolose per l'uomo e per l'ambiente!! GRAZIE
englishfeedback: Pesticides and hazardous chemicals are harmful always and everywhere! If they are banned in Europe, they must also be banned in Africa and South America! It is important to ban the export of pesticides and chemicals dangerous to humans and the environment anywhere in the world! THANKS

feedback: Sehr geehrte Damen und Herren, sind Pestizide anderswo als dort, wo sie bereits verboten sind, weniger giftig? Richten sie langfristig weniger Schaden an dort, wohin sie von den Unternehmen exportiert werden, um ihren Gewinn zu maximieren? Wenn wir unseren Planeten nachhaltig schützen wollen und zu einer Landwirtschaft hin umgestalten möchten, die auch langfristig den Erhalt der Biodiversität und das Wohl der Menschen überall in den Blick nimmt, kann die Lösung nur lauten, dass Chemikalien, die bereits in der Europäischen Union verboten sind, auch anderswohin nicht verkauft werden dürfen. Kein Profit für Gift, so einfach ist das. Wenn die Unternehmen ihre Arbeitsplätze sichern wollen, müssen sie auf nachhaltige Produkte umsteigen - das ist unternehmerisches Risiko. Ich danke Ihnen herzlich für eine der Umwelt und den Menschen gegenüber nachhaltige Position bei dieser Entscheidung. Mit freundlichen Grüßen, Daniel Michael Kaiser, Berlin
englishfeedback: Ladies and gentlemen, are pesticides less toxic elsewhere than where they are already banned? In the long term, do they reduce the damage to where they are exported by companies in order to maximise their profits? If we want to protect our planet in a sustainable way and to transform it into agriculture that also takes account of the preservation of biodiversity and the well-being of people everywhere in the long term, the solution can only be that chemicals that are already banned in the European Union cannot be sold elsewhere. This is not a profit for poison, so easy. If companies want to safeguard their jobs, they need to switch to sustainable products – this is a business risk. I would like to thank you for a sustainable position of the environment and people in this decision. Yours sincerely, Daniel Michael Kaiser, Berlin

feedback: Bin gegen den Export in der EU verbotener Chemikalien speziell für die Landwirtschaft, weil ich diese dann in den importierten Nahrungsmitteln wiederfinde.
englishfeedback: I am against the export of chemicals banned in the EU specifically for agriculture, because I will find them in the imported food.

feedback: Werte Damen und Herren Mir liegt die Zukunft aller Lebewesen auf diesem wunderschönen blauen Planeten sehr am Herzen. Als ehemaliger Inhaber eines Biomarktes habe ich (über vierzig Jahre) unendlich viele Meinungen gehört, mit meinen Kundinnen und Kunden über aktuelle Probleme gesprochen. Das reichte von Tschernobyl bis Covid 19, aber auch Diskussionen über unsere Demokratie und Menschlichkeit, Politik und persönliche Probleme. Mit 78 Jahren habe ich "den Laden dicht gemacht". Jetzt sind die Jungen dran .... :D Ich bitte alle unsere Vertreter innen jetzt endlich allen Eigennutz und Gehorsam beiseite zu legen und den profitgierigen Konzernen die Stirn zu bieten. Wir haben nur eine Erde
englishfeedback: Ladies and gentlemen Mir attach great importance to the future of all living beings on this beautiful blue planet. As a former owner of a biomarket, I heard infinitely many opinions (over forty years) about current problems with my customers. This ranged from Chernobyl to Covid 19, but also discussions about our democracy and humanity, politics and personal problems. At the age of 78, I ‘tightened the shop’. Now the boys are... I would now ask all our representatives at last to put aside all their own interests and obedience and to offer the right thing to profit-making groups. We have only one planet

feedback: Here are some reasons why we need an export ban: The export of toxic pesticides exposes a double standard: Dangerous pesticides are banned in Europe after they were linked to cancer, reproductive problems and neurodegenerative diseases as well as the dying of bees. Some of these pesticides are banned in Europe because of their links to brain damage in children and unborn babies. If these pesticides are too dangerous for us, how can we allow them to be exported? The export of toxic pesticides is a human rights issue as these toxic pesticides are damaging to people: Every year, thousands of farmers die from exposure to dangerous pesticides. The pesticides exported have countless studies supporting the damaging effects on people. The export of toxic pesticides is bad for the bees, biodiversity and the planet. The evidence is clear: neonics and other poisonous pesticides kill bees. Thats why theyre banned in Europe. Why are we still allowing them to be exported to countries with weaker regulation, killing bees and decimating biodiversity? The export of toxic pesticides is taking advantage of countries with weaker regulation. Europe has a role to play in the world - its companies should not be allowed to take advantage of countries with weaker regulation. How can we be taken seriously if we ship our hazardous chemicals abroad, poisoning people and nature in the process in countries where safety regulations are weaker and less strictly enforced. An export ban of toxic pesticides would be a boon for innovation and help Europe and the world move towards more sustainable plant protection methods. Keeping old and dangerous pesticides on the market is depriving us from a greener future and more sustainable farming practices. A legal opinion by the Center for International Environmental Law published in 2022 shows that EU exports of banned pesticides to Africa and Central America violate the EUs international legal obligations and human rights law.

un avis juridique du Centre de recherche en droit international de l'environnement affirme que les exportations de pesticides interdits de l'UE vers l'Afrique et l'Amérique centrale violent les traités internationaux et les droits humains, donc l'UE doit interdire l'exportation de pesticides interdits et d'autres produits chimiques dangereux, et promouvoir des alternatives à faible risque dans le monde entier
englishfeedback: a legal opinion of the Centre for Research on International Environmental Law states that EU exports of banned pesticides to Africa and Central America violate international treaties and human rights, so the EU must ban the export of banned pesticides and other hazardous chemicals, and promote low-risk alternatives worldwide.

feedback: Interdire dans le monde entier.
englishfeedback: Ban all over the world.

feedback: Penso sia ora di finirla di continuare ad usare pesticidi e concimi chimici. Roberto Desenzani
englishfeedback: I think it is now time to continue using chemical pesticides and fertilisers. Roberto Desenzani

feedback: Voici quelques raisons pour lesquelles nous avons besoin dinterdire les pesticides dangereux : L'exportation de pesticides toxiques révèle une politique de deux poids deux mesures : Les pesticides dangereux sont interdits en Europe après avoir été associés à des cancers, des problèmes de reproduction et des maladies neurodégénératives, ainsi qu'à la mort des abeilles. Certains de ces pesticides sont même interdits en Europe en raison de leur lien avec des lésions cérébrales chez les enfants et les bébés à naître. Si ces pesticides sont trop dangereux pour nous, comment pouvons-nous autoriser leur exportation ? L'exportation de pesticides toxiques est une question de droits humains , car ces pesticides sont nocifs pour notre santé : Chaque année, des milliers d'agriculteurs meurent des suites dune trop forte exposition à ces pesticides dangereux. Les pesticides exportés font l'objet d'innombrables études qui confirment leurs effets néfastes sur les humains. L'exportation de pesticides toxiques est néfaste pour les abeilles, la biodiversité et la planète en général. Les preuves sont claires : les néonics et autres pesticides dangereux tuent les abeilles. C'est pourquoi ils sont interdits en Europe. Pourquoi autorisons-nous encore leur exportation vers des pays où la réglementation est moins stricte, alors quils continueront de tuer les abeilles et décimer la biodiversité ? L'exportation de pesticides toxiques profite des pays où la réglementation est moins stricte. L'UE a un rôle à jouer dans le monde - ses entreprises ne devraient pas être autorisées à profiter des pays où la réglementation est plus faible. Comment pouvons-nous être pris au sérieux si nous expédions nos produits chimiques dangereux à l'étranger, empoisonnant ainsi les populations et la nature dans des pays où les règles de sécurité sont plus faibles et moins strictement appliquées ? L'interdiction d'exporter des pesticides toxiques serait une opportunité unique pour l'innovation et aiderait l'Europe et le monde à évoluer vers des méthodes de protection des plantes plus durables. Le maintien sur le marché de pesticides anciens et dangereux nous prive d'un avenir plus vert et de pratiques agricoles plus durables. Un avis juridique du Center for International Environmental Law publié en 2022 montre que les exportations européennes de pesticides interdits vers l'Afrique et l'Amérique centrale violent les obligations juridiques internationales de l'UE et le droit relatif aux droits humains.
englishfeedback: Here are some reasons why we need to ban hazardous pesticides: The export of toxic pesticides reveals a double standard policy: Hazardous pesticides are banned in Europe after being associated with cancer, reproductive problems and neurodegenerative diseases, as well as bee death. Some of these pesticides are even banned in Europe because of their link to brain damage in children and born babies. If these pesticides are too dangerous for us, how can we authorise their export? The export of toxic pesticides is a human rights issue, as these pesticides are harmful to our health: Every year, thousands of farmers die as a result of excessive exposure to these hazardous pesticides. Exported pesticides are subject to countless studies confirming their adverse effects on humans. The export of toxic pesticides is harmful to bees, biodiversity and the planet in general. The evidence is clear: neonics and other hazardous pesticides kill bees. This is why they are banned in Europe. Why do we still allow their export to countries with less stringent regulation, while they will continue to kill bees and decay biodiversity? The export of toxic pesticides benefits countries with less stringent regulation. The EU has a role to play in the world – its businesses should not be allowed to benefit from countries with weaker regulation. How can we be taken seriously if we send our hazardous chemicals abroad, poisoning people and nature in countries where safety rules are weaker and less strictly enforced? Banning the export of toxic pesticides would be a unique opportunity for innovation and would help Europe and the world to move towards more sustainable plant protection methods. Keeping old and dangerous pesticides on the market deprives us of a greener future and more sustainable agricultural practices. A legal opinion of the Center for International Environmental Law published in 2022 shows that European exports of banned pesticides to Africa and Central America violate the EU’s international legal obligations and human rights law.

feedback: Gefährliche Chemikalien sollten nirgendwo auf dieser Welt auf den Boden gekippt werden.
englishfeedback: Hazardous chemicals should not be tilted to soil anywhere in the world.

feedback: It is nonsense to ban hazardous chemicals in Europe but to allow them still to be produced for export to other parts of the world. They should be banned completely and in every sense of the word, period.

Surely we can think of better ways to grow food than by poisioning the land and killing the myriad creatures that we share this planet with. Please ban toxic pesticides, herbicides and fungicides everywhere. It doesn't make sense in terms of economic, ecological or individual health to continue the use of these chemical toxins.
Bitte verbieten Sie die Ausfuhr gefährlicher Pestizide nach Afrika und Südamerika und in jedes weitere Land. Die Gifte kommen wie ein Bumerang zu uns zurück. MfG Annette Meuthrath
englishfeedback: Please prohibit the export of hazardous pesticides to Africa and South America and to any other country. The poisons come back to us like a bomach. MFG Annette Meuthrath

feedback: Perché andiamo ad inquinare i paesi che hanno meno risorse x opporsi alle regole di noi bravi democratici ? Se queste sostanze sono dannose x tutte le forme di vita, perché possono essere esportate verso i paesi con più difficoltà economiche? Allora non siamo così evoluti come si vuol fare credere ; siamo solo opportunisti e propensi a fare gli affari nostri !!! È ora di considerare le sostanze chimiche pericolose , pericolose x tutti gli abitanti del pianeta e quindi vietarne la produzione e l'esportazione.
englishfeedback: Why are we pollute countries that have less resources x oppose our own democratic rules? If these substances are harmful x all life forms, why can they be exported to countries with the most economic difficulties? Then we have not as evolved as you want to believe; we are only opportunists and are keen to do our business! It is time to consider hazardous chemicals x all people on the planet and thus ban their production and export.

feedback: Hallo, es ist meiner Meinung nach zynisch, Chemikalien, Pestizide o.ä., deren Anwendung hier in Europa verboten ist, weil sie für Mensch und Umwelt giftig und gefährlich sind, in andere Länder zu exportieren. Frei nach dem Motto, wenn dort jemand erkrankt oder stirbt ist es uns egal - aber wir haben gut verdient. Oder sind die Menschen dort anders gebaut und daher resistent? Mit freundlichen Grüßen Jörg Herrmann
englishfeedback: Hallo, in my view, it is cynical to export chemicals, pesticides, etc. whose use is prohibited here in Europe because they are toxic and dangerous for humans and the environment. Free according to the motto when someone falls ill or dies there, but we earn well. Or are people built differently and therefore resistant? Yours sincerely, Jörg Herrmann

feedback: This is my opinion: we need an export ban on hazardous chemicals The reasons why we need an export ban: The export of toxic pesticides exposes a double standard: Dangerous pesticides are banned in Europe after they were linked to cancer, reproductive problems and neurodegenerative diseases as well as the dying of bees. Some of these pesticides are banned in Europe because of their links to brain damage in children and unborn babies. If these pesticides are too dangerous for us, how can we allow them to be exported? The export of toxic pesticides is a human rights issue as these toxic pesticides are damaging to people: Every year, thousands of farmers die from exposure to dangerous pesticides. The pesticides exported have countless studies supporting the damaging effects on people. The export of toxic pesticides is bad for the bees, biodiversity and the planet. The evidence is clear: neonics and other poisonous pesticides kill bees. Thats why theyre banned in Europe. Why are we still allowing them to be exported to countries with weaker regulation, killing bees and decimating biodiversity? The export of toxic pesticides is taking advantage of countries with weaker regulation. Europe has a role to play in the world - its companies should not be allowed to take advantage of countries with weaker regulation. How can we be taken seriously if we ship our hazardous chemicals abroad, poisoning people and nature in the process in countries where safety regulations are weaker and less strictly enforced. An export ban of toxic pesticides would be a boon for innovation and help Europe and the world move towards more sustainable plant protection methods. Keeping old and dangerous pesticides on the market is depriving us from a greener future and more sustainable farming practices. A legal opinion by the Center for International Environmental Law published in 2022 shows that EU exports of banned pesticides to Africa and Central America violate the EUs international legal obligations and human rights law

Continuïng the use of hazardous chemicals in agriculture will prove to be very costly. Future generations wil pay the bill. In remembrance of how these chemicals have been used in Vietnam. (Orange) And recent research shows that Alzheimer is linked to thes chemicals. Please move towards an enviremental approach to modern agriculture. A. Meijer, journalist

L'esportazione di pesticidi tossici mette in luce un doppio standard: I pesticidi pericolosi sono stati vietati in Europa dopo essere stati collegati a cancro, problemi riproduttivi e malattie neurodegenerative, nonché alla morte delle api. Alcuni di questi pesticidi sono vietati in Europa perché collegati a danni cerebrali nei bambini e nei neonati. Se questi pesticidi sono troppo pericolosi per noi, come possiamo che vengano esportati allestero?
englishfeedback: The export of toxic pesticides highlights a double standard: Hazardous pesticides have been banned in Europe after being linked to cancer, reproductive problems and neurodegenerative diseases, as well as to the death of bees. Some of these pesticides are banned in Europe because they are linked to brain damage in children and infants. If these pesticides are too dangerous for us, how can they be exported abroad?

feedback: L'esportazione di pesticidi tossici mette in luce un doppio standard: I pesticidi pericolosi sono stati vietati in Europa dopo essere stati collegati a cancro, problemi riproduttivi e malattie neurodegenerative, nonché alla morte delle api. Alcuni di questi pesticidi sono vietati in Europa perché collegati a danni cerebrali nei bambini e nei neonati. Se questi pesticidi sono troppo pericolosi per noi, come possiamo che vengano esportati allestero?
englishfeedback: The export of toxic pesticides highlights a double standard: Hazardous pesticides have been banned in Europe after being linked to cancer, reproductive problems and neurodegenerative diseases, as well as to the death of bees. Some of these pesticides are banned in Europe because they are linked to brain damage in children and infants. If these pesticides are too dangerous for us, how can they be exported abroad?

feedback: I want the EU to ban the export of hazardous chemicals to other countries. In my opinion, it is despicable to sell the chemicals not allowed in the EU to anywhere in the world, it is double standards at its worst. However hard the pesticide loby pressures, I want the EU to resist and stay firm on this. Let us be true leaders in difficult issues like this one!

The export of toxic pesticides should be banned because: * it creates a double standard * it's a human rights issue * it's bad for bad for the bees, biodiversity and the planet * it's taking advantage of countries with weaker regulation * a ban would be a boon for innovation. Do the right thing and ban the export of toxic pesticides.
Bei uns sind die Chemikalien aus gutem Grund verboten. Im Ausland sind diese nicht besser, daher ist ein Exportverbot sehr wichtig.
englishfeedback: In our case, chemicals are banned for good reason. They are not better abroad, so an export ban is very important.

feedback: Would be happy for a ban of pesticides, and a ban for exporting them outside the EU as well.

dal punto di vista economico bandire la vendita di tali sostanze non ha affatto grosse conseguenze se comparate al danno che esse causano all' ambiente. l' industria europea deve essere spinta ad innovare nel rispetto degli ecosistemi e solo scelte lungimiranti permetteranno di mantenere adeguati profitti ed un economia funzionale. le istituzioni europee hanno il dovere di imporre regolamentazioni etiche e tenere a bada i pericolosi lobbismi che vogliono fare profitto a prescindere. più che le politiche nazionali, vessate da facili populismi e lobbismi indebiti, sono le istituzioni europee che possono agire libere da continue convenienze elettorali. assumetevi questa responsabilità.
englishfeedback: from an economic point of view, banning the sale of these substances does not have any major consequences when compared to the damage they cause to the environment. European industry must be encouraged to innovate with respect for ecosystems and only forward-looking choices will make it possible to maintain adequate profits and a functioning economy. The European institutions have a duty to impose ethical regulations and to keep dangerous lobbying that they want to profit out. It is more than national policies, which are harmed by easy populism and undue lobbying, that the European institutions can act free of constant election-related convenience.

feedback: Das Anwendungsverbot einer Chemikalie in der EU sollte auch ein Exportverbot dieser Chemikalie auf die anderen Kontinente implizieren! Es gibt nur eine Erde für alle Menschen und Lebewesen.
englishfeedback: The ban on the use of a chemical in the EU should also imply a ban on exports of that chemical to the other continents! There is only one Earth for all humans and living beings.

feedback: Sehr geehrte Damen und Herren, ich finde es ein Gebot dessen was ethisch-moralisch selbstverständlich sein sollte: dass wir keine Chemikalien/Pestizide in andere Länder und Regionen dieser Erde exportieren, von denen wir erkannt haben, dass sie aufgrund ihrer Schädlichkeit für Pflanzen, Tiere, Menschen und Umwelt im Allgemeinen nicht verwendet werden sollten. Wir würden ansonsten Mensch und Umwelt und unsere gemeinsame Lebensgrundlage schädigen. Es sollte bekannt sein, dass eine Schädigung der Umwelt in einer bestimmten Region dieser Erde Auswirkungen auf das globale Ökosystem hat. Wir schaden uns selbst möglicherweise sogar direkt, wenn wir wiederum Lebensmittel aus diesen Regionen importieren. Mit freundlichen Grüßen Matthias Kämper
englishfeedback: Ladies and gentlemen, I find it a requirement for what should be ethically and morally self-evident: that we do not export chemicals/pesticides to other countries and regions of the world that we have realised that due to their harmfulness to plants, animals, humans and the environment in general, they should not be used. We would otherwise damage people, the environment and our shared livelihoods. It should be known that environmental degradation in a specific region of that Earth has an impact on the global ecosystem. We may even harm ourselves directly if we again import food from these regions. Yours sincerely, Matthias Kämper

feedback: Hazardous and harmful pesticides that are forbidden in the EU should be forbidden around the world. When they're damaging here, they're damaging elsewhere. Pretending that they aren't reveals the EU's double standards: make a profit and let the people and wildlife suffer in non-EU countries but protect them here. It won't work in the long run, it'll backfire. The EU should set a good example, for once, and signal to the rest of the world, and especially industries and lobbyists, that enough is enough. Ban those terrible pesticides everywhere, once and for all.

Wir haben den Einsatz von gefährlichen Pestiziden mit gutem Grund in der EU verboten. Bitte seien Sie konsequent und verhindern den Einsatz derselben in anderen Teilen der Welt. Sie sind dort genauso gefährlich wie in der EU!
englishfeedback: We have for good reason banned the use of hazardous pesticides in the EU. Please be consistent and prevent their use in other parts of the world. They are as dangerous as in the EU!

feedback: Ritengo che le norme sui pesticidi che valgono in Europa, a salvaguardia della salute e dell'ambiente, debbano valere anche vietando l' esportazione di tali prodotti al di fuori dell' unione europea. È ora di cambiare passo e gli interessi economici non possono condizionare uno sviluppo che deve essere sano e rispettoso dell' ambiente per garantire un futuro possibile. L' Europa deve essere promotrice di una nuova visione di sviluppo che metta al centro il pianeta e il benessere dei cittadini.
englishfeedback: I believe that the rules on pesticides that apply in Europe, in order to protect health and the environment, should also apply by prohibiting the export of such products outside the European Union. Time to change and economic interests cannot affect development that must be healthy and environmentally friendly to ensure a possible future. Europe must be a promoter of a new development vision that puts the planet and the well-being of its citizens at the centre.

feedback: Guten Tag, Agrarkonzerne wie BASF und Bayer-Monsanto machen riesige Gewinne mit dem Export giftiger Pestizide nach Afrika und Südamerika und gefährden damit das Leben der Menschen, die dort in der Landwirtschaft arbeiten und vergiften den Planeten. In Europa sind diese Pestizide aus gutem Grund verboten - weil sie zu gefährlich sind. Auch kommen die ausgeführten Chemikalien wieder zu uns zurück, in importierten Lebensmitteln oder durch Umweltereignisse. Es muss daher ein schnellstmögliches Verbot der Herstellung und Ausfuhr von Pestiziden geben, die in der EU verboten sind. Gewinne für Unternehmen dürfen nicht weiter über das Wohl von Mensch und Natur gestellt werden Freundliche Grüße
englishfeedback: Good day, agricultural groups such as BASF and Bayer-Monsanto make huge profits by exporting toxic pesticides to Africa and South America, thus endangering the lives of people working in agriculture and poisoning the planet. In Europe, these pesticides are banned for good reason because they are too dangerous. The exported chemicals also come back to us, in imported food or through environmental events. There must therefore be a ban on the production and export of pesticides banned in the EU as soon as possible. Profits for businesses must not be put beyond the well-being of people and nature.

feedback: Please, ban the production for export of chemicals banned in the European Union.Thank you
Ich finde, dass wir Alternativen für umweltbelastende Chemikalien finden sollten und auch deren Ausfuhren verhindern sollten. Alles steht mit allem in Verbindung.
englishfeedback: I believe that we should find alternatives to polluting chemicals and also prevent their exports. All of this is related to all of them.

feedback: Bonjour, Je réfléchissais à une longue démonstration éclairée plutôt technique sur le non-sens évident de la situation et de la question. Je l'ai finalement abandonné. En effet, à quoi bon un énième paragraphe sur la toxicité des ces poisons, les atteintes irréversibles sur tout le vivant, la situation déjà catastrophique dans laquelle nous nous trouvons, etc... Tout le monde le sait déjà, vous y compris. En effet, à quoi bon tenter une longue explication motivée dès lors que le raisonnement et la posture à adopter tombent sous le sens de n'importe quel quidam normalement pourvu de matière cérébrale ? Les peuples d'Europe, que vous représentez, sont unanimes et on ne peut à la fois représenter des peuples et rester sourds à leurs demandes pressantes, faute de perdre toute légitimité à siéger. Pourquoi encore empoisonner les pays du sud, et comme les substances circulent, pourquoi empoisonner plus encore à long terme la planète ? Pour quelques lobbys menteurs et manipulateurs, indécents, dénués d'éthique et de morale, déjà très connus pour leurs exactions et leurs destructions du vivant ? Pour des acteurs de la mort, déjà de nombreuses fois dénoncés et condamnés, qui étonnement ne vont jamais en prison même convaincus d'homicide, juste condamnés à de lourdes amendes qu'ils paient rubis sur l'ongle car elles sont prévues dans leurs business plans ? Pour des vicieux qui s'appuient sur des menaces fausses et éculées comme la perte d'emplois, la suspension des financements aux partis politiques, j'en passe et des meilleures ? Pour quelques corrompus cupides, arrivistes, lâches et irresponsables ? Pour des expériences, écouler des stocks, contourner systématiquement les lois de protection du vivant, obtenir sans arrêt des dérogations, le tout en faisant pression sur des pleutres ? Merci de mettre un terme définitif et sans délai à ce type de comportement mortifère, il y a urgence, vous le savez. D'autant que les vraies solutions propres existent, vous le savez également. Je compte et nous comptons tous sur vous car votre rôle est extrêmement important. Vous devez vous diriger et nous diriger vers une autre façon de traiter la vie, il est grand temps. Avec mes remerciements, respectueusement Hervé Martin
englishfeedback: Hello, I would reflect on a long, rather technical and informed demonstration of the obvious lack of meaning of the situation and the issue. I finally abandoned it. What a nth paragraph on the toxicity of these poisons, irreversible damage to the whole of life, the already catastrophic situation in which we find ourselves, etc. Everyone already knows this, including you. What is the good idea of a long and reasoned explanation, given that the reasoning and the posture to be adopted are in the direction of any quidam normally with cerebral material? The peoples of Europe, which you represent, are unanimous and we cannot both represent people and remain deaf at their urgent demands, as they do not lose any legitimacy to sit. Why still poisoning southern countries, and as substances circulate, why poisoning the planet even more in the long term? For a few mentors and manipulators, indecent, unethical and moral, already well known for their exactions and destruction of life? For those involved in death, who have already been denounced and condemned on many occasions, who are never astonished in prison, even convinced of homicide, who are just sentenced to heavy fines that they pay on the nail because they are provided for in their business plans? For victimisation that is based on false and disrupted threats such as job losses, the suspension of funding to political parties, I am on track and the best ones? For some corrupts cupides, arrivals, loose and irresponsible? For experiments, disposing of stocks, systematically circumventing living protection laws, obtaining derogations without stopping, while putting pressure on pleutres?
