Thank you for putting an immediate and definitive end to this type of mortiferous behaviour, which is a matter of urgency, you know. All the more so as the real clean solutions exist, you are also aware of this. I and we all count on you because your role is extremely important. You need to direct you and move us to another way of dealing with life, it’s high time. Thank you, Honourable Hervé Martin

feedback: European companies mustn't export EU-banned toxics to third countries. Please be vigilant.

C'est une chance que de pouvoir s exprimer mais un tel questionnement paraît invraisemblable ! Bien évidemment jebsuis contre toute production de produits nocifs, qu'ils soient destinés à mon voisin ou à moi-même. C'est l humanité qui est engagée dans ces décisions. Merci
englishfeedback: It is a chance to be able to express itself, but such a question seems unlikely! Of course, jebsuis against any production of harmful products, whether for my neighbour or for me. Humanity is committed to these decisions. Thanks

feedback: Wir haben in Europa Krieg, weil es einen despotischen Machthaber gibt, der nur an seine Macht und Geld denkt. Wenn das nicht schon schlimm genug wäre, werden Gifte leider noch verwendet und künftighin insbesondere verkauft, damit die Agrarprodukte, die wir dann aus diesen Ländern importieren, wieder diese Gifte enthalten. Wann werden wir erkennen, daß man Geld nicht essen kann. Mit freundlichen Grüßen Manfred Moser
englishfeedback: We have war in Europe because there is a despot leader who only thinks about his power and money. Unfortunately, if this is not bad enough, poisons will still be used and sold in the future, in particular to ensure that the agricultural products we import from these countries again contain these poisons. When will we see that money cannot be eaten. Yours sincerely, Manfred Moser

feedback: La vita diventa sempre più difficile, le api sono in via di estinzione. L'esportazione di pesticidi tossici è dannosa per le api, la biodiversità e il pianeta. Le prove sono chiare: i neonicotinoidi e altri pesticidi velenosi uccidono le api. Ecco perché sono vietati in Europa. Perché continuiamo a permettere che vengano esportati in Paesi uccidendo le api e decimando la biodiversità?
englishfeedback: Life is becoming increasingly difficult, bees are extinct. The export of toxic pesticides is detrimental to bees, biodiversity and the planet. The evidence is clear: neonicotinoids and other poisonous pesticides kill bees. This is why they are banned in Europe. Why do we continue to allow them to be exported to countries by killing bees and deciding on biodiversity?

feedback: Dear sir/Madam, Greetings from APSDHISAR, Our way of life is poisoning. The legislative initiative aim to introduce a mechanism prohibiting production and or export of certain harmful chemicals are banned in EU to protect non-EU countries from their negative impacts on human health and the environment. Chemicals can enter and irrigate the nose, airpassages end lungs they can become deposited in the airways or be absorbed by lungs into the bloodstream. The blood can them carry these substances is another route of exposure. Health hazardous chemicals, physical or biological factors in our environment that can have negative impact on our short or long term health. Exposure can occur through, touch, inhalation and ingestion, understanding the risks of these hazardous can help us to take action to ban the hazardous chemicals. Some 60 chemicals elements are found in the human body, but what all of them are doing there is still unknown, roughly 96%of the mass of human body is made up of just four elements oxygen, carbon, hydrogen and nitrogen, with in the from of water. Although genetic factors play a role neurotoxins such as arsenic chlorpyrifos, dichlorodipheny trichloroethane (DDT),ethyalcohal, fluoride lead polybrominated diphenyl,ethers (PBDEs)polybrominated, biphenyls (PCBs)manganese, mercury and toluene are major contributors to the prevalence of neurobehavioral. Pesticides, paraquat is so dangerous that just one sip can be lethal chronic, exposure, even at low doses can cause Parkinson disease. EU has banned harmful chemicals like this. But still exports them to other countries. We demand our chance to pile on and protect millions of people from there deadly chemicals. Thank you Mange Ram Adhana President Association For Promotion Sustainable Development from India

Je suis contre l'exportation de produits dangereux (pesticides, herbicides,..) dans des pays hors EU. Je suis d'ailleurs contre leur utilisation en EU et je milite pour une utilsation encore plus restrictve que ce qui est fait aujourd'hui en EU. N'oublions jamais le proverbe: La terre ne nous appartient pas. Nous l'empruntons à nos enfants. Au même titre que nous devons laisser les toilettes propres quand nous les quittons, nous devons laisser une terre propre à nos enfants. Les dernières générations des pays industrialisés devraient avoir honte d'avoir fait passer pendant des années les considérations économiques de certaines sociétés et de certaines personnes AVANT la préservation de la biodiversité, la santé humaine et animale. J'espère que nous serons nombreux à lutter contre les lobbys qui gravitent un "peu trop" autour des décideurs de la CE. D. Lange
englishfeedback: I am against the export of dangerous products (pesticides, herbicides, etc.) to countries outside the EU. Indeed, I am against their use in the EU and I am pushing for an even more restrictive use than what is being done in the EU today. Let’s never forget the proverb: The land does not belong to us. We borrow it from our children. Just as we have to leave the toilets clean when we leave, we must leave our children’s own land. The last generations of industrialised countries are expected to be ashamed for years to pass on the economic considerations of certain societies and individuals BEFORE the preservation of biodiversity, human and animal health. I hope that many of us will be fighting the lobby that is “not too much” around EC decision-makers. D. Lange

feedback: Wie können wir Stoffe, die wir bei uns nicht in der Luft, im Boden und im Wasser haben wollen, weil wir sie als gefährlich einschätzen an andere Länder weitergeben, wo sie exakt dieselbe Wirkung haben? Abgesehen davon, dass die Stoffe dann in importierten Produkten wieder zurück kommen, ist es auch verachtend, in Kauf zu nehmen, dass in anderen Regionen der Welt Menschen, Tiere und Pflanzen geschädigt werden.
englishfeedback: How can we use substances that we do not want to have in air, soil and water because we consider them dangerous to other countries where they have exactly the same effect? Apart from the fact that the substances are then returned to imported products, it is also forgotten to accept that humans, animals and plants are harmed in other regions of the world.

feedback: Sehr geehrte Damen und Herren, Länder, in denen es kaum Vorschriften für giftige Pestizide gibt, werden als Markt benutzt. Europäische Unternehmen sollten nicht die Möglichkeit haben, diesen Umstand auszunutzen. Wie kann Europa als Weltmacht ernst genommen werden, wenn wir gefährliche Chemikalien ins Ausland verschiffen und dabei Mensch und Natur in Ländern vergiften, in denen Sicherheitsvorschriften geringer sind und weniger streng durchgesetzt werden? Ein Rechtsgutachten des Center for International Environmental Law, das 2022 veröffentlicht wurde, zeigt, dass die EU mit dem Export verbotener Pestizide nach Afrika und Mittelamerika gegen internationale rechtliche Verpflichtungen und die Menschenrechte verstößt. Bitte stellen Sie sicher, dass die Menschenrechte eingehalten werden. Sonst verlieren Sie alle Glaubwürdigkeit bei Ihren Wählern. Das was ich nicht will dass es mir geschieht, füge ich auch niemand anders zu!!! MFG Sven Koch
englishfeedback: Ladies and gentlemen, countries where toxic pesticides are rarely regulated, are used as a market. European companies should not be able to take advantage of this fact. How can Europe be taken seriously as a global power when we ship dangerous chemicals abroad, poisoning people and nature in countries where safety rules are lower and enforcement is less stringent? A legal opinion from the Center for International Environmental Law, published in 2022, shows that the EU is in breach of international legal obligations and human rights by exporting banned pesticides to Africa and Central America. Please ensure that human rights are respected. Otherwise, you will lose all credibility with your voters. What I don't want to do I don’t want to do it, I am nobody else! MFG Sven Koch

feedback: L'esportazione di pesticidi tossici è dannosa per le api, la biodiversità e il pianeta. Le prove sono chiare: i neonicotinoidi e altri pesticidi velenosi uccidono le api. Ecco perché sono vietati in Europa. Perché continuiamo a permettere che vengano esportati in Paesi uccidendo le api e decimando la biodiversità?
englishfeedback: The export of toxic pesticides is detrimental to bees, biodiversity and the planet. The evidence is clear: neonicotinoids and other poisonous pesticides kill bees. This is why they are banned in Europe. Why do we continue to allow them to be exported to countries by killing bees and deciding on biodiversity?

feedback: Dear EU Commission, we have banned the use of these pesticides in the EU because we know how harmful they are. To still be selling these pesticides elsewhere in the world is a horrible double standard, that within the next generation will no doubt have serious consequences which will eventually effect Europeans too. Can we predict what effects these pesticides have in the countries where we sell them? Will it mean that the people and farmers and food production there can be constant and kept in a healthy, liveable standard which means the populations will continue to live their lives healthily, NOT requiring assistance from the EU? We need to ensure food systems and biodiversity remain as strong as possible in various sites around the planet; because this is also in Europes interest too, come the next 20 years. The number of people arriving in Europe by boat because of how difficult it is to live a life of peace (which is already caused by western/European countries involvement in their political affairs) will only increase if there are more people from the global south whose food systems are weakening due to unregulated pesticide use, and unknown affects on their health and environment. Here in Europe we have the know-how and financial ability to generate change with new technologies and concepts when it comes to farming/food/environment, etc and I believe it is the just thing to do for all the planet to encourage this concept everywhere around the world. We need to start looking at other countries around the world as our siblings. Would you send hazardous chemicals to your own family if you knew it would cause them harm? If this answer is no, then I dont believe the EU should be sending these pesticides to anyone, and their production should cease. Thank you for your time.

Ci sono parecchi motivi per vietare l'esportazione di pesticidi pericolosi. 1) Danneggiano le persone provocando il cancro o entrando nella catena alimentare e finendo assorbite dall'uomo danno problemi riproduttivi e malattie neurodegenerative. Tra parentesi molte di queste molecole non si degradano, ma vengono accumulate nel corpo umano. 2) I pesticidi a base di neonicotinoidi ed altri danneggiano le api e tutti gli insetti impollinatori, non permettendo alla fine la riproduzione delle piante. 3) I pesticidi danneggiano la biodiversita' e quindi globalmente la terra. Non si puo' permettere l'esportazione di pesticidi vietati in Europa negli altri continenti, questo viola i diritti umani.
englishfeedback: There are many reasons to ban the export of hazardous pesticides. (1) damage people by causing cancer or entering the food chain and eventually absorbed by humans, causing reproductive problems and neurodegenerative diseases. In brackets, many of these molecules do not degrade, but accumulate in the human body. (2) neonicotinoid-based pesticides and others damage bees and all pollinating insects by ultimately preventing plant propagation. (3) pesticides damage biodiversity’ and thus the earth as a whole. The export of pesticides banned in Europe to other continents cannot be allowed, which violates human rights.

feedback: NO. If we have banned chemicals in Europe you should not allow to use/ expot them somewhere else. They are there as harmful as they are here.
Alle Chemikalien die ausgeführt werden kommen auch wieder zu uns zurück. Sei es in importierten Lebensmitteln oder Gütern oder durch Umweltereignisse.
englishfeedback: All the chemicals exported come back to us. Whether in imported food or goods or through environmental events.

feedback: Nous avons besoin dinterdire les pesticides dangereux car : - L'exportation de pesticides toxiques révèle une politique de deux poids deux mesures : les pesticides dangereux sont interdits en Europe après avoir été associés à des cancers, des problèmes de reproduction et des maladies neurodégénératives, ainsi qu'à la mort des abeilles. Certains de ces pesticides sont même interdits en Europe en raison de leur lien avec des lésions cérébrales chez les enfants et les bébés à naître. Si ces pesticides sont trop dangereux pour nous, comment pouvons-nous autoriser leur exportation ? - L'exportation de pesticides toxiques est une question de droits humains , car ces pesticides sont nocifs pour notre santé : Chaque année, des milliers d'agriculteurs meurent des suites dune trop forte exposition à ces pesticides dangereux. Les pesticides exportés font l'objet d'innombrables études qui confirment leurs effets néfastes sur les humains. - L'exportation de pesticides toxiques est néfaste pour les abeilles, la biodiversité et la planète en général. Les preuves sont claires : les néonics et autres pesticides dangereux tuent les abeilles. C'est pourquoi ils sont interdits en Europe. Pourquoi autorisons-nous encore leur exportation vers des pays où la réglementation est moins stricte, alors quils continueront de tuer les abeilles et décimer la biodiversité ? - L'exportation de pesticides toxiques profite des pays où la réglementation est moins stricte. L'UE a un rôle à jouer dans le monde - ses entreprises ne devraient pas être autorisées à profiter des pays où la réglementation est plus faible. Comment pouvons-nous être pris au sérieux si nous expédions nos produits chimiques dangereux à l'étranger, empoisonnant ainsi les populations et la nature dans des pays où les règles de sécurité sont plus faibles et moins strictement appliquées ? - L'interdiction d'exporter des pesticides toxiques serait une opportunité unique pour l'innovation et aiderait l'Europe et le monde à évoluer vers des méthodes de protection des plantes plus durables. Le maintien sur le marché de pesticides anciens et dangereux nous prive d'un avenir plus vert et de pratiques agricoles plus durables. - Un avis juridique du Center for International Environmental Law publié en 2022 montre que les exportations européennes de pesticides interdits vers l'Afrique et l'Amérique centrale violent les obligations juridiques internationales de l'UE et le droit relatif aux droits humains.
englishfeedback: We need to ban hazardous pesticides because: — The export of toxic pesticides reveals a double standard policy: hazardous pesticides are banned in Europe after being associated with cancer, reproductive problems and neurodegenerative diseases, as well as bee death. Some of these pesticides are even banned in Europe because of their link to brain damage in children and born babies. If these pesticides are too dangerous for us, how can we authorise their export? — The export of toxic pesticides is a human rights issue, as these pesticides are harmful to our health: Every year, thousands of farmers die as a result of excessive exposure to these hazardous pesticides. Exported pesticides are subject to countless studies confirming their adverse effects on humans. — The export of toxic pesticides is harmful to bees, biodiversity and the planet in general. The evidence is clear: neonics and other hazardous pesticides kill bees. This is why they are banned in Europe. Why do we still allow their export to countries with less stringent regulation, while they will continue to kill bees and decay biodiversity? — The export of toxic pesticides benefits countries with less stringent regulations. The EU has a role to play in the world – its businesses should not be allowed to benefit from countries with weaker regulation. How can we be taken seriously if we send our hazardous chemicals abroad, poisoning people and nature in countries where safety rules are weaker and less strictly enforced? — Banning the export of toxic pesticides would be a unique opportunity for innovation and would help Europe and the world to move towards more sustainable plant protection methods. Keeping old and dangerous pesticides on the market deprives us of a greener future and more sustainable agricultural practices. — A legal opinion of the Center for International Environmental Law published in 2022 shows that European exports of banned pesticides to Africa and Central America violate the EU’s international legal obligations and human rights law.

feedback: Voici quelques raisons pour lesquelles nous avons besoin dinterdire les pesticides dangereux : L'exportation de pesticides toxiques révèle une politique de deux poids deux mesures : Les pesticides dangereux sont interdits en Europe après avoir été associés à des cancers, des problèmes de reproduction et des maladies neurodégénératives, ainsi qu'à la mort des abeilles. Certains de ces pesticides sont même interdits en Europe en raison de leur lien avec des lésions cérébrales chez les enfants et les bébés à naître. Si ces pesticides sont trop dangereux pour nous, comment pouvons-nous autoriser leur exportation ? L'exportation de pesticides toxiques est une question de droits humains , car ces pesticides sont nocifs pour notre santé : Chaque année, des milliers d'agriculteurs meurent des suites dune trop forte exposition à ces pesticides dangereux. Les pesticides exportés font l'objet d'innombrables études qui confirment leurs effets néfastes sur les humains. L'exportation de pesticides toxiques est néfaste pour les abeilles, la biodiversité et la planète en général. Les preuves sont claires : les néonics et autres pesticides dangereux tuent les abeilles. C'est pourquoi ils sont interdits en Europe. Pourquoi autorisons-nous encore leur exportation vers des pays où la réglementation est moins stricte, alors quils continueront de tuer les abeilles et décimer la biodiversité ? L'exportation de pesticides toxiques profite des pays où la réglementation est moins stricte. L'UE a un rôle à jouer dans le monde - ses entreprises ne devraient pas être autorisées à profiter des pays où la réglementation est plus faible. Comment pouvons-nous être pris au sérieux si nous expédions nos produits chimiques dangereux à l'étranger, empoisonnant ainsi les populations et la nature dans des pays où les règles de sécurité sont plus faibles et moins strictement appliquées ? L'interdiction d'exporter des pesticides toxiques serait une opportunité unique pour l'innovation et aiderait l'Europe et le monde à évoluer vers des méthodes de protection des plantes plus durables. Le maintien sur le marché de pesticides anciens et dangereux nous prive d'un avenir plus vert et de pratiques agricoles plus durables. Un avis juridique du Center for International Environmental Law publié en 2022 montre que les exportations européennes de pesticides interdits vers l'Afrique et l'Amérique centrale violent les obligations juridiques internationales de l'UE et le droit relatif aux droits humains.
englishfeedback: Here are some reasons why we need to ban hazardous pesticides: The export of toxic pesticides reveals a double standard policy: Hazardous pesticides are banned in Europe after being associated with cancer, reproductive problems and neurodegenerative diseases, as well as bee death. Some of these pesticides are even banned in Europe because of their link to brain damage in children and born babies. If these pesticides are too dangerous for us, how can we authorise their export? The export of toxic pesticides is a human rights issue, as these pesticides are harmful to our health: Every year, thousands of farmers die as a result of excessive exposure to these hazardous pesticides. Exported pesticides are subject to countless studies confirming their adverse effects on humans. The export of toxic pesticides is harmful to bees, biodiversity and the planet in general. The evidence is clear: neonics and other hazardous pesticides kill bees. This is why they are banned in Europe. Why do we still allow their export to countries with less stringent regulation, while they will continue to kill bees and decay biodiversity? The export of toxic pesticides benefits countries with less stringent regulation. The EU has a role to play in the world – its businesses should not be allowed to benefit from countries with weaker regulation. How can we be taken seriously if we send our hazardous chemicals abroad, poisoning people and nature in countries where safety rules are weaker and less strictly enforced? Banning the export of toxic pesticides would be a unique opportunity for innovation and would help Europe and the world to move towards more sustainable plant protection methods. Keeping old and dangerous pesticides on the market deprives us of a greener future and more sustainable agricultural practices. A legal opinion of the Center for International Environmental Law published in 2022 shows that European exports of banned pesticides to Africa and Central America violate the EU’s international legal obligations and human rights law.

feedback: Die Ausfuhr von giftigen Pestiziden ist eine Frage der Menschenrechte, denn die Pestizide schaden den Menschen: Jedes Jahr sterben Tausende von Landwirt*innen durch den Kontakt mit gefährlichen Pestiziden. Es gibt unzählige Studien, die die schädlichen Auswirkungen der exportierten Pestizide auf den Menschen belegen. Viele Grüße U. Steinvorth
englishfeedback: The export of toxic pesticides is a human rights issue, as pesticides harm people: Every year thousands of farmers die from exposure to hazardous pesticides. There are countless studies demonstrating the harmful effects of exported pesticides on humans. Many greetings U. Steinvorth

feedback: Die Ausfuhr von giftigen Pestiziden ist eine Frage der Menschenrechte, denn die Pestizide schaden den Menschen: Jedes Jahr sterben Tausende von Landwirt*innen durch den Kontakt mit gefährlichen Pestiziden. Es gibt unzählige Studien, die die schädlichen Auswirkungen der exportierten Pestizide auf den Menschen belegen.
englishfeedback: The export of toxic pesticides is a human rights issue, as pesticides harm people: Every year thousands of farmers die from exposure to hazardous pesticides. There are countless studies demonstrating the harmful effects of exported pesticides on humans.

feedback: WE, the European people, need YOU to act right now and ban all dangerous pesticides from European soil and from being exported anywhere else in the world. You are allowing them to go out the door and enter back from the window via the food we import from those countries; this is NOT acceptable. WE need YOU to do the right thing right now. Sara

Wir bitten Sie mit Nachdruck, auf gefährliche Chemikalien im Ausland zu verzichten !! Das betrifft die Herstellung und Ausfuhr von Chemikalien, die in der Europäischen Union verboten sind!!! Hochachtungsvoll Dres Tomka Dominique und Iván
englishfeedback: We urge you to dispense with hazardous chemicals abroad. This concerns the production and export of chemicals that are banned in the European Union! Dear Dres Tomka Dominique and Iván

feedback: Totally in favor of the legislative initiative that aims to introduce a mechanism prohibiting production and/or export of certain hazardous chemicals that are banned in the EU to protect non-EU countries from their negative effects on human health and the environment.

De export van giftige pesticiden is slecht voor bijen, biodiversiteit en de planeet. Het bewijs laat er geen twijfel over bestaan: neonicotinoïden en andere giftige pesticiden zijn dodelijk voor bijen. Daarom zijn ze verboden in Europa. Waarom staan we dan alsnog toe dat ze naar landen met zwakkere regelgeving worden geëxporteerd, om aldaar de bijen te doden en de biodiversiteit te decimeren? Een juridisch advies van het Centrum voor Internationaal Milieurecht, gepubliceerd in 2022, laat zien hoe de EU met de export van verboden pesticiden naar Afrika en Centraal-Amerika haar internationale wettelijke verantwoordelijkheden en mensenrechten schendt. De export van giftige pesticiden legt een dubbele standaard bloot. De gevaarlijke pesticiden werden in Europa verboden nadat een verband was aangetoond met kanker, vruchtbaarheidsproblemen, neurodegeneratieve ziektes en bijensterfte. Sommige van deze pesticiden zijn verboden in Europa omdat ze in verband zijn gebracht met hersenbeschadiging bij kinderen en ongeboren babys. Als de pesticiden te gevaarlijk voor ons zijn, hoe kunnen we ze dan laten exporteren? De export van giftige pesticiden profiteert van landen met een zwakkere regelgeving. Europa kan iets goeds betekenen voor de wereld haar bedrijven zouden niet mogen profiteren van landen met zwakkere regelgeving. Hoe kan iemand ons nog serieus nemen als we onze gevaarlijke chemicaliën naar het buitenland verschepen, om zo mens en natuur te vergiftigen in landen waar veiligheidsvoorschriften zwakker zijn en minder worden gehandhaafd?
englishfeedback: The export of toxic pesticides is bad for bees, biodiversity and the planet. The evidence leaves no doubt: neonicotinoids and other toxic pesticides are fatal to bees. This is why they are banned in Europe. Why do we still allow them to be exported to countries with weaker regulations in order to kill bees and decompose biodiversity? A legal opinion of the Centre for International Environmental Law, published in 2022, shows how the EU is violating its international legal responsibilities and human rights with regard to exports of banned pesticides to Africa and Central America. The export of toxic pesticides reveals a double standard. Hazardous pesticides were banned in Europe after a link was demonstrated with cancer, fertility problems, neurodegenerative diseases and bee mortality. Some of these pesticides are banned in Europe because they have been associated with brain damage in children and unborn babys. If pesticides are too dangerous to us, how can we get them exported? The export of toxic pesticides benefits from countries with weaker regulation. Europe can do something good for the world’s businesses should not benefit from countries with weaker regulation. How can someone still take us seriously if we shipped our dangerous chemicals abroad to poisoning people and nature in countries where safety requirements are weaker and less enforced?

feedback: Notre planète fonctionne de manière holistique, tout est un tout. Tuer le vivant, insectes, plantes, sols, eau, air, c'est tuer par ricochet l'humanité. Utiliser des produits comme ceux-là, c'est mettre en danger les producteurs comme les consommateurs, tout cela au nom d'énormes profits de quelques sociétés et sous couvert de moindres réglementations de pays moins riches. Pourtant les gens de ces pays en paient le prix et les productions passent les frontières arrosant de leur poison le monde entier. Harmonisons les chances de vie sur la planète entière ainsi respectons les peuples et non les super profits.
englishfeedback: Our planet works holistically, everything is a whole. Killing live, insects, plants, soil, water, air means killing humankind in turn. Using products like them means putting both producers and consumers at risk, all in the name of huge profits from a few companies and under the guise of lower regulations in less wealthy countries. Yet people in these countries pay the price and productions cross the booming borders of their poison around the world. Let’s harmonise life opportunities across the globe and respect people and not super profits.

feedback: Fermate le esportazioni di sostanze chimiche pericolose!
englishfeedback: Stop exports of hazardous chemicals!

feedback: It's essential to ban the export of pesticides that are banned in Europe. Human rights and ecosystem health are our shared responsibility globally

Warum sollte die EU im eigenen Territorium verbotene, nachweislich mit Hirnschäden bei Kindern und ungeborenen Babys, Krebs, Beeinträchtigung der Fruchtbarkeit, neurodegenerativen Krankheiten und ähnliches in Verbindung stehende Pestizide exportieren und das Leben vieler Menschen, noch mehr die Lebensgrundlage aller Menschen, da Umweltschäden an EU Grenzen keinen Halt machen, aufgrund v. schädlichem Wirtschaftswachstum gefährden wollen? Warum will die EU gegen internationale rechtliche Verpflichtungen und die Menschenrechte verstoßen? Die EU steht in der Verantwortung mit gutem Vorbild, hinsichtlich Menschenrechte, Doppelmoral, Korruption, gutes vs. schlechtes Wirtschaftswachstum, Einhaltung des Shared-Value Konzepts von in der EU ansässigen Firmen uvm. voranzugehen und ein Zeichen für Menschenrechte zu setzen. Lassen Sie nicht zu, dass diese Pestizide in Länder exportiert werden! Lassen Sie nicht zu, dass diese Pestizide eingesetzt werden! Lassen Sie nicht zu, dass diese Pestizide unsere Erde vergiften! Stoppen Sie die Hersteller*innen dieser Pestizide! Exportverbot für giftige Pestizide JETZT! Nachhaltige Pflanzenschutzmethoden JETZT! Kein Gift mehr auf unseren Tellern, weil Bayer Gewinne einstreichen will JETZT! Keine Umweltzerstörung mehr, weil Bayer Gewinne einstreichen will JETZT! Sie haben den Green Deal unterzeichnet? -Dann handeln Sie auch konsistent!
englishfeedback: Why should the EU export on its territory banned from its territory, proven to cause brain damage in children and unborn babies, cancer, fertility impairment, neurodegenerative diseases and similar pesticides, and endanger the lives of many people, even more the livelihoods of all people, as environmental damage at EU borders does not stop, due to harmful economic growth? Why does the EU intend to violate international legal obligations and human rights? The EU has a responsibility to lead by example in terms of human rights, double morale, corruption, good vs bad economic growth, adherence to the Shared Value concept of EU-based firms, and a sign of human rights. Do not allow these pesticides to be exported to countries! Do not allow these pesticides to be used! Do not allow these pesticides to poison our planet! Stop the manufacturers of these pesticides! Export ban on toxic pesticides Sustainable plant protection methods No more poisoned on our phones because Bayer wants to start winnings! No more environmental degradation because Bayer wants to make profits YETZT! Have you signed the Green Deal? —Because you also act consistently!

feedback: L'exportation de pesticides toxiques profite des pays où la réglementation est moins stricte. L'UE a un rôle à jouer dans le monde - ses entreprises ne doivent pas être autorisées à profiter des pays où la réglementation est plus faible. Comment pouvons-nous être pris au sérieux si nous expédions nos produits chimiques dangereux à l'étranger, empoisonnant ainsi les populations et la nature dans des pays où les règles de sécurité sont plus faibles et moins strictement appliquées ?
englishfeedback: The export of toxic pesticides benefits countries with less stringent regulation. The EU has a role to play in the world – its businesses should not be allowed to benefit from countries with weaker regulation. How can we be taken seriously if we send our hazardous chemicals abroad, poisoning people and nature in countries where safety rules are weaker and less strictly enforced?

feedback: Dear EU Commission, I personally saw the terrible effects of pesticides in South America, especially in Argentina, and it's shocking. The damage caused by these chemicals is very concerning, and we need to act urgently to deal with this serious problem. The export of toxic pesticides exposes a double standard: Dangerous pesticides are banned in Europe after they were linked to cancer, reproductive problems, neurodegenerative diseases, and the dying of bees. Some of these pesticides are banned in Europe because of their links to brain damage in children and unborn babies. If these pesticides are too dangerous for us, how can we allow them to be exported? The export of toxic pesticides is a human rights issue as these toxic pesticides are damaging to people: Every year, thousands of farmers die from exposure to dangerous pesticides. The pesticides exported have countless studies supporting the damaging effects on people. The export of toxic pesticides harms the bees, biodiversity and the planet. The evidence is clear: neonics and other poisonous pesticides kill bees. Thats why theyre banned in Europe. Why are we still allowing them to be exported to countries with weaker regulations, killing bees and decimating biodiversity? Europe has a role to play in the world - its companies should not be allowed to take advantage of countries with weaker regulations. How can we be taken seriously if we ship our hazardous chemicals abroad, poisoning people and nature in countries where safety regulations are weaker and less strictly enforced? An export ban on toxic pesticides would be a boon for innovation and help Europe and the world move towards more sustainable plant protection methods. Keeping old and dangerous pesticides on the market is depriving us of a greener future and more sustainable farming practices. A legal opinion by the Center for International Environmental Law published in 2022 shows that EU exports of banned pesticides to Africa and Central America violate the EUs international legal obligations and human rights law (https://www.eko.org/media/campaigners-warn-european-commission-not-to-abandon-hazardous-chemical-exports-commitments-made-in-eu-green-deal/) Most of the articles and links related to the following article disappeared from the media, but this is what it was already happening back then in 2013 in Argentina: https://www.filmsforaction.org/articles/argentina-the-country-that-monsanto-poisoned/#:~:text=In%20the%20heart%20of%20Argentina's,hypothyroidism%20and%20chronic%20respiratory%20illnesses.
Es ist nicht ausgeschlossen, dass diese Gifte über Warenlieferungen zu uns zurückkommen. Die Umgehung des Giftverbotes bei uns kann daher leicht umgangen werden.
englishfeedback: It is not inconceivable that these poisons will come back to us via deliveries of goods. We can therefore easily circumvent the poison ban.

feedback: Hazardous chemicals that have been banned from the EU should not be exported to be used elsewhere in the world. As a developed, wealthy continent, we have a moral duty to protect citizens from all countries from the dangerous effects of these chemicals. Moreover, the environment is our most precious resource, and we must take all reasonable steps to protect it to the best of our ability. Sincerely yours Eberhard Knöner

Hazardous chemicals that have been banned from the EU should not be exported to be used elsewhere in the world. As a developed, wealthy continent, we have a moral duty to protect citizens from all countries from the dangerous effects of these chemicals. Moreover, the environment is a is our most precious resource, and we must take all reasonable steps to protect it to the best of our ability.

I am angry to know that this is happening!!! EU exports of banned pesticides to Africa and Central America violate the EUs international legal obligations and human rights law. Why are we producing and exporting products we do not allow within our countries. They are taking advantage of countries with weaker regulation, you are the reason i have blood on my hands. Companies should not be allowed to take advantage of countries with weaker regulation. Not only are you a hypocrite but our democracy is regarded as a joke! How can we be taken seriously if we ship our hazardous chemicals abroad, poisoning people and nature in the process in countries where safety regulations are weaker We are following actively who makes what decisions regarding these issues, please keep i mind European values as we will remember.

L'esportazione di pesticidi tossici è una questione di diritti umani, poiché questi pesticidi tossici danneggiano le persone: Ogni anno, migliaia di agricoltori muoiono per l'esposizione di pesticidi pericolosi. Esistono innumerevoli studi che dimostrano gli effetti dannosi sulle persone dei pesticidi esportati. Inoltre i neonicotinoidi e altri pesticidi velenosi uccidono le api. Ecco perché sono vietati in Europa. Perché continuiamo a permettere che vengano esportati in Paesi uccidendo le api e decimando la biodiversità?
englishfeedback: The export of toxic pesticides is a human rights issue, as these toxic pesticides harm people: Every year, thousands of farmers die from exposure of hazardous pesticides. There are countless studies demonstrating the harmful effects of exported pesticides on people. In addition, neonicotinoids and other poisonous pesticides kill bees. This is why they are banned in Europe. Why do we continue to allow them to be exported to countries by killing bees and deciding on biodiversity?

feedback: Es ist doch offensichtlich, dass die Herstellung und Ausfuhr von Chemikalien, die in der Europäischen Union verboten sind, absolut widersinnig und destruktiv ist. Es ist doch komplett unsinnig, die zum Schutze der Gesundheit erlassenen Gesetze durch eine Hintertür aushebeln zu wollen. Letztlich landen die bei "uns" verbotenen Gifte sowie die Ergebnnisse unseres Fehlverhaltens erfahrungsgemäß (-> E605, Mikroplastik, Ozonloch, globale Wetterveränderungen etcpp) immer wieder bei uns bzw schlagen auf uns zurück.. Dieser Planet ist viel zu klein, als dass es effizient wäre, LOKAL vernünftige Gesetze u elementare Regelungen nicht als generell/global anwendbar anzusehen. Die implizite Menschenverachtung durch den Export eigener "Probleme" ist ebenso arrogant wie untragbar. CF Kant's Kategorischer Imperativ. QED. MfG, D. Heidler
englishfeedback: It is clear that the production and export of chemicals banned in the European Union are absolutely paradoxical and destructive. It is completely pointless to want to override the laws adopted to protect health by means of a backdoor. According to experience, the poisons prohibited by ‘our’ and the achievements of our misconduct (-> E605, microplastics, ozone hole, global weather changes, etc.) end up again and again with us. This planet is far too small for it to be efficient not to regard LOKAL as generally/globally applicable laws and basic rules. The implicit suspicion of human beings by exporting its own ‘problems’ is just as an arrogant as it is unacceptable. CF Kant’s Categorical Imperative. QED. MFG, D. Heidler

feedback: Sehr geehrte Mitglieder der Kommission, ich begrüße es ausdrücklich, daß endlich ein Verbot der Herstellung und Ausfuhr von Chemikalien, die in der EU verboten sind. geplant ist. Viele dieser Pestizide sind bereits lange in Europa verboten, trotzdem ist aber der Export erlaubt. Wie kann das sein? Das ist eine gefährliche Doppelmoral. Diese giftigen Pestizide wurden in Europa verboten, nachdem sie mit Krebs, Beeinträchtigung der Fruchtbarkeit und weiteren Krankheiten in Verbindung gebracht wurden - zum Bienensterben tragen sie außerdem bei. Einige dieser Pestizide sind in Europa verboten, weil sie mit Hirnschäden bei Kindern und ungeborenen Babys in Verbindung gebracht werden. Wenn diese Pestizide für uns zu gefährlich sind: Wie können wir dann zulassen, dass sie exportiert werden? Die Ausfuhr von giftigen Pestiziden ist eine Frage der Menschenrechte, denn die Pestizide schaden den Menschen: Jedes Jahr sterben Tausende von Landwirt*innen durch den Kontakt mit gefährlichen Pestiziden. Es gibt zahlreiche Studien, die die schädlichen Auswirkungen der exportierten Pestizide auf den Menschen belegen. Die Ausfuhr giftiger Pestizide ist desaströs für Bienen, die biologische Vielfalt und den Planeten. Die Beweislage ist eindeutig: Neonics und andere giftige Pestizide töten Bienen. Deshalb sind sie in Europa verboten. Wir sollten nicht zulassen, dass diese Pestizide in Länder exportiert werden, in denen Gesundheitsvorschriften weniger streng sind und dort Bienen und die biologische Vielfalt zerstören. Länder, in denen es kaum Vorschriften für giftige Pestizide gibt, werden als Markt benutzt. Europäische Unternehmen sollten nicht die Möglichkeit haben, diesen Umstand auszunutzen. Wie kann Europa als Weltmacht ernst genommen werden, wenn wir gefährliche Chemikalien ins Ausland verschiffen und dabei Mensch und Natur in Ländern vergiften, in denen Sicherheitsvorschriften geringer sind und weniger streng durchgesetzt werden? Ein Exportverbot für giftige Pestizide würde Europa und der Welt helfen, zu nachhaltigeren Pflanzenschutzmethoden überzugehen. Wenn gefährliche Pestizide auf dem Markt bleiben, werden wir weiter auf eine grünere Zukunft und nachhaltige Landwirtschaft warten müssen. Ein Rechtsgutachten des Center for International Environmental Law, das 2022 veröffentlicht wurde, zeigt, dass die EU mit dem Export verbotener Pestizide nach Afrika und Mittelamerika gegen internationale rechtliche Verpflichtungen und die Menschenrechte verstößt. Ich bitte Sie sehr nachdrücklich, sich für ein solches Verbot einzusetzen und nicht erneut den Forderungen der Pestizid-Lobby nachzugeben, mit besorgten Grüßen Michael Betz
englishfeedback: Dear Commissioners, I warmly welcome the plan to finally ban the production and export of chemicals that are banned in the EU. Many of these pesticides have been banned in Europe for a long time, but exports are still allowed. How can this be? This is a dangerous double standard. These toxic pesticides have been banned in Europe after being associated with cancer, fertility impairment and other diseases, and contribute to bee mortality. Some of these pesticides are banned in Europe because they are associated with brain damage in children and unborn babies. If these pesticides are too dangerous for us: How can we then allow them to be exported? The export of toxic pesticides is a human rights issue, as pesticides harm people: Every year thousands of farmers die from exposure to hazardous pesticides. There are numerous studies demonstrating the harmful effects of exported pesticides on humans. Exports of toxic pesticides are desastrous for bees, biodiversity and the planet. The evidence is clear: Neonics and other toxic pesticides kill bees. This is why they are banned in Europe. We should not allow these pesticides to be exported to countries where health rules are less stringent and where bees and biodiversity are destroyed. Countries with little regulation on toxic pesticides are used as a market. European companies should not be able to take advantage of this fact. How can Europe be taken seriously as a global power when we ship dangerous chemicals abroad, poisoning people and nature in countries where safety rules are lower and enforcement is less stringent? A ban on exports of toxic pesticides would help Europe and the world move towards more sustainable plant protection practices. If hazardous pesticides remain on the market, we will have to wait for a greener future and sustainable agriculture. A legal opinion from the Center for International Environmental Law, published in 2022, shows that the EU is in breach of international legal obligations and human rights by exporting banned pesticides to Africa and Central America. I urge you to push for such a ban and not to respond again to the demands of the pesticide lobby, with Mr Michael Betz’s worries.

feedback: Allowing pesticides to be exported to countries with a weaker regulation that have been banned in Europe because they endanger people, especially born and unborn children, and nature, such as bees, seems like creating a double standard to me. Are people and nature in other countries worth less than in Europe? The EU should be showing the world a good example, and this doesn't fit to allowing European companies to take advantage of weaker regulation in other countries. Banning pesticides for good would also pave the way for innovation in terms of developing more sustainable and environmentally and health-friendly methods of plant protection methods. Thank you so much for asking for people's feedback and taking it into consideration!
malgré tous les signaux d alerte écologiques , allons nous continué jusqu' a la fin de toutes vie sur terre , a détruire au profit d une minorité de nantis ,qui se croit a l abri
englishfeedback: despite all the ecological warning signals, we are going to continue until the end of all lives on earth, destroyed for the benefit of a minority of swimmers, who believe they are sheltered.

feedback: Giftige Chemikalien dürfen außerhalb Europas die Umwelt nicht noch zusätzlich schädigen und Menschen und Tiere töten. Eine saubere Umwelt ist ein Menschenrecht, gesunde Nahrung und eine intakte Biospäre ebenso. Mit freundlichem Gruß, Dr. Rainer Jogschies
englishfeedback: Toxic chemicals must not cause additional damage to the environment outside Europe and kill humans and animals. A clean environment is a human right, healthy food and an intact biospular as well. Best regards, Dr Rainer Jogschies

feedback: Dangerous chemicals must be fully banned from export out of EU. The issue is a fundamental one of human rights and protection of an already burning planet. No dilution of that principle should be negotiated or lobbied away or Europes credibility on green agenda is shredded

Dear Sir/Madame, I would like to voice my opinion about the bann of the export of pesticides. How can we allow to export products that are already banned in Europe to other cuntries especially if we banned them because they are dangerous for citizens due to their cansor influence on humans and because they kill bees? if one looks at all the reports and even what is happening in our own gardnes bees are on the way to become extinct and then we have to grwo our vegtables like they do in China by getting thousands of workers to put the poln by hand on the fruits? Not that we do not have those workers available but we have to think about the future. Right now forests all over the world are burning, people suffer from hunger, more and more animals get extinct and the climate change which nobody can ignore anymore (just look at the south of Europe, the USA, Canada, etc.) and then we as the European Union who have signed treaties to protect humans and the environment want to export goods that willl damage those things somewhere else? That is not moral and not what we as the European union should even think about! We have to try and protect what is left of our nature and wild life and try to counter things that are going on right now - it is already quite late but we have the power to start the change and I believe in the European Union to do the right thing and stop the export of banned substances! Thanks in advance for your assistance and your support! yours sincerely mr. Ginger claassen
People are the same all over the world. They deserve to be treated equally by the EU as well. Show the world that you live this in your policies and ban the export of dangerous chemicals.
englishfeedback: People are the same all over the world. They deserve to be treated equally by the EU as well. Show the world that you live this in your policies and ban the export of dangerous chemicals.

feedback: Es darf nicht sein, dass in der EU verbotene Substanzen hier hergestellt und exportiert werden dürfen. Das ist Doppelmoral!
englishfeedback: It must not be possible for substances banned in the EU to be manufactured and exported here. This is double morality!

feedback: Export von in Europa verbotenen Pestiziden verbieten!!! Die Pestizide schädigen die Gesundheit in den Anwendungsländern und durch importierte Pestizidware kommen die verbotenen Pestizide nach Europa zurück und schädigen so auch in Europa die Konsumenten! Bitte handeln Sie verantwortungsbewußt und mitmenschlich und nicht zugunsten der profitorientierten Pestizidlobby! Mit freundlichen Grüßen Christine Richarz-Mattke
englishfeedback: Ban export of pesticides banned in Europe! Pesticides are harmful to health in the countries of use and imported pesticide products bring the banned pesticides back to Europe and thus harm consumers in Europe too! Please act responsibly and humanely and not in favour of the profit-oriented pesticide lobby! Best regards Christine Richarz-Mattke

feedback: Bitte unterbinden Sie die Produktion gefährlicher Stoffe Bitte lassen Sie sich nicht beirren von Expertisen, die die Ungefährlichkeit behaupten bzw zu belegen vorgeben Sie wissen, dass die betreffenden Firmen (Industrieen) im Interesse ihrer Eigentümer auf Rendite achten müssen (es ist daher nachvollziehbar, dass die ihre Produkte in ein günstiges Licht rücken wollen - leider haben sie auf Grund ihrer finanziellen Möglichkeiten fast unbegrenzt Gelegenheit dazu .. Das ist so) Bitte seien Sie im Interesse Ihrer Wähler misstrauisch! Bitte sehen Sie das Interesse Ihrer Wähler (und natürlich aller Menschen) als vorrangig an! Mit freundlichen Grüßen WolliM aus PB - BRD - am Freitag 21. Juli 2023
englishfeedback: Please stop the production of dangerous substances. Please don't hesitate to do so by experts who claim or provide evidence of the non-hazardous nature of the products in question, knowing that the companies concerned (industry) must pay attention to returns in the interest of their owners (it is therefore understandable that they want to get their products in a favourable light – unfortunately, because of their financial capacity, they have almost unlimited opportunities to do so. This is the case) Please be distrustful in the interests of your voters. Please consider the interest of your voters (and of course all people) to be a priority! Yours sincerely, WolliM from PB – Germany – on Friday 21 July 2023

feedback: negative effects on human health and the environment

The export of toxic pesticides from the EU needs to be prohibited. How can substances banned in Europe be allowed to be exported and cause harm in other countries? It is already recognised that these pesticides are linked to serious health outcomes such as cancer, reproductive problems, and neurodegenerative diseases. Not to mention the detrimental effects on biodiversity and hence food security in Europe for generations to come. How can we then export these substances so they can harm people's health, hurt human rights, and destroy biodiversity elsewhere? The biodiversity crisis is a global one and these harms will come back to hurt us as well. Please ban the export of toxic pesticides immediately.

Agiamo per il bene della comunità europea e la salute delle persone di tutto il mondo; difendiamo la natura dal business aggressivo e miope di poche persone. Aria, acqua, terra, piante, animali e genere umano...una interrelazione magnifica e in pericolo...ogni persona è chiamata ad un cambiamento radicale per tutelare il futuro della nostra Madre Terra. Francesco
englishfeedback: We act for the good of the European community and the health of people around the world; we defend nature against the aggressive and short-sighted business of a few people. Air, water, land, plants, animals and humans... a magnificent and endangered interrelationship... everyone is called upon to change radically to protect the future of our Madre Terra. Francesco

feedback: Mi sembra ovvio; non puo' essere che una sostanza considerata pericolosa in Europa, possa essere esportata dall'Europa stessa verso altri paesi solo perchè in questi paesi le restrizioni sono minori. Se una sostanza è pericolosa, è pericolosa per tutti, per tutti i cittadini del mondo e per tutti gli ambineti del mondo! Licio Ferrari
englishfeedback: It seems obvious to me; a substance that is considered dangerous in Europe can only be exported from Europe to other countries because there are fewer restrictions in these countries. If a substance is dangerous, it is dangerous for everyone, for all citizens of the world and for all of the world! Licio Ferrari

feedback: Gentilissimi, porto alla vostra attenzione una questione etica e ambientale di massima urgenza e rilevanza: come sapete, i pesticidi pericolosi sono vietati in Europa, ma continuano a essere esportati in Africa e America del Sud. Finalmente, lUE potrebbe porre fine a questa contraddizione con un divieto sulle esportazioni. I cittadini dell'Europa vi chiedono a gran voce di porre fine a questa assurdità pericolosa per tutti e di fare un passo avanti in termini di civiltà. Cordialmente, Cristina
englishfeedback: Dear, I would like to draw your attention to an ethical and environmental issue of the utmost urgency and relevance: as you know, hazardous pesticides are banned in Europe, but continue to be exported to Africa and South America. Finally, the EU could put an end to this contradiction with an export ban. Europe’s citizens are calling on you to put an end to this dangerous absurdity for all and to take a step forward in terms of civilisation. Cordially, Cristina

feedback: Bonjour, Le déreglement climatique est en cours et la biodiversité est mise à mal partout sur la planete. Nos choix de pays riches ont un impact considérable de par notre mode de vie sur les autres habitants de la terre. Dans un monde aux limites finies, on est obligé de s'adapter. En tant que citoyenne concernée et impliquée je peux vous dire que je suis farouchement pour l'interdiction de la production à des fins d'exportations de produits chimiques interdits en Europe. Je pense que ce sera une étape importante pour mettre nos actes en accord avec nos paroles. Je pense qu'on pourrait aussi interdire l'importation de produits de consommation ayant utilisé les dits produits chimiques pour leur fabrication. Cela permettrait aux industriels de revoir toute la chaine de production et d'avoir une perspective d'avenir. Cela favoriserait les entreprises européennes qui font l'effort d'utiliser des produits chimiques moins nocifs mais souvent plus couteux. Quand je vois les fast-food qui ont été obligé de changer leur emballage pour les repas en passant du jetable au réutilisable et qui maintenant font du greenwaching en disant faisant de la communication disant que c'est super pour la planète, cela me conforte dans l'idée que c'est en passant par un cadre reglementaire fort et contraignant que l'on pousse à penser au bien commun. Nous avons une seule planète et si on veut la garder vivable, il va falloir des actes politiques forts, merci de les oser. Lucie PAUZE
englishfeedback: Hello, Climate change is under way and biodiversity is being undermined everywhere on the plant. Our choices of wealthy countries have a huge impact on other people living in the land through our way of life. In a world of finite boundaries, we have to adapt. As a citizen concerned and involved, I can tell you that I am deeply committed to banning production for export of chemicals banned in Europe. I think this will be an important step to align our actions with our words. I think that it could also be possible to prohibit the importation of consumer products which have used the chemicals in question for their manufacture. This would allow manufacturers to review the whole production chain and have a perspective for the future. This would favour European companies that make efforts to use less harmful but often more expensive chemicals. When I see fast-food products that have been forced to change their packaging for meals from disposable to reusable, and which now make greenwaching by saying that it is a super for the planet, this supports me in the idea that it is through a strong and binding regulatory framework that we are pushing to think about the common good. We have one planet and if we want to keep it alive, we will need strong political acts, thank you for daring them. Lucie PAUZE

feedback: Dear Sir, dear Madame, The export of toxic pesticides exposes a double standard: Dangerous pesticides are banned in Europe after they were linked to cancer, reproductive problems and neurodegenerative diseases as well as the dying of bees. Some of these pesticides are banned in Europe because of their links to brain damage in children and unborn babies. If these pesticides are too dangerous for us, how can we allow them to be exported? The export of toxic pesticides is a human rights issue as these toxic pesticides are damaging to people: Every year, thousands of farmers die from exposure to dangerous pesticides. The pesticides exported have countless studies supporting the damaging effects on people. The export of toxic pesticides is bad for the bees, biodiversity and the planet. The evidence is clear: neonics and other poisonous pesticides kill bees. Thats why theyre banned in Europe. Why are we still allowing them to be exported to countries with weaker regulation, killing bees and decimating biodiversity? The export of toxic pesticides is taking advantage of countries with weaker regulation. Europe has a role to play in the world - its companies should not be allowed to take advantage of countries with weaker regulation. How can we be taken seriously if we ship our hazardous chemicals abroad, poisoning people and nature in the process in countries where safety regulations are weaker and less strictly enforced. An export ban of toxic pesticides would be a boon for innovation and help Europe and the world move towards more sustainable plant protection methods. Keeping old and dangerous pesticides on the market is depriving us from a greener future and more sustainable farming practices. A legal opinion by the Center for International Environmental Law published in 2022 shows that EU exports of banned pesticides to Africa and Central America violate the EUs international legal obligations and human rights law. So please support an ambitious and environmental friendly change in this context! Our Children and the Childrens Children deserve a healthy World, where they are able to not only survive, but live a peaceful and healthy life, if possible, with a basic comfort (which would be in massive danger, if we don't act in the right and wise way). Thank you in advance, in the name of all living beings. Kind regards, Stefan Wilk
Verpackt in Ernte-Früchten bekommen wir diese Chemikalien dann wieder zurück und dürfen sie essen. Das geht gar nicht! Produktion und Export solcher Stoffe muss generell verboten werden.
englishfeedback: Packed in harvest fruits, we will then get these chemicals back and can eat them. That’s not at all! The production and export of such substances must be prohibited in general.

Some of these pesticides are banned in Europe because of their links to brain damage in children and unborn babies. If these pesticides are too dangerous for us, how can we allow them to be exported? Sehr geehrte Damen und Herren, es ist ein Unding, dass immer noch Pestizide und Chemikalien, die in der EU seit Jahren verboten sind, hergestellt und in Drittländer exportiert werden. Darüber ärgere ich mich schon lange. Es kann und darf nicht sein, dass Monsanto und Co. sich an diesen Mitteln bereichern und Menschen und Umwelt in anderen Ländern massiv schädigen. Ich fordere Sie unmissverständlich auf, endlich dafür zu sorgen, dass diese Praxis eingestellt wird. Freundliche Grüße Barbara Schwedland
englishfeedback: Ladies and gentlemen, it is a business case that pesticides and chemicals that have been banned in the EU for years are still produced and exported to third countries. I have been angry about this for a long time. It cannot and should not be that Monsanto and Co. enrich themselves with these funds and cause massive damage to people and the environment in other countries. I strongly urge you to finally put an end to this practice. Yours sincerely, Barbara Schwedland

feedback: I can't believe how this is still lawful!

Pestizide sind in Europa verboten, aber der Export ist erlaubt: Das ist eine Regelungslücke die schnellstmöglich geschlossen werden muss. Die gefährlichen Pestizide wurden in Europa verboten, nachdem sie mit Krebs, Beeinträchtigung der Fruchtbarkeit und neurodegenerativen Krankheiten in Verbindung gebracht wurden - zum Bienensterben tragen sie außerdem bei. Einige dieser Pestizide sind in Europa verboten, weil sie mit Hirnschäden bei Kindern und ungeborenen Babys in Verbindung gebracht werden. Wenn diese Pestizide für uns zu gefährlich sind: Wie können wir dann zulassen, dass sie exportiert werden? Bitte stellen Sie das ab und schieben einen Riegel vor!
englishfeedback: Pesticides are banned in Europe, but exports are allowed: This is a regulatory gap that needs to be filled as soon as possible. Hazardous pesticides have been banned in Europe after being associated with cancer, fertility impairment and neurodegenerative diseases and contribute to bee mortality. Some of these pesticides are banned in Europe because they are associated with brain damage in children and unborn babies. If these pesticides are too dangerous for us: How can we then allow them to be exported? Please stop and put a stop!

feedback: Sehr geehrte Damen und Herren, bitte wirken Sie darauf hin, die bestehende Doppelmoral zu beenden. Der Export von in der EU verbotener Pestizide ist nicht weiter hinnehmbar. Die gefährlichen Pestizide wurden in Europa verboten, nachdem sie mit Krebs, Beeinträchtigung der Fruchtbarkeit und neurodegenerativen Krankheiten in Verbindung gebracht wurden - zum Bienensterben tragen sie außerdem bei. Abseits politischer Grenzen leben wir auf einem gemeinsamen Planeten. Wenn die Natur in Afrika mit unserer Hilfe zerstört wird, kommt das Ergebnis in kurzer Zeit bei uns an. Bitte setzen Sie sich dafür ein, dass die natürlichen landwirtschaftlichen Ressourcen in allen Ländern gestärkt werden und für den Export von gefährlichen Pestiziden vergleichbare Regeln wie für den Binnenhandel gelten. Vielen Dank für Ihr Engagement!
englishfeedback: Ladies and gentlemen, please work to put an end to the existing double standards. The export of pesticides banned in the EU is not more acceptable. Hazardous pesticides have been banned in Europe after being associated with cancer, fertility impairment and neurodegenerative diseases and contribute to bee mortality. Beyond political borders, we live on a common planet. If our help destroys nature in Africa, the result will come with us in a short period of time. Please ensure that natural agricultural resources are strengthened in all countries and that rules for the export of hazardous pesticides are comparable to those applicable to domestic trade. Thank you for your commitment.

Some of these pesticides are banned in Europe because of their links to brain damage in children and unborn babies. If these pesticides are too dangerous for us, how can we allow them to be exported? - The export of toxic pesticides is a human rights issue as these toxic pesticides are damaging to people: Every year, thousands of farmers die from exposure to dangerous pesticides. The pesticides exported have countless studies supporting the damaging effects on people. - The export of toxic pesticides is bad for the bees, biodiversity and the planet.
