This is why they are banned in Europe. Why do we continue to allow them to be exported to countries by killing bees and deciding on biodiversity? The export of toxic pesticides highlights a double standard: Hazardous pesticides have been banned in Europe after being linked to cancer, reproductive problems and neurodegenerative diseases, as well as to the death of bees. Some of these pesticides are banned in Europe because they are linked to brain damage in children and infants. If these pesticides are too dangerous for us, how can they be exported abroad? The export of toxic pesticides is a human rights issue, as these toxic pesticides harm people: Every year, thousands of farmers die from exposure of hazardous pesticides. There are countless studies demonstrating the harmful effects of exported pesticides on people. The export of toxic pesticides exploits countries with more permissive laws. Europe has a role to play in the world: its companies should not be allowed to take advantage of countries with weaker regulation. How can we be taken seriously if we ship our hazardous chemicals abroad, poisoning people and nature in countries where safety standards are weaker and lower? A ban on the export of toxic pesticides would benefit innovation and help Europe and the world towards more sustainable farming practices. Keeping old and hazardous pesticides on the market deprives us of a greener future and more sustainable farming practices.

feedback: Chiedo alla Commissione europea di vietare le esportazioni dei pesticidi tossici, già vietati in Europa per la loro pericolosità per ambiente e tutti gli esseri viventi. Grazie
englishfeedback: I call on the European Commission to ban exports of toxic pesticides, which are already banned in Europe because of their danger to the environment and to all living beings. Thanks

feedback: Ich fordere Sie auf die Ausfuhr gefährlicher Chemikalien endlich zu stoppen!
englishfeedback: I call on you to finally stop exporting dangerous chemicals!

feedback: Dobbiamo vietare la produzione per l'esportazione di sostanze chimiche vietate nell'Unione europea!
englishfeedback: We need to ban the production for the export of chemicals banned in the European Union!

feedback: Mi unisco a chiedere un divieto di esportazione dei pesticidi pericolosi, già vietati in Europa. Il profitto economico di pochi non può continuare ad essere più importante della vita e la sopravivenza del nostro pianeta.
englishfeedback: I join my call for a ban on the export of hazardous pesticides, which are already banned in Europe. The economic gain of a few cannot continue to be more important than life and the survival of our planet.

feedback: Dobbiamo vietare la produzione per l esportazione di sostanze chimiche vietate nell Unione europea
englishfeedback: We need to ban the production for the export of chemicals banned in the European Union

feedback: Dobbiamo vietare la produzione per l esportazione di sostanze chimiche vietate nell Unione europea
englishfeedback: We need to ban the production for the export of chemicals banned in the European Union

feedback: E' assurdo vietare l'utilizzo di anticrittogamici nocivi per l'ambiente in Europa e nel contempo permetterne la produzione e l'esportazione per l'uso in Paesi extra UE mettendo così a rischio le vite degli agricoltori e delle loro famiglie, oltre che avvelenando il pianeta. L'ambiente è ambiente in ogni parte del Pianeta e la brutalizzazione in qualsiasi parte dei esso si risolve a danno di tutti. Basta con le politiche che tendono alla massimizzazione dei profitti. Non siamo, o meglio non dovremmo essere, un'entità fondata su ciò ma dovremmo diventare una Nazione che lavora per il bene dei popoli e dell'ambiente che ci accoglie. Voglio ricordare a me stesso in primis ed a voi, miei rappresentanti, che su questo pianeta siamo ospiti di passaggio e dovremmo lasciare ai nostri figli ed alle generazioni future un ambiente accogliente e, per quanto possibile, non inquinato. Tutto quanto successo in questi ultimi anni invece che farci riflettere su quello che stiamo combinando, e farci fare una sterzata a 180° tornando al rispetto di Chi ci accoglie e ci da da mangiare ha portato ad accelerare sulla massimizzazione dei profitti e quindi all'aumento di quell'inquinamento che porterà inevitabilmente alla catastrofe ambientale. La Terra si è stancata di sopportarci e se ancora qualcuno non lo ha capito ha deciso di farci fare la fine dei dinosauri. Sta a noi evitare che ciò accada. RISPETTIAMOLA.
englishfeedback: It is absurd to ban the use of anti-rittogamic substances harmful to the environment in Europe, while allowing them to be produced and exported for use in non-EU countries, thus endangering the lives of farmers and their families, as well as poisoning the planet. The environment is an environment in every part of the Planet and brutalisation in any part of it is detrimental to everyone. It is enough with policies that tend to maximise profits. We are not, or should not be, an entity based on this, but we should become a Nation that works for the good of the people and the environment we welcome. I would like to remind myself, first of all, and to you, my representatives, that we are visiting this planet and we should give our children and future generations a welcoming and, as far as possible, unpolluted environment. Everything that happened in recent years, rather than making us reflect on what we are combining, and making us steered to 180°, returning to respect for those who welcome us and to eat us, has led to the acceleration of profit maximisation and thus the increase in pollution that will inevitably lead to the environmental catastrophe. The Earth was tired to shoulder us and if someone still did not understand it, he decided to put an end to the dinosauri. It is up to us to prevent this from happening. RESPETTIAMOLA.

feedback: L'uso dei pesticidi è stato vietato in Europa perchè si è dimostrato che tali sostanze provocano gravi danni alla salute dei bambini e dei neonati. In base a queste considerazioni anche l'esportazione verso i paesi extra europei dovrebbe essere vietata per evitare gravi problemi di salute alle popolazioni dove i pesticidi vengono portati. Inoltre ogni anno molti decessi vengono causati dall'utilizzo dei pesticidi che devono quindi essere vietati in qualsiasi parte del mondo e di conseguenza non esportati nei paesi extra europei. I pesticidi sono anche dannosi per le api, insetto indispensabile per mantenere un corretto funzionamento della natura. L'uso di queste sostanze contribuisce all'uccisione di molte api e gravi problemi alla natura e questo è uno dei motivi che hanno spinto l'Europa a vietarne l'utilizzo e che dovrebbe provocare anche lo stop alle esportazioni. L'esportazione dei pesticidi avviene verso le nazioni che hanno una regolamentazione più debole rispetto a quella europea. In questo modo le nazioni che ricevono i pesticidi subiscono gravi danni alla popolazione e alla natura e questo non può essere un vanto per il nostro continente.
englishfeedback: The use of pesticides has been banned in Europe because they have been shown to cause serious harm to the health of children and infants. In the light of these considerations, exports to countries outside Europe should also be banned in order to avoid serious health problems for populations where pesticides are brought. Moreover, many deaths are caused every year by the use of pesticides, which must therefore be banned anywhere in the world and thus not exported to countries outside Europe. Pesticides are also harmful to bees, which is essential for maintaining the proper functioning of nature. The use of these substances contributes to the killing of many bees and serious problems to nature, and this is one of the reasons why Europe has banned their use and should also lead to a stop to exports. The export of pesticides takes place to countries that have weaker regulation than the European one. In this way, nations receiving pesticides suffer serious damage to people and nature, and this cannot be a vanguard for our continent.

feedback: Non spargete veleno, il mondo non ha bisogno di questo, la gente vi vota per fare gli interessi di chi non ha voce, non dovete fare sempre e solo gli interessi di chi fa soldi a danno delle persone inconsapevoli. È ora di fermarvi nello sponsorizzare prodotti di morte .
englishfeedback: Don’t spread poisonous, the world does not need this, people vote for the interests of those who do not have a voice, you do not always need to do so and only the interests of those who make money to the detriment of unconscious people. It is time to stop sponsoring death products.

feedback: I pesticidi pericolosi sono stati vietati in Europa poiché causano cancro, problemi riproduttivi e malattie neurodegenerative, e la morte delle api e in qualche caso danni cerebrali nei bambini e nei neonati. E paradossale che non sia vietata lesportazione allestero di pesticidi tossici: Non è onesto spedire le nostre sostanze chimiche pericolose all'estero, approfittando delle leggi più permissive di molti altri paesi e avvelenando le persone e la natura. Un divieto di esportazione dei pesticidi tossici sarebbe un vantaggio per l'innovazione e aiuterebbe l'Europa e il mondo intero verso pratiche agricole più sostenibili.
englishfeedback: Hazardous pesticides have been banned in Europe as they cause cancer, reproductive problems and neurodegenerative diseases, and the death of bees and in some cases brain damage in children and infants. And paradoxical that the export of toxic pesticides abroad is not prohibited: It is not honest to ship our hazardous chemicals abroad, taking advantage of the more permissive laws of many other countries and poisoning people and nature. A ban on the export of toxic pesticides would benefit innovation and help Europe and the world towards more sustainable farming practices.

feedback: Ormai non si può più mettere in dubbio che l'agricoltura intensiva e il relativo uso indiscriminato dei pesticidi sta impoverendo i suoli e uccide la biodiversità, cosi importante per il futuro dell'umanità. Se è vero che l'Europa ha una piccola percentuale di agricoltura intensiva devastante è comunque un faro e sono sempre state importanti le sue leggi e decisioni, trainanti comunque il pensiero del resto del mondo fino agli intellettuali delle grandi città americane che hanno una base di cultura europea. In più questa devastazione non nutre il mondo ma solo gli animali che mangiamo in modo eccessivo, pericoloso per la nostra salute, così come campagne pubblicitarie ingannevoli ci hanno insegnato a fare. La ricchezza di pochi immorali è la fame di molti innocenti. Cominciamo noi europei compattamente e senza indugi a fermare questa follia devastante anche per il clima poi adoperiamoci perché altri ci seguano. Fermate le lobby deii pesticidi e il mondo vi ricorderà. Grazie
englishfeedback: It can no longer be questioned that intensive agriculture and the related indiscriminate use of pesticides are depleting soils and killing biodiversity, which is so important for the future of humanity. While Europe has a small percentage of devastating intensive agriculture, it is a beacon and its laws and decisions have always been important, driving the thoughts of the rest of the world up to the intellectuals of the big American cities that have a basis of European culture. Moreover, this devastation does not feed the world, but only the animals we eat too much, which is dangerous for our health, as well as misleading advertising campaigns taught us to do. The wealth of a few immorals is the hunger of many innocent people. We start our Europeans compattly and without delay to stop this devastating folly, not least because of the climate we then adoperiamoci because others follow us. Stop pesticide lobbies and the world will remember them. Thanks

feedback: I pesticidi ammazzano non solo le api ma anche tutti quella categoria di insetti che servono ad interagire con la vita agricola e eliminano i parassiti infestanti dalle piante. La campagna tanto decantata dall UE sul Green parta anche da questo, fermare l'inquinamento dei terreni e delle falde acquifere, non inquinano solo le case ma anche e soprattutto i pesticidi che poi noi e i nostri figli mangiamo. Basta veleno.
englishfeedback: Pesticides blend not only bees but also all those insects that interact with agricultural life and eliminate pests from plants. The EU’s long-held Green campaign also starts from this, halting the pollution of soils and aquifers, not only polluting homes, but also, and above all, the pesticides we then eat and our children. Enough poison.

feedback: L'esportazione di pesticidi tossici è dannosa per le api, la biodiversità e il pianeta. Le prove sono chiare: i neonicotinoidi e altri pesticidi velenosi uccidono le api. Ecco perché sono vietati in Europa. Perché continuiamo a permettere che vengano esportati in Paesi uccidendo le api e decimando la biodiversità?
englishfeedback: The export of toxic pesticides is detrimental to bees, biodiversity and the planet. The evidence is clear: neonicotinoids and other poisonous pesticides kill bees. This is why they are banned in Europe. Why do we continue to allow them to be exported to countries by killing bees and deciding on biodiversity?

feedback: L'esportazione di pesticidi tossici è dannosa per le api, la biodiversità e il pianeta. Le prove sono chiare: i neonicotinoidi e altri pesticidi velenosi uccidono le api. Ecco perché sono vietati in Europa. Perché continuiamo a permettere che vengano esportati in Paesi uccidendo le api e decimando la biodiversità?
englishfeedback: The export of toxic pesticides is detrimental to bees, biodiversity and the planet. The evidence is clear: neonicotinoids and other poisonous pesticides kill bees. This is why they are banned in Europe. Why do we continue to allow them to be exported to countries by killing bees and deciding on biodiversity?

feedback: Good morning, please ban the pesticide export! The export of toxic pesticides is bad for the bees, biodiversity and the planet. The evidence is clear: neonics and other poisonous pesticides kill bees. Thats why theyre banned in Europe. Why are we still allowing them to be exported to countries with weaker regulation, killing bees and decimating biodiversity? thank you regards Giuliana De Poli - Italy

Come cittadina dell'Unione Europea non posso dare il mio consenso all'esportazione di sostanze chimiche vietate nell'Unione Europea perché cancerogene o genotossiche: la vita umana ha lo stesso valore ovunque. L'Unione Europea non può essere trasformata in un comitato di affari dove il profitto di pochi prevale su ogni considerazione di ordine etico.
englishfeedback: As a citizen of the European Union, I cannot give my consent to the export of chemicals banned in the European Union because they are carcinogenic or genotoxic: human life has the same value everywhere. The European Union cannot be transformed into a business committee where the profit of a few outweighs all ethical considerations.

feedback: Se continuiamo ad avvelenarci, facciamo presto una brutta fine... I posti di lavoro rimangono, tuttavia devono spostarsi dai settori tossici a settori compatibili con la vita sul pianeta Terra, altrimenti, come specie umana, facciamo una brutta fine... sarebbe un peccato!
englishfeedback: If we continue to poisoned us, let’s soon make a brutal end... Jobs remain, but we need to move from toxic sectors to sectors compatible with life on the planet Earth, otherwise, as a human species, we make a brutal end... it would be a pect!

feedback: Scusate: se certe sostanze sono VIETATE nei nostri paesi (leggi Comunità Europea), sarà perché sono nocive, no? Ma allora gli africani ed i sudamericani quali mutazioni genetiche, anticorpi e caratteristiche che li rendono immuni dalle conseguenze dannose di queste sostanze devono avere??? Non è una PERSONA quella che (magari poi anche professandosi Cristiana) permette la produzione e l'esportazione di tali sostanze in paesi del sud del mondo!!! Infine è una cosa comunque priva di buonsenso: pensate davvero che poi noi EUROPEI non si ritrovino residui di tali sostanze nei cibi che importiamo? Vi ESORTO a vietare la produzione di sostanze nocive! Con fiducia, nonostante tutto, Mariella Stefanoni - STFMLL70T50L682R
englishfeedback: Apologised: if certain substances are VIETATED in our countries (European Community laws), will it be because they are harmful, not? But should Africans and South Americans such as genetic mutations, antibodies and characteristics that make them immune from the harmful consequences of these substances have to have? It is not a PERSON what (perhaps even by professing Cristiana) allows these substances to be produced and exported to countries in the south of the world! Last but not least, this is not a good thing: do you really think that we EUROPEAN do not find residues of these substances in the food we import? I urge you to ban the production of harmful substances! With confidence, however, Mariella Stefanoni – STFMLL70T50L682R

feedback: Occorre vietare le esportazioni di pesticidi non autorizzate in UE verso TUTTI i paesi. Il pianeta è uno e non ha senso permettere che venga avvelenato a pezzi! Ricordiamoci che con l'immigrazione oramai inarrestabile le persone malate a causa dei pesticidi arrivano anche da noi con carico sui sistemi sanitari delle nazioni europee. Se non lo volete fare per ragioni umanitarie fatelo almeno per soldi!
englishfeedback: Exports of pesticides not authorised in the EU to ALL countries should be banned. The planet is one and it makes no sense to allow it to be poisoned in pieces! Remember that as a result of immigration, people who are ill as a result of pesticides are now also coming from us to the health systems of European nations. If you do not want to do so for humanitarian reasons, give it at least for money!

feedback: Considero quello indicato un problema mondiale e non solo europeo, è pressoché inutile vietare l'utilizzo di questi veleni in Europa se poi il resto del mondo, molto ma molto più grande ed impattante dell'Europa, continua ad utilizzarli ed inquinare come se non ci fosse un domani...... ed è proprio qui il problema..... se andiamo avanti così non so che 'domani' potremo lasciare alle nuove generazioni..... La scelta 'stop ai pesticidi' dovrebbe essere totale e condivisa altrimenti rimane una delle solite scelte penalizzanti solo per l'Europa...
englishfeedback: I see this as a global and not only European problem. It is almost pointless to ban the use of these poison in Europe if the rest of the world, much but much larger and more impactful than Europe, continues to use them and pollute them as if there were no tomorrow... and it is precisely here... if we go ahead so I don’t know that ‘tomorrow’ we will be able to let the new generations... The ‘stop to pesticides’ choice should be full and shared otherwise it remains one of the usual choices that penalise only Europe...

feedback: È tempo di dire basta all'uso di pesticidi dannosi per l'uomo la natura gli animali ecc... Mettiamo fine all' uso indiscriminato di prodotti che arricchiscono le multinazionali creando lobby di potere occulto o palese a danno della natura. Non cediamo ai loro ricatti ma perseguiamo il diritto di vivere in un mondo dove il rispetto per la nostra madre terra (già martoriata) deve essere messo al centro delle nostre vite. Per noi stessi e per le prossime generazioni. Grazie
englishfeedback: It is time to say enough to use pesticides harmful to humans, animals, etc. We end the indiscriminate use of products that enrich multinationals by creating hidden or blatant power lobbies to the detriment of nature. We do not give to their blackmails but we pursue the right to live in a world where respect for our mother land (already married) must be placed at the heart of our lives. For ourselves and for the next generations. Thanks

feedback: Proibire alle multinazionali di utilizzare pesticidi di qualsiasi genere
englishfeedback: Prohibit multinationals from using pesticides of any kind

feedback: E' ora di fermare una volta per tutte e per sempre la Monsanto, basta avvelenare il mondo in cui viviamo, basta distruggere il futuro dei nostri figli. Fermiamoli una volta per tutte.
englishfeedback: It is time to stop once for everyone and always Monsanto, just poisoning the world we live in, just destroying the future of our children. Fermiamoli once and for all.

feedback: With my heart in my hand dripping with blood, I implore you, I beg you, I plead with you to appeal to your conscience and the love you have for your family: for your beloved wife or husband and, above all, for your precious children. Imagine a time when you will have to face your loved ones and explain to them the terrible consequences of our actions. Dear children, by my irresponsible voting, I am contributing to leaving you with a poisoned world, where the risk of contracting diseases such as cancer will be higher and higher. I do not want to be responsible for your future suffering, nor do I want your parents to have to live with this burden on their shoulders. I ask for your help, your compassionate action, vote against the importation of those chemical fertilizers banned in Europe. We have a duty to protect our land, our nature and our children's future. Be brave, be strong, be humane. Your choice can make the difference between a future of hope and one marked by avoidable tragedies. Please do not allow the lust for easy profits to take precedence over the safety and well-being of the people you love. This is your chance to show your love and dedication to family and all humanity. Thank you for your attention and for listening to this appeal from the bottom of my heart, praying for a better, healthier and safer future for all of us. Your choice matters and could save precious lives. Be on the side of justice, love and hope. Thank you.

The export of toxic pesticides is a human rights issue as these toxic pesticides are damaging to people: Every year, thousands of farmers die from exposure to dangerous pesticides. The pesticides exported have countless studies supporting the damaging effects on people. The export of toxic pesticides is bad for the bees, biodiversity and the planet. The evidence is clear: neonics and other poisonous pesticides kill bees. Thats why theyre banned in Europe. Why are we still allowing them to be exported to countries with weaker regulation, killing bees and decimating biodiversity? Please, stop the export of toxic pesticides!
THE PLANET IS ONLY ONE ! WE CANNOT AFFORD TO POISON IT EVEN IF AWAY FROM OUR HOMES ! WE NEED TO PROTECT IT ! FOR OUR OWN LIFES !
englishfeedback: THE PLANET IS ONLY ONE! WE CANNOT AFFORD TO POISON IT EVEN IF AWAY FROM OUR HOMES! WE NEED TO PROTECT IT! FOR OUR OWN LIFES!

feedback: Sono perfettamente d'accordo. Purtroppo la logica del profitto (e nient'altro) è ciò che spinge Bayer Monsanto ha impedire che venga immesso questo sacrosanto divieto. Senza dimenticare l'enorme potere che questo esempio può avere sul resto del mondo. Non bisogna mai smettere di sperare in un mondo migliore.
englishfeedback: I fully agree. Unfortunately, the logic of profit (and nothing else) is what Bayer Monsanto pushes out the introduction of this sacrosanto ban. Not forgetting the huge power that this example can have over the rest of the world. We must never stop hoping for a better world.

feedback: L'esportazione di pesticidi tossici mette in luce un doppio standard: I pesticidi pericolosi sono stati vietati in Europa dopo essere stati collegati a cancro, problemi riproduttivi e malattie neurodegenerative, nonché alla morte delle api. Alcuni di questi pesticidi sono vietati in Europa perché collegati a danni cerebrali nei bambini e nei neonati. Se questi pesticidi sono troppo pericolosi per noi (e lo sono come ormai dimostrato da una gran quantità di studi internazionali!), come possiamo accettare che vengano esportati allestero? Un divieto di esportazione dei pesticidi tossici sarebbe un vantaggio per l'innovazione e aiuterebbe l'Europa e il mondo intero verso pratiche agricole più sostenibili. Mantenere sul mercato pesticidi vecchi e pericolosi ci priva di un futuro più verde e di pratiche agricole più sostenibili.
englishfeedback: The export of toxic pesticides highlights a double standard: Hazardous pesticides have been banned in Europe after being linked to cancer, reproductive problems and neurodegenerative diseases, as well as to the death of bees. Some of these pesticides are banned in Europe because they are linked to brain damage in children and infants. If these pesticides are too dangerous for us (and are they as shown by a large number of international studies!), how can we accept that they are exported abroad? A ban on the export of toxic pesticides would benefit innovation and help Europe and the world towards more sustainable farming practices. Keeping old and hazardous pesticides on the market deprives us of a greener future and more sustainable farming practices.

feedback: Vietare in Europa ma permettere altrove l'uso di veleni è solo un'ipocrisia e prima o poi ci si ritorcerà contro, sta già succedendo. Basta pesticidi! Siamo tutti sullo stesso unico pianeta, anche noi la facessimo franca, condanniamo I nostri figli e le future generazioni.
englishfeedback: Banning in Europe but allowing the use of poison elsewhere is only a hypocrisy and is already happening again before or later on. Only pesticides! We are all on the same planet, we too free it, we condemn our children and future generations.

feedback: Stiamo distruggendo la natura e la biodiversità su questa terra. La chimica applicata all'agricoltura è responsabile dell'inquinamento delle falde acquifere e della scomparsa degli insetti, compresi gli impollinatori, sempre più rari nelle zone ad agricoltura intensiva, con effetti a catena sulla flora e sulla fauna. L'uomo è il primo responsabile della devastazione delle risorse nel mondo, che tratta come un giocattolo da cui trarre infinito godimento. Bisogna assolutamente porre un freno allo sfruttamento della terra, all'inquinamento, alla sottrazione di risorse, all'accumulo di rifiuti e, in definitiva, alla crescita della popolazione umana mondiale. Non esiste alcuna crescita infinita possibile in un ambiente finito con risorse limitate.
englishfeedback: We are destroying nature and biodiversity on this land. Chemistry applied to agriculture is responsible for groundwater pollution and the disappearance of insects, including pollinators, which are increasingly rare in intensive farming areas, with knock-on effects on flora and fauna. Man is the first responsible for the devastation of resources in the world, treating it as a toy for infinite enjoyment. It is imperative to curb the exploitation of land, pollution, the diversion of resources, the accumulation of waste and, ultimately, the growth of the world’s human population. There is no endless growth possible in a finite environment with limited resources.

feedback: Bisogna evitare che quei prodotti vengano messi in circolazione,in tutti i paesi,anche extra europei. Dovrebbero essere vietati a livello mondiale ed essere sostituiti da altri meno inquinanti!
englishfeedback: It is important to prevent those products from being put on the market, in all countries, even outside Europe. They should be banned globally and be replaced by other less polluting!

feedback: Sarebbe ora che la smettessimo di fare gli interessi delle multinazionali permettendo loro di fare enormi guadagni fregandocene delle conseguenze per la terra e per gli uomini. Se continuate su questa linea evidentemente dimostrate di essere corrotti e di avere interessi personali in questa faccenda. Non vi abbiamo eletto x fare i vostri porci comodi ed interessi particolari ma x fare gli interessi di tutti gli uomini e per rendere il mondo vivibile, non per distruggerlo. Vergognatevi e cambiate strada
englishfeedback: It would be now that we stop doing the interests of multinationals by allowing them to make huge gains by creating the consequences for land and men. If you continue along this line, you are clearly shown to be corrupt and have personal interests in this way. We did not elect yourself x make yourself comfortable and special interests, but x do the interests of all men and make the world alive, not to destroy it. Vergognatevi and changed street

feedback: Here are some reasons why we need an export ban: The export of toxic pesticides exposes a double standard: Dangerous pesticides are banned in Europe after they were linked to cancer, reproductive problems and neurodegenerative diseases as well as the dying of bees. Some of these pesticides are banned in Europe because of their links to brain damage in children and unborn babies. If these pesticides are too dangerous for us, how can we allow them to be exported? The export of toxic pesticides is a human rights issue as these toxic pesticides are damaging to people: Every year, thousands of farmers die from exposure to dangerous pesticides. The pesticides exported have countless studies supporting the damaging effects on people. The export of toxic pesticides is bad for the bees, biodiversity and the planet. The evidence is clear: neonics and other poisonous pesticides kill bees. Thats why theyre banned in Europe. Why are we still allowing them to be exported to countries with weaker regulation, killing bees and decimating biodiversity? The export of toxic pesticides is taking advantage of countries with weaker regulation. Europe has a role to play in the world - its companies should not be allowed to take advantage of countries with weaker regulation. How can we be taken seriously if we ship our hazardous chemicals abroad, poisoning people and nature in the process in countries where safety regulations are weaker and less strictly enforced.

I pesticidi sono sostanze tossiche e pericolose per la nostra salute e per l' ambiente. Se sono vietate in Europa è impensabile che possano essere esportate in altri paesi. Come cittadino europeo chiedo che ne sia vietato l' uso, la produzione, la vendita e l' esportazione in qualsiasi paese. Dovrebbe esistere un organismo imparziale non collegato alle industrie di produzione che controlli gli effetti dell' uso di sostanze chimiche in agricoltura e magari promuova ricerca sull' uso di preparati più naturali e compatibili con l' ambiente.
englishfeedback: Pesticides are toxic and hazardous to our health and the environment. If they are banned in Europe, it is unthinkable that they can be exported to other countries. As a European citizen, I call for a ban on its use, production, sale and export to any country. There should be an impartial body not linked to manufacturing industries that monitors the effects of the use of chemicals in agriculture and perhaps promotes research into the use of more natural and environmentally sound preparations.

feedback: I giganti dellagricoltura come Bayer-Monsanto intascano profitti enormi grazie alle esportazioni di pesticidi tossici in Africa e America del Sud, mettendo così a rischio le vite degli agricoltori e delle loro famiglie, oltre che avvelenando il pianeta. Questi stessi pesticidi sono vietati in Europa perché ritenuti troppo pericolosi. E' necessario vietarne l'esportazione al fine di tutelare la salute dell'intero pianeta e dei cittadini dell'Unione Europea. Se non vietiamo l'esportazione dei pesticidi tossici in Africa ed in America i cittadini europei si troveranno sempre prodotti con glifosato sui banchi dei supermercati. Vi prego per una volta mettete al centro delle vostre politiche il benessere dei cittadini e del pianeta anziché i profitti delle multinazionali.
englishfeedback: Agricultural giants such as Bayer-Monsanto make huge profits thanks to exports of toxic pesticides to Africa and South America, thus putting the lives of farmers and their families at risk, as well as poisoning the planet. These same pesticides are banned in Europe because they are considered too hazardous. It is necessary to prohibit its export in order to protect the health of the entire planet and of the citizens of the European Union. If we do not ban the export of toxic pesticides to Africa and America, European citizens will always find themselves produced with glyphosate on supermarket desks. I would like to ask you once you put the well-being of citizens and the planet at the heart of your policies, rather than the profits of multinationals.

feedback: L'agricoltura deve diventare più sostenibile e naturale, numerosi studi dimostrano quanto l'uso di pesticidi e fertilizzanti creino nuovi problemi, è come per la resistenza agli antibiotici, si creano resistenze e si uccidono insetti che sono indispensabili ad uno sviluppo equilibrato e sostenibile Per questo i pesticidi devono essere banditi non solo per consumo interno, ma anche per l'esportazione, è ipocrita vietare internamente e lasciare al contempo produrre per esportare, produrranno danni altrove, e al contempo tali produzioni poi magari verranno importate nella UE, di fatto aggirando l''ostacolo dell'uso interno
englishfeedback: Agriculture needs to become more sustainable and natural, many studies show how the use of pesticides and fertilisers creates new problems, such as antibiotic resistance, resistance and the killing of insects, which are indispensable for balanced and sustainable development. Therefore, pesticides must be banned not only for internal consumption but also for export, it is hypocribed to ban internally, while leaving production for export, will produce damage elsewhere, and at the same time these products may eventually be imported into the EU, effectively circumventing the barrier to internal use.

feedback: Buongiorno Da 10 anni faccio parte di Gruppo di Acquisto Solidale, G.A.S.: acquistiamo insieme ad altre famiglie direttamente da produttori biologici che non avvelenano se stessi, l'ambiente e le.persone a cui vendono il frutto del proprio lavoro. È da tempo arrivato il momento di cambiare le logiche del guadagno e puntare su quelle del rispetto e del futuro. Ciascuno può fare la sua parte! La ringrazio per quello che potrà fare per tutti noi. Buon lavoro! Cordiali saluti Giovanna Cosentino
englishfeedback: Good for 10 years, I have been a member of the Solidale Purchase Group, G.A.S.: we buy together with other households directly from organic producers who do not poison themselves, the environment and people to whom they sell the fruit of their work. This is my small way of contributing to the protection of my health, that of the environment and the support of decent and respectful sectors of the Earth that hosts us. The time has long come to change the logic of earnings and focus on those of respect and the future. Everyone can do its part! Thank you for what you can do for all of us. Enjoy the quiz! feedback: L'esportazione di pesticidi tossici è una questione di diritti umani, poiché questi pesticidi tossici danneggiano le persone: Ogni anno, migliaia di agricoltori muoiono per l'esposizione di pesticidi pericolosi. feedback: Buongiorno, le sostanze chimiche pericolose oltre a uccidere insetti e animali di ogni genere, sono dannose nel cibo che si raccoglie dalla terra, per cui dannose per chi il cibo lo consuma, inquinano i corsi e le falde di acqua e nella maggioranza dei casi restano nel territorio e nell'ambiente per un numero di anni molto elevato. Se si vuole tutelare il territorio e dunque le persone, è necessario essere rigorosi sul divieto di importazione e utilizzo di queste sostanze, ci sono molte modalità per ottenere ottimi risultati sul raccolto, senza avvelenare nessuno, è palese che questi prodotti vengono importati e utilizzati, solo per arricchire pochissime persone alle quali della salute delle persone e del territorio, non importa nulla. A chi con i prodotti della terra si deve nutrire, il divieto su questi veleni interessa veramente moltissimo. Siete delegati a tutelare persone e territorio, fatelo al meglio, è il vostro compito, grazie, cordiali saluti, Valeria Ceron
englishfeedback: Buongiorno, hazardous chemicals, as well as killing insects and animals of all kinds, are harmful in the food collected from land, so that they are harmful to food consumers, pollute courses and water aquifers and in most cases remain in the territory and environment for a very high number of years. If we want to protect the territory and thus people, it is necessary to be strict on banning the import and use of these substances, there are many ways to achieve excellent results on the harvest, without poisoning anyone, it is clear that these products are imported and used only to enrich very few people to whom the health of people and the local area is concerned. The ban on these poisonings really affects a great deal of food to those of the earth’s products. You are delegated to protect people and local areas. feedback: I strongly support the EU's initiative to introduce a legislation prohibiting production and/or export of hazardous chemicals that are banned in the EU. This action is in agreement with the EU Chemicals Strategy for Sustainability (CSS) and the ambition for a toxic-free environment. The protection of health and the environment of third countries and the reduction of risks, in which they are exposed, is of utmost importance.

ECOCITY strongly supports the EU's initiative to introduce a legislation prohibiting production and/or export of hazardous chemicals that are banned in the EU. This action is in agreement with the EU Chemicals Strategy for Sustainability (CSS) and the ambition for a toxic-free environment. The protection of health and the environment of third countries and the reduction of risks, in which they are exposed, is of utmost importance, for the protection of human rights, equality and global sustainability. Implementing double standards inside and outside EU/EEA should be unacceptable and stopped. Approximately 44% of farmers and agricultural workers globally experience pesticide poisoning, with significantly higher rates observed in South and East Asia as well as East Africa . Despite developing countries using only around 25% of the world's pesticides, 99% of all fatal poisonings occur in these regions. Moreover, we strongly believe that a firm ban could stimulate innovation and trigger a turn to safer alternatives while it could serve as an example and best practice to other countries.

The 12 POP's under Stockholm Convention are not listed on the EU's banned pesticides list, why? This is a problem as these are banned in most African countries *such as the SADC region) so the import of these pesticides from EU countries into African countries is a problem. The criteria used to ban pesticide products in the EU (PAN criteria) is different from the criteria used in the SADC countries (FAO/WHO JMPM criteria) so matching the banning of pesticide products in SADC countries to the EU can't be done as the criteria used to ban the products were different. There are only 8 products banned in both SA and EU, but the criteria used could be different. SADC countries would also prefer that the pesticides products banned in SADC not be imported into SADC countries. The Global alliance on pesticides could probably assist in standardizing 1 set of criteria to use globally to use to ban pesticide products. This will assist to standardize criteria and allow countries to align their national regulatory processes. The document attached is an example of the challenges faced when trying to align different approaches.
organization: Department of Forestry, Fisheries and the Environment
attachementDocumentIds: [{'documentId': '090166e5fef531e4', 'fileName': 'SA HHPs using JMPM criteria including banned in SA and EU 2023.pdf'}]

feedback: Given our current state of knowledge of the interaction of chemical products with the biosphere, oceans and atmosphere, we can no longer countenance the export from Europe, including the UK, of chemicals known to be harmful, understanding that such substances e.g. Paraquat and Glyphosate are toxic to humans and other animal life such as pollinators (bees). We need to act immediately to stop exports of such chemicals and refocus the resources used in their production for safer and more productive purposes.

Main evidence of the need to ban the export of Hazardous Pesticides from the EU to the Global South is that the use of these pesticides is already banned in EU. Regarding this Public Consultation Process, we in the EU are living in the frame of a regulatory system that guarantees freedom, and the rights to access to information, participation and justice in health and environmental issues. But in many countries at the Global South there is a general lack of regulatory frame on this issues, worst conditions to access to information -including sometimes in some of the countries risk situations for those who are researching-, high percent of illiteracy, low/impossible internet connection, etc. So it´s non equilibrated and unfair to expect, in this process, enough information or evidence about the burden on the use of pesticides on the importing countries in the Global South that operate in such conditions. The short period of time given for public consultation doesn´t help to collect and analyse the huge amount of information on cases of contamination, death and diseases associated to the use and/or exposure to pesticides, which are hundreds in different countries of the world. It´s needed to be highlighted the underestimation of the real number of cases of poisoning, deaths, accidents, injuries, pollution related to the use of pesticides banned in the EU by the countries of the Global South. The decision-making process regarding the banning of Toxic Exports from the EU to the Global South must consider these aspects, that introduce an extreme deviation from the statistic perspective. The cases reported, perhaps with extremely effort, of evidence of harm from the countries importing our toxic pesticides, are less than the peak of the iceberg. Millions of farmers, families affected, around the world in the Global South: 1.- are not aware of this process 2.- if they were, they do not have access to participate on it 3.- meanwhile, are systematically poisoned by the pesticides they use, or are in contact with through the polluted water and soil, and food 4.- they have the main objective to survive and take care of their families Founding Principles of the European Union (Article 191 of the Treaty on the Functioning of the European Union) states that Union policy: 1.- shall contribute to achieving conservation, protection, and improvement of the quality of the environment, protection of human health, and the promotion of measures at the international level to deal with regional or global environmental problems. 2. -will have the objective of achieving a high level of protection and will be based on the principles of precaution and preventive action, on the principle of correction of attacks on the environment, preferably in the source itself, and on the polluter pays principle. So, it is clear that now, the European Union must: 1.- Stop this Double Standard: if hazardous pesticides banned in the EU are bad for us, they are bad for all. 2.-Decide from the Principle of Precaution and Preventive action -we don´t have information about the real high burden of our toxic exports for the ecosystems and health of importing countries; we don´t have the real information about the impact on our and our families´health when importing products from the South cultivated with these pesticides, we don´t know all the effects in the short, media and long term on us and on next generations.. 3.- Decide from the Principle of correctionin the source itself: We have to stop our production and export of Toxic Pesticides to the Global South. 4.- Think in act from the PPP the Polluter Pays Principle.

Queridos lectores y responsables de políticas, Hoy me gustaría abordar un tema de gran preocupación: los productos químicos peligrosos, específicamente los pesticidas, y su impacto devastador en la salud humana y el medio ambiente. Si bien la Unión Europea ha tomado medidas progresivas para proteger a sus ciudadanos y su entorno natural, aún enfrentamos una seria amenaza debido a la exportación de estos productos químicos fuera de nuestras fronteras. La UE ha demostrado su compromiso con la protección del medio ambiente y la salud pública al prohibir el uso de ciertos pesticidas dañinos en nuestro territorio. Sin embargo, estos mismos pesticidas son enviados a otros países donde, lamentablemente, las regulaciones y prácticas de uso pueden no ser tan estrictas como las nuestras. Esto resulta en consecuencias desastrosas tanto para los seres humanos como para la biodiversidad. Numerosos estudios científicos han demostrado que muchos pesticidas utilizados en la agricultura están vinculados a problemas graves de salud. La exposición a estos productos químicos se ha asociado con enfermedades como el cáncer, problemas reproductivos, trastornos del sistema nervioso y disfunciones hormonales. Los trabajadores agrícolas y las comunidades cercanas a los campos de cultivo son los más afectados, y esta problemática se extiende a las generaciones futuras debido a la acumulación de sustancias tóxicas en el medio ambiente. Además de los riesgos para la salud humana, la exportación de pesticidas peligrosos tiene un impacto devastador en la biodiversidad y la salud de los ecosistemas. La fauna y la flora se ven gravemente afectadas por la contaminación química, lo que lleva a la pérdida de especies y al deterioro de los hábitats naturales. Los pesticidas también pueden contaminar fuentes de agua, afectando la calidad y disponibilidad del recurso vital para las comunidades locales y la vida silvestre. Es nuestro deber ético y moral luchar por una prohibición completa de la exportación de productos químicos peligrosos, especialmente aquellos que ya están prohibidos en la Unión Europea. Debemos abogar por prácticas agrícolas más sostenibles y seguras en todo el mundo, promoviendo el uso de alternativas no tóxicas y respetuosas con el medio ambiente. Insto a nuestros líderes políticos a que actúen con determinación y valentía, promoviendo leyes y acuerdos internacionales que prohíban la exportación de pesticidas peligrosos fuera de la UE. Nuestro objetivo debe ser la protección de la salud pública, la conservación de la biodiversidad y la promoción de prácticas agrícolas responsables en todo el mundo. Juntos, podemos hacer la diferencia y asegurar un futuro más seguro y saludable para las generaciones venideras. Gracias por escuchar esta petición urgente. Es hora de tomar acción y ser líderes en la lucha contra los productos químicos peligrosos.
englishfeedback: Dear readers and policy-makers, I would like to address an issue of great concern: hazardous chemicals, specifically pesticides, and their devastating impact on human health and the environment. While the European Union has taken progressive steps to protect its citizens and their natural environment, we still face a serious threat due to the export of these chemicals beyond our borders. The EU has demonstrated its commitment to protecting the environment and public health by banning the use of certain harmful pesticides on our territory. However, the same pesticides are sent to other countries where, unfortunately, regulations and practices of use may not be as strict as ours. This has disastrous consequences for both humans and biodiversity. Numerous scientific studies have shown that many pesticides used in agriculture are linked to serious health problems. Exposure to these chemicals has been associated with diseases such as cancer, reproductive problems, nervous system disorders and hormonal dysfunctions. Agricultural workers and communities close to the fields are the most affected, and this problem extends to future generations due to the accumulation of toxic substances in the environment. In addition to risks to human health, the export of hazardous pesticides has a devastating impact on biodiversity and ecosystem health. Fauna and flora are severely affected by chemical pollution, leading to the loss of species and deterioration of natural habitats. Pesticides can also contaminate water sources, affecting the quality and availability of vital resource for local communities and wildlife. It is our ethical and moral duty to fight for a complete ban on the export of hazardous chemicals, especially those already banned in the European Union. We must advocate for more sustainable and safer farming practices worldwide, promoting the use of non-toxic and environmentally friendly alternatives. I urge our political leaders to act with determination and courage, promoting international laws and agreements that prohibit the export of hazardous pesticides outside the EU. Our goal should be the protection of public health, the preservation of biodiversity and the promotion of responsible agricultural practices worldwide. Together, we can make the difference and ensure a safer and healthier future for future generations. Thank you for listening to this urgent petition. It is time to take action and be a leader in the fight against hazardous chemicals.

feedback: Die GHC Gerling, Holz & Co. Handels GmbH (GHC) begrüßt die Möglichkeit zu der EU-Initiative Gefährliche Chemikalien Verbot der Herstellung und Ausfuhr von Chemikalien, die in der EU verboten sind Feedback geben zu können. Grundsätzlich befürwortet GHC die EU-Chemikalienstrategie für Nachhaltigkeit und dazugehörige Vorschriften mit diesen Zielen. Allerdings wären pauschale Verbote, zum Beispiel allein auf Basis einer nicht beantragten EU-Zulassung oder einer Einstufung der Chemikalie dabei der falsche Weg. Stattdessen sollte ein risikobasiertes Schutzkonzept gefördert werden und dem Anwender alle erforderlichen Informationen zum sicheren Umgang mit den Chemikalien bündig und einfach verständlich zur Verfügung gestellt werden. In dieser Initiative sollten daher folgende Punkte berücksichtigt werden: Anwendungsbereich Betroffene Chemikalien: Der Anwendungsbereich für welche Chemikalien die Anforderungen anzuwenden sind, muss weiterhin klar und eindeutig in Form einer Liste wie aktuell im Anhang der PIC-VO geregelt sein. Verbot der Herstellung / des Exports von Chemikalien, die in der EU verboten sind: Es gibt nur sehr wenige Chemikalien, deren Verwendung in der EU komplett verboten ist. Stattdessen sind in der Regel nur bestimmte Verwendungen verboten. Ein Verbot der Herstellung / des Exports darf somit nur für Verwendungen erfolgen, die in der EU verboten sind. Verbot der Herstellung / des Exports von Chemikalien, die in der EU nicht zugelassen sind: Bei einem Verbot der Herstellung / des Exports von Chemikalien, die in der EU nicht zugelassen sind, muss der Grund der nicht-Zulassung berücksichtigt werden. Wenn die nicht-Zulassung erfolgt, weil das Produkt nicht im Geltungsbereich der EU-Vorschriften liegt oder weil das Produkt nicht in der EU verwendet wird, wäre ein Herstellungs- und Exportverbot nicht angemessen. Nur wenn die nicht-Zulassung erfolgt, weil für diese Verwendung eine Risikobewertung eine unzumutbare Gefahr für Mensch und/oder Umwelt ergeben hat, sollte die Herstellung und der Export verboten werden. Informationsbereitstellung für nicht-EU Behörden: Eine Bereitstellung von mehr Information an nicht-EU Behörden, damit diese besser auf die im EU-Recht ermittelten Risiken reagieren können, ist nicht erforderlich. Reduzierung des administrativen Aufwands: Eine Überarbeitung der PIC-Verordnung sollte auch zur Reduzierung des administrativen Aufwands für die Industrie und die EU-Behörden genutzt werden. In dem beigefügten Schreiben sind zu den einzelnen Punkten noch Beispiele und Erläuterungen.
organization: GHC Gerling, Holz & Co. Handels GmbH
englishfeedback: GHC Gerling, Holz & Co. Handels GmbH (GHC) welcomes the possibility of providing feedback on the EU Dangerous Chemicals Initiative banning the production and export of chemicals that are banned in the EU. In principle, GHC supports the EU Chemicals Strategy for Sustainability and related rules with these objectives. However, blanket bans, for example on the basis of an unrequested EU authorisation or classification of the chemical, would be the wrong way to do so. Instead, a risk-based approach to protection should be promoted and all necessary information on the safe handling of chemicals should be provided to the user in a concise and easy-to-understand manner. The following points should therefore be taken into account in this initiative: Scope of chemicals concerned: The scope of which chemicals are to be subject to the requirements must continue to be clearly and unambiguously regulated in the form of a list as currently in the Annex to the PIC Regulation. Ban on the production/export of chemicals banned in the EU: There are very few chemicals whose use is completely banned in the EU. Instead, only certain uses are usually prohibited. Thus, a ban on production/export can only be made for uses that are prohibited in the EU. Ban on the production/export of chemicals not authorised in the EU: A ban on the production/export of chemicals not authorised in the EU must take into account the reason for non-authorisation. If the product is not authorised, because the product does not fall within the scope of EU rules or because the product is not used in the EU, a ban on manufacturing and exports would not be appropriate. Only if the non-authorisation is carried out because a risk assessment has revealed an unacceptable risk to humans and/or the environment, production and export should be prohibited. Provision of information to non-EU authorities: There is no need to provide more information to non-EU authorities to better respond to the risks identified in EU law. Reduction of administrative burden: A revision of the PIC Regulation should also be used to reduce the administrative burden on industry and EU authorities. The attached letter provides examples and explanations on the individual points.

feedback: We need to ban production of hazardous chemicals. Many people suffer from the damage and diseases caused by these chemicals.

Exporting banned pesticides to countries like South Africa, the largest consumer of agro-toxins in Africa, is a glaring act of hypocrisy. It is alarming that South Africa relies heavily on highly hazardous pesticides (HHPs) and chemicals prohibited in the European Union, which highlights the brutal and destructive nature of its industrial food system. The agricultural chemical industry is currently experiencing a regulatory breakdown, resulting in human rights violations and environmental disasters. This situation represents a direct assault on both nature and humanity, jeopardising the very essence of life itself. These issues arise at the intersection of multiple crises within late-stage capitalism, encompassing the climate impact of pesticides, economic and social injustices, and an escalating push towards further industrialisation. Agribusiness, operating alongside a neo-colonial capitalist machinery, seeks to preserve the existing status quo, in which these chemicals play an inseparable role. This fundamentally destructive system obstructs the development of decentralised and democratic food systems based on ecological and social principles. To contribute positively and promote the use of fewer and less harmful pesticides, it is imperative to cease the production and exportation of pesticides that would not be used within one's own country. By doing so, you can support countries like South Africa in their efforts to transition towards safer and more sustainable agricultural practices.

It is hypocritical to export pesticides that are banned in the EU. I am from South Africa, which is the largest consumer of agro toxins in Africa, deploying also many chemicals that are categorised as highly hazardous pesticides (HHPs), as well as chemicals that are banned in the European Union. The agrotoxin industry epitomises the brutality and destructiveness of South Africas industrial food system. There is currently a regulatory break-down and free-for-all in the agricultural chemical industry, leading to human rights violations and environmental calamity. This is nothing less than a war on nature and humans, threatening the very foundation of life. It occurs at the nexus of multiple crises in the late stage of capitalism, including the climate cost of pesticides and economic and social injustice as we move to an even greater intensification of industrialisation, in a bid by agribusiness and a neo-colonial, capitalist machinery, to maintain the current status quo, which these chemicals are an inextricable part. This utterly destructive system, stands in the way of decentralised and democratic food systems, embedded in the practice, science, and movement that uses ecological and social concepts and principles in the design and management of ecologically sustainable and just agricultural and food systems. Please aid countries like South Africa to move towards fewer and less harmful pesticides by doing your part and stopping the making and export of pesticides you would not use in your own countries!

Evidemment qu il faut interdire toute exportation de pesticides toxiques et même leur fabrication. Les firmes chimiques qui les produisent doivent être poursuivis pour ecocide et mise en danger de la vie d autrui. Incroyable qu il faille une consultation pour une décision si évidente. A t on perdu tout bon sens en Europe
englishfeedback: It is clear that all exports of toxic pesticides and even their manufacture must be prohibited. The chemical firms producing them must be prosecuted for Ecocide and endangering the life of others. Incredible that consultation is necessary for such an obvious decision. Lost all common sense in Europe

feedback: Si les usines de production de semences de l'union europeenne ne peuvent plus traiter des lots de semences avec des produits de traitement autorisés dans le pais d'exportation, il ne faut pas penser que dans ce pais de destination ils vont arréter d'utiliser ce produir de traitement, le résultat obtenue sera que ces lots de semences s'exporteront non traité et seront traités à pied de parcelle para les agriculteurs de ces païs. La conséquence évidente sera la complète dégradation des conditions d'application de ces produits de traitement qui au lieu d'être appliqués dans des usines professionelles et certifiés ESTA (European Seed Treatment Assurance) qui se préoccupent de la protection de l'environement et de leur personnel, ces produit seront appliqués par des milliers d'agriculteurs qui ne pourront en aucun cas le faire de la même manière professionnelle, ayant donc pour résultat un impact ambiantal negatif dans ces pais de destination.
englishfeedback: If seed production plants in the European Union can no longer treat seed lots with treatment products authorised in the export straws, it should not be assumed that in this destination stray they will make it harder to use this treatment product, the result will be that these seed lots will be exported untreated and treated on foot of plot para the farmers of these païs. The obvious consequence will be the complete deterioration of the conditions for the application of these treatment products, which, instead of being applied in professional and ESTA (European Seed Treatment Assurance) plants, which are concerned with the protection of the environment and their staff, will be applied by thousands of farmers who will under no circumstances be able to do so in the same professional way, thus resulting in a negative environmental impact on those straws of destination.

feedback: Dear Madam / Sir, Please find enclosed, on behalf of a few clients of ours, the substantive comments to the legislative initiative prohibiting production for export of chemicals banned in the European Union. By way of summary to the enclosed document, the prohibition to manufacture and export an active substance "banned" in the EU should not apply to: (i) non-EU countries applying legislations comparable to the European ones; (ii) non-EU countries that ratified the Rotterdam Convention on the Prior Informed Consent Procedure for Certain Hazardous Chemicals and Pesticides in International Trade; (iii) substances that were not formally "banned", but whose authorisation was not renewed due to the lack of commercial interest of applicants.

En el Perú los plaguicidas que se fabrican en el Norte, llegan a mi país y sin ninguna asistencia técnica por parte de los organismos competentes del estado, son utilizados por los trabajadores agrícolas que no tienen idea del daño a la salud y al ambiente, por la falta de información. Los agricultures y agricultoras preparan los plaguicidas sin tomar en consideración las medidas adecuadas de protección, exponiéndose a riesgos de la salud por tener contacto directo con estos productos tóxicos. Las aspersiones de plaguicidas que realizan lo hacen sin ropa de protección (mandiles, botas, guantes, respirador, etc.) en su mayoría (87,5%). En el Perú existen alrededor de 1,5 millones de niños/as trabajadores/as, de éstos el 70% están en el campo o en la zona rural y el 30% en la zona urbana. El 64% son varones y el 36% son mujeres (Valle, 1998). La pobreza y el trabajo infantil en el campo están íntimamente relacionados y son causados por los bajos precios de los productos agrícolas, la falta de mejores canales de comercialización y la tradición reinante de salarios deprimidos en el campo. Por tal motivo, todos los intentos de prohibir o reducir el trabajo infantil o por lo menos eliminar las peores formas de trabajo deben ser partes de grandes reformas políticas y económicas. En el Perú se han registrado casos emblemáticos de intoxicaciones que han llamado la atención internacional y nacional, como sucedió en la comunidad de Taucamarca- Cusco 1999 (50 intoxicados, de los cuales 24 murieron), Cachachi-Cajamarca 2011 (tres muertos y 94 intoxicados), Ica- 2012 (400 intoxicados) y Nepeña- Ancash (92 escolares intoxicados) y nuevamente en Ica 2017 (28 intoxicados), San José de Ushua- Provincia de Paucar del Sara Sara, 2018 (100 intoxicados y murieron 10), lo que evidencia la situación crítica generada por el uso de los plaguicidas. En solo 19 años hemos tenido siete intoxicaciones masivas por plaguicidas, que han afectado a 867 personas, de las cuales 36 han perdido la vida, una situación preocupante porque cada uno de estos casos se ha producido por la limitada regulación del comercio y uso de éstos insumos peligrosos que en la actualidad se aplican de manera indiscriminada en los diferentes cultivos en la costa, sierra y selva (ver cuadro1). Esta intoxicación masiva ha afectado principalmente a escolares de las escuelas rurales por consumir alimentos proporcionados por los programas sociales contaminados por plaguicidas de alta toxicidad aguda, como lo sucedido en Taucamarca-Cusco y Cachachi-Cajamarca, otros casos han tenido que ver con la exposición de trabajadores agrícolas a los plaguicidas altamente tóxicos en empresas dedicadas a la agroexportación como lo sucedido en Ica y Piura. De igual manera, las intoxicaciones masivas se han producido en comunidades rurales pobres donde se han servido alimentos contaminados con plaguicidas en actividades sociales como es el caso de San José de Ushua-Ayacucho. Fuente: Propuesta de plan de reducción de uso de plaguicidas en el Perú. CAP/RAAA 2021.
englishfeedback: In Peru, the pesticides produced in the north arrive in my country and without any technical assistance from the competent state bodies, are used by agricultural workers who have no idea of damage to health and the environment due to a lack of information. Farmers prepare pesticides without taking into account the appropriate protective measures, exposing themselves to health risks because they have direct contact with these toxic products. Pesticide sprays do so without protective clothing (blankets, boots, gloves, ventilators, etc.) mostly (87.5 %). There are around 1,5 million children in Peru, of whom 70 % are in the countryside or in the rural area and 30 % in the urban area. 64 % are male and 36 % are women (Valle, 1998). Poverty and child labour in the countryside are closely linked and are caused by the low prices of agricultural products, the lack of better marketing channels and the prevailing tradition of depressed wages in the countryside. For this reason, all attempts to ban or reduce child labour or at least eliminate the worst forms of work must be part of major political and economic reforms. In Peru, there have been emblematic cases of intoxications that have attracted international and national attention, as was the case in the Taucamarca-Cusco community 1999 (50 intoxicates, of which 24 died), Cachachi-Cajel 2011 (three dead and 94 intoxicated), Ica-2012 (400 intoxicated) and Nepeña-Ancash (92 schoolchildren intoxicated) and again in Ica 2017 (28 intoxicated). San José de Ushu- Province of Paucar del Sara Sara Sara, 2018 (100 intoxicated and killed 10), which shows the critical situation created by the use of pesticides. In just 19 years, we have had seven massive pesticide poisoning, affecting 867 people, 36 of whom have lost their lives. This is a worrying situation because each of these cases has been caused by the limited regulation of trade and use of these hazardous inputs, which are currently applied indiscriminately to different crops on the coast, saws and forests (see Table 1). This massive poisoning has mainly affected schoolchildren in rural schools as they consume food provided by social programmes contaminated by highly toxic pesticides, such as in Taucamarca-Cusco and Cachachi-Cajel, other cases have related to the exposure of agricultural workers to highly toxic pesticides in agro-export companies such as in Ica and Piura. Similarly, massive poisoning has occurred in poor rural communities where pesticide contaminated food has been served in social activities such as San José de Ushua-Ayacucho. Source: Proposal for a plan to reduce the use of pesticides in Peru. CAP/RAAA 2021.

feedback: The Prior Informed Consent Regulation (PIC, Regulation (EU) No. 649/2012) regulates the import and export of certain chemical substances and imposes obligations on companies wishing to export them to third countries. Its purpose is to promote shared responsibility and joint efforts in the international movement of hazardous chemicals, and to protect human health and the environment by providing developing countries with information on the storage, transport, use and disposal of hazardous chemicals. in safe conditions. This Regulation applies in the European Union the provisions of the Rotterdam Convention on the prior informed consent procedure applicable to certain pesticides and dangerous chemical products in international trade. This regulation must be improved and the export of the most polluting chemical substances to third countries prohibited. IT IS SHAME THAT EUROPE USE THE REST OF THE WORLD TO CLEAN UP ITS TRASH. THANK YOU.

El tratamiento de Semillas con productos fitosanitarios asegura la sanidad de la planta protegiéndola desde su inicio, cuando es vulnerable y a menudo atacada por plagas y enfermedades transmitidas por el suelo. Aplicando una cantidad de producto muy pequeña se consigue asegurar la calidad, la seguridad y el rendimiento de los cultivos, antes de la siembra. El proceso de tratamiento de semillas con productos fitosanitarios tiene lugar en los países donde se producen las semillas, o en la sede central de las empresas, donde disponen de plantas de tratamiento con avanzada tecnología. Las empresas de semillas europeas suministran semillas de alta calidad de variedades innovadoras a cualquier país del mundo. Los requisitos fitosanitarios de algunos países terceros incluyen los tratamientos de las semillas (con productos no autorizados en Europa en algunos casos), para asegurar la sanidad de las semillas que se introducen en su país. En Europa los tratamientos de semillas se realizan en plantas de tratamiento altamente tecnificadas y por especialistas, donde se gestionan los aspectos de seguridad y medioambiente de forma cuidadosa. Son instalaciones profesionales diseñadas para trabajar en condiciones seguras para los operadores y con equipos especiales que protegen a los trabajadores de cualquier exposición accidental a los productos químicos. La industria de semillas ha establecido una certificación para las plantas de tratamiento de semillas, Certificación ESTA (European seed Treatgment Assurance), que implica estándares muy altos de calidad y seguridad. Si los agricultores de terceros países reciben directamente semillas tratadas en plantas europeas con condiciones controladas, no tienen que manipular o mezclar sustancias químicas para el tratamiento de semillas, lo que elimina prácticamente cualquier riesgo de exposición no deseada para esos agricultores en sus países.
englishfeedback: The treatment of seeds with plant protection products ensures the health of the plant by protecting it from the outset, when it is vulnerable and often attacked by pests and diseases transmitted by the soil. A very small quantity of product is used to ensure the quality, safety and yield of the crops before sowing. The seed treatment process with plant protection products takes place in the countries where the seeds are produced, or at the headquarters of the companies, where they have treatment plants with advanced technology. European seed companies supply high-quality seed of innovative varieties to any country in the world. Plant health requirements in some third countries include seed treatments (with products not authorised in Europe in some cases) to ensure the health of seeds entering their country. In Europe seed treatments are carried out in highly technical and specialist treatment plants, where safety and environmental aspects are carefully managed. These are professional facilities designed to work safely for operators and with special equipment to protect workers from accidental exposure to chemicals. The seed industry has established certification for seed treatment plants, Certification ESTA (European seed Treatment Assurance), which implies very high standards of quality and safety. If farmers in third countries receive directly treated seeds on European plants under controlled conditions, they do not have to handle or mix chemicals for seed treatment, which removes virtually any risk of unwanted exposure to those farmers in their countries.

feedback: De EU kan niet langer een dubbele standaard volgen. Wat verboden is bij ons, moet ook in het buitenland uit circulatie genomen worden. De studie in bijlage uit Burkina Faso toont overduidelijk aan aan welke gevaren de lokale bevolking blootgesteld wordt als het pesticidengebruik onvoldoende aan banden wordt gelegd.
englishfeedback: The EU can no longer follow a double standard. What is forbidden by us must also be withdrawn from circulation abroad. The annexed study from Burkina Faso clearly shows the hazards to which the local population is exposed if the use of pesticides is not sufficiently restricted.

feedback: We should ban these and force the UK to also. We should replace them with reciprocal arrangements for regenerative techniques R&D and knowledge transfer from indigenous populations around d the world. Mother Nature provides the solutions if we only open our senses to accept them. This will result in a localised, appropriate solutions working with mature but shared as an open non-profit globally beneficial knowledge base for now and future generations. We should not stop with pesticides - but also all PFAs and forever chemicals. What on earth are we doing to our planet!!! Any financial institution, corporation, or pension fund invested in any of these activities should hang their heads in shame. Support the alternatives that all workers and employees can make a living from, for a just and fair transition that leaves no one behind and leaves the planet in a better state for future generations that have no voice.

CropLife Europe supports the ambitious commitment of the European Commission and its Chemicals Strategy for Sustainability (CSS) to protect human health and the environment. As an innovative industry that supports farmers progress towards a more sustainable EU food production, we are dedicated to increasing the sustainability of our solutions. The CSS sets out to achieve a big transformation the EU will see under the Green Deal. We recognise the Commissions underlying concern that certain substances banned for use as pesticides in Europe are exported to other parts of the world. Many of the substances which would be captured by such a ban are exported to fulfil important and specific needs of farmers in other parts of the world. Different regions have different needs the agronomic needs and climatic conditions vary by region and are considered in the country and region-specific registration process. In addition, some of these substances are registered and used in third countries for other important societal reasons, like vector control, other than crop protection. Simply banning manufacturing for export of these substances will not have the desired outcome. Doing so would result in losing a valuable opportunity for the EU to positively influence how pesticides are used in other parts of the world. CropLife therefore encourages the EU to use its world leading influence to show how best practices of safety, risk assessment of chemical products and transparency can better protect people and the environment. Banning chemical/pesticide exports from the EU would increase the risk of illegal and counterfeit pesticides being used in other parts of the world, compromise EU competitiveness and investment in innovation in the sector. Such a ban would likely result in manufacturing being exported from Europe to other regions in the world, where the EU would have no opportunity to lead by example. Please find attached CropLife Europe's feedback on the call for evidence.

feedback: Approximately 44% of farmers and agricultural workers globally experience pesticide poisoning, with significantly higher rates observed in South and East Asia as well as East Africa . Despite developing countries using only around 25% of the world's pesticides, 99% of all fatal poisonings occur in these regions . A study by Public Eye and Greenpeace Unearthed revealed that 41 banned pesticides were notified for export from the EU in 2018 predominantly from 7 countries. Pesticide Action Network Asia Pacific (PANAP) has conducted monitoring on pesticide use and its impact in several countries, and it has found out that: 1. Study in Bangladesh, Laos, India, and Laos reveals that 69% of the pesticides used by farmers and farmworkers are banned in the EU during 2021 monitoring. 2. From 2021 to 2022, 32 pesticides found were from EU-based brands 3. From 2021 to 2022, 76% of pesticides not approved to be used in the EU were used in these four countries 4. 36.80% of women farmers and 37.28% showed symptoms of illness after pesticide exposure in 2021 study 5. In Tiruvallur, India, 33% of the pesticides are EU-based brands. 6. 87.5% children reported that they felt sick after the field was sprayed in Tiruvallur, India *Details finding is attached below. The problem of allowing pesticide use without adequate protection, which is the normal condition of use in many low- and middle-income countries (LMICs), is compounded by the national and international failure to prevent double standards trade in pesticides in which countries that have banned pesticides for health and/or environmental reasons continue to allow their export to LMICs and other countries continue to import them. Global pesticide governance, which is largely voluntary, has failed to stem the flood of poisonings, chronic health impacts and environmental destruction experienced in these four Asian and many other countries.

Hello, Please exporting chemicals banned in the EU to other countries. Those countries and their people deserve a healthier environment. Also, most of those countries send their produced back to be consumed in the EU filled with those same chemicals. If you create a more biodiverse system with bigger plant varieties, more buffer zones around the farm and ground cover, you create a more diverse ecosystem that provides a home for insects and organisms that are predators of the pest. The ecosystem on the farm would ensure that pest levels stay low even without pesticides. That would also make the farm more resilient to climate shocks because a farm that has a strong ecosystem is more resilient to floods or droughts. When theres heavy rain, a farm with a lot of soil organisms is much more capable of absorbing the water. If you have a monoculture and you use a lot of agrochemicals, the soil gets hard and not permeable anymore. The topsoil will be lost, including a lot of nutrients. Taking care of the soil and having a more biodiverse farming will ensure a better future in Europe and everywhere else.

The Norwegian Environment Agency welcomes this opportunity to provide input concerning prohibiting production for export of chemicals banned in the European Union. We support the EU's initiative to introduce a mechanism prohibiting production and/or export of certain hazardous chemicals that are banned in the EU/EEA, with the aim of reducing the environmental and health risks linked to exporting hazardous chemicals to countries outside EU/EEA (third countries). This is in line with the EU Chemicals Strategy for Sustainability (CSS) which is a key action in the European Green Deal and the move towards a toxic-free environment. Norway fully supports this strategy, and we are actively taking part in several of its follow-up actions. The EU/EEA would not be able to attain the ambitious goals of the CSS unless action is taken to increase protection for human health and the environment both within EU/EEA and globally. We support the intention behind this initiative and support stronger regulation of export out of the EEA of chemicals that are not permitted within the EEA. Restricting such export could stimulate innovation to introduce safer alternatives. We hope it will set an example and encourage other countries to do the same and that it may encourage business operators and industry outside the EU to reconsider the continued use of such chemicals. It is also important for ensuring a level playing field between operators. We urge for a thorough impact assessment accompanying any legislative proposals, that will also consider all impacts in a broader, global context. Potential measures could cover bans on production for export of chemicals that are banned or severely restricted in the EU/EEA due to unacceptable risk for health and/or to the environment. Whether this should be a broad and general ban or a ban with possibilities of exceptions, and what legal instruments will best suited when introducing such bans, need to be considered after impact assessments have been completed.
